Wine: Gary Farrell 2016 Toboni Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: This is a hearty, acid-driven white, with a white peach flavor and a lush, creamy palate. Hints of jasmine and apple blossom meld with a touch of lemon zest on the lingering finish.
Wine: Kenzo Estate 2017 Asatsuyu Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: Fresh and deep, this offers ripe fruit flavors of apple, Asian pear and white melon. It was fermented in barrel with native yeast and 20% new oak. The structure, as with all Lavinea wines, is perfectly balanced for optimal tension and texture.
Wine: Lavinea 2016 Elton Chardonnay (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This bottling by Ian Brand always packs bang for the buck, but he really nailed it in the 2017 vintage. Clean and delicate aromas of Asian pear, lemon rind and edgy chalk lead into a racy, crisp and tightly wound palate. Flavors of grapefruit, nectarine, blanched almond and sea salt are delicious.
Wine: Le P'tit Paysan 2017 Jacks Hill Chardonnay (Monterey County)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: A richer style of Syrah, this bottling offer baked black cherry, blueberry sorbet, lilac and baking spice on the nose. The palate is lavish and loaded with black fruits and jasmine flavors, framed by buoyant acidity.
Wine: Roblar 2016 Estate Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Review: This is such a lovely white wine, priced attractively, which delivers a heady entry of honey and caramelized oak. Juicy acidity lifts bold flavors of lemon meringue, green apple and tangerine, finishing with a balanced weight and intrigue of nutmeg.
Wine: RouteStock 2017 Route 121 Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Blackberry, black cherry, vanilla and baking spice converge for a very hedonistic and delicious aromatic entry to this bottling from an old vineyard near Gilroy. Roasted red-fruit flavors show on the sip along with star anise and cherry-wood smoke.
Wine: Sarah's Vineyard 2014 Besson Vineyard Syrah (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Quite gamy and savory on the nose, this select bottling offers aromas of cracked black pepper, roast beef, crushed violet and elderberry. The palate falls in line with meaty, peppery flavors as well as a black currant and black-plum sauce, with hints of cardamom and chai tea.
Wine: Zaca Mesa 2015 Eight Barrel Syrah Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This is winemaker Jim Clendenen's take on the region's most important vineyard. It is light in the glass yet with savory aromas of chalk, butter, hazelnut and sandalwood. Rounded flavors of lemon, honeydew and orange cream lead into a caramelized finish.
Wine: Au Bon Climat 2016 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Coursey Graves
Review: This lovely, well-made white is spicy, grippy and textured, with robust underlying richness. Light in style, the mouthfeel is balanced in juicy, lingering acidity and quiet flavors of green apple and lime.
Wine: Coursey Graves 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: This single-vineyard wine offers a well-formed nose of honey-drizzled peach and white flowers. The semisweet palate is creamy in feel, loaded with swirls of ripe peach and fleshy yellow apple that are balanced by drawing acidity.
Wine: Hermann J. Wiemer 2016 Josef Vineyard Estate Bottled & Grown Riesling (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Review: Ripeness is paramount in this full-bodied, dark-fruit-forward wine crafted by Winemaker Kirk Venge. It smells and tastes soaked in late-picked grape and berry flavors, has a broad, almost thick texture and full mouthfeel. The oak influence is not obvious, but adds complexity and grip to the midpalate and finish.
Wine: Jax 2016 Y3 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Tightly woven aromas of cranberry, soft leather and gravelly minerality show on the nose of this bottling from the vineyard that surrounds this winery. There's good grip to the palate, where flavors of turned soil, sagebrush and tart cherry make for an intriguingly rustic sip.
Wine: Kynsi 2015 Stone Corral Vineyard Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Exotic and floral, this has a substantial midpalate of powerful concentration, exhibited as big flavors of apple, pear and lemon. Lightly ripe, it has texture and nuance that are impressively lengthy and delicious.
Wine: La Follette 2016 Sangiacomo Green Acres Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Review: From a vineyard in the heart of the Sta. Rita Hills, this bottling shows vanilla and star anise on the nose along with black plum fruit. The palate is very cohesive and well integrated, offering alpine strawberry, boysenberry and rounded lilac flavors.
Wine: Migration 2016 Drum Canyon Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: Vibrant and firm in texture but intense in flavor, this wine has a pale-salmon color, subtle aromas of white flowers and white raspberries followed by tangy, almost chewy raspberry and white-peach flavors. It practically vibrates with tantalizing acidity and has a clean, snappy finish.
Wine: Pennyroyal Farm 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Pianetta
Review: Bright and joyous Bing cherry aromas meet with nutmeg and gingerbread on the extremely accessible nose of this bottling. It's really juicy and lovable on the palate, where playful cherry and strawberry flavors are framed by slate-driven minerality, tense tannins and strong acidity.
Wine: Pianetta 2016 Sangiovese (Paso Robles Estrella District)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Smooth aromas of mace, strawberry and red plum paste show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The palate is a bit angular in texture, with sharp acidity and a raspberry sorbet flavor. A flash of vanilla unfolds on the finish.
Wine: Scheid 2016 Doctor's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Loads of white-flower, guava-peel and orange-blossom aromas show on the nose of this blend of 75% Roussanne, 18% Grenache Blanc and 7% Picpoul Blanc. Light pear, peach and guava flavors make for a very mellow expression of Roussanne that will age for years but is drinking great now. Drink until 2030.
Wine: Tablas Creek 2016 Esprit Blanc De Tablas White (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Exotic cherry aromas mix with mace and other rum-barrel spices on the nose of this blend of 46% Mourvèdre, 31% Syrah, 18% Grenache and 5% Counoise. There's a burst of red cherry and tart strawberry on the palate, which then settles into a smooth suave texture.
Wine: Tablas Creek 2016 Esprit de Tablas Red (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Layered in crunchy apple and cinnamon, with an underlying richness of pie dough, this is a well-integrated and highly likable white. Oak does its job quietly and with purpose, as a mineral component of crushed rock provides an exotic edge to the finish.
Wine: The Calling 2015 Sullivan Vineyard Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: With all five major Bordeaux red varieties represented, this blend is a majority Cabernet Sauvignon. An herbal, broadly defined entry of black cherry, plum and moderate structure define it, as a moderate structure of juicy tannin gives it grip.
Wine: Beaulieu Vineyard 2014 Tapestry Reserve Red (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Very fresh on the nose, this twist-top bottling from the East Bay shows tart black-raspberry and dried violet aromas. It's both bright and very slate-driven on the palate, where boysenberry and black-plum-skin flavors meet with white pepper and lavender. It's very expressive.
Wine: Bonny Doon 2016 Old Telegram Mataro (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: The fruit in this ripe, rich wine is farmed by the Casteel family (Bethel Heights). The lemon, peach and apricot flavors bounce with youthful vitality, and the overall balance is spot on. The tea-flavored tannins are lightly dusty, and the overall texture and persistence are first class.
Wine: Brooks 2016 Hope Well Vineyard Riesling (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Stags Leap District, Napa, California, US
Review: This wine has significant tannin power that presents as grippy and powerful on the palate. Soft underlying aspects of violet, dark cherry and plum are complemented by graphite and toasted oak, all within a full-bodied ripe rich persona. Enjoy 2025–2030.
Wine: Chimney Rock 2015 Ganymede Vineyard Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

Appellation: Encanto
Review: High in acidity and crisp red fruit, this wine contrasts with a bold tannic backbone of powerful concentration and richness. Juicy red cherry and cola persist along a through line of focused flavor.
Wine: Encanto 2015 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: This full-bodied wine is unusually on-point for the varietal and tastes terrific. The cherry and blackberry flavors are nicely focused and the wine has great structure from moderate tannins and good fruit acidity.
Wine: Fiddletown Cellars 2015 Jack Rabbit Flat Fox Creek Vineyards Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: Pristine aromas of ripe peach and pineapple are accented by a dusting of lime zest and jasmine on the nose of this semisweet Riesling. The succulent palate displays a dazzling array of juicy stone- and orchard-fruit flavors that are brightened by shots of tangerine and passion fruit, all honed by an explosion of acidity.
Wine: Hosmer 2017 Patrician Verona Riesling (Cayuga Lake)

Appellation: J. Davies
Review: This blends the main variety with 16% Malbec and smaller pinches of Merlot, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc. The resulting wine is robust and well built, softly structured and punctuated in flavors of bold red cherry and plum. Rich, it shows some restraint and ultimately balance, the fruit integrated with oak and tannin.
Wine: J. Davies 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Aromas of framboise, with lavender, potpourri and sage sticks, show on the nose of this bottling from one of the steepest vineyards in the region. Earthy flavors of sagebrush and minty tarragon meet with boysenberry and elderberry fruits, and an aromatic lift goes deep into the finish.
Wine: Ken Brown 2014 Radian Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Margerum
Review: This Grenache is elegant and light, starting with aromas of rose hips, hibiscus extract and rooibos tea. The palate is energized, tense and quite quaffable, with plummy fruit-punch flavors that are lifted by star anise and other baking spices.
Wine: Margerum 2016 Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Smashed berries, charred meat and peppercorn-crusted game show on the nose of this expression of a single vineyard that's dry farmed at 2,100 feet in the mountains. It's very dry on the sip, with flavors of elderberry, crushed pepper and garden herbs.
Wine: Scar of the Sea 2016 Casa Vineyard Syrah (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Review: From a vineyard that's one of this appellation's closest to the Monterey Bay, this bottling is tightly woven on the nose with lime pith, chalk, Meyer lemon, lily and a hint of apple flesh aromas. It's very taut on the palate, with honeysuckle, apple blossom and Key lime pie flavors.
Wine: Scheid 2016 Escolle Road Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Made for a Rhode Island wine bar of the same name, run by Leonard and Sherri Mello, this cross-country collaboration is quite fresh and spicy on the nose, showing aromas of strawberry, dried rose petals and a dusting of thyme and sage. It's bright and taut on the palate, with pomegranate and raspberry flavors, as well as touches of white pepper and curry.
Wine: Tavolo 2016 Lindsay's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: This blend of two-thirds Syrah and one-third Cabernet Sauvignon is earthy, smoky and black peppery in a very good way, as it reveals funky nuances from the potent aromas through flavors that are also ripe and full of black-fruit notes, to the lingering spicy finish. There aren't many pure Syrahs from the Foothills as good as this blend.
Wine: Terre Rouge 2014 Garrigue Red (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Bold and spicy, this high-octane wine starts with salt and pepper aromas, and delivers intense black-pepper and black-cherry flavors on a firm palate bolstered by fine-grained tannins. Winemaker Matt Cline included 11% Petite Sirah, 9% Carignan and 2% Black Malvoisie in the blend.
Wine: Three 2016 Live Oak Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Whitehall Lane
Review: Tones of creamy citrus and vanilla wafer dominate the palate of this layered, complex white. Additional flavors of green apple and tangerine emphasize the underlying acidity that's both juicy and crisp.
Wine: Whitehall Lane 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

Appellation: Atlas Peak, Napa, California, US
Review: Earthy in forest floor, this mountain wine is grippy and oaky, powerful in its grasp of a drought-affected vintage that offered density and concentration in spades. Stony dusty mineral components override the blue and black fruit that simmers beneath a full-bodied ripeness.
Wine: Alpha Omega 2015 Stagecoach Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Review: There is great restraint shown on this bottling of the often oily and dense variety, starting with subtle yellow apple, Meyer lemon peel and melon aromas on the nose. Baked nectarine and yellow-peach flesh show on the sip, yet there is a salty, savory aspect with orange rind and almond touches toward the finish.
Wine: Alta Colina 2016 Model Citizen Roussanne (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Lime skins, grapefruit, ash, lily, chives and dairy aromas make for a unique and dynamic entry to the nose of this bottling from a vineyard high in the mountains near Chalone. There's a grainy tightness to the palate, where Meyer lemon pith, almond oil and herbal elements battle for attention.
Wine: Big Basin 2016 Coastview Vineyard Chardonnay (Monterey County)

Appellation: Chalk Hill, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Leathery, sinewy tobacco adorns firm tannin in this structured, layered and integrated wine, made from a tiny acre block of the producer's hillside property. Elegant in style, it's lovely and light, a perfect companion for the table.
Wine: Calluna 2015 The Colonel's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Chalk Hill)

Appellation: Cienega Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: The 25% new French oak shows in luxurious ways on this bottling, with aromas of butterscotch, scorched hazelnuts, pecans and a backdrop of seashell minerality on the nose. Warm nutty flavors consume the palate, yet there's a grapefruit-rind edge as well.
Wine: Eden Rift 2016 Terraces Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Very lively aromas of lemongrass, kaffir lime, rainy cement and a hint of greenish orange show on the nose of this block-designated bottling. The texture is very crunchy and grippy with lime skins, springtime herbs and a touch of passion fruit. It is fresh yet complex.
Wine: Grassini 2017 Block 14 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Snappy black-raspberry and green-peppercorn aromas meet with black-plum paste and purple flowers on the nose of this bottling. It's a lively wine, fresh, floral and medium bodied on the palate, where thyme, rosemary and fennel flavors decorate the dark fruit.
Wine: Jaffurs 2015 Kimsey Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: This blends 79% Cabernet Sauvignon with 16% Merlot, 3% Malbec and 1% each of Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc. The brawny nose opens in black currant and licorice, paving the way for the bold, rich flavors of lavender, blueberry and graham cracker to come.
Wine: Pahlmeyer 2015 Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Dried red flowers and sagebrush combine for an elegant aromatic entry to this bottling by two business partners who have worked in Santa Barbara's restaurant scene for many years. Tarragon and intriguing peppercorn flavors decorate the tangy cranberry palate, which is lightly bodied but very well structured.
Wine: Point & Line 2016 John Sebastiano Vineyard Reserve Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Review: Extraordinarily deep and resonant in a black fruit flavor, this is a full-bodied wine that has great focus and a moderate layer of tannins to offer grip. Black berry, plum and cherry flavors all contribute to the palate and keep reverberating on the finish.
Wine: Shannon Ridge 2017 High Elevation Collection Zinfandel (Lake County)

Appellation: Tablas Creek
Review: Rounded aromas of ripe melon and nearly tropical fruit show on the nose of this single-varietal expression, but it's the edgy chalky aromas that are most compelling. That grippy minerality peaks on the palate, grabbing attention with citrus and more melon flavors before settling into a smooth finish.
Wine: Tablas Creek 2017 Grenache Blanc (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: Two different Muscat clones are blended, and the wine is finished completely dry. The aromas are classic for the variety—rosewater, orange peel and citrus blossom. Flavors of orange, apricot and peach rule the palate, with a hint of brioche through the lengthy finish. Have fun pairing this with a variety of spicy noodle dishes.
Wine: Treos 2016 Dry Muscat (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: This single-vineyard Riesling from the eastern shore of Seneca Lake is intensely focused on the nose, displaying defined aromas of lime zest, white flowers and crushed limestone. It's bright and zesty on the dry, light-bodied palate, with shots of tart green plum and powdered minerals. There's a delicate astringency come the midpalate which culminates on a peach-fuzz sensation on the finish.
Wine: Wagner 2017 Caywood East Vineyard Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Y Rousseau
Review: This monster of a wine is made from a very unusual grape variety for California. It shows a deep dark color, potent, smoky black-pepper aromas and bone-dry black-fruit flavors carried by unflinchingly firm tannins. It's fascinating to taste and imagine how long the wine should age to lose at least some of its impressive grip. Best after 2030.
Wine: Y Rousseau 2014 Tannat (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This is a meaty, thick version of the variety from a well-farmed site. It shows a density of tannic structure that wraps around elements of leather, tar, oak and brawny black pepper. The fruit broods appropriately in blackberry and blueberry richness.
Wine: B Cellars 2016 Kick Ranch Syrah (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Quite light in the glass, this bottling from atop the Santa Cruz Mountains offers cherry, pomegranate and strawberry aromas on the nose with a pinch of nutmeg. The palate combines ripe cherry with sarsaparilla spice.
Wine: Big Basin 2016 Old Corral Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Black currant, lilac and dried herbs combine for a delicious aromatic entry to this bottling. There is a hearty richness to the palate, with flavors of smoked blackberries framed by firm but forgiving tannins.
Wine: Black Ridge 2014 San Andreas Red (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Mendocino Ridge, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: This wine is tannic and tightly wound in its youth, exotic and feral with its grasp of earthy forest and dried herb. Blue fruit pokes through, trying to make its way against a wall of structure and grippy balance. Enjoy 2023–2026.
Wine: Brick & Mortar 2016 Manchester Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino Ridge)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: One among numerous limited-production Rieslings from Brooks, this young wine puts a strong emphasis on phenolic skin flavors rather than just-squeezed fruit. Lemon, grapefruit zest and brewed tea show the most.
Wine: Brooks 2016 Meyer Vineyard Riesling (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Candied honeydew, lime cream, white peach and chalk show on the inviting nose of this organically grown Falanghina, an uncommon grape for California. There's a sizzle of fresh acid on the palate, which is full of balanced flavors of peach and guava.
Wine: Castoro Cellars 2017 Whale Rock Vineyard Falanghina (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Cinnabar
Review: Crushed black currant, elderberry, mint and damp forest aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is a taut texture to the palate, where robust tannins uphold blackberry and purple-flower flavors, all leveled by decent acidity.
Wine: Cinnabar 2015 Petit Verdot (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Howell Mountain, Napa, California, US
Review: Initially reduced and oaky, this estate wine is intense in tar, black plum and gunpowder tones. The palate is big and ripe, with a generous feel and firm, chalky tannins. Enjoy 2025–2030.
Wine: Clif Family 2015 Croquet Vineyard Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: This dry-style Riesling is named after the wife of Willy Frank, second generation owner of the estate. An expressive nose of lime, white blossoms and slate gives it an intense, focused start. The palate is persistent in acidity and well-textured, displaying flavors of lime and white cherry that end on a lingering powdered-stone finish.
Wine: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2017 Margrit Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Bright aromas of candied blackberry meet with dewy herbs on the nose of this multiple vineyard blend by Doug Margerum. The palate combines black-currant juice with licorice, cracked black pepper and fresh acidity.
Wine: Margerum 2016 Uber Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Finding zesty white wines in Paso Robles is a noble quest, and this bottling works well. Broad aromas of pear, grass clippings and pomelo skins lead into a tangy palate of lime peels, lemongrass and kaffir lime leaf. Then it rounds out into green-apple flesh, all framed by a chalky edge.
Wine: Robert Hall 2017 Cavern Select Vermentino (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: Consistent with past releases of the winery's reserve, this uses the estate's oldest Dijon vines and is barrel fermented and aged for almost a year in 20% new French oak. It's firm and spicy, with flavors of yellow plum, white peach and phenolic highlights of peach skin and grapefruit zest. The time in barrel does not add significant flavors of toast, but has helped to smooth out the mouthfeel. Drink now through 2025.
Wine: Stoller 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Monterey, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Paying homage to how the Romans would have fermented their Falanghina in a ceramic vessel, this skin-contact wine is slightly orange and cloudy in the glass, offering aromas of wet stone, orange rind and crushed nuts. Tangy tangerine rind, lemon and apple flavors meet with a touch of rust on the palate.
Wine: Wrath 2016 Ex Dolio Falanghina (Monterey)

Appellation: Animo
Review: This offers classic flavors of crisp, red currant and cassis, with background notes of dried herb and floral rose. The tannins are sturdy and supportive of the fruit. Toasted oak components are emphasized on the lengthy peppery finish.
Wine: Animo 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Yamhill-Carlton, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: Tightly wound and bursting with botanical highlights, there is a ginlike flavor to this pure varietal expression. Power and precision abound, and the long, phenolic finish, bone dry and detailed, defines this as a wine worth exploring and experimenting with as far as companion foods.
Wine: Brooks 2017 Deux Vert Vineyard Viognier (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: This delicious semidry Riesling offers an exuberant nose of ripe apple, white blossoms and crushed slate. There's a pleasing roundness to the palate, with a textured, fuzzy feel that carries flavors of crisp apple and lemon underscored by juicy, sweet peach. Laser-focused acidity keeps it all in check, making this a well-balanced offering.
Wine: Damiani 2016 Semi-Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Dark and brooding aromas of peppercorn-crusted beef steak, teriyaki, blueberry and wood smoke make for a savory entry to this bottling. Intense blueberry, charred meat and cherry-wood flavors show on the palate, which is framed by firm mouthcoating tannins. It's a great barbecue wine.
Wine: Fess Parker 2016 The Big Easy Red (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: This is a refined, well-built wine, with tightly wound, concisely focused fruit flavors of fresh apple. Layers of butter, butter brickle and toasted hazelnut wrap around the fruit, and the balancing acidity brings a hint of lemon zest.
Wine: Flâneur 2016 Cuvée Constantin Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Heitz
Review: A matchstick aroma leads to a package of great flavor and texture in this white from a historic producer. Flavors of apple, lemon and peach accentuate the creamy mouthfeel, with a honed balance of acidity, tannins and oak.
Wine: Heitz 2016 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: A delicate nose of gardenia, jasmine, quince and slate give this semisweet Riesling a graceful start. The palate offers explosive acidity that carries flavors of juicy white cherry, green melon and candied lemon zest.
Wine: Hosmer 2016 Patrician Verona Riesling (Cayuga Lake)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This wine is exuberant in juicy tones of Meyer lemon, peach and wet stone. The medium-bodied palate has a fleshy mouthfeel that will appeal to a wide array of wine lovers.
Wine: J Vineyards & Winery 2017 Estate Grown Pinot Gris (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: The nose is tightly wound yet showing hints of roasted plum, root beer and sandalwood on this blend of 50% Mourvèdre, 33% Grenache and 17% Syrah. There sip is wrapped in tannic tension and offers flavors of pine wood, nutmeg and black plum.
Wine: Jaffurs 2015 High Tide Red (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: Broadly structured and succulent, this wine offers brawny, well-integrated tannins and juicy undertones of baked plum and black cherry. With 5% Cabernet Franc, it's floral and brimming in dried herb, black pepper and tobacco.
Wine: Jax 2015 55 Barrels Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Strawberry sorbet, light licorice and dried earth show on the nose of this bottling, which is quite mellow at first but becomes incredibly enjoyable with time. Fresh and accessible red-fruit flavors combine with hints of tobacco and tea leaf on the palate, which is delicate but with juicy depth.
Wine: Kathryn Kennedy 2016 Small Lot Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Kynsi
Review: Rustic aromas of pomegranate, sagebrush, forest floor and charred wood show on the nose of this appellation blend. Pine tree and eucalyptus aromas decorate the soft strawberry and red-plum flavors of the lightly bodied palate.
Wine: Kynsi 2015 Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Earthy notions of tree bark and forest floor mark this lovely wine, a light bright expression of the variety that's focused and tense in acidity. Baked orange and plum flavors add to the mix, contributing to the spicy, lengthy palate of flavor and understated intensity.
Wine: La Follette 2016 Sangiacomo Roberts Road Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Silky in delicate layers of strawberry and light spice, this wine builds power and concentration as it opens in the glass, becoming darker and more brooding in fruit. Baking-spice and black-tea components give it a savory edge that works well in the larger context.
Wine: MacRostie 2016 Klopp Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Malibu Coast, South Coast, California, US
Review: This is a solid bottling from the upper reaches of the Malibu Coast appellation, showing oak smoke, black cherry and a hint of dried mint on the nose. The palate, which is bolstered with 6% Petite Sirah, 4% Merlot and 2% Cabernet Franc offers flavors of savory meat and roasted cherries, all wrapped in taut tannins that stand firm in the finish.
Wine: Malibu Rocky Oaks 2016 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Malibu Coast)

Appellation: Pennyroyal Farm
Review: Very fresh and very vibrant, this light-bodied and well-balanced wine is aromatic, crisp and refreshing. It promises green apples, garden herbs and citrus in the aroma and delivers juicy tangy apple and grapefruit on the palate.
Wine: Pennyroyal Farm 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Relatively light in the glass, this bottling offers red berry, tart strawberry, tea leaf and exotic floral touches on the nose. The red-plum flavors are hit by star anise, red licorice and red apple on the palate, proving to be a well rounded sip.
Wine: Roblar 2016 Estate Mourvèdre (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Arroyo Grande Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Lots of rocky earth and chaparral scrub aromas meet with mellow black-plum and strawberry fruit on the rustic yet refined nose of this blend of two vineyards. The palate combines peppercorn, elderberry and more dried earth.
Wine: Saucelito Canyon 2015 Dos Ranchos Zinfandel (Arroyo Grande Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Boysenberry, dried lavender and dark-soil aromas show compellingly in this bottling, which is darkened by 15% Petite Sirah. The acid-driven sip offers tart and dark berries, proving very fresh and poppy on the palate.
Wine: Sculpterra 2015 Estate Mourvèdre (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Green Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Tart cranberry and pomegranate flavors present as juicy on the palate, the spiciness tenacious and accented in citrus. The energy and freshness is complemented well by a soft velvety texture.
Wine: Sedition 2014 Chenoweth Vineyards Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Lush and brightly layered in exotic citrus, this features crunchy pomegranate and cherry tones as well. The fruitiness is marked by acidity and balanced ripeness. It has a lasting impact of spice and cola.
Wine: Sojourn 2016 Wohler Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Review: A stony, citrus-laden nose offers glimpses of earthy white tea and stone fruit in this dry-style wine made from seedless (or virgin) Riesling grapes. There's power on the palate, with a firm grip of slate, yellow apple skin and peach flavors that lead to a lingering limestone finish.
Wine: The Grapes of Roth 2017 Virgin Berry Dry Riesling (Long Island)

Appellation: Theorize
Review: Golden honey and apple are met by a richness of coconut in this well-integrated, substantive wine. A balance of oak adds weight and breadth around a medium-bodied ripeness and lasting bit of ginger.
Wine: Theorize 2015 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Woodward Canyon
Review: This wine is equal parts fruit from Celilo and the winery's Estate vineyard. Seeing a kiss of 20% new oak from Burgundy barrels, the aromas draw you into the glass, with notes of spice, lemon curd, pear, mineral and apple. Sleek, seamless flavors backed by bright, lemony acidity follow. The finish sails into the distance. The balance is exquisite. This one is all about delicacy and restraint but it brings both in abundance. Best from 2020–2025.
Wine: Woodward Canyon 2017 Chardonnay (Washington)

Appellation: Works and Days
Review: Earthy in ash, dusty rock and forest, this coastal wine is succulent and tightly wound. It offers density on the palate, with succulent flavors of strawberry and rhubarb laced with cola.
Wine: Works and Days 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Works and Days
Review: Winemaker/owner Cabell Coursey ages this white entirely in terra-cotta amphorae, and the result is robustly perfumed in apple blossom, with a hint of citrus. Light in texture and balanced power, it finishes in a lovely mix of lemon verbena and pear.
Wine: Works and Days 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Lavender aromatics accent a delicately built body that develops intensity as it opens. Asian spice, white pepper and toasted oak burnish on the palate before settling into a soft rounded finish of dark cherry.
Wine: Works and Days 2016 Hill Justice Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Intense black-plum and cassis aromas show on the sharp nose of this bottling. There is solid tannic tension to the palate, where black fruit and dark spice flavors are lifted by strong acidity.
Wine: McClain Cellars 2016 Family Values Petite Sirah (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: This is a savory red, adorned in cedar, dried herb and black pepper. The aromatics are nicely defined in violet. Burly grippy tannins complement a wealth of ripe plum and graphite.
Wine: Anderson Conn Valley 2016 Estate Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: This is a thick, rich and rounded red, structured in complex notions of dark cherry and cassis. Billowy tannins give it a lift of texture and lightness despite its overall weight and heft. Let this sit a bit; best 2026–2031.
Wine: Anderson Conn Valley 2016 Signature Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: With a touch of reduction in its tightly wound youth, this red shows plenty of juicy black cherry to appeal from the get-go—a concentrated effort that's rich and equally generous in tannin. Lavender, black licorice and smoky oak complement the proceedings.
Wine: B Cellars 2016 Manzana Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Bishop's Peak
Review: Snappy blackberry and boysenberry aromas combine with lilac, herbs and olive on a very inviting nose in this second-label bottling by the Talley family. It's a fully flavored experience on the sip, with black plum, savory charred meat and dried herbs, showing great complexity for under $25.
Wine: Bishop's Peak 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: This 20th anniversary release is a zippy, sassy fruit bomb of a wine. Apple cider, a squirt of grapefruit, and plenty of juicy acidity push the flavors forward and keep the mouthfeel fresh and lively. Drink now–2020.
Wine: Carabella 2017 Estate Pinot Gris (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Carlton Cellars
Review: Though still rare, Auxerrois seems to have found a good home in Oregon, as this young wine clearly demonstrates. Crisp apple, juicy nectarine, pink grapefruit and Meyer lemon components come together seamlessly, bound with snappy, refreshing, mineral-driven acidity.
Wine: Carlton Cellars 2017 Auxerrois (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Los Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Review: Spicy and acid-driven, with a lushness that develops on the back of the palate, this is a highly aromatic white, floral in jasmine and honeysuckle. The fruit is crisply lemon and green apple, with a touch of white peach.
Wine: Cuvaison 2016 ATS Estate Grown Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: A mineral-laden nose of wet rock and crushed slate mingles with broader tones of white blossoms and yellow apple. This is off-dry in style and delicately textured on the palate, displaying a juicy orchard-fruit profile that's peppered with notes of jasmine and tonic water.
Wine: Keuka Spring 2017 Humphrey's Vineyard Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: La Honda Winery
Review: Very delicate on the nose, this appellation blend offers aromas of Asian pear, lychee and spring flowers. It's tightly wound yet expressive on the palate with honeysuckle and nectarine flavors.
Wine: La Honda Winery 2017 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Savory spice components of cardamom meet black tea and forest floor in this powerful rich wine. A blend of the best blocks and barrels from several vineyards gives it a complex set of flavors and textures, from delicate and elegant to structured and age-worthy. Best 2020–2025.
Wine: MacRostie 2015 The Loch Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Mt. Brave
Review: Rich, tannic and woody, this wine is robust in big black fruit, espresso and toasted oak. It is youthful in dense concentration and structure, a worthy showcase of the variety grown in a wild cool-climate appellation that appears to love it with abandon. Enjoy 2025–2030.
Wine: Mt. Brave 2015 Merlot (Mount Veeder)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: This massively built Rhône-style wine is chock full of equal parts color, flavor and tannin. It smells like blackberries, black cherries and black pepper, tastes ripe and rich, and feels very firm and tannic in texture.
Wine: Naggiar 2015 La Bete Noire Estate Reserve Red (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Mount Veeder, Napa, California, US
Review: A 100% varietal wine from the cool mountain appellation, this wine is lightly spiced in clove and nutmeg and has a smooth soft elegance on the palate. Red currant, plum and blackberry give it a fruity underbelly that complements the feral aspects and viscosity.
Wine: Paratus 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Review: Aromas of strawberry, cherry and underbrush lead to an exquisitely balanced, drawn-out palate, full of juicy, flavorful fruit that brings a sense of delicacy. The tannins give a light squeeze. It's as good an example as I've had of the variety from this appellation.
Wine: Savage Grace 2016 Underwood Mountain Vineyards Pinot Noir (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Appellation: Chalone, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Clean and bright Bing cherry aromas meet with red flowers on the intense nose of this bottling from high above the Salinas Valley. The palate combines rooibos tea with hibiscus flavors, but the compelling aspect is the grippy texture on an otherwise light frame.
Wine: Scar of the Sea 2015 Clone 113 Westside 3 Block Brosseau Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chalone)

Appellation: Sculpterra
Review: Roasted red and black cherries meet with hickory and nutmeg on the rich nose of this bottling, which is given color and depth thank to 10% Petite Sirah. A chalky mouthfeel carries flavors of rich red cherry, framed by tense tannins and decent acidity.
Wine: Sculpterra 2015 Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sineann
Review: Lovely ripe flavors of pear and white peach carry a hint of mint. The wine gathers itself into a focused core, buoyed with natural acidity and finishing with a lick of spice.
Wine: Sineann 2017 Pinot Gris (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: This wine has the grip and good acidity of a Sangiovese along with ample red- and black-cherry flavors that fill out the palate very well. It has a medium-dark color, light salt and pepper aromas that accent the cherries, and then a satisfying richness on the palate that is well supported by fine-grained tannins.
Wine: Via Romano 2014 Tuscan Style Papa Romano Red (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: This tasty, tawny wine is made from barrel-fermented, free-run juice. Aging in oak for 16 months both smooths out and softens its flavors, resulting in a broad, expressive palate with flavors of baked apple cobbler, with notes of vanilla and buttered toast. It's in a fine drinking window and should be consumed in the next couple of years.
Wine: Anne Amie 2015 Prismé Blanc Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Dusty blackberries and roasted fennel aromas show on the nose of this blend of 50% Dolcetto, 29% Refosco and 21% Nebbiolo that nods toward the owners' Italian heritage. The grapes do well in the cool Regan Vineyards, pairing a lighter weight mouthfeel with grippy tannins, wrapped in slightly tart red fruit and baking spice. Drink now–2034.
Wine: Bargetto 2014 La Vita Red (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: Aromas of fresh thyme, honeycomb wax and citrus blossom meld with a stony core of quince and slate in this single-vineyard Riesling sourced from the east side of Seneca Lake. A smooth, well-concentrated palate delivers flavors of green melon, apple and white cherry, while an electric current of acidity keeping this feeling persistent yet balanced. Drink now–2022.
Wine: Bellwether 2016 Sawmill Creek Vineyard Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Review: There is a strong sense of minerality to the nose of this bottling, with aromas of wet stone, turned loam and moist clay covering up the background fruits. The structure is very tannic on the palate, where elderberry and purple-flower flavors emerge from the soil-like core.
Wine: Big Basin 2015 Sixty-Two Terraces Syrah (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Roasted aromas of coffee, charred black currant and pepper show on the rather lavish nose of this bottling. It's rich in style on the palate, where hearty dark-fruit flavors couple with an espresso note and are framed by solid acidity.
Wine: Castoro Cellars 2016 Whale Rock Vineyard Reserve Estate Grown Syrah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Calistoga, Napa, California, US
Review: From a valley floor vineyard in the warmer northern climes of the valley, this 100% varietal red is broad and generous in black brambly fruit that veers into a rich rounded taste of vanilla. Soft texture makes it approachable and enjoyable in its youth.
Wine: Davies 2015 Winfield Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Calistoga)

Appellation: Ektimo Vineyards
Review: Sizzling acidity greets the palate immediately in this medium-bodied white that makes a good first impression and supports it with well-defined flavors of lemon, lime and green apple. The finish teases further in white peach.
Wine: Ektimo Vineyards 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Redwood Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: Very pure and deep black-cherry flavors highlight this inky-colored and full-bodied wine. It's packed with layers of very ripe cherry, plum and blackberry and wrapped in thick velvety tannins for a full mouthfeel.
Wine: Jigar 2015 Tollini Vineyard Syrah (Redwood Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County-Monterey County, California Other, California, US
Review: The grapes for this wine come 83% from Sonoma County, the remainder mostly from Monterey, with just 2% from Mendocino. It's made in a quenching style of succulent acidity and nuanced flavors of fig, quince and Meyer lemon, the backbone nicely rich in graham cracker.
Wine: La Follette 2016 Los Primeros Chardonnay (Sonoma County-Monterey County)

Appellation: Maddalena
Review: A deep red-berry aroma meets with mocha and toasty oak on the richly layered nose of this bottling by the Riboli family. There is solid complexity to the palate, with chalky tannins sitting beside more cocoa, red fruit and light caramel. This is an affordable wine to lay down. Drink now–2029.
Wine: Maddalena 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Monterey, Central Coast, California, US
Review: A bright raspberry aroma meets accents of hibiscus tea, turned soil and wet rock on the nose. The palate brings broad flavors of sour cherry and thyme that are enhanced by peppery spice and a grippy texture.
Wine: Metz Road 2016 Riverview Vineyard Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Monterey)

Appellation: Mount Veeder
Review: Brawny layers of blueberry and blackberry show in this broad and textured wine. Supple yet powerful tannins frame flavors of cedar, sage and cinnamon, which it an attractive, appealing vibe.
Wine: Mount Veeder 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Boysenberry and slate are lifted by baking spice on the nose of this bottling, which is being released later than the 2016 vintage. Tart plum-skin and floral flavors play on the palate, which is not as dense as usual but is still a strong wine.
Wine: Patz & Hall 2015 Pisoni Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: Great balance and freshness make this medium-bodied wine very appealing. It has lively acidity, just-ripe citrus and green-apple flavors and a mouthfeel that's both full and a bit tangy at the same time. It comes from the family that founded Navarro.
Wine: Pennyroyal Farm 2016 Hammer Olsen Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Perfusion
Review: From a small vineyard in the East Bay, this bottling offers snappy black-raspberry, rose-petal and peppercorn aromas on a light but expressive nose. There is a herbal tinge on the palate, with thyme and sagebrush flavors, as well as more berry. The structure and acidity are in balance.
Wine: Perfusion 2016 Pinot Noir (San Francisco Bay)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Housed in a classic green-glass bottle, this appellation blend offers aromas of lime blossom, sharp citrus rind, burnt almond and chalk. The palate is very racy and sharp with mouthwateringly sour citrus and wound-up pome fruit flavors.
Wine: Scar of the Sea 2016 Seven Leagues Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Terra d'Oro
Review: An exotic earthy character dominates this dark-colored, full-bodied and firmly tannic wine, giving it a rustic feral appeal that gets progressively more enjoyable on the palate and finish. Blackberry and blueberry flavors underneath add to its appeal. Best after 2023.
Wine: Terra d'Oro 2016 Petite Sirah (Amador County)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: Now designated as part of the single-vineyard series, this rich wine is packed with ripe flavors of peach, apricot and honeysuckle. There's a streak of vanilla cream which adds to the lush mouthfeel. This will appeal to those who love a buttery, decadent style, with enough acidity to keep it lively.
Wine: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2016 Tualatin Estate Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Waxy and mineral, this delightful white has a bright high-acid freshness and a texture of stone. Lemon, quince and apricot factor into the flavor profile with an exotic complexity and undeniable drinkability.
Wine: Anaba 2017 Snow Vineyard Picpoul Blanc (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: The aromas draw you into the glass, with notes of flower, fresh and dried herb, wet iron and blue and purple fruit. There's a pretty sense of purity and richness to the tightly wound blue fruit flavors, though they bring a bit of alcoholic heft along with them. Smoked meat notes linger on the finish.
Wine: Avennia 2016 Arnaut Boushey Vineyard Syrah (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Boushey Vineyard makes up the 70% majority of this wine, with the rest coming from Red Willow. Barrel fermented with native yeast, the aromas are light on first pour, with notes of lemon verbena, lemon oil and herb. The flavors are tart, racy and acid driven, with a long, drawn out finish. It's elegant and subtle, with pleasing complexities to be had. Give it some additional time in bottle to see it at its best.
Wine: Avennia 2017 Oliane Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Intense boysenberry aromas meet with slate, soil and a hint of char on the nose of this expression of the historic clone. It's still very young and shy on the palate, yet the elegant black-raspberry and dried herb flavors emerge with patience and air.
Wine: Bargetto 2017 Mount Eden Clone Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: These 33-year-old vines have been ripened to spätlese sweetness and left hanging in the balance between sweet and tart. The peach and papaya fruit flavors come with ample acidity, finishing with the flavor of sweet lemon tea.
Wine: Brooks 2016 Bois Joli Vineyard Riesling (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: A well-honed mix of ripe peach and tangerine mix with underscores of white blossoms and slate. The palate is broadly concentrated in ripe fruit flavors of tart kumquat and passion fruit that are struck against a taut, astringent sensation. Persistent bursts of acidity keep this both succulent and tense, making the palate beg for more.
Wine: Empire Estate 2017 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Review: Oaky and reduced, this wine has a nose of honey and heady ginger, with lemongrass and nutmeg spice. Bold concentrated flavors of apple and fig follow. The wine is made in a big bold style that's done well and richly ripe.
Wine: Frank Family 2016 Lewis Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Jaffurs
Review: Rarely is Grenache the best grape to lay down in the cellar, but this bottling has the bones and pedigree to qualify. Plump berry, cherry and red-currant fruits have a floral edge on the nose, while the palate is very grippy with tannins that hold the sumac and tart cherry flavors tightly. Drink 2020–2026.
Wine: Jaffurs 2016 Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Carmel Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Though predominantly Zinfandel, this field blend from a vineyard planted in 1984 by Dick Sias also includes Primitivo, Aleatico, Alicante Bouschet, Carignan, Grenache and Petite Sirah, and is a great taste of the past. Blackberry, thyme and dried mint aromas drop into a palate of black plum, loamy soil, dried herbs and cocoa. This is full bodied and well layered.
Wine: Joullian 2014 Sias Cuvée Zinfandel (Carmel Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: Pinot Gris has been a Lange highlight since the winery was founded in 1987. For the first time, a portion of this vintage was aged in concrete egg. It takes some time to open up, then does so with a burst of a lemon drop flavor. It's a tart and juicy style, with excellent pull through to a long, minerally finish.
Wine: Lange 2017 Reserve Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Young winemaker Gretchen Voelcker got her hands on some rare fruit for this bottling, which shows edgy aromas of crushed rock, flint, smoked apple and citrus peel on the nose. There is an immensely chalky tension to the palate, where yellow-apple and grapefruit-rind flavors wrestle for attention.
Wine: Luna Hart 2017 Fiddlestix Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Doug Margerum is capturing the freshness of Rhône varieties like few others in California, as evidenced in this twist-top blend of 44% Grenache, 37% Syrah, 11% Mourvèdre, 4% Counoise and 4% Cinsaut. Aromas of zesty rosewater, raspberry and a hint of smoke lead into a palate that's zippy with joyous flavors of red fruit, sumac and white pepper.
Wine: Margerum 2017 M5 Red (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: Bright fresh acidity wraps around darker denser flavors of blueberry, black cherry and black currant in this vineyard-designate, which is full bodied in style. It has appealing elements of dried herb and clove.
Wine: Peter Paul Wines 2014 Giuliani Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Elkton Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Review: Mike Landt makes an amazingly deep, ripe Sauvignon Blanc, especially given his cool-climate location. It is rich and textural, with dense fruit flavors of melon, grapefruit and kiwi and a lush and creamy mouthfeel.
Wine: River's Edge 2017 Vintage Farm Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Elkton Oregon)

Appellation: Rowdy Bush
Review: A beefy, savory aspect gives this concentrated and full-bodied wine some nice complexity. Its richly layered tannins coat the mouth while deep and persistent blueberry and blackberry flavors taste compelling and delicious. Best after 2023.
Wine: Rowdy Bush 2016 Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Review: A 100% whole-cluster bottling from Glenrose Vineyard, this whimsically labeled wine combines dark black currant and blackberry on the nose with saddle leather and earthy aromas. The palate is very earthy as well, with stewed black-plum and turned loam flavors.
Wine: Saint K 2017 Dial Tone Mourvèdre (Adelaida District)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This twist-top blend of various vineyards is an affordable and excellent way to get a taste of what this historic winery is up to. Aromas of black raspberry, turned loam and savory dried meats lead into a tense palate that bursts with berry and is layered with black rock minerality.
Wine: Saucelito Canyon 2016 Backroads Zinfandel (San Luis Obispo)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Woody aromas frame the blackberry-jam and vanilla-cookie scents on the nose of this blend of 43% Cabernet Sauvignon, 33% Primitivo and 24% Merlot. Concentrated flavors of blackberry and black-plum jam are leveled by pine-needle herbs on the rich palate.
Wine: Sculpterra 2015 Figurine Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Calistoga, Napa, California, US
Review: Inviting in rich layers that taste of cinnamon toast, dusty black fruit and clove, this is a powerfully built and nicely layered wine that has tannic structure to spare.
Wine: Summers 2014 Checkmate Cabernet Sauvignon (Calistoga)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: A smooth black-cherry aroma meets with a touch of red flower on the nose of this Merlot, which is blended with 25% Sangiovese. The broad mouthfeel and tannic tension carry flavors of baking spice and dark fruit.
Wine: McClain Cellars 2016 Purpose Road Merlot (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: This fortified rosé is in its own class. With 110 g/L of residual sugar and 18.5% alcohol, this is close to a Port in its overall makeup. It has concentrated flavors of marzipan, candied fruits, orange marmalade and rock candy. Drink now and over the next five years.
Wine: Björnson 2016 Ratafia Rosé (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine is a blend of 46% Cabernet Sauvignon, 35% Cabernet Franc and 19% Merlot. The aromas are locked up at present, with notes of herb, flower, mineral and black fruit. The palate is incredibly tightly wound, full of dark fruit flavors and firm tannins. It needs time in the cellar to come together. Best after 2022.
Wine: Cadence 2015 Tapteil Vineyard Red (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Carlton Cellars
Review: Sourced from eight-year-old vines, this tangy young wine is bursting with tart grapefruit and pineapple fruit. It's leesy and refreshing, with underlying minerality and bountiful acidity.
Wine: Carlton Cellars 2017 Pinot Blanc (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: In this lovely and complex white from estate fruit, winemaker Elizabeth Vianna blends 79% Sauvignon Blanc with 21% Sauvignon Gris to offer an intense, ripe and thick-bodied wine that's lush and layered. The fruit is a mix of green apple and quince.
Wine: Chimney Rock 2016 Elevage Blanc Estate Grown White (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Review: This is made from a majority of Pinot Noir alongside Chardonnay and Pinot Gris. Aged three-and-a-half years in bottle, it's complex and approachable in equal measure. Cherry, peach and a twist of lime round out the lush palate, with integrated acidity underlining its freshness.
Wine: Domaine Carneros 2014 Brut Cuvée Sparkling (Carneros)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Walnut and toasted oak aromas meet with poached and roasted apples on the nose. Flavors of sliced yellow pear and honeysuckle sit atop a rocky mineral note on the palate.
Wine: Edna Valley Vineyard 2016 Winemaker Series Heritage Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Firestone
Review: Black cherry, cocoa and turned loam aromas show on the nose. Bright berry and cherry flavors meet with tobacco and ancho chile dust on the palate.
Wine: Firestone 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Franciscan
Review: This is a finely made wine, blended with 10% Merlot and smaller bits of Petit Verdot and Malbec. It offers silky tannins and lovely notes of dried herb, sage, black cherry and blackberry. The finish is dusted in cocoa powder.
Wine: Franciscan 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Mint, lavender and rose-petal aromas make for an exotic floral entry as substantial tannins and body weight build strength on the palate. Well made, the wine is robust in dark-cherry fruit and a lasting note of toasted oak.
Wine: Fulcrum 2016 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Smoothed-out aromas of caramelized blackberry, vanilla and purple flowers make for a very full and inviting nose on this bottling. Black-cherry, baking-spice and mocha-cappuccino flavors show on the lush and hedonistic palate, which is hard not to like.
Wine: J. Lohr 2016 Gesture Syrah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Crisp aromas of nectarine meet with riper melon and chalky tension on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very restrained at first but then allows smooth with flavors of melon, papaya and lime rind to take over.
Wine: Jaffurs 2017 Thompson Vineyard Grenache Blanc (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Joseph Cellars
Review: Tight in tannin structure and reductive qualities, this opens slowly to offer a robust ripeness and intensity of strawberry and cherry jam. Dark chocolate and black tea season the lengthy finish.
Wine: Joseph Cellars 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: This is best viewed as a rosé, as the three-day cold soak prior to fermentation has pulled a lovely copper color out of the Pinot Gris. It's bright and lively, with spicy cinnamon and a core of baked apple. It lingers nicely, adding pekoe tea and a touch of caramel.
Wine: Keeler 2017 Skin Contact Pinot Gris (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Klinker Brick
Review: A deep dark color leads to floral and cinnamon aromas, nicely concentrated blueberry and boysenberry flavors and a multi-layered texture due to fine-grained tannins. This wine has delicious richness and ripeness that outweigh the varietal's typical astringency.
Wine: Klinker Brick 2015 Petite Sirah (Lodi)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Smashed blackberry, roasted meats, asphalt and toasty oak aromas show strongly on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard off of Montebello Road. Very earthy flavors of tar and turned soil come through on the palate, framed by very dry tannins and a finishing with a hint of cocoa.
Wine: Left Bend 2014 Fellom Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Coming from Ranch at the End of the Road Vineyard, aromas of blackberry and blue fruit are followed by ripe, full-bodied fruit flavors with slightly gritty tannins. It delivers a lot of hedonistic appeal.
Wine: Liberty Lake 2016 Reserve Syrah (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Review: Big fat berries meet with turned loam and crushed slate on the approachable nose of this blend of Zinfandel, Syrah, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Dried berry and potpourri flavors meet with popping acidity on the palate, which finishes on cocoa and mint spices.
Wine: Lorenzi Estate 2014 Catalyst Private Reserve Red (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Smoky and reduced, this is a dense, tannic and boldly flavored wine, its flavors a mix of black tea, baked orange and red currant. Baking spice notes pierce the finish.
Wine: MacRostie 2016 Rodgers Creek Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This is a soft, delicate and lightly styled red from the appellation, earthy and quietly rich in caramelized oak and baked cherry. It has a nice balance of nutmeg and cola on the finish.
Wine: MacRostie 2016 Wildcat Mountain Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This is a beautifully made wine, crispy in mineral elements and lovely layers of fig, Meyer lemon, tangerine and pear. Medium bodied, it holds its fruit and acidity well, with gritty layers of texture from start to finish.
Wine: Peter Paul Wines 2016 Live Free or Die Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Monterey, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Tar, forest floor and muddy earth aromas meet with wild berries on the nose of this blend of 52% Syrah and 48% Cabernet Sauvignon. Strong herb and mint flavors arise on the palate, giving complexity to the black-plum and cedar backdrop.
Wine: Pianetta 2016 Bilancio Syrah-Cabernet Sauvignon (Monterey)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Smoky oak and caramel enriched the expansive palate of this intense, ripe and powerful red that's black in brooding fruit and root beer. Well made in a big style, it finishes in mocha chocolate.
Wine: Sonoma-Loeb 2016 Apple Lane Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Fruit for this wine is 43% Destiny Ridge, 30% Wallula, 14% Red Willow and 13% Stillwater Creek vineyards. Aromas of blueberry, herb and flower are followed by ripe but still in check blue and black fruit flavors that coat the palate but show a sense of elegance. Herbal notes persist on the finish. It brings a lot of appeal.
Wine: Structure 2016 Bauhaus Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Review: This wine is intriguing in an earthy oolong note that's backed by ripe apricot and peach. It's well concentrated on the palate in these flavors, with a defined layer of acidity keeping it persistent and lengthy.
Wine: The Grapes of Roth 2017 Dry Riesling (Long Island)

Appellation: Suisun Valley, North Coast, California, US
Review: Rich boysenberry flavors and a hint of sweetness make this wine easy to sip in spite of its full body and rather thick tannins. It delivers blackberry-jam and mocha accents while the broad texture seems to coat the sides of the mouth.
Wine: Vezer Family Vineyard 2015 Cassie Petite Sirah (Suisun Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: This blend is rich in feel, with elongated tannins to support the full body. Elements of lavender and sage accent a core of black licorice and ripe plum on the palate.
Wine: William Hill Estate 2015 Bench Red (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: A hint of flowers in the aroma of this rich and full-bodied wine gives way to ripe fig, pear and honey flavors on the palate. It's so ripe that it verges on sweetness, and has an opulent, viscous texture that helps the honeyed character cling to the sides of the mouth for a lingering finish.
Wine: Wood Family Vineyards 2017 Para Mas Amigas Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Monterey, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Tightly wound on the nose, this clonal combo offers citrusy aromas of grapefruit rind and sharp apple flesh on the nose. The palate is wrapped in a chalky, tight texture, revealing flavors of Anjou pear and Pink Lady apple.
Wine: Wrath 2016 3 Clone Chardonnay (Monterey)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: A fine example of the variety, this wine is crisply defined and brimming with a mix of grapefruit, melon and kiwi flavors. It is fruit driven for sure, but detailed and textural, with lingering fruit tones that wrap smoothly into a clean finish.
Wine: Apolloni 2017 Estate Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Sharp pomegranate aromas and concentrated strawberry tones meet with star anise, clove and crushed rocks on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. It's taut on the palate with tightly woven raspberry and a touch of thyme, proving rather light and easy.
Wine: Au Bon Climat 2015 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Made in an austere style, this has a backbone of tannin and power that builds on the midpalate, with the oak prominent and supportive. Meyer lemon and tangerine flavors are seasoned in touches of nutmeg and ginger, making for a balanced experience of fruit and spice.
Wine: Balletto 2015 Sexton Hill Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Thirst quenching in lemon, anise and wet stone, this is a steely, focused white that will appeal to fans of the unoaked style. It finishes on a lingering baked-bread tone.
Wine: Balletto 2017 Teresa's Unoaked Estate Grown Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Beaulieu Vineyard
Review: A great value from the great producer, this includes 5% Touriga, 4% Petite Sirah and 1% of mixed other grapes. Together, they offer juicy cherry notes and a big imprint of toasted tannin, the backbone of oak substantial yet soft and approachable. The finish is all mocha.
Wine: Beaulieu Vineyard 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Beaulieu Vineyard
Review: Brawny char and dark chocolate create a stage for jammy black cherry and blackberry to star in this big-boned full-bodied wine. Generous use of oak and substantial tannin give it an oomph of power that persists through a soft rounded finish.
Wine: Beaulieu Vineyard 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

Appellation: Berryessa Gap
Review: This is one of the lightest-tasting and most charming examples of a notoriously blunt and tannic varietal. Cherries and violets accent the aromas, bright black-cherry flavors brighten the palate and a moderately tannic texture gives a snap to the mouthfeel.
Wine: Berryessa Gap 2016 Petite Sirah (Yolo County)

Appellation: Blue Rock
Review: This has lithe bright red fruit with a touch of blueberry—flavors that are integrated and elegantly interwoven. Polished tannins give it grip and weight within this medium-bodied approach. This wine enjoyable and approachable in its understated complexity.
Wine: Blue Rock 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Review: This is an aromatic, bone-dry wine that shows off the grape's floral side. It smells of jasmine, rose and lychee, tastes crisp and refreshing and finishes with an appetizing nip of astringency.
Wine: Bonterra 2017 Dry Muscat (Lake County)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Made of 90% Cabernet Sauvignon, with the balance Merlot. Cherry, graphite, raspberry and herb aromas lead to even-keeled dark fruit flavors that break up a bit in the middle before pulling back together. The tannins come off as a bit gruff out of the gate but soften with significant time open. Give it some time or a very long decant. Best after 2022, and it has the stuffing to go well beyond that.
Wine: Cadence 2015 Camerata Cara Mia Vineyard Red (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This is a fruity white that is balanced by buoyant acidity. Fermented mostly in stainless steel, it offers defined flavors of lemon, melon and lime.
Wine: Cannonball 2017 Eleven Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: Here is a very fine example of Oregon Pinot Gris. It pushes fresh apple and pear fruit right down the heart of the palate. It's full bodied and balanced, drinking at its youthful best already.
Wine: Cardwell Hill 2017 Estate Bottled Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Cubanisimo Vineyards
Review: Bright fruit flavors blend apple and pear with spicy highlights. A hint of lemon rind adorns the finish. All in all, it's a tasty, well-made and totally enjoyable bottle.
Wine: Cubanisimo Vineyards 2017 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Juicy in blue and black fruit, this is a thick, tangy and savory wine. Clove, forest floor and black tea play supporting roles on the palate. It's rich and will satisfy fans of a richer style of Pinot.
Wine: Davis Bynum 2016 Jane's VIneyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: This hearty red wine is a blend of 57% Cabernet Sauvignon, 37% Merlot, 5% Cabernet Franc and 1% Petit Verdot. The palate twists together flavors of cedar and sage with black cherry and blackberry, supported by a full-bodied, powerful structure.
Wine: Duckhorn 2014 The Discussion Red (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Quiet aromatically, this bold, reserve-tier wine includes 8% Petite Sirah. Thick and softly layered in blue fruit, it also offers meaty leather and black pepper amongst waves of rich concentration.
Wine: Francis Coppola 2015 Reserve Syrah (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: Reduced at first, this wine comes around to reveal soft layers of baked plum, graham cracker and coffee. Full bodied and ripe, it offers a balanced oak nuance and a soft texture that speaks to the varietal character.
Wine: Grgich Hills 2015 Estate Grown Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Keuka Spring
Review: A bright nose of apple and pear aromas melds with an edging of tangerine and grapefruit in this off-dry wine. The palate is delicate and soft, displaying a plump orchard-fruit flavor backed by orange acidity. A peach-fuzz texture lingers on the finish.
Wine: Keuka Spring 2017 Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Sonoma County-Monterey County, California Other, California, US
Review: A blend of two worlds (62% of the fruit from Sonoma County and 38% from Monterey), this is an approachable red wine, with a juicy entry of savory forest floor, black tea and black cherry. It finishes in a tartness of acidity akin to rhubarb.
Wine: La Follette 2016 Los Primeros Pinot Noir (Sonoma County-Monterey County)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Wet stone, crushed rocks and a touch of funky grass aromas show on the nose of this bottling, the first for young vintner Gina Hildebrand. The palate is all about minerality, reminiscent of wet sidewalks on a rainy day, along with touches of lime skin, grapefruit pith and ash.
Wine: Lady of the Sunshine 2017 Coquelicot Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: Some tasters may prefer the Classique to the Reserve, because it's a bit fruitier and more open at first taste. Both are leesy and textural, this one with mineral-drenched flavors of melon and apple. It was fermented and aged in neutral puncheons and stainless steel.
Wine: Lange 2017 Classique Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
Review: Spiced apple and pear aromas mix with lemon and ginger on the nose. The palate is dry in style, with a juicy orchard-fruit flavor that's peppered with white blossoms and lemongrass. A honed bed of acidity frames it all, with spiced apricot marking the close.
Wine: Millbrook 2017 Proprietor's Special Reserve Dry Riesling (Hudson River Region)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: This unoaked wine is positively charged with crisp apple and grapefruit flavors, has tangy acidity and medium body. Refreshment is in the forefront from the apple-skin aromas to citrus flavors to a mouthwatering finish.
Wine: Portalupi 2017 Graziano Vineyard Arneis (Mendocino)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This has a carbonic freshness and high-strung acidity. The fruit is nuanced, fresh and powerful in strawberry and orange.
Wine: Red Car 2015 Zephyr Farms Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Santa Barbara Winery
Review: From portions of the Burning Creek and Lafond Vineyards, this fruit-forward wine is a solid deal, starting with strong aromas of black cherry, licorice and nutmeg. It's a full-flavored Pinot Noir that currently shows a rather tense structure, carrying flavors of black raspberry, boysenberry and black pepper.
Wine: Santa Barbara Winery 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Rutherford, Napa, California, US
Review: Sanguine notes of red currant and plum meet a light dusting of baking spice and clove in this well-made, well-integrated wine. It shows a heartiness of full-bodied richness and toasted oak.
Wine: St. Supéry 2014 Estate Vineyard Merlot (Rutherford)

Appellation: Stephanie
Review: Toasty black-cherry jam meets smoky oak in this robust, rich varietal wine, blended with a small amount of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Abundantly ripe, it finishes soft and round.
Wine: Stephanie 2014 Malbec (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: Aromas of fuzzy peach and powdered slate start off this bright, sunny semidry Riesling. The palate brings ripe red apple and dusty minerals to the fore, enlivened by a flowing river of acidity. Ending on a talc-dusted green apple tone, this is a well-balanced, well-priced offering.
Wine: Wagner 2017 Semi-Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Review: Concentrated red-cherry aromas meet with caramel, baking spice and vanilla brioche on the nose of this bottling. Ripe red-fruit flavors are lifted by red licorice and more caramel on the palate, which rides through chunky tannins and finishes on vanilla.
Wine: Wilson Creek 2015 Winemaker's Reserve Zinfandel (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This full-bodied elevated-alcohol wine offers an enticing salt and pepper aroma followed by meaty wood-smoke accents that complement the underlying blackberry flavors. It matches the grapey fruitiness of the wine with oak accents and a just-firm enough texture.
Wine: Wood Family Vineyards 2016 Big Wood Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This kitchen sink blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and more offers aromas of boysenberry, alpine strawberry and peppercorn on the fresh nose. The earthy palate combines violet and black cherry with a pinch of pepper.
Wine: Zaca Mesa 2016 Toyon Red (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Altvs
Review: This is a grippy, dense and powerful red, blended with 5% Petit Verdot. Approachable in its youth, it shows strong flavors of red currant, cherry and coconut, with a lushness that lingers on the finish.
Wine: Altvs 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)

Appellation: Sonoma Mountain, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Aromatically, vanilla oak supports a medium-bodied ripeness of baked pineapple and lemon curd—viscous richness that works in the context of its balanced acidity.
Wine: Belden Barns 2016 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sonoma Mountain)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Intense waves of black currant, elderberry, lavender and tar show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard high above the eastern flanks of the Salinas Valley. The palate is framed by solid tannins and acid, offering very ripe black-currant flavors that are ready to drink now.
Wine: Big Basin 2015 Coastview Vineyard Terraces Syrah (Monterey County)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: A dance between tangy acidity and a creamy texture plays out wonderfully in this medium- to full-bodied wine. It offers fresh citrus aromas and generous apple and honeydew melon flavors while the mouthfeel is broad and smooth.
Wine: Binz 2017 White Grenache (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: A perfectly composed blend of 30% Riesling, 20% Pinot Blanc, 25% Muscat, 10% Gewürztraminer and 15% Pinot Gris, this nicely integrates the various aromatic, spicy and fruity components from the different grapes. Tart apple, orange, lemon and grapefruit flavors come in equal proportion, with a refreshing minerality underscoring the fruit.
Wine: Brooks 2017 Amycas White (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
