Review: Vanilla, tire rubber, char and cherry aromas are followed by ripe black fruit flavors with a lightly tacky feel. The tannins give a squeeze. It finishes warm.
Wine: Marshall Davis 2015 Seven Hills Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Cabernet Sauvignon makes up just over half of this wine, with the balance being Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Dried herb, graphite and cherry candy aromas are followed by somewhat woody, straightforward fruit flavors.
Wine: Maryhill 2015 Serendipity Proprietor's Reserve Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Original House Wine
Review: Aromas of green herb, sweet black currant and sugared plum are followed by lightly sweet fruit flavors. It's a straightforward, easy drinker.
Wine: Original House Wine 2016 Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: This blends 52% Petit Verdot with 48% Zinfandel for an intensely tannic expression of dried herb and clove that overwhelms.
Wine: Paraduxx 2015 Rector Creek Block 4 Red (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: Fairly rich and ripe tasting, this medium-bodied wine has strong oak aromas and flavors that register as cedar, tobacco, dill and pine. It is light in terms of tannin and acidity, has a touch of sweetness and feels very smooth in texture.
Wine: Sobon Estate 2015 Red A Premium Red (Amador County)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: It's not clear what happened here, other than that the vegetal aromas and flavors suggest unripe fruit in the mix. The wine spent 14 months in 30% new oak, which can be detected in a certain toasty component, but sticks out from the herbal/vegetal core like a sore thumb. Maybe more bottle aging will smooth it over a bit.
Wine: Coelho 2016 Paciência Coelho Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Lorimar
Review: Blatant oak aromas and flavors dominate whatever fruit flavors might lie underneath. It smells sweet and spicy, tastes spicy and has moderate tannins and high alcohol.
Wine: Lorimar 2015 Red (California)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: This is a fruity, soft-textured and sweet wine with cherry and raspberry flavors. The mouthfeel is rich and plush and the acidity is quite low.
Wine: Naggiar 2017 Estate Rosé (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: This wine is very fruity, smooth and polished, showing light oaky touches on ripe plum and black-cherry flavors that finish on the sweet side. The texture is soft and acidity feels low.
Wine: Trentadue 2016 Old Patch Red (California)

Appellation: Bedell
Review: Quiet tones of white flowers and citrus carry the nose and palate. This is a simple, straightforward white that would appeal to those looking for a light, crisp refresher.
Wine: Bedell 2016 Viognier (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Creamy thick with a candied midpalate of watermelon Jolly Rancher and strawberry jam, this has elements of dried herb and jalapeño.
Wine: Kenwood 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Ripe peach and apple aromas are out front, followed by whiffs of tropical fruit. The palate brings dried apple flavors with a lightly smoky finish.
Wine: Maryhill 2017 Tudor Hills Vineyards Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This blends 67% Syrah with 33% Malbec to powerful effect. The wine is thick in nondescript red berry and blueberry notes and oaky tannin.
Wine: Spann Vineyards 2014 S & M Syrah-Malbec (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: A straightforward nose of citrus and orchard fruit carries to the delicately semidry palate. It's light in feel, with quiet impressions of apple, lemon and stone.
Wine: Treleaven 2016 Estate Bottled Semi-Dry Riesling (Cayuga Lake)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: This is a light and lightly sweet wine that looks like a dark rosé, smells very fruity and tastes like cherry juice. It is simple and soft: something to please people who don't like dry wines.
Wine: Sepal Estate 2017 Soft Red (California)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: A strong aroma of cedar wood and fresh-cut oak lead to smoky cranberry, blackberry and wood-ash flavors and a flood of tannins. The wine is deep in color and aggressive in flavor.
Wine: French Bar 2016 Gold Dust Red (California)

Appellation: Bedell
Review: Faint aromas of citrus are covered by a bit of a soapy floral tone. Light in body and concentration, apple skin and citrus flavors are met with a mild vein of acidity.
Wine: Bedell 2016 Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Review: A mild nose of citrus and creamed corn carries to the medium-bodied palate. The flavors are fresher in nature, with broad citrus and melon carried by a soft vein of acidity.
Wine: Lieb 2017 Bridge Lane Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Maryhill
Review: The aromas don't seem entirely settled at present, showing some reductive notes. The palate is light, tart and tangy. It doesn't stand up on its own but might have a place at the dinner table, though the listed alcohol seems a bit high for that as well.
Wine: Maryhill 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 28% Cabernet Franc and 12% Merlot is very extracted on the nose with strong blackberry, pepper, roasted beef and balsamic aromas. It's tart and tangy on the palate, with a hint of black plum and mint chocolate chip.
Wine: Millésimé 2012 Bleu Saphir Red (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US

Wine: Pedroncelli 2016 Barrel Select Classico Red (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: You'll have to look closely to spot the Trouble designation on the front label, which differentiates this from the estate's Gemini cuvée. There are mousy scents and flavors, some blackberry fruit, and a funky finish with sour tannins.
Wine: A Blooming Hill Vineyard 2016 Trouble Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Review: Green aromas like pine needles and celery are followed by rather tangy apple and herb flavors in this medium-bodied, basic and refreshing wine.
Wine: Collier Creek 2016 Front Coach Chardonnay (Lodi)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: A sharp, strong and pervasive scent of some feral animal aroma takes away much of the potential pleasure here. There's cherry fruit as well, but the finish is short and muted. Two bottles were tasted with the same results.
Wine: Soléna 2016 Guadalupe Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: This soft but full-bodied wine smells like maple syrup and brown sugar and tastes ripe, almost sweet, due to low acidity and plenty of oak treatment.
Wine: Gen5 2016 Ancestral Red (California)

Appellation: Melt
Review: This wine is buttery all the way through. It starts with an aroma of buttered popcorn, proceeds to Butterfinger candy flavors and has an almost sweet finish. Not for dry wine diehards, but it's a fun thing to sample.
Wine: Melt 2016 Chardonnay (Lodi)

Review: Made from Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec, Syrah, Zinfandel and Graciano, all stainless-steel fermented, this wine is earthy and rough, with a diluted palate of peach fuzz and blueberry.
Wine: Simi 2017 Dry Rosé (Sonoma County)

Appellation: David Bruce
Review: This wine is creamy and hugely oaky, with a sweetness of candied marshmallow.
Wine: David Bruce 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Braised green pepper, herb and tar aromas are followed by lightly sweet plum flavors. It's extremely green for the variety.
Wine: Original House Wine 2016 Mountain Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Winery by the Creek
Review: Earthy aromas and herbal, iron-like flavors of mineral and tomato highlight this medium-bodied, lightly tannic and mature wine.
Wine: Winery by the Creek 2012 Sangiovese (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: An intensely perfumed nose of grapefruit, white grape juice and candied lime zest turn more confected in nature the more you swirl. Immensely punchy on the palate, a flavor reminiscent of Pixy Stix offers a sweet-tart nature to the wine, ending on a sweet white grape finish.
Wine: Agness 2016 Semi-Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Millésimé
Review: Extremely extracted aromas of blackberry juice veer toward vinegar on the nose of this bottling. That balsamic aspect dominates the palate.
Wine: Millésimé 2014 Malbec (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: A savory nose of nuts and smoke masks much of the fruit, yet the palate offers a bit more life with a juicy citrus core. This rounded in feel, with a tense line of acidity hiding behind that weight.
Wine: Heron Hill 2017 Unoaked Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Millésimé
Review: Extremely extracted and concentrated aromas of cherry syrup and grenadine show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is sweet and syrupy with cherry-balsamic flavors.
Wine: Millésimé 2014 Merlot (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Hound's Tree
Review: An oddly floral nose carries to an overripe, flabby palate. This is low-energy in feel, with flavors of pineapple and melon.
Wine: Hound's Tree 2016 Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine is a blend of equal parts Morrison and Copeland vineyards. Aromas of lees, custard and butter are followed by lightly styled, herb and wilted flower flavors that taper on the finish. It doesn't all come off.
Wine: MCM Wine Co. 2017 Marveluxe Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Sagelands
Review: Aromas of lees, bruised apple and pear are followed by light, sleek fruit flavors with a tart finish.
Wine: Sagelands 2017 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This blend of 54% Merlot, 38% Cabernet Franc and 8% Cabernet Sauvignon is extremely dense and yet tangy on the nose, and cloudy in the glass. The palate is overly tangy and muddy.
Wine: Millésimé 2012 Lumiere Du Fleur Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Simi
Review: Reductive and sulfurous, this wine tastes of big oak, baked pineapple and hazelnut.
Wine: Simi 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Review: Very light hints of strawberry fruit are more or less masked with high-toned aromas of nail polish. There's a gluey streak running through the wine and on into the finish.
Wine: Cathedral Ridge 2015 Dampier Vineyard Pinot Noir (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: From a vineyard situated amongst ranchettes near the winery, this wine begins with extremely beautiful scents of black cherry, rosewater and sharp nose-tingling cola spice, proving juicy but elegant. The palate is full of brilliant flavors, from snappy black raspberry to more rounded strawberry sorbet, lifted by allspice, clove, vanilla and plenty of fresh acidity.
Wine: Claiborne & Churchill 2016 Greengate Ranch & Vineyard Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: Elegant and silky, this medium-bodied wine is carried by aromas of cinnamon and dried currant. The palate brings tones of mineral, plum and black tea, with a lightly tannic texture and a good dose of acidity. The wine has a distinct personality and showcases the high-elevation El Dorado appellation's suitability for Rhône varieties.
Wine: Skinner 2015 Estate Grown Mourvèdre (El Dorado)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Review: There's a prominent but relatively restrained sense of cherry juice on the nose of this bottling alongside gamy meat, sagebrush and composting rose-petal aromas. The palate is framed by strong energy, which delivers red fruit, sharp red spice and tinges of spearmint and tarragon.
Wine: Byron 2015 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Lean and light aromas of pomegranate, tart strawberry and sour cherry mix with plenty of clove on the elegant nose of this botting by the actress Challen Cates. There is a strong spice quality to the sip, where loads of star anise and clove play against the darker cherry and mulberry flavors.
Wine: Challen 2015 Zotovich Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Review: Perennially delicious, this vintage holds up tradition by offering fresh, strong flavors of strawberry, raspberry and vanilla cookie. Blending 70% Chardonnay and 30% Pinot Noir from several vineyards, including Tognetti and Hyde, it's floral and softly interwoven—a fresh, focused delight. A portion of proceeds goes to Napa agricultural land preservation.
Wine: Schramsberg 2014 Querencia Brut Rosé Sparkling (Carneros)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Effusive black-cherry and raspberry aromas lead to more tightly wound rhubarb and red-cherry flavors in this attractively restrained, medium-bodied and fascinating wine that has the nervy energy to age well. It has a good sense of balance due to firm acidity and light tannins that keeps it refreshing sip after sip. Best after 2022.
Wine: Hirsch 2015 Raschen Ridge Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Green Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Rich and round with underlying notes of wet stone, apple and lemon peel, this beautifully made wine benefits National Geographic's Ocean Initiative, helping to support sustainable fishing and establish marine protected areas. It finishes crisp and dry with lasting elegance—as good to drink as it's doing good.
Wine: Iron Horse 2014 National Geographic Ocean Reserve Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Green Valley)

Appellation: Humboldt County, North Coast, California, US
Review: This wine is vibrant, elegant, and abundantly flavorful while maintaining a lean nervy mouthfeel. It has very expressive black-cherry and cranberry aromas, almost-tart cherry and raspberry flavors and a combo of firm tannins and fresh acidity that give the texture a nice grip.
Wine: Joseph Jewell 2015 Elk Prairie Vineyard Pinot Noir (Humboldt County)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: This wine is not too fat and not too lean, finding a great balance point between vivid fruit and black-pepper flavors and firm tannins and acidity. Little or no oak comes through in the taste, but an engaging earthy, funky, sage-like element does, making it unusually complex and interesting to sip.
Wine: Terre Rouge 2015 DTR Ranch Syrah (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Green Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This is from a prime site in the Sebastopol Hills and it shows plenty of cool-climate provenance. Earthy pine needle, sage and mushroom are complemented by savory strawberry, tangerine and tart cherry—the flavors blending well with fresh sparks of acidity and spice.
Wine: Wait Cellars 2015 Devoto Garden Vineyard Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: Beautifully floral in jasmine and apple blossom, this is a dry, mineral-laden expression of the variety that shines in wet stone, peach and lemon, while delivering sticky, refreshing acidity. Well integrated and light in approach, it will work beautifully on the table as a white with body and elegance.
Wine: Chappellet 2017 Signature Chenin Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Cracked white and black pepper meet with elderberry and violet on the stunning nose of this blend, which is at once savory, juicy and floral. The palate picks up that savory touch with strong pepper spice, then come the black plum-skin flavors, all riding into a long finish.
Wine: Folded Hills 2016 August Red (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Yorkville Highlands, North Coast, California, US
Review: Rich and generous fruit flavors mingle with deft touches of sweet, spicy oak in this full-bodied and mouthfilling wine. Black cherry, ripe plum and a touch of raspberry meet cinnamon and black tea accents. Moderate tannins add good structure in this standout wine from a relative newcomer.
Wine: Brooks Note 2015 Weir Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yorkville Highlands)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Cola, loam, mint and dried black cherries show on the nose of this library release from the boundary-pushing winery owned by tech mogul T. J. Rodgers. The tannins are very refined on the palate, easing in the earthy flavors of bay leaf, pine needle, fig and black plum, which is nearing prune.
Wine: Clos de la Tech 2004 Domaine Lois Louise Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: Mellow and relaxed in texture and extremely ripe in flavor, this full-bodied wine oozes jammy blackberry and black cherry on a mouthcoating structure of soft tannins and acidity.
Wine: Donum 2015 Year of the Ram Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Review: Made from 90% Pinot Noir and 10% Chardonnay, this is cranberry colored and flavored, with a rich, thick mousse. Delicately textured, it has back notes of orange and strawberry and bright, fresh, persistent acidity and a complex lingering of seashell.
Wine: Gloria Ferrer 2015 Late Disgorged Brut Rosé Sparkling (Carneros)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: Small producer Ralph Hertelendy blends 81% Merlot with smaller percentages of other red Bordeaux grapes from a variety of sites across the valley in this well-made, complex wine. Char, smoked meat, juicy currant and cranberry are set against tight compressed tannins and intense oak, suggesting more time in bottle. Enjoy best 2025–2030.
Wine: Hertelendy 2015 Signature Mountain Red (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Spicy, complex and layered, this is a richly interwoven vineyard-designate. It shines in earthy lavender and forest floor, spiced cherry and cardamom, lingering with ease on the palate within a balanced framework of acidity and tenacious freshness.
Wine: Inman Family 2015 Pratt Vine Hill Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Demure and lightly earthy in forest and cardamom, this wine is defined by that underlying spiciness and a lengthy background of oak. Its balanced take on fruit includes strong twists of orange and wild strawberry.
Wine: Siduri 2016 Perry Ranch Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Grown on a vineyard less than three miles to the ocean behind Cambria, this bottling shows popcorn, light marshmallow and light cream on the very plush nose. The sip tightens up considerably, focusing on fresh and racy lime peels yet with richer hints of clotted cream and flowing butter in the background.
Wine: Stolo 2016 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo)

Appellation: Folded Hills
Review: Savory aromas of white pepper, charred wood and roasted black fruit run alongside elegant touches of purple flowers on the very layered nose of this bottling. It's lightly bodied for Syrah but very energetic on the palate, offering lilac, violet, pepper and elderberry flavors.
Wine: Folded Hills 2015 Syrah (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Deep and dark aromas of black plum meet with smoke, turned earth and dried herbs on the nose of this bottling. The palate combines juicy flavors of baked cherry and more plum with sharp baking spices, all framed by strong but pleasant tannins.
Wine: Gainey 2016 Limited Selection Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Review: A mingling of 55% Pinot Noir and 45% Chardonnay, this imparts nicely complex, layered elements of brioche, wet stone and lemon rind, the acidity tenacious and complementary. Dry, its late disgorging makes for admirable length and breadth.
Wine: Gloria Ferrer 2007 Carneros Cuvée Late Disgorged Brut Sparkling (Carneros)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This light- to medium-bodied wine shows good tension between expressive black currant and damp earth aromas and an almost steely texture. Though richer than the 2014, it's lean in mouthfeel, crisp and lightly tannic, and the flavors are quite enjoyable in a restrained way. Best after 2022.
Wine: Hirsch 2016 The Bohan-Dillon Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Sonoma Mountain, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This is an approachable release from the mountain estate that is known for ageworthy Cabernet. Earthy and herbal, it offers clove, cedar and peppery notes. The structure is rounded and concentrated in balanced black fruit.
Wine: Laurel Glen 2015 Counterpoint Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Mountain)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: This wine could be the centerpiece for a great dinner due to its combination of vivid, concentrated fruit flavors and good structure. Bold black-cherry and blackberry aromas lead to layered fruit and light spice flavors backed by moderate tannins and good fruit acidity that add grip to the mouthfeel.
Wine: Navarro 2016 Deep End Blend Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Review: The nose on this single-vineyard expression combines ripe red fruits of pomegranate and raspberry with spicy Red Hots cinnamon candies. Bright red currant and more raspberry flavors explode on the palate, where nuances of Earl Grey tea, potpourri and rose petal flavors make for a fresh sip.
Wine: Roar 2016 Sierra Mar Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Skinner
Review: This wine tastes bold and assertive, pushing smoky oak and vanilla flavors close to the edge but rescuing them with attractive ripe flavors of blackberry and black cherry. The wine is full bodied, layered and mouthcoating, supported by moderate tannins that melt into the bold flavors.
Wine: Skinner 2015 Syrah (El Dorado)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: An engaging spice-rack aroma and fruit flavors so ripe they're almost sweet make this a gorgeous, generous wine that feels wonderful on the palate and warm on the finish. Light touches of earth, black-pepper and new leather flavors meld with blackberry and blueberry while a full body carries them all to a lingering fnish.
Wine: Terre Rouge 2015 High Slopes Syrah (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Suisun Valley, North Coast, California, US
Review: This wine explodes with apricot and apple aromas. It's one of the purest expressions of the grape variety to be found in California, and brings excellent depth, concentration and personality to the table. Crisp acidity helps the texture to be lively, and despite light alcohol, it's rich enough to create a lingering finish.
Wine: Bodkin 2017 The White Rino Albariño (Suisun Valley)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: The nose on this bottling from a vineyard first planted in 1970 starts with woody sagebrush, forest floor, mushroom and moss aromas, but leads into ripe cranberry and rose petals, with the slightest hint of game. Bay leaf, marjoram and tangy cranberry touches complete the palate.
Wine: Byron 2015 Julia's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Loads of savory aromas, from cracked black pepper, tar, game and beef crust, mesh with roasted black-currant and coffee tones on the nose of this bottling from the historic vineyard. The palate combines black fruit with coffee cream, savory lamb and more cracked pepper.
Wine: Epiphany 2015 Bien Nacido Vineyard Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Green Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Made from equal parts Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, and late-disgorged after seven years en tirage, this is the winery's top-of-the-line bubbly, and it shows. Gorgeous wafts of peach skin tease the nose before dry, layered components of lemon peel, white flower and apple skin shine on the palate, dipped in a strong mineral streak of crushed stone.
Wine: Iron Horse 2010 Brut LD Sparkling (Green Valley)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Concentrated morello cherry, packed flower petals, turned soil, light pepper and concentrated watermelon aromas make for an exotic nose on this bottling from Alta Colina Vineyard. Chalky tannins make for a grippy, somewhat sticky entry to the palate, where black-plum and wild animal flavors arise.
Wine: Paix Sur Terre 2016 Comes a Time Mourvèdre (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Fruit for this wine comes from the winery's vineyard in the foothills of the Blue Mountains. The aromas pop, with notes of nori, black pepper, sea breeze, parsley, black olive tapenade, fresh flower, herb and wet stone, revealing more complexity on each swirl. Smoked meat aromas emerge over time. The palate is elegant yet richly flavorful, with an extremely long, smoked meat finish. This one is all about delicacy and finesse but it brings both in abundance.
Wine: Reynvaan Family Vineyards 2015 In the Hills Estate Foothills in the Sun Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: Subtle savory flavors like herbs and mushrooms and consommé meet mellow fruit flavors of Bosc pear and yellow plum in this full-bodied and lushly textured wine. It has a broad mouth-filling presence, and flavors that are at once rich but also show some restraint that encourages more sipping. Save until at least 2021 for an extra treat.
Wine: Terre Rouge 2016 Monarch Mine Vineyard Roussanne (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Bright lemon aromas meet with toast and sweet oak on the nose of this single-vineyard bottling. The palate is aggressive in flavor, with bright citrus, buttery brioche, sea salt and a vanilla finish, all wrapped in grippy structure with well-integrated oak flavors.
Wine: Bernardus 2016 Sierra Mar Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Fairly tart and juicy on the nose, this bottling from one of the region's oldest vineyards offers raspberry, baking spice and a hint of wild boar flesh on the nose. The flavors are full of barely ripe red fruit and more gamy qualities, and there is plenty of acid cutting through the rounded mouthfeel.
Wine: Byron 2015 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Dark aromas of black cherry, wet slate, loam and strong baking spice show on the nose of this bottling, which comes from some of the more neutral barrels in the winery. It's crisp and juicy on the palate, with rich flavors of wild cherry and cola, all cut by strong acidity.
Wine: Fess Parker 2016 Older Barrels Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Freshly smashed lemon aromas meet with yeast and sourdough on the nose of this excellent bubbly bottling. The palate's bubbles are soft and inviting, with flavors of yuzu, fresh bread and the slightest hints of smoke and ash.
Wine: Goat Bubbles 2015 Blanc de Noirs Bien Nacido Vineyard Sparkling (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This bold, flavorful wine offers well-integrated tones of red currant, dried cherry, dusty leather and clove. Savory and profound in elongated tannins, it holds its powerful ripeness and structure with pride, showing the stuffing to age well. Best 2024–2029.
Wine: Louis M. Martini 2014 Monte Rosso Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: While full bodied, this wine also has more than enough fruit, spice and savory nuances to give it plenty of flavor. The aroma exudes sour cherry, wild berry and underbrush while the flavors reveal ripe black cherry, rhubarb and light tea notes for an appealing and complex mix. It's called Rescue Block because the grapes are from a block of 1,000 old vines that Lula's owners nursed back to health.
Wine: Lula 2016 Rescue Block Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Review: A crisp texture and rather full body carry subtle spice and lean dry fruit flavors in this nicely reserved and complex wine. Apple skin, lemon zest and hints of toasted almond carry the palate and linger on the finish.
Wine: Schramsberg 2014 Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (North Coast)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: Made from a family estate in the eastern wilds of Napa Valley, this small-production red is fermented in a concrete tank and aged in neutral oak. It retains ebullient freshness and focus, its fruit a mix of grape, cherry and plum. Around the edges are floral aromas and superb mineral characteristics.
Wine: Wilson Foreigner 2016 Rancho Chimiles Valdiguié (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Review: This is a taut and bracing wine, with aromas of grapefruit and lime and flavors of lemon and jicama. It's rather light in bodied, but has such a refreshing, almost electric character that it still makes a big impression.
Wine: Peltier 2017 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: From the producer's estate vineyard wedged within the Vaca Mountains, this is a nicely structured wine, lengthy in dry tannin and a persistence of dried herb. A lingering fruitiness of cherry and cassis offer depth of flavor within floral aromatics of lavender and sage. The finish is defined in mocha.
Wine: Janzen 2015 Cloudy's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: Ripe and round, this generous semi-sweet wine is quite different from the average Grigio. It has ripe apple and pear aromas, concentrated fruit and light spice flavors, a broad, almost thick texture and lingering finish.
Wine: Lichen Estate 2016 Estate Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: Balanced sweetness is at the heart of this wine, a blend of 71% Flora with 16% Pinot Noir and 13% Chardonnay. Richly layered flavors of peach and vanilla complement a lingering effervescence that will work beautifully with spicy foods.
Wine: Schramsberg 2014 Crémant Demi-Sec Sparkling (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Deeply layered spice-rack aromas of clove and star anise lift the mulberry fruit on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard on the appellation's westernmost point. Tarragon and marjoram flavors give depth to elderberry and black-plum-skin backdrop, which proves rather elegant.
Wine: Bellante 2015 Bentrock Vineyard Reserve Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Butterscotch and hazelnut aromas make for a very creamy and yet not overblown nose on this bottling. It's zesty on the palate with strong lime and lemon-rind flavors, yet the core remains the clarified butter, hazelnut and cashew flavors, leading into a crème brûlée finish.
Wine: Bernardus 2016 Rosella's Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Review: This is a delightfully delicious and immensely quaffable wine, made from a majority of whole cluster-pressed, estate-grown grapes that were fermented in stainless steel. It is light in body and lively in a dried herb tone, with crisp, inviting flavors of tangerine, white peach and watermelon.
Wine: Bouchaine 2017 Vin Gris of Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This blend of Petite Sirah, Petit Verdot and Merlot is aged in new French and American oak two times (once before blending, and once after) to produce a whopper of a wine. Aromas of black cherry, toffee and vanilla are leveled by gravel and fresh raspberry. The rich sip reveals scorched caramel, roasted coffee beans and charred black-currant flavors.
Wine: Broken Earth 2014 Studium Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: Sophisticated in flavor and extremely smooth in texture, this high-elevation wine is easy to enjoy while also offering interesting nuances of fig and black pepper in the aroma, and plump plum and raspberry on the palate. It's another excellent wine from the very consistent Cedarville property.
Wine: Cedarville 2015 Estate Grenache (El Dorado)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Well-integrated aromas of clove, star anise, cola and suave black cherry show on the nose of this bottling from the southernmost vineyard currently used by winemaker Coby Parker-Garcia. Dark cherry flavors meet with sarsaparilla and cola on the rich, brawny palate.
Wine: El Lugar 2016 Hilliard Bruce Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Quite a dark expression of Pinot Noir, this wine begins with aromas of boysenberry juice, pungent star anise and a black licorice touch on the nose. On the palate, bouncy and sharp acidity drives through dark-fruit flavors, making for a very lively bottling.
Wine: Fess Parker 2016 Fiddlestix Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Spring Mountain District, Napa, California, US
Review: This wine is fermented partially in concrete, partially in amphora and French oak puncheon. Lemony green-apple and peach flavors star with ease against a backdrop of creamy, lush texture and plenty of fresh bright acidity.
Wine: Galerie 2017 Terracea Riesling (Spring Mountain District)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This is a new project from Skip Battle and family, with Patrick Sullivan making the 100%-varietal wine. Elegant and cool climate in nature, it offers exotic complex layers of forest floor, sage, graphite and currant, the tannins elongated and polished. The structure and moderate ripeness show potential for aging. Enjoy best 2024–2029.
Wine: Battle Family 2014 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Cranberry, hibiscus, sandy mud and pepper aromas show on the nose of this bottling from Morgantini Vineyard, which is rather light in color. It's soft and elegant on the sip, with well-integrated flavors of oregano, rose petals, bergamot, black raspberry and elderflower.
Wine: Blair 2014 Morgantini Vineyard Tasting Room Series Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Relatively light in color, this reserve bottling from Delfina's Vineyard offers tangy red plum, sagebrush, bay leaf and rust aromas on the nose. The palate is awash in herbs, from thyme to oregano, set against a red-currant-reduction sauce and light savory flavors of roasted pork.
Wine: Blair 2014 The Reserve Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: San Francisco Bay, Central Coast, California, US
Review: There are strong aromas of turned earth, wet loam, bay leaf, tobacco leaves and black olive tapenade on the nose of this recent library release from the winery that sits atop the Santa Cruz Mountains above Silicon Valley. It's thick on the palate with Indian and Mexican spices (from coriander to curry), with hints of powdered cocoa and tobacco as well. The acid and structure remain solid.
Wine: Clos de la Tech 2004 Domaine du Docteur Rodgers Pinot Noir (San Francisco Bay)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This Grenache-based rosé is one of the best of the year, showing tight aromas of strawberry, pink rose petals and crushed chalk. The palate is framed by an incredible acidic sizzle and chalky grip, carrying expertly subdued flavors of raspberry and red plum.
Wine: Folded Hills 2017 Lilly Rosé (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Brioche and almond flavors meet a sleek, smooth and tightly focused core in this meticulously made white. Apple, pear and lemon meringue provide complexity on the midpalate before finishing crisp and slightly spicy.
Wine: Fort Ross Winery 2016 Sea Slopes Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: A clean shade of yellow hay in the glass, the nose on this bottling is very inviting with aromas of baking croissant, baking soda and lemon peel. The palate combines strong yeast with crushed chalk and clay flavors, proving quite creamy in texture.
Wine: Goat Bubbles 2015 Cremant Sierra Madre Vineyard Sparkling (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Green Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This wine celebrates diversity and is beautifully layered and fresh in a rounded peach tone. Moderate structure gives way to plenty of brioche richness on the palate.
Wine: Iron Horse 2014 Rainbow Cuvée Estate Bottled Sparkling (Green Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This blend of 28% Malbec, 28% Tannat, 15% Syrah, 15% Petite Sirah and 14% Grenache is very rich on the nose, showing cherry reduction, pepper and licorice aromas. The palate starts off very silky and then stiffens to present well-integrated flavors of black cherry, dried mint and loamy earth.
Wine: Midnight 2014 Gemini Reserve Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: This is a beautifully balanced wine that has enticing, expressive black-cherry and sweet oak aromas, and equally vibrant and complex fruit flavors that are well supported by good acidity and moderate tannins. It's a nicely tight wine that doesn't give everything away at first whiff, but keeps one coming back for more.
Wine: Miro 2015 Conzelman Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: This is a finely made wine that offers plenty of ripeness, structure and intensity. Rich and round, it has a soft backbone of cherry and cassis, with supportive yet integrated oak.
Wine: Priest Ranch 2015 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Review: Lush round flavors of pear, melon and salted rocky minerality work well together in this well-made estate wine. With integrated oak, it offers a soft smooth palate of balanced richness.
Wine: Schug 2016 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Aromatic baking spices accent the lavish, ripe fruit flavors in this generous full-bodied wine that combines power and good balance. It is full of black cherries from the first whiff to the mouth-filling flavors and on through the finish. Moderate tannins and a touch of acidity add a little welcome grip to the texture.
Wine: Ten Acre 2015 Jenkins Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Toasty oak aromas surround the bright raspberry and strawberry fruit as well as a floral touch of rose petals and carnation on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very fresh with smashed raspberry and cranberry flavors, smoothed out by oak-smoked meat.
Wine: Zotovich 2016 Z Estate Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This single-vineyard expression is loaded on the nose with brioche aromas alongside Meyer lemon preserves and a hint of apple cream. The palate is full in that California way, but balanced deftly, combining toast, oak, cashew and tangy lemon-curd flavors.
Wine: Bernardus 2016 Soberanes Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: Smoky oak meets rounded black fruit in this rich dense wine, softened in structure on the midpalate. Chocolate and vanilla flavors combine to underline the grip and full-bodied ripeness.
Wine: Clark-Claudon 2014 Eternity Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: From a site within the cool Sebastopol Hills, this light-bodied wine is earthy, minty and spicy, with length and grace. Smooth and silky on the palate, it shines in dark cherry, cassis and cardamom, and has a memorable, lasting finish.
Wine: De Loach 2015 Pennacchio Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: With 22% Petite Sirah and 2% Carignan in the mix, and the vines averaging more than 95 years in age, this is a memorable wine. Structured and powerful, it boasts flavors of raspberry jam, graham cracker and cinnamon, with integrated tannins that impart richness and length.
Wine: Dry Creek Vineyard 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Firestone
Review: This is a very savory and quite compelling Cabernet, starting with aromas of black pepper, tar, dried olive and yet also a bright fresh boysenberry kick. The palate is framed by lavish, silky tannins that envelop flavors of cassis, black cherry and baking spice, with continued layers of Sichuan peppercorn and plum arising into the finish.
Wine: Firestone 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This wine has a backbone of tannin and dense fruit that offers power. Flavors of rhubarb, pomegranate and strawberry meet added complexities of cherry liquor and earthy spice on the palate.
Wine: Gary Farrell 2015 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: Savory sage and black tea are top notes for this well-balanced, nicely fruity and medium-bodied wine from one of the pioneering wineries of Anderson Valley. Hints of black pepper and clove meet solid, ripe black-cherry and raspberry flavors as moderate tannins help shape an appetizing mouthfeel.
Wine: Husch 2016 Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Bright and fresh in Gravenstein apple, fig and citrus flavors, this full-bodied wine is balanced and well integrated, with a depth of texture and complexity. It lingers gingerly in Asian spice.
Wine: MacRostie 2016 Kent Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: The aromas of this wine intoxicate, showing more initial fruit aromas compared to many wines from this region, with strong blueberry and orange peel scents. Those notes are dominated by more savory tones over time, with waves of wildflower, olive, fresh herb, gravel and a whiff of smoked meat. The elegant palate offers a seamless feel that leads into an extended finish, showing a lovely overall sense of refinement.
Wine: Reynvaan Family Vineyards 2015 Estate In the Rocks Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This wine offers a depth of aromatic intensity and is expansive in velvety tannin. Spicy cherry, strawberry and a compelling thread of cola highlight a succulence on the midpalate that lingers leisurely on the finish.
Wine: Siduri 2016 Barbieri Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Tart in complex acidity and subtle flavors of strawberry, pomegranate and orange, this is a light-bodied, lightly ripe wine, that's angular and elegant.
Wine: Siduri 2016 Ewald Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Baked red cherry, star anise, gingersnaps and purple flowers show on the fruity but elegant nose of this bottling. Those strong fruit and hearty spice flavors show on the sip as well, which is framed by powerful acidity. That acid needs more time to mellow, so drink 2020–2030.
Wine: Ten Acre 2015 Soberanes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This wine offers a fruity core of plum and dark-cherry compote, with elements of spicy clove and forested earth. It has a backbone of acidity that contributes freshness against a powerful backdrop of ripeness and intensity. The finish is dusted in chocolate.
Wine: V. Vineyards 2014 Single Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Review: An earthy, figgy sur lie character sets this wine apart from the crowd, while a supple texture and good balance make it easy to sip and enjoy. Plenty of cherry and raspberry flavors emerge on the palate, seeming to fill the mouth and then lingering on the finish.
Wine: B.R. Cohn 2016 Silver Label Pinot Noir (North Coast)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Earthy and floral with an inviting nose of cherry and tangerine, this is a deft, lithe, focused and fresh wine with a lasting thread of tangy acidity. It is delicious in its understated elegance and delicate fruit.
Wine: Baker Lane 2016 Ramondo Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Loads of earthy aromas of thyme, cracked pepper, rosemary, lavender and loamy soil add intrigue to the dark elderberry core of this blend of 60% Syrah and 40% Grenache. That array of savory herbs also decorates the black-plum flavors of the palate, which is bolstered by pepper spice and tea leaves.
Wine: Bodega de Edgar 2015 E2 10th Anniversary Kimsey Vineyard Syrah-Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This is a field blend of Gewürztraminer, Trousseau Gris, Riesling and other mixed whites that invites in its perfumed aromas of green apple and lychee. With a grainy texture and lifted acidity, it refreshes in a lingering taste of lime zest with an oomph of body.
Wine: Carlisle 2016 Compagni Portis White (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Cinnabar
Review: Smashed red currants, rose petals, roasting pork and baking spice make for a very inviting nose on this appellation blend. There is great tension and freshness to the palate, where cranberry, raspberry and pomegranate flavors meet with rosewater for a lively experience.
Wine: Cinnabar 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Strong flavors of lemon, lime and salty oak permeate the opening of this dense concentrated wine, which retains moderate acidity and freshness. The brightness comes from a lingering sensation of wet stone and citrus that intrigues.
Wine: Della 2016 Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Folded Hills
Review: A rusty red color in the glass, this light but layered bottling shows dried cherry, pomegranate, carnation, hibiscus, cinnamon and vanilla-dusted toast on the nose. There is a strong grip to the palate, where flavors center on rose petal and Montmorency cherry, proving quite firm and yet delicate.
Wine: Folded Hills 2015 Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Review: From a large estate located in the western foothills of Paso Robles, this blend of 75% Grenache, 10% Syrah, 8% Mourvèdre and 7% Tannat shows dark mulberry, plum, elderflower and sandalwood on the nose. It's rich on the palate, with black plum, dried purple flowers and more elderflower touches.
Wine: Halter Ranch 2016 CDP Estate Bottled Grenache-Syrah-Mourvèdre-Tannat Red (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This bottling has been a lighter, chillable red long before those wines came into vogue, and it's still a leading option. Aromas of smashed raspberries and white pepper drop into an energetic sip, where fresh cranberries, carnations and a zippy acidity reign.
Wine: Happy Canyon Vineyard 2017 Chukker Cabernet Franc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: A rich, rounded entry starts off this voluptuous, layered and clove-spiced wine that offers length and breadth on the palate. Baked orange and cherry flavors exude warmth and complement tones of forest floor and white pepper.
Wine: Jax 2016 Calesa Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Jayson
Review: A whole-cluster pressed white aged in both French oak and stainless steel, this wine is richly woven in lemon verbena, pineapple, quince and grapefruit, its structure complex, lengthy and moderate in acidity.
Wine: Jayson 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: This fascinating wine blended from five Rhône grape varieties—both red and white—has enough character and body to pass as a full-fledged red, and in fact the color is much deeper than most rosés today. A plethora of plums and raspberries fill the aroma and spread richly across the palate.
Wine: Terre Rouge 2017 Vin Gris d'Amador Rosé (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Candied boysenberry fruit, dried sagebrush, pepper spice and a pinch of purple flowers show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The palate combines earthy and herbal tones of bay leaf and pine needle with black-plum flavors, wrapped in tense tannins.
Wine: Ancien 2015 Fiddlestix Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Sonoma Mountain, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Crisp and creamy in Meyer lemon meringue and grapefruit, this lovely white also has flavors of red cherry and is acid-driven, with ample body to complement the freshness. It finishes in a lingering taste of wet stone.
Wine: Belden Barns 2016 Estate Grown Grüner Veltliner (Sonoma Mountain)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Deep and hearty in the glass, this built-to-last bottling shows black currant, roasted coffee, cocoa powder, new leather and cola on the nose. Chiseled yet sticky tannins and powerful acidity frame the palate, where dark-berry, root-beer and chocolate flavors reign. Drink 2021–2034.
Wine: Bodega de Edgar 2014 Gran Reserva Laetitia Vineyard Tempranillo (Central Coast)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: From the wilds of Atlas Peak this is a 100% varietal wine, aged nearly two years in 100% French oak. Dusty and bright, with lingering waves of toasted coconut, it offers persistent freshness and tamed tannins around strong flavors of mocha and raspberry.
Wine: Decades5 2012 Stagecoach Vineyard Petit Verdot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This tightly wound, dense wine shows a touch of reduction on the nose. It's tart and spicy, with layered flavors of tangerine, mint, cardamom, tobacco and white pepper that intrigue and delight.
Wine: Gary Farrell 2015 McDonald Mountain Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Rather boisterous on the nose, this bottling shows fresh aromas of black cherry alongside pencil shavings and milk chocolate. There is solid depth to the palate, where flavors of smashed blackberry and boysenberry meet with tangy black-plum skins and roasted coffee notes on the finish.
Wine: Justin 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lang & Reed
Review: This medium-bodied wine offers depth and complexity that are unusual for the varietal in California. It has lightly earthy, mineral, figgy aromas, a palate-coating texture and layers of flavor that unfold from apple to almond to fig, giving it the substance to be a main-course wine, not just a pre-dinner beverage.
Wine: Lang & Reed 2017 Chenin Blanc (Mendocino)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: This nicely balanced wine poses tantalizing, bright fruit flavors against relatively full body and wraps them in a velvety blanket of fine-grained tannins. Red cherry, cranberry and light earthy notes give it welcome complexity.
Wine: Lichen Estate 2016 Moonglow Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Pale pink in the glass, this rosé shows very subtle aromas of thin lemon-skin ribbons, raspberry water and a whiff of cotton candy on the inviting and fresh nose. There is extreme grip to the sip, which is all about texture and freshness, showing delicate touches of lime, chalk and pink-fleshed fruit.
Wine: Loubud 2017 Cebada Vineyards Rosé of Pinot Noir (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: The aromas are expressive, with abundant notes of smoked ham along with herb, wet stone and olive. The palate has a sensuous soft feel, with fruit and savory flavors carrying on the smoked meat finish. It's all about elegance. Give it some time to open up.
Wine: Reynvaan Family Vineyards 2015 Stonessence Estate In the Rocks Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This wine is exotic on the nose in rose and white pepper, as it opens into a palate of thick rich cherry-cordial flavor and enduring acidity. The freshness complements the lushness of the fruit and maintains a lively aspect of brightness.
Wine: Saintsbury 2016 Pratt Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Terre Rouge
Review: Full flavored and rather full bodied, too, this wine exudes vivid and spicy aromas of pears, browned butter and toasted almonds, feels broad and mouthfilling and has softly ripe flavors. Light baking spices add complexity and a nicely viscous texture combines with good acidity for a lingering finish.
Wine: Terre Rouge 2016 Viognier (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Treana
Review: Roasted blackberry, soft vanilla and rich milk chocolate aromas start off this suave blend of 75% Cabernet Sauvignon and 25% Syrah. Polished tannins frame flavors of black-cherry and caramel on the palate, resulting in a rich and pleasing wine.
Wine: Treana 2015 Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: Aromas that are slightly earthy at first become spicy, complex and fruity and lead to good red-cherry and rhubarb flavors in this medium-bodied elegant wine. Moderate tannins and good acidity balance it out well.
Wine: Waits-Mast 2015 Deer Meadows Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This blend of 83% Cabernet Sauvignon and 17% Syrah shows dark, roasted black plums and berries as well as charred beef and green peppercorns, proving both very ripe yet still a tad green on the nose. It's thick on the palate with elderberry and black-currant flavors, wound together by rigid tannins, and finishing on caramel, vanilla and pepper.
Wine: Asuncion Ridge 2015 Inception Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Arroyo Grande Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Bursting aromas of black raspberry, bright blackberry, lavender and chaparral scrub make for an intriguing nose to this single-vineyard Tempranillo. There's a leathery Old World vibe to the palate, where gamy dusty touches give depth to dried berry and herb flavors.
Wine: Bodega de Edgar 2014 Laetitia Vineyard Tempranillo (Arroyo Grande Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Review: Ssaturated flavors of dark fruits are framed by firm but velvety tannins in this mouthfilling, pleasing and full-bodied wine. It has well-integrated oak aromas and flavors that hint at nutmeg, cinnamon and wood smoke but stay in the background.
Wine: Buck Shack 2016 Small Batch Sustainably Farmed Red (Lake County)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Definitely falling into the sessionable and chillable reds category, winemaker Karen Steinwachs had fun with this carbonically treated wine, which shows sour red cherry and a touch of smoke on the nose. The lightly bodied palate is not particularly complex, but the tart red-fruit flavors are playful, quaffable and extremely refreshing.
Wine: Buttonwood 2017 Carbonique Cabernet Franc (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: This is a very deep-colored wine that has a laser-focus on ripe black-currant and black-cherry flavors and very firm tannins to shape those flavors. The texture is dry and astringent but the fruit component is so focused that it softens the tannic blow somewhat. Drink now with rich, fatty proteins or cellar until 2022 by which time it may mellowed.
Wine: Charles B. Mitchell 2014 Reserve Intense Figone Syrah (Fair Play)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: Richness, depth and layering all contribute to this full-bodied, Grenache-based wine's considerable appeal. It has lots of ripe blackberry and black-cherry flavors, nicely firm tannins and a mouth-coating texture. What else does a GSM-C (for 5% Cinsault) need?
Wine: Cochon 2015 Pape Rocks Red (California)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Review: This wine is seductive and delicious yet well balanced, from an aroma of pear tart to substantial but not showy flavors of kiwi, apricot and guava that coat the palate. The texture is generous and mouthfilling but backed by subtle acidity that keeps it lively. Vintner Jeff Morgan is doing great things with Lodi grapes.
Wine: Covenant 2017 Mensch Roussanne (Lodi)

Appellation: Eighty Four
Review: This is reduced and robust in oaky char and strong flavors of barbecue meat, coffee and leather. Full bodied, it's surprisingly graceful, too, with mouth-filling complexity and structured jammy blackberry fruit.
Wine: Eighty Four 2012 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot is a great way to see what's happening with this family-owned estate. Aromas of roasted coffee, toasted oak, ripe black plum and blackberry lead into a palate full of charred cherry, black raspberry and cedar. A rocky earthy minerality is also apparent throughout.
Wine: Grassini 2015 Articondo Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This coastal wine has a feral element of exotic fruit, rhubarb and blood orange mostly, with touches of rose petal around its edges. Silky smooth and unabashedly ripe and full bodied, it has an underlying freshness of lively acidity and integration.
Wine: JCB 2015 No 22 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: Sourced from 72% Monterey County, 15% Santa Barbara County and 13% Sonoma County, this bottling starts with red cherry, clove, vanilla and star anise on the nose. The palate combines sharp baking spice with baked cherry, all framed by powerful acidity.
Wine: Landmark 2016 Overlook Pinot Noir (California)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: Attractively tight in structure, this intricate and well-balanced wine pours red-cherry and raspberry flavors on the palate, backed by firm tannins and acidity and medium body. It will be fascinating to see how this develops. Best after 2020.
Wine: Lichen Estate 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Review: Gamy aromas of lamb meat and asphalt lead into violet and elderberry touches on the nose of this proprietary red blend. The palate shows elegant touches of dried purple flowers and black-plum skins, finishing on a riper black-currant flavor.
Wine: Lorenzi Estate 2014 Reserve Red (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This wine offers an explosive entry of tangerine and rock salt within a context of light, integrated oak and moderate ripeness. Still, it has plenty of power and full-bodied textural complexity that makes it memorable in the glass.
Wine: MacRostie 2016 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Los Angeles County, South Coast, California, US
Review: Though quite expensive, this is an interesting argument for growing wine in the heart of West Los Angeles, as these grapes hail from Brentwood. Aromas of nectarine, lemon rind and key lime meet with a rich woody background on the nose. The sip is quite bright and refreshing with flavors of lemon and mandarin orange.
Wine: Melhill 2016 Estate Chardonnay (Los Angeles County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Dark red-currant, dried herbs and cigar-box aromas make for an Old World-like elegance on this blend of 36% Cabernet Sauvignon, 28% Cabernet Franc, 24% Merlot and 12% Petit Verdot. Oregano, marjoram and peppercorn meet with elderberry and black plum on the palate, which is deep in loamy flavors and finishing on a hint of carnation.
Wine: Roblar 2016 Triomphe Red (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Review: This wine is a blend of 70% Grenache, 20% Mourvèdre and 10% Syrah. The aromas jump up, with notes of fresh orange, raspberry, olive, herb and wet stone. The palate is full bodied and rich, with abundant fruit and savory flavors that persist on the finish.
Wine: Rôtie Cellars 2016 Southern Blend Red (Washington)

Appellation: Saintsbury
Review: Fruity in dark cherry and cola spice and cinnamon, this is a moderately ripe, textured wine, toasty in oak and fulfilling in its balanced richness.
Wine: Saintsbury 2016 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Appellation: Pine & Brown
Review: This wine is exceptionally smooth and polished, showing a gentle but not too-soft texture that carries fresh apple and lime flavors and subtle oak accents like nutmeg and vanilla. With medium to full body, it feels like a barrel-fermented wine but without obvious oakiness, and shows good layering and concentration.
Wine: Pine & Brown 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino Ridge)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Quite dark in the glass, this reserve bottling shows cassis, olive and savory earth aromas of dried herb and peppercorn on the nose. A roasted beef in blackberry sauce flavor meets with notes of black plum, mint and shaved chocolate on the palate.
Wine: San Simeon 2015 Estate Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Minty sage and an intensely tart sense of citrus and rhubarb shine in this balanced, coastal-influenced red, which retains plenty of tannic power against its fresh bubbly acidity.
Wine: Siduri 2016 Pratt Vineyard Sexton Road Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Sketchbook
Review: This lightly earthy wine is soft in mouthfeel despite bright underlying acidity and fine-grained tannins. Hints of leather and barnyard lead to generous flavors of red and black cherry as well as light baking spices on the palate.
Wine: Sketchbook 2016 Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: This will be an outstanding dinner wine when a roast or steak is on the menu. It has a good, gripping texture and firm acidity that will stand up well to fatty dishes. A nice core of blackberry and black-cherry flavors is surrounded by hints of clove and cinnamon.
Wine: Skinner 2015 Eighteen Sixty-One Red (El Dorado)

Appellation: Sutcliffe
Review: Engaging aromas of forest berries and wild herbs are touched by savory white pepper and blue flowers on the nose of this light red. On the palate, delightful flavors of ripe red cherry, cranberry, granite and crushed thyme are supported by barely perceptible tannins and a peppery spice. There is a charming vein of acidity right from the start that weaves all the way through the wild black raspberry and white pepper-inflected finish. Drink now–2025.
Wine: Sutcliffe 2015 Cinsault (Colorado)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Crisp aromas of candied cherry and raspberry are straightforward, while wet river stones add minerality and cola adds spice to the nose of this wine. Those elements converge on the palate, picking up ginger-spice and pomegranate juice flavors.
Wine: Zotovich 2016 Estate Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: Shaved dark-chocolate, cedar and black-cherry aromas show on the nose of this blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Syrah and 20% Sangiovese from the Santa Rosa Valley, a region that connects Los Angeles to Ventura County. Lighter bodied than expected on the palate, the bottling offers strawberry, cherry tomato, peppercorn and oregano flavors, and is still quite young.
Wine: Al Lago 2015 Sonata Red (California)

Appellation: Mendocino Ridge, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: Abundant fruit flavors that are so ripe they're almost sweet dominate this full-bodied, mouth-filling and seemingly soft-textured wine. It is generous with plummy cherry-candy notes and has soft tannins for a pillowy finish.
Wine: Arista 2015 Perli Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino Ridge)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Soft and smooth aromas of exotic cherry and plum meet with baking spice and clove on the nose of this bottling. The palate integrates stewed red fruits with white and black pepper, showing both a deep dark richness and a tangy edge.
Wine: Challen 2015 Lindsay's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Cinnabar
Review: Loads of purple flowers and wild thyme meet with aromas of black raspberry and alpine strawberry on this appellation blend from a winery founded by Tom Mudd in 1983. The well-integrated palate shows tangy black-plum and wild chaparral flavors, starting quite exuberant before tightening up around woody tannins.
Wine: Cinnabar 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Dark cherry, turned earth and hibiscus meet with cedar and pine-wood spice on the nose of this bottling. It's more delicate on the palate, where earthy herbs meet with bright raspberry fruit flavors, framed by solid acid and a lighter mouthfeel.
Wine: Claiborne & Churchill 2016 Twin Creeks Estate Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Rather ripe on the nose, this blend offers aromas of candied strawberry, red cherry and a hint of cinnamon. The palate is lighter in mouthfeel, very clean and easy to enjoy, with a decent structure that's not too tight, showing flavors of red fruits and red spice.
Wine: Folded Hills 2015 August Red (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Yountville, Napa, California, US
Review: This vineyard-designated white is impressively layered and complex, with integrated acidity and texture to its light-bodied character. Lime, cantaloupe and wet stone give it a fruity complexion met by a note of salty brine.
Wine: Gamble Family Vineyards 2017 Gamble Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)

Appellation: Grassini
Review: Penetrating and inviting aromas of candied cherries and sweet cedar show on the nose of this estate bottling. The palate combines both ripe red cherries with slightly underripe fruit flavors alongside pencil shavings, dried herbs and chalky tannins.
Wine: Grassini 2015 Merlot (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This is made from 100% Pinot Noir grapes grown on the producer's Olivet Grange Vineyard—a fun, quaffing wine with plenty of quality to back up its whimsy. Light-orange-yellow in color, it's funky and earthy in flavors of wild strawberry, wet stone and dried herb.
Wine: Inman Family 2014 Whole Buncha Bubbles Blanc de Noir Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Red-fruit-forward and full of sanguine earthiness, this wine is soft, supple and expressive in rich voluptuous flavor and a cradling of charred, toasty oak. Full bodied and ripe, it delivers plenty of rounded lushness.
Wine: Kinsella 2015 Heirloom Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Knights Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This white has a creamy, lush texture that is complemented by a bright enduring freshness of grapefruit and lime. The full-bodied midpalate fruit profile is defined in tropical guava, apricot and almond paste.
Wine: Knights Bridge 2016 Pont de Chevalier Sauvignon Blanc (Knights Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Light and pleasant aromas of nectarine and red apple show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression of rosé. The texture is very grippy and chalky, carrying light flavors of raspberry soda.
Wine: Malene 2017 Camp 4 Vineyard Rosé of Mourvèdre (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Rosewater, sweet tar, tea and cedar aromas provide the hallmark aromas of Nebbiolo in this bottling. Strong tannins and acid frame the sip, allowing flavors of red cherry, leather, rust and potpourri flavors to emerge. Drink 2020–2030.
Wine: Martin Ranch 2012 Therese Vineyards Dos Ninas Vineyard Nebbiolo (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Intensely floral, this youthful white is citrus-driven in nature, with a grainy texture and moderate acidity. Toasted oak rides in the background, offering a complementary element to racy lemon.
Wine: Neyers 2017 304 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: This is a Cabernet Franc-driven blend, combined with a large percentage of Cabernet Sauvignon and smaller amounts of Merlot and Petit Verdot—some of the fruit from Stagecoach Vineyard. Big effusive tannins wrap around robust cassis, currant and mocha vanilla flavors. The wine is generously ripe and robust in structure.
Wine: Oakville East 2015 Core Stone Red (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Oakville, Napa, California, US
Review: Chocolate graham cracker richness defines the early impression of this wine, which is powerfully intense and tannic. A succulence of dark cherry meets the bolder, more savory character with ease—balanced and refreshing.
Wine: Oakville East 2015 Harter Family Double H Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Boysenberry pie, sweet asphalt and roasted coffee aromas show on the nose of this blend of 52% Grenache, 45% Mourvèdre and 3% Cinsaut. Fairly firm and thick tannins frame the palate, which shyly shows flavors of black currant, elderberry and dried ginger spice.
Wine: Paix Sur Terre 2016 Songs of Its Own Glenrose Vineyard Red (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Tight-grained tannin and texture wrap around this wine's fresh acidity and full embrace of forest and earth. Robust flavors of dark cherry and baked strawberry ride along smooth full-bodied ripeness before unfurling a minty finish.
Wine: Sonoma-Loeb 2016 Dutton Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Treana
Review: Extremely rich, deep and extracted on the nose, this bottling by Austin Hope is loaded with vanilla, cassis, caramel and Bourbon aromas. It's rich, lush and soft on the palate, offering vanilla, sea-salt caramel and coffee flavors set against a black cherry core.
Wine: Treana 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Ripe cranberry and raspberry juice aromas meet with the hint of wet river stones on the nose of this twist-top bottling. The palate is loaded with pomegranate and more cranberry flavors as well as hints of wild mint and dusty chaparral, with a pop of vanilla on the finish.
Wine: Zotovich 2016 Zoto Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Dark and deep aromas of black currant, black plum and kirsch meet with shaved licorice on the nose of this bottling. There is chalky tannic framing and decent layers of acid on the sip, where milk chocolate and caramel meet with cassis and black-cherry flavors.
Wine: Aver Family Vineyards 2014 Heritage Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine is a blend of 54% Merlot, 22% Cabernet Sauvignon, 14% Cabernet Franc, 6% Malbec and 4% Petit Verdot. The aromas present notes of black cherry, cedar, spice box and dried herb. The dark-fruit flavors offer a pretty sense of balance and elegance. It shows the benefits of some additional time in bottle.
Wine: Brian Carter 2013 Le Coursier Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: Soft and rich as a chocolate brownie covered in raspberry jam, this is a decadent exploration of 100% Cabernet Sauvignon, aged two years in French oak, the majority of it new. Rich and dense, it has round approachable tannins and a lasting flavor of mountain-grown blueberry.
Wine: Clark-Claudon 2014 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Mountain, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Tart and tangy, with a high-strung streak of acidity that's fresh and focused, this wine traffics in forest pine, strawberry and a lasting linger of orange rind.
Wine: De Loach 2015 Van Der Kamp Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: A refreshing approach to the grape, this bottling offers red currant and black plum alongside an earthy elegance of gravel and wood on the nose. It's well balanced on the palate, with flavors of ripe red fruit, wood spice, dried herb and tobacco.
Wine: Hearst Ranch 2016 Bunkhouse Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lobo Hills
Review: This wine comes from Lonesome Springs Ranch Vineyard and was fermented and aged in stainless steel, with rocks from the vineyard included in the tanks. After starting out just a touch reduced, it opens to reveal aromas of kiwi, white grapefruit, mineral and herb. The palate is sleek in style with electric acidity. It's a racy acid white at a terrific price. Pair it with ceviche.
Wine: Lobo Hills 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Poet's Leap
Review: Generous aromas of lime leaf, citrus, wet slate and white peach lead to off-dry stone-fruit and citrus flavors that stretch out on the palate. It brings a beautiful sense of acid balance with an impressively long finish. Give it some additional time in bottle to see it at its best.
Wine: Poet's Leap 2017 Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yorkville Highlands, North Coast, California, US
Review: Generous fruit and oak-spice flavors fill out this full-bodied and plush-textured wine quite nicely. It has an attractive earthy, figgy aroma, and ripe warm baked-cherry and baking-spice flavors with good depth and length.
Wine: Roadhouse Winery 2016 Platinum Pinot Noir (Yorkville Highlands)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Slightly darker in color that most pale-pink rosés, this wine offers aromas of ripe watermelon, strawberry, cherry and red plum, proving quite aromatic. There is great tension to the palate, where zesty citrus and red fruit flavors are fresh and vibrant.
Wine: Sanford 2017 Estate Grown Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Review: This elegant and well-balanced wine has a brilliant copper color, tangy cherry and apple-skin flavors and a mouth-filling mousse. It tastes nicely dry and a bit lean and nervy in character.
Wine: Schramsberg 2015 Brut Rosé Sparkling (North Coast)

Appellation: Star Lane Vineyard
Review: Very rich and deep blackberry aromas meet with smoke and crushed herbs on the nose of this still very young wine. The palate is balanced in structure, showing flavors of pepper, dried herb, elderberry and dust. Drink 2020–2030.
Wine: Star Lane Vineyard 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: San Benito County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: A light, citrusy aroma of lemon pith meets with tones of strawberry and wet cement on the nose of this bottling. The palate shows a clean line of river stone, with a rounded sense of plum and light cranberry.
Wine: Alara 2017 Grenache Rosé (San Benito County)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Light aromas of rose petals, raspberry sorbet, carnations and hibiscus make for a snappy, fresh entry to this bottling, which is an ode to Nordic legends that the winery's founder once studied. It's tart and tangy on the sip with red-plum-skin and cranberry flavors, lifted by thyme and bay leaf.
Wine: Claiborne & Churchill 2016 Runestone Wolff Vineyard Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This is a fresh lovely wine made entirely from the variety, fuzzy in stone-fruit flavors and a companion of red grapefruit. Strong in acidity and wet stone minerality, it's impressively fresh, focused and imminently enjoyable.
Wine: Côte West 2017 Mounts Vineyard Rosé of Counoise (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Big, lingering tannins give this wine impressive complexity against a framework of tart blackberry, dark cherry and a dusty mix of savory spice. Supple layers of chocolate caramel and mint add more to the story, finishing in an impressive balance of rich fruit and bright acidity.
Wine: Dry Creek Vineyard 2015 DCV7 Estate Wallace Ranch Single Vineyard Series Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Foxen
Review: This appellation blend offers a more affordable way to see what owners Bill Wathen and Dick Doré were up to in 2016, and the results are delicious. Aromas of fresh raspberry, gravelly earth and sagebrush lead into a palate loaded with tangy, vibrant and fresh flavors of tart red fruit, pepper spice and flower petals.
Wine: Foxen 2016 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Review: Creamy and lush, this late-disgorged blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay has a slightly metallic edge that adds earthy complexity and intrigue to the medium-bodied mix. Flavors lean into green apple, pear and strawberry with ease.
Wine: Gloria Ferrer 2010 Extra Brut LD Reserve Cuvée Sparkling (Carneros)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: This is an elegant and beautifully balanced white wine made in an unusual way by combining the juice of Pinot Noir grapes that are pressed right after picking with Pinot Gris juice. It matches crispness with smoothness, has fresh apple and white peach flavors, light body and low alcohol.
Wine: Lichen Estate 2017 Les Pinots Noir & Gris White (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Green Valley, Sonoma, California, US
