Review: Olive, fig and candied lemon peel provide an exotic complexity to this vineyard-designate, from the famous sandy Goldridge soil-site in Occidental. Salty oak and sea spray add a minerality that's welcome against a full-bodied palate flecked in tart, light acidity.
Wine: MacRostie 2016 Charles Heintz Vineyard Chardonnay (Green Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: There is a pleasing roasted black-cherry aroma to the start of this wine, but then come more elegant touches of gravelly minerality and dried soil. On the well-rounded palate, the blend of 65% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Sangiovese, 5% Merlot, 5% Freisa and 5% Petit Verdot offers fresh cranberry, cherry, plum skins and roasted beef flavors.
Wine: Toccata 2014 Riserva Red (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Bell
Review: This is a very attractive and well-oaked wine with spicy-sweet aromas backed by nicely ripe plum and cherry flavors and a smooth medium-bodied feel on the palate. Aged in French and American barrels, more than half of which were new, the wine is hard to resist for its spiciness, fruitiness and plush texture.
Wine: Bell 2016 Syrah (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: In a vintage that saw early bud break an uneven fruit set, this shows ample concentration and thick tannin. Velvety on the palate, it features voluptuous flavors of lavender, orange, cherry and strawberry around a backbone of distinctive acidity.
Wine: Emeritus 2015 Hallberg Ranch Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Girasole
Review: This wine balances flavorful, ripe fruit flavors with subtle acidity and a smooth, polished texture. Light hints of flowers and pistachios add complexity on the palate.
Wine: Girasole 2017 Pinot Blanc (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: A hearty red blend that's powerfully built and full bodied, this offers big ripe flavors of bacon fat, toasted oak and blueberry jam. Intensely rich and concentrated, it will wholly satisfy fans of the style.
Wine: Hall 2015 Craig's Red (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Lang & Reed
Review: Earthy and oaky, this white is floral and lengthy, with a moderate body of ripeness and weight. Peach, apple and lime play on the midpalate before finishing in a burst of white flowers.
Wine: Lang & Reed 2017 Chenin Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Lynmar
Review: Pungent in earthy compost and a touch of matchstick, this wine offers strong, sturdy flavors and body, with a silkiness on the midpalate. Intense flavors of baked apple and pineapple are softened and balanced by a lasting embrace of acidity.
Wine: Lynmar 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Intensely ripe and full bodied on entry, this wine settles into a more balanced sensibility of caramel apple, salty oak and robust flavors of candied apple and pear.
Wine: Migration 2016 Running Creek Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: This combines all five red Bordeaux varieties, with Cabernet Sauvignon dominant at 48% and Cabernet Franc close behind at 24%. Juicy, approachable and round, it has strong present tannins and an intensity of oak, tobacco and cedar.
Wine: Provenance Vineyards 2014 Winemaker's Reserve Red (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Blended with 7% Petite Sirah, this tightly tannic wine allows room for a juicy core of fleshy dark-cherry flavor around moderate oak and a mix of dried herb and black pepper. Complex and structured, it shows plenty of potential to age. Enjoy best 2025–2030.
Wine: Quivira 2015 Black Boar Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Broad aromas of pear, Pink Lady and Granny Smith apples show on the fresh nose of this wine. The flavors are fresh and vibrant, offering hints of crisp Anjou pear and wild lime.
Wine: Rancho Sisquoc 2017 Flood Family Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Riley's Rows
Review: Salty green apple and taffy give this robustly rounded, textured and layered wine a focus and bright streak that's met by earthy mineral qualities of wet stone and sea spray.
Wine: Riley's Rows 2016 Chardonnay (North Coast)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Rounded honeysuckle, honey butter and seared white-peach aromas make for a fairly rich entry to this estate bottling. Yellow-peach and creamy mango flavors show on the sip, but the ripe fruit evolves into a savory sea salt and saffron side, finishing with a hint of pound cake.
Wine: Roblar 2017 Estate Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Review: With a light entry of spicy earth and pomegranate, this full-bodied wine evolves to share warm baking spices, brown sugar and baked cherry flavors—a robust and memorably rich experience on the palate.
Wine: Saintsbury 2016 Stanly Ranch Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Review: This wine is tart in cranberry and strawberry, with a depth of blue fruit seamlessly blending in. Velvety smooth, it tastes voluptuous in style, with a lasting imprint of cola and oak.
Wine: Saintsbury 2016 Toyon Farm Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Appellation: Shoup
Review: The aromas are brooding, with notes of dried herb, soil and cherry. The cherry and black-fruit flavors are rich and full, with firm tannins providing support. Give it some time in the cellar to develop. Best after 2023.
Wine: Shoup 2014 Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: Exuberant jammy aromas and equally fruity flavors drive this full-bodied and plush-textured wine. It has truly concentrated blackberry and blueberry aromas plus expansive and deep flavors that coat the tongue and linger on the finish. There's not a lot of tannin to interrupt the fun.
Wine: Skinner 2015 Dry Diggings Red (El Dorado)

Appellation: Stewart Cellars
Review: Salty stone and lemon zest offer a blend of deep prolonged flavor in this well-made white that is bittersweet in oak and managed tannin. There's an intensity to the finish of baked apple, pear and fig.
Wine: Stewart Cellars 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Mountain)

Appellation: Terre Rouge
Review: Fat in mouthfeel, waxy and earthy in aroma and rich, apricot-like and nutty in flavor, this wine emphasizes savory notes rather than fruity ones and richness in texture rather than crispness. Dried meats like prosciutto and salami could be great pairings.
Wine: Terre Rouge 2015 Viognier (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: This is a mellow, soft and gentle wine that offers ripe strawberry and cherry flavors, subtle brown sugar and vanilla accents and a smooth, mouth-filling texture. It seems to lack some of the stuffing of recent vintages but still gives lots of pleasure.
Wine: Waits-Mast 2015 Nash Mill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Review: From a breezy site within the Mahoney estate, this delicately compressed red is fresh and focused in acidity, with a thick midpalate of cranberry, orange and rhubarb. The oak is well-integrated and in support of the fruit without distraction, finishing fleshy.
Wine: Anaba 2015 Las Brisas Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This is a very delicate Pinot Noir from a vineyard 2,000 feet in elevation, which is a good sign for the potential of elegance for this grape when grown near Paso Robles. Boysenberry, leather, purple flowers and Earl Grey tea notes show on the while the palate is tangy with red-plum notes and soft in texture, lifted by potpourri-like flavors.
Wine: Asuncion Ridge 2015 Barrel Select Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Fresh and tight aromas of boysenberry fruit and star anise show on the nose of this easy-to-enjoy bottling. It's very lively with juicy dark fruits and light baking spice on the palate, making a great pairing for pizza, pasta and burgers.
Wine: Bella Luna 2016 Glenrose Vineyard Barbera (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Bydand
Review: Softly round and voluptuous in style, this wine offers oaky char overtones and brawny black fruit. Full bodied, it finishes with secondary characteristics of leather and black pepper that balance well against the dense fruit.
Wine: Bydand 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Dense, concentrated layers of plum, dark cherry and blackberry intermingle on the brooding palate. Vanilla and cinnamon add seasoning and hints of richness. This is sourced from a site considered somewhat extreme for the appellation, on the back side of Bradford Mountain.
Wine: Dry Creek Vineyard 2015 Vogensen Ranch Single Vineyard Series Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Juicy aromas of black currant and black cherry are bolstered by tones of vanilla and coffee. It's rich, soft and lush on the sip, with a grippy tannic frame that supports flavors of blackberry syrup and espresso bean. The acidity rises on the finish.
Wine: Dunning Vineyards 2015 Private Reserve Zinfandel (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Baked black cherry, black plum and shaved licorice make for a thick aromatic profile on the nose of this estate bottling by the legend Gary Eberle and winemaker Chris Eberle (no relation, really). Ripe blackberry, purple flowers and dark chocolate shavings show on the palate, which is elegantly wrapped in chalky tannins and buoyant acidity.
Wine: Eberle 2015 Eberle Estate Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Flanagan
Review: Reduced on the nose, this full-bodied wine is spicy, earthy, dark and dense, with strong flavors of Gravenstein apple and nutmeg. The aromas are floral, a hearty mix of honeysuckle and apple blossom.
Wine: Flanagan 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Boysenberry juice, wild thyme and mint make for a compelling entry to this blend of 34% Grenache, 33% Syrah and 33% Mondeuse. The palate is quite dry and framed by decent tannins and fresh acidity, carrying a strong mint and berry flavor combination.
Wine: Jamie Slone Wines 2016 Lozier Red (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: Lifted acidity buoys hefty dusty tannins in this well-made red, a collaboration between its famous French namesake and Napa Valley winemaker Jean Hoefliger of Alpha Omega Winery. Dried herb, soy, oak and tobacco all make a full-bodied, richly rewarding statement, complementing the quiet tangy red fruit.
Wine: Michel Rolland Napa Valley 2013 MR Red (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Rose petal, potpourri, red cherry and vanilla make for an elegant entry to this bottling, which spent 26 months in neutral French oak. There is decent structure to the palate, where cranberry and red-cherry flavors decorate roasted meat and violet touches.
Wine: Midnight 2014 Starlight Sangiovese (Paso Robles)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Review: This medium- to full-bodied wine heaps on the fruit flavors but has a good backbone of moderate tannins and acidity that make it appetizing and keep it tasting fresh on the finish. Made from mostly Grenache and Syrah, it has a dash of Petite Sirah, too.
Wine: Miro 2016 Cuvée Sasha Red (North Coast)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: Aromas like white cherries and pistachios, and flavors that are floral and deeply fruity give a lot of depth and substance to this medium- to full-bodied wine. The texture is rich and soothing and leads to a good lingering finish.
Wine: Navarro 2016 Deep End Gewürztraminer (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Thick, rich and smoky fruit dominates in this full-bodied densely lush vineyard-designate. Dark cherry, cola and clove round out the interwoven flavors.
Wine: Reynoso 2016 Putnam Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Skinner
Review: Fruity and vibrant, this crisp and clean wine brings fresh green apples to the aroma and an almost citrus character to the flavors, which have floral and almond accents too. It shows medium body and a nicely round texture balanced by good acidity.
Wine: Skinner 2017 Grenache Blanc (El Dorado)

Appellation: Spring Mountain Vineyard
Review: From the producer's grand estate atop Spring Mountain, this is a memorable white, exuberant in apple, stone fruit and lemon peel, with a tease of guava. The acidity is integrated well and complementary to its contoured texture and hint of minerality.
Wine: Spring Mountain Vineyard 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Stags Leap District, Napa, California, US
Review: Blended with 15% mixed varieties, this estate-grown red is oaky and robust, generous in youthful, chalky tannin. Mocha, caramel and coffee flavors ride along a wave of sharp blueberry and strawberry, with a persistence of black pepper.
Wine: Stags' Leap Winery 2014 Ne Cede Malis Petite Sirah (Stags Leap District)

Appellation: The Orcas Project
Review: Fruit for this 100% varietal wine comes from Bacchus and Weinbau vineyards. There's no mistaking the variety, with its notes of sliced green pepper, herb, flower and cherry. The pit-fruit flavors are sweet but show a pretty sense of elegance that carries through the finish. It's all about subtlety.
Wine: The Orcas Project 2016 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: The Pinot Project
Review: This is such a great buy from importer Michael Skurnik who turned to California for this wine. While supple in texture, the wine packs in dense red-cherry and ripe raspberry aromas and flavors that seem subtle at first but slowly open and expand with each sniff and sip. It has good layering and an excellent balance of moderate tannins and acidity.
Wine: The Pinot Project 2017 Pinot Noir (California)

Appellation: Via Romano
Review: Rich fig and almond flavors follow a floral aroma in this full-bodied and mouth-filling wine. Melon, mineral and consommé notes add complexity while the generous texture coats the tongue and creates a lingering finish.
Wine: Via Romano 2017 Pinot Grigio (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: William Hill Estate
Review: Tightly wound in pillowy tannins, this big, boldly ripe red is awash in blackberry, black currant, black cherry and vanilla flavors. The finish is succulent and lingering.
Wine: William Hill Estate 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Dusty tobacco and thick concentrated tannic structure dominate in this ripe full-bodied wine. Blackberry cobbler comes to mind on the palate, alongside mocha chocolate and brown sugar.
Wine: XYZin 2015 Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This widely available, cleverly named blend of 44% Syrah, 31% Grenache, 13% Petite Sirah, 10% Mourvèdre and 2% Tannat packs in a ton of flavor for the price, offering fresh, inviting aromas of baked black cherry, boysenberry pie and vanilla. The palate is clean and juicy, with berry, thyme, cracked pepper and lavender flavors.
Wine: Chronic Cellars 2016 Sofa King Bueno Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This blends 40% Cabernet Sauvignon with 31% Malbec, 26% Merlot and 3% Cabernet Franc, aging the whole in 70% new oak. Woody and tightly wound in tannin, it offers strong layered flavors of blueberry, cinnamon and dark chocolate, finishing dry and peppery.
Wine: Aperture 2015 Soil Specific Red (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This aged blend of Pinot Noir, Pinot Meunier and Chardonnay has an intense mousse on entry, a layering of flavor dipped in green apple and lemon. Structured and crisp, it tastes dry, complex and layered.
Wine: Breathless 2012 Méthode Champenoise Brut Sparkling (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: From two blocks of the vineyard planted to Pommard, this is an earthy, smoky wine, concentrated in dark cherry and plum flavors. Medium bodied and supple, it finishes in a richness of baking spices.
Wine: Bucher 2015 Pommard Clone Bucher Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Big tense layers of flavor dip into wild mint, strawberry and black cherry in this intense full-powered red. Cola and baking spice round it out and contribute complexity and length.
Wine: Buena Vista 2015 Bela's Selection Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Chalk Hill, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Integrated and succulent, this estate wine is savory in clove and dried herb, sage and red currant. It is also powerfully built and full bodied with abandon. Containing 4% Petit Verdot and aged in 75% new French oak, it packs a lasting punch of tobacco.
Wine: Chalk Hill 2014 Chairman's Club Cabernet Sauvignon (Chalk Hill)

Appellation: Crossbarn by Paul Hobbs
Review: A mostly stainless-steel fermented effort, this wine succeeds in floral, earthy, robust and richly layered richness, teasing caramel and vanilla crème brûlée out of the glass. With full-bodied oomph, it tingles in an underlying thread of stony mineral.
Wine: Crossbarn by Paul Hobbs 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This wine is full bodied and fleshy, with flavors of dried herb, blackberry jam and cinnamon toast. Big tannins and structured acidity balance the bold flavors, giving this a soft, supple richness that's hard to shake.
Wine: Dry Creek Vineyard 2015 Somers Ranch Single Vineyard Series Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Flanagan
Review: Rose, lavender and tree bark pique the nose in this full-bodied earthy wine. Thick and rich on the midpalate, it shows a layering of dark cherry, rhubarb and rose, mingling fruit from several sources within the appellation.
Wine: Flanagan 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: Aged in French puncheons and concrete, this is an herbal, bright and buzzy white that's medium bodied and complex. Apricot dominates alongside hints of ginger and lemongrass.
Wine: Galerie 2017 Naissance Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine comes from one of the state's premier Syrah vineyards. Inviting aromas of bacon fat, mineral, herb, flower and dark fruit are followed by ripe full-bodied fruit flavors. The style is quite rich but brings enjoyment.
Wine: JM Cellars 2015 Boushey Vineyard Syrah (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: A unique blend of Chardonnay (62%), Roussanne (34%) and Orange Muscat, the aromas provide light notes of cream, apple, tangerine and spice. There's a pleasing sense of texture and freshness on the palate, followed by a clean orange-blossom-filled finish. It shows a pleasing sense of balance.
Wine: Kontos 2017 Gossamer White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Knights Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Light buttery notes complement fruit and salted oak in this dry, tannic and full-bodied white. The texture is grainy and lengthy, with flavors of ginger and lemongrass that work well against the riper, bolder aspects.
Wine: Lawer 2016 Betsy's Vineyard Chardonnay (Knights Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: From 44-year-old Grenache vines, this old vine rosé is a unique idea, and works quite well. Crisp aromas of strawberry, chalk and flint show much minerality. The palate is very textural, showing wet gravel and steely flavors with the lightest flash of red fruit.
Wine: Malene 2017 Old Vine Rosé of Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Maxville
Review: Juicy, dusty and black cherry-flavored, this is a soft, rich and well-integrated wine, boldly concentrated and complex, yet easily enjoyed now. The tannin structure is impressively built and a good foil for the oak.
Wine: Maxville 2015 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Just-sliced Asian pear, tangy grapefruit and a cool steel aroma show on the nose of this bottling of Picpoul—a grape which is increasingly seen alone in bottle. There is great tension on the sip, where lime-skin flavors reign.
Wine: Paix Sur Terre 2017 Glenrose Vineyard Picpoul (Adelaida District)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Review: Tiny bubbles keep rising long after this dry and crisp wine made from 100% Chardonnay is poured. It has a lemony flavor with almost salty, nutty accents and vivid acidity to keep it clean and balanced.
Wine: Schramsberg 2015 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (North Coast)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Review: A rich, robust and lushly textured wine, this features toasted oak and spice tones, with strong flavors of butterscotch and tropical mango.
Wine: Sonoma-Loeb 2016 Private Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Review: Voluptuously fleshy and rounded in oak, this earthy white shines in spicy ginger and lemongrass before unfurling lush layers of green apple, pear and mango that stick to the palate through a lengthy finish.
Wine: Sonoma-Loeb 2016 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Coombsville, Napa, California, US
Review: Exotic and delicate on the nose, exuberant in rose petal and lavender, this wine is earthy and stemmy, with a weight on the palate that belies its underlying elegance and persistent acidity.
Wine: Tulocay 2015 Haynes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Coombsville)

Appellation: Alara
Review: Deep and dark in the glass, this bottling of a grape rarely seen in the state combines black plum, vanilla and ginger spice on the nose. Black cherry and milk chocolate flavors show on the palate, where strong acidity slices through the full flavors and the soft mouthfeel. The high listed alcohol is surprisingly balanced.
Wine: Alara 2016 Negrette (San Benito County)

Appellation: Coombsville, Napa, California, US
Review: A tiny-production wine, this is thick, dense and concentrated upon entry, finding its way to freshness and balance via a midpalate of stone fruit, wet stone and salted oak.
Wine: Ancien 2015 Haynes Old Block Chardonnay (Coombsville)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Very grassy aromas of lawn cuttings, juniper and pine oil show on the pungent nose of this zesty bottling. It's intriguing and lively on the sip, with green-fruit skins and more pine-needle tea flavors that keep one coming back for more on a hot day.
Wine: Bernardus 2017 Griva Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Big Cork Vineyards
Review: This delightful Viognier offers aromas of ripe lemon, gooseberry, fresh cut grass and crushed white gravel on the nose. The palate is soft and caressing, but with plenty of mild mannered acidity to bolster flavors of peach, lemon-lime and rocks. It finishes on a white peach and lime juice note.
Wine: Big Cork Vineyards 2015 Viognier (Maryland)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Review: Savory aromas and flavors like fennel bulb, snap pea and cucumber make this medium-bodied wine stand out. It has a good, crisp dash of acidity for balance and excellent fruit concentration that unfolds on the palate.
Wine: Bodkin 2017 Musqué Clone Sandy Bend Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Stemmy and earthy, this is a robust, full-bodied and richly concentrated wine, candied in cherry and strawberry flavors. Accents of cola and cardamom add complexity and freshness to the power.
Wine: Della 2016 Keefer Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Concentrated aromas of boysenberry and black cherry meet with hints of game, jerky and cola on the nose of this bottling. Fairly ripe and rich blackberry-sauce flavors are lifted by anise on the palate, which is framed by balanced acid and tannins and makes for a fairly easy-drinking wine.
Wine: Dusty Nabor 2016 Paper Plane Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Ex
Review: Freshly cut lawn, wet cement, sour lime rinds, jalapeno and kelp combine for a very unique and compelling nose on this bottling. The roasted jalapeño note extends to the palate, where white pepper and crushed white-rock flavors make for a memorable sip.
Wine: Ex 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This is a bold brawny wine from a site high above the Petaluma Gap, with remarkably thick layers of spice and forest floor. The fruit is a mix of baked wild strawberry and rhubarb, with a lingering hint of white pepper.
Wine: Flanagan 2016 Sun Chase Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Sweet rose petal opens the nose of this intensely ripe wine, seductive in layers of soft integrated oak and tannin. The flavors veer into strawberry, cherry and orange, with an underlying brightness that helps balance out the bold.
Wine: JCB 2015 No 7 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Jordan
Review: Tart and tangy in underlying acidity, this elegant red offers a mix of dried herb, tobacco leaf and red currant, showing subdued ripeness within a context of elongated polished tannin and well-integrated oak.
Wine: Jordan 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: This is 100% varietal, from grapes grown atop Stagecoach Vineyard. Both stainless-steel and French oak-aged, it offers strawberry, blueberry and watermelon flavors, strong, well-defined characteristics complemented by supple texture and a twist of lemon peel at the finish.
Wine: Ladera 2017 Rosé of Malbec (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This is the only example of this variety I am aware of in the state. Aromas of apple, melon and lees lead to full-bodied creamy-feeling fruit flavors that linger on the finish. Though seeming a bit stylistically different from the previous vintage, it's delicious all the same.
Wine: Lobo Hills 2017 Inland Desert Auxerrois (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Temecula, South Coast, California, US
Review: Strong aromas of licorice meet with dark-black plum on the nose of this blend of Zinfandel, Syrah, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. It's tightly packed on the palate with black plum, boysenberry and tart plum-skin flavors, flecked by anise throughout.
Wine: Lorenzi Estate 2014 Catalyst Private Reserve Red (Temecula)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: This is a relatively light wine that's elegant, easy to drink and well balanced. It shows plenty of jazzy cherry flavors, light spice and rhubarb accents and a smooth mouthfeel backed by light tannins and acidity.
Wine: Navarro 2016 Méthode A L'Ancienne Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: Mouthfilling, ripe and generous, this medium- to full-bodied wine packs a lot of flavor into a big but soft frame. Black cherry, blueberry and a hint of chocolate provide plenty to appreciate while mild tannins and soft acidity keep the structure gentle.
Wine: Parducci 2016 Small Lot Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)

Appellation: V. Sattui
Review: Generously fruity in blueberry and rich soft flavors of chocolate mocha, this is a decadent wine that offers integrated oak and tannin and is lush and fleshy from start to finish.
Wine: V. Sattui 2015 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Review: There's a strong cedar kick to the woody nose of this bottling, alongside cinnamon and cranberry aromas. The wood spice is also strong on the palate, which is energetic in flavors of cranberry and rhubarb.
Wine: Velvet Bee 2015 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Roasted black cherries and dried herbs show prominently on the pleasant nose of this bottling by a luxury hotel property in the region. The palate combines dark fruit and ginger-like spice with a chalky mouthfeel, finishing on vanilla dust.
Wine: Allegretto 2014 Willow Creek Vineyards Ayres Family Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Anderson Conn Valley
Review: With 10% Sémillon, the white aged in neutral barrels, this is a rich, interwoven wine with spicy acidity and bold tropical flavors at its core. A dash or two of ginger and white pepper memorably finishes things out.
Wine: Anderson Conn Valley 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Suisun Valley, North Coast, California, US
Review: More savory than fruity, this interesting and earthy wine has aromas of smoke and chalk, herbal and brothy flavors and good balance. It's off the beaten path but well worth the detour.
Wine: Bodkin 2017 The Falconer Verdelho (Suisun Valley)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: There is a strong amount of smoke and oak on the nose of this bottling, but there's also elegant touches of creamy Asian pear and lemon rind. That citrus and smoke combination shows on the sip as well, along with sweet touches of apple flesh and a compelling sandalwood flavor.
Wine: Byron 2015 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Mountain, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Nutty and dense on the nose and entry, this wine finds its rhythm with ease, showing a depth of grainy texture and focused flavors of citrus-fresh tangerine and Meyer lemon. It shows structure to age gracefully but is nearly impossible not to enjoy now.
Wine: Carlisle 2016 Steiner Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Sonoma Mountain)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: An enticing toasty spicy oak aroma leads to good, ripe blackberry and black-cherry flavors that are layered and concentrated. This full-bodied wine is made from 62% Zinfandel and 38% Petite Sirah. It shows a lot of oak character but does it well and backs it up with ample rich fruit notes and a moderately tannic texture.
Wine: Cedarville 2015 The Rules of Fair Play Red (Fair Play)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This is a light-bodied, refreshing white, succulent and fruity in pear, apple and fuzzy peach. A thread of minerality plays out as wet stone and lemon peel.
Wine: Côte West 2017 Gianquinto Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This compelling blend of Tempranillo, Grenache, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petite Sirah starts off somewhat light on the nose before deep blueberry aromas lead into sweet smoke, loamy earth and caramel-laced coffee aromas. The palate is quite ripe with black-currant fruit as well as a touch of leather.
Wine: Croma Vera 2016 Revelación Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Red plum, spice cake and flower petals make for a light, elegant nose in this blend. The palate shows tart cranberry, rosewater and sumac flavors, with the slightest hint of game, framed by rather light tannins.
Wine: Hearst Ranch 2016 Three Sisters Cuvée Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Koehler
Review: Black-raspberry lollipop aromas are lifted by oak, bay leaf and thyme on the nose of this bottling. It's lighter bodied than most Syrahs, offering white-pepper, dark-red-fruit and dried chaparral herb flavors, proving quite easy to enjoy.
Wine: Koehler 2015 Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Les Trouvés
Review: Grenache (56%) is out front on this blend, which also contains 29% Syrah and 15% Mourvèdre. Somewhat light in color, the aromas pop with notes of orange peel, black pepper and huckleberry. There's a lovely sense of elegance on the palate, which is seamless straight through the warm finish.
Wine: Les Trouvés 2016 Red (Washington)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: Very fruity, fresh and lively, this well-balanced and delicious wine has soothing bubbles and vivid citrus and apple flavors accented by floral and pistachio notes.
Wine: Lichen Estate 2014 Blanc de Noir Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Hailing from Boushey Vineyard, this wine was aged in a combination of large format oak and concrete. Aromas of gooseberry, kiwi, pink grapefruit, lemon rind, tropical fruit and herb lead to creamy-feeling fruit flavors supported by well-balanced acidity. A lingering finish caps it off. It's a richer styled interpretation of the variety.
Wine: Matthews 2017 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Pale in color, light aromas of blueberry, smoked meat, ember and green herb are followed by light elegant fruit and savory flavors. It's a pretty expression of the variety and region.
Wine: Reynvaan Family Vineyards 2015 The Contender Estate In the Rocks Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Demure on the nose, this wine is intense in tannin and oak, the rich red cherry fruit marked by earthy spice, forest pine and sizzling acidity.
Wine: Siduri 2016 Lingenfelder Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Strawberry, rhubarb and forest floor mix well in this intensely big-boned, thickly tannic wine. Asian spice seasons the ripe ribald fruit.
Wine: Siduri 2016 Saralee's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: Exotic and intensely fruity aromas lead to equally vivid fruit flavors that are well matched by moderate tannins and good acidity. Black plum and macerated cherry join hints of cedar and clove for a complex and satisfying flavor profile.
Wine: Skinner 2016 Smithereens Red (El Dorado)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: This full-bodied wine is very fruity but also bolstered by darker flavors and firm tannins that bring balance and a good mouthfeel. An almost jammy cherry and strawberry flavor is complemented by light baking-spice notes and a touch of black pepper. Winemaker Bill Easton blended 79% Grenache with Mourvèdre and Syrah.
Wine: Terre Rouge 2015 L'Autre Red (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Colorado, Colorado, US
Review: This red presents aromas of leather, raw oak, tobacco leaves and raspberry preserves, followed by vanilla and black plum with time in the glass. The palate combines smooth, velvety tannins and judicious acidity with sumptuous flavors of cherry, cedar, leather, warm vanilla and nutmeg. The plush finish lingers on a black plum note.
Wine: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey 2015 Revelation Proprietary Red (Colorado)
Winery: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This wine blends within a hearty helping of Merlot (13%) and Cabernet Franc (10%). Together, they offer pencil shavings, soy and earthy sage in character, the tannins sizably built and fully wrapped around rich layers of baked plum and black cherry.
Wine: V. Vineyards 2014 Audace Ruby Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Clean aromas of citrus-laced crème brûlée and creamy white peach make for an inviting entry to the nose of this bottling from a vineyard high atop the appellation. Those elements tighten on the palate to focus more on lime zest before the richer vanilla and peach-custard flavors lead into a caramelized finish.
Wine: Velvet Bee 2014 Rita's Crown Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This is a great entry-level wine, starting with aromas of lemongrass, Asian pear, pomelo pith, chalk and a slight hint of butter. There is strong tactile energy on the sip, which grabs hold of the palate with a lime pith edge then settles into creamier lemon-balm flavors.
Wine: Zotovich 2016 Zoto Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Made in conjunction with the top luxury property in Paso Robles, this slightly aged bottling offers chocolaty vanilla-laced and caramel-kissed aromas on the nose, set against the dried blackberry and clove scents. It's thick on the palate, sliding from alpine strawberry flavors into espresso, framed by sandy tannins.
Wine: Allegretto 2013 Ayres Family Reserve Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Zesty aromas of lime give an edge to the warmer tones of poached pear and peach on the nose of this bottling. The palate starts with a lemon sorbet and tangerine-rind kick before tasting much like orange juice, with a flash of hazelnut on the finish.
Wine: Bodega de Edgar 2017 Paso Ono Vineyard Albariño (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Deep and hearty aromas of blackberry, cherry wood and bacon show on the nose of this bottling. Dark berry, roasted pork and violet-flower flavors show on the palate, hitting all the classic Syrah notes.
Wine: Epiphany 2015 Hampton Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Meyer lemon pith and tangy grapefruit flesh make for a tart and crisp entry to the nose of this wine. The palate is also tangy with lemon peels and apple skins, all wrapped in a chalky texture.
Wine: Epiphany 2016 Rodney's Vineyard Grenache Blanc (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Fess Parker
Review: This is a steal for under $20, offering aromas of apple flesh, ripe pear, brioche and yellow grapefruit on the nose. The palate is crisp with citrus yet broad with fresh Gravenstein and Gala apple flavors.
Wine: Fess Parker 2017 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This value-driven wine is juicy up front in dark cherry cola flavors complemented by orange-peel-laden acidity. Its structure is moderate and approachably round.
Wine: Jax 2016 Y3 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: The 5% Viognier is out front on first pour, with aromas of freshly squeezed orange dominating, with notes of wet stone and smoked meat emerging over time. The palate brings a mixture of fruit and savory flavors, with the concentration seeming light. Tasted twice with consistent notes.
Wine: Rôtie Cellars 2016 Northern Blend Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Review: Velvety in thick dense tannins, this wine is stemmy and earthy, with an exotic hint of clove and tobacco. There's a lingering hit of smoked cherry on the midpalate, finishing in oak.
Wine: Saintsbury 2016 Lee Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Appellation: San Benito County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Very viscous and darkish yellow in the glass, this dessert wine offers fairly dainty aromas of smoke, oak and lemon sorbet. It's thick and sweet at first on the sip, but settles into honey and pleasant oak, with a savory roasted chicken finish.
Wine: Alara 2016 Late Harvest Viognier (San Benito County)

Appellation: Alara
Review: Refreshing aromas of key lime, pear flesh and the slightest hint of sweet oak show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is crisp and tight with Asian pear and lime-pith flavors, wrapped in a decent tannic tension.
Wine: Alara 2017 Viognier (San Benito County)

Appellation: Cosa Obra
Review: Thick and relatively rich, with a nutty underbelly, this white offers peach and pineapple flavors up front before making room for brighter aspects of lemon peel and grapefruit.
Wine: Cosa Obra 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Dusty dried herb and tobacco frame a compressed structure of tightly wound tannin and oak in this chewy grippy wine. Black pepper and savory leather override the brambly blackberry and dark cherry with ease, finishing like a cup of strong coffee.
Wine: Dry Creek Vineyard 2015 DCV2 Estate Four Clones Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Dusty Nabor
Review: Loads of purple flowers, cassis and black raspberry framboise show on the nose of this bottling. Ripe strawberries, black plums and figs arise on the sip, where they are enhanced by minty pinches of tarragon.
Wine: Dusty Nabor 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Floral in rose petals on the nose, this hearty red is creamy in texture, with a lushness on the midpalate. The flavors are dipped in raspberry, orange and brioche.
Wine: Eric Kent 2015 Stiling Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Flora Springs
Review: Chalky tannins wrap around sizable oak, sage, tobacco and cedar in this full-bodied 100% varietal wine. An herbaceous component dominates on the back of the palate.
Wine: Flora Springs 2015 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Smoked cherry and blackberry contribute richness to this wine's toasted quality of full-bodied intensity and flabby fleshy structure.
Wine: JCB 2015 No 6 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Kessler-Haak
Review: Fresh honeysuckle and ripe lemons meet with white peach, roasted nuts and toast on the nose of this bottling. The zesty palate is mouthwatering with flavors of lemon and apple, framed by decent tannic tension.
Wine: Kessler-Haak 2016 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Reynoso
Review: Intensely built, this wine offers sleek, velvety texture and a ripe body of dark-fruit flavor. Forest floor, black tea and Asian spice mingle well with black-cherry and wild strawberry robustness.
Wine: Reynoso 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Tenor
Review: Barrel aromas are at the fore, with notes of char and toasty oak in front of red fruit. The fruit and barrel flavors are lithe, with the tannins bringing a slightly grainy feel. The oak shows prominently at present.
Wine: Tenor 2015 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Tenor
Review: The aromas are generous and inviting, with notes of char, smoked meat, olive brine, flower and berry. The palate shows a pretty sense of elegance to the olive flavors—especially for the labeled alcohol level—but doesn't fully deliver on all of the aroma's promise.
Wine: Tenor 2015 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Reduced on the nose and aromatic in balsamic, this wine features tight-grained oak and a sizable grip of tannin, with dense, layered flavors of blackberry, dark cherry and leather.
Wine: Trentadue 2015 La Storia Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: Attractively buttery in flavor and very creamy in texture, this medium- to full-bodied wine tastes like vanilla, butterscotch and honey, and feels smooth and almost thick on the palate. Not the usual tangy profile of the varietal, but it's done well in an über-rich style.
Wine: Wilson Foreigner 2017 Rorick Vineyard Albariño (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Clos du Bois
Review: Ripe flavors and a round texture make this full-bodied wine a pleasure to sip. It layers black cherry, clove and black currant flavors with light oak spices on the mouthfilling frame that has a good touch of tannin for structure.
Wine: Clos du Bois 2015 Pinot Noir (California)

Appellation: Au Jus
Review: Asian and Bartlett pear, cherimoya, honeydew and a hint of toast show on the nose of this bottling, which is full of creamy white-fleshed fruit elements. The palate is more tangy with lime, then settles into full white-peach flavors, cut by a pinch of savory sea salt.
Wine: Au Jus 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This unique, creatively named and labeled blend of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 30% Grenache and 20% Syrah shows rather light aromas of gently pressed black currant. The palate offers tart black plum and lilac, making for a nice table wine.
Wine: Bodega de Edgar 2014 El CabRhône Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Humboldt County, North Coast, California, US
Review: Grassy, herbaceous aromas and tangy citrus flavors give a lively, extroverted personality to this medium-bodied wine. It has good crisp acidity that will make it refreshing on a warm day and especially good with simply prepared seafood and fresh-style cheeses.
Wine: Briceland 2017 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Humboldt County)

Appellation: Col Solare
Review: Being 100% varietal, blue-fruit aromas are at the fore, with notes of blueberry and huckleberry in front of spice—very unusual for Cabernet. The flavors are plump in style with firm tannins that don't quite seem to have fully ripened.
Wine: Col Solare 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Vibrant aromas of lees, toast, custard and cream are followed by full-bodied buttery flavors that linger on the warm finish. For those looking for a full bore Chardonnay, look no further.
Wine: Dillon Cellars 2014 Calyptra Stillwater Creek Vineyard Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: This is a nicely concentrated dry wine that blends fruity and savory aspects and has a good framework of crisp acidity and medium body. Aromas of apple skin and flavors of apple and cucumber are accented by light earthy touches.
Wine: Easton 2017 Monarch Mine Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: There's a tight weave on this bottling, which offers grapefruit rind and pear flesh on the nose alongside flint, steel and white-flower aromas. It's clean and crisp on the palate, with grassy flavors that are unusual for Viognier but quite welcome.
Wine: Eberle 2017 Mill Road Vineyard Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Kessler-Haak
Review: Apple blossoms, zesty lime sorbet and a flash of honey show on the nose of this bottling. There is just enough grip to the sip, where honey, lemon rind and yellow-apple flavors arise.
Wine: Kessler-Haak 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Saintsbury
Review: Lively acidity helps balance a wealth of concentrated red and blackberry fruit in this thickly tannic wine with sizable body weight and breath.
Wine: Saintsbury 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Review: This wine is big in flavor and offers lots of oak character along with very ripe berry, cherry and chocolate notes. The aroma has toasted bread, baking spices and cedar that continue on the palate matched by generous fruit flavors.
Wine: Shannon Ridge 2015 Buck Shack Red (Lake County)

Appellation: Simi
Review: Inviting in floral and lemon peel, this large-production white is textured and balanced in acidity, with a depth of tangerine and apple blossom.
Wine: Simi 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Tenor
Review: This wine was vinified in a mixture of new 300-liter French oak barrels (50%) and stainless steel, with all of the fruit coming from Stillwater Creek Vineyard. Appealing aromas of kiwi, whole pineapple and spice are followed by full-bodied, textured tropical-fruit flavors that lead to a warm finish. The concentration doesn't seem all there, but it is still quite enjoyable.
Wine: Tenor 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: A chalky, mineral aroma leads to a very dry, crisp and tangy flavor that shows a lot of restraint and firm acidity. Fermented in neutral (used) barrels and steel tanks, the wine is practically steely and certainly palate-cleansing.
Wine: Terragena 2017 Wiley Vineyard Riesling (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey
Review: Keen aromas of black cherry, cassis, vanilla and clove introduce this endlessly approachable Cabernet Sauvignon. The round palate shows ripe raspberry, tart pomegranate, vanilla and baking spice with a touch of cedar woodiness. Well integrated, velvety tannins are smartly balanced by vibrant acidity.
Wine: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Colorado)
Winery: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey

Appellation: Colorado, Colorado, US
Review: Sharp, tangy aromas of red currant, pomegranate and underripe blackberry are backed by licorice, cherry wood, clove and vanillin on the nose. The palate is surprisingly fruit-forward in flavors of raspberry, black plums and more pomegranate, while peppery spice whispers of clove and oak. This feels light and juicy but grounded by dusty tannins in a stalemate with the rampant acidity. There is a nice kick of peppery spice to cut through the tangy fruit on the finish.
Wine: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Colorado)
Winery: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey

Appellation: Colorado, Colorado, US
Review: This Cabernet-dominant blend balances obvious oak influences of vanilla and stemmy wood with black fruits and warm cinnamon on the nose. Flavors of raspberry and blackberry meld with vanilla and baking spice while a subtle woodiness weaves in and out. Moderate acidity balances the supple, but well structured tannins that gently grip the palate. The tannins turn dry and spicy on the finish, with lingering notes of pomegranate and mulling spice.
Wine: Creekside Cellars 2015 Robusto Red (Colorado)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Concentrated red-cherry aromas meet with sweet wood oil to offer a pleasant entry to this bottling. There are eucalyptus and pine-oil flavors drizzled across the palate, where dark elderberry fruits dominate.
Wine: Epiphany 2015 Rodney's Vineyard Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine is a full seven years old, coming from the exceptionally cool 2011 vintage. Appealing aromas of berry, black currant, cassis and herb lead to well-balanced fruit flavors. It shows a lovely sense of poise, showing the benefits that this challenging vintage can offer.
Wine: Full Pull & Friends 2011 CVBDX Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yadkin Valley, North Carolina, US
Review: Bright, grassy notes lead the nose with peach, lime juice and bell pepper. The round palate offers concentrated notes of beach grass, kumquat and more lime juice. Tingling acidity builds towards the zesty finish, loaded with yellow peach and white pepper.
Wine: Jones von Drehle 2015 Estate Viognier (Yadkin Valley)

Appellation: Humboldt County, North Coast, California, US
Review: The rather deep salmon-copper color of this wine is eye-catching. Each sip has all the energy and zest of a rosé sparkling wine without the sparkle. The flavors are ripe but crisp, combining raspberry with a touch of earthiness.
Wine: Joseph Jewell 2017 Ryan Vineyard Pinot Noir (Humboldt County)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Review: Loads of anise and licorice aromas meet with blackberry jam and loamy earth on this bottling. Rich black-currant paste flavors meet with black licorice on the well structured palate.
Wine: Lorenzi Estate 2014 Private Reserve Syrah (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Pull
Review: Red-cherry, wood-smoke and crushed graphite aromas show on the nose of this bottling. It's soft and luxurious on the palate at first but then come more rigid, chalky tannins, carrying flavors of black cherry and oak.
Wine: Pull 2014 Merlot (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sonoma Mountain, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Woody oak and elongated tannin mark this powerfully built wine, which is angular in acidity. Juicy citrus amplifies the freshness, lingering in cola and cardamom.
Wine: Siduri 2016 Van Der Kamp Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)

Appellation: Grand Valley, Colorado, US
Review: This blend of 28% Cabernet Franc, 25% Malbec, 22% Petit Verdot, 14% Cabernet Sauvignon and 11% Merlot offers savory aromas of bell pepper, tomato leaf, woodland berry and tart cranberry. The palate is bright and juicy in notes of pomegranate and strawberry, while a supportive woodiness takes a backseat adding depth. The smooth mouthfeel is not without tannin, which takes on a sandy texture towards the lingering, raspberry-laced finish.
Wine: Snowy Peaks 2016 Sebastian's Reserve Red (Grand Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Very strong smoky aromas of hickory and a solid pepper spice give a savory background to the backdrop of blackberry fruit on the nose of this bottling. That smoke carries into the palate, where roasted wood, campfire and bacon flavors meet with black currant and caramel.
Wine: Vinum 2016 Red Dirt Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: This medium- to full-bodied wine shows hints of mint and cedar on the nose, with lively, concentrated flavors of blackberrry and black cherry on the palate. It has a smooth texture and just enough tannins to firm up the mouthfeel.
Wine: Andis 2015 Painted Fields Red (Amador County)

Appellation: Humboldt County, North Coast, California, US
Review: Earthy waxy aromas meet crisp and bracing but subdued grapefruit and lemon-zest flavors in this taut, unoaked and medium-bodied wine. It has a slightly austere appeal and good acidity that will liven up food pairings from fish and chips to roast pork.
Wine: Briceland 2017 Ishi Pishi Ranch Gewurztraminer (Humboldt County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: A subtle shade of pink-yellow in the glass, this bottling shows light strawberry and a touch of sourdough on the nose. Framed by laser-sharp bubbles, the palate offers rounded plum flavors alongside grapefruit rinds and the sour kick of green-apple skins.
Wine: Broken Earth 2016 Sotto Voce Grenache Rosé Sparkling (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Brooks Note
Review: This crisp and appetizing wine offers herb and apricot aromas, lip-smacking acidity and tempting flavors of dried herbs, apricots and mineral water. It is medium bodied, shows no signs of oak and will be very versatile with food.
Wine: Brooks Note 2017 Pinot Blanc (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Los Angeles County, South Coast, California, US
Review: Lilac buds, caramelized black-fruit and sweet tobacco-leaf aromas show on the nose of this blend of 75% Syrah and 25% Tannat. It's a bit tangy and fruit-powered on the palate, where candied boysenberry and black raspberry meet with a touch of balsamic sauce and a chalky structure.
Wine: Byron Blatty 2015 Agenda Red (Los Angeles County)

Appellation: Idaho, US
Review: Fermented and aged in stainless steel, this wine is a blend of fruit from Sawtooth, Martin and Williamson vineyards. Bright aromas of tangerine, mouthwatering ripe peach and honeysuckle lead to plentiful stone fruit flavors that glide on the apricot-filled finish.
Wine: Cinder 2016 Dry Viognier

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: An abundance of fruit flavors and generous dashes of baking spices give this full-bodied wine from the E. & J. Gallo folks an extroverted personality. Ripe berry and cherry flavors meet lavish oaky notes of nutmeg and vanilla for an easy, pleasing profile.
Wine: Ghost Pines 2016 Winemaker's Blend Pinot Noir (California)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Concentrated red cherry aromas meet with peppery spice and coffee on the rounded and classically styled nose of this bottling. The palate balances flavors of roasted fruit with darker berries, a hint of pepper and dried herbs, framed by squeaky tannins.
Wine: Hearst Ranch 2016 Lone Tree Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lula
Review: This full-bodied wine is well-saturated with dark-berry flavors and has a velvety, slightly tannic texture. Hints of dark chocolate and toasted oak add some complexity to this firm and well-structured wine.
Wine: Lula 2016 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Roasted red cherries, clove and sweet wood aromas show on the nose of this blend of 50% Sangiovese, 33% Malbec and 17% Cabernet Sauvignon. There is a dusting of herbs on the palate, but it's primarily roasted red berries, cherry juice and smoke flavors.
Wine: Midnight 2014 Capriccio Italien Reserve Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Review: Well-concentrated but still lively and fresh, this medium-bodied wine is just what many people look for. It smells grassy and grapefruity, tastes more ripe and full like honeydew melon, and has a pleasant richness on the palate.
Wine: Shannon Ridge 2017 High Elevation Collection Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Deep black-plum and blackberry aromas make for a hearty nose on this bottling, which comes from two specific rows. The mouthfeel is thick and the palate is framed by a strong acidity, carrying flavors of ripe boysenberry.
Wine: Zanoli 2016 Glenrose Vineyard Rows RR & SS Syrah (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Cline
Review: A bright blend of honeysuckle and mango flavors give plenty of personality to this medium-bodied, well-balanced wine. Bright acidity lifts the mouthfeel for a refreshing, but still rich flavor profile.
Wine: Cline 2017 Viognier (North Coast)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Earthy forest notes meet a rich succulent midpalate of mocha and red cherry in this wide-angled, chewy wine from an estate-grown site.
Wine: Kunde 2014 Drummond Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Aromas of baking spice, vanilla, herb and high-toned cherry cola are followed by lighter-styled fruit and herb flavors. It provides intrigue.
Wine: Lobo Hills 2015 Lonesome Springs Ranch Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Herb, dark soil and cherry-candy aromas lead to well-balanced fruit flavors with a lick of tannins. Put it on the dinner table to see it at its best.
Wine: Lobo Hills 2015 StoneTree Vineyard Petit Verdot (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Maison Areion
Review: Fresh aromas of apple and pear juice meet with a touch of lemon rinds on the fruit-driven nose of this bottling by winemaker Nicolas Vonderheyden. It's crisp on the palate and easy to quaff with touches of seared lemon and peanut brittle.
Wine: Maison Areion 2017 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Medaloni
Review: The nose displays aromas of orange blossoms, gardenias, peach fuzz and green pears. The slick palate is zippy in flavors of Mandarin and lime, joined by sweet grass, yellow pepper and a hint of lemon pith.
Wine: Medaloni 2016 Viognier (Yadkin Valley)

Appellation: Nola Grace
Review: Flinty wet-stone aromas and subtle mineral and fig flavors mark this wine. It tastes clean and crisp, boasting a well-balanced, medium body.
Wine: Nola Grace 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Ripe apple and honeysuckle aromas meet with gunmetal on the nose of this bottling. Fresh citrusy flavors meet with toasted hazelnut, a hint of flint and chilled apple flesh on the palate.
Wine: Pali 2016 Highlands Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Rancho Sisquoc
Review: Lime blossom, orange sorbet, apple rinds and grapefruit zest make for a very fresh and inviting nose on this bottling. There's a strong botanical kick to the sip, with hints of juniper, as well as interesting and likable orange and apple flavors.
Wine: Rancho Sisquoc 2017 Riesling (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Result of a Crush
Review: This wine is a blend of 45% Grenache Blanc, 33% Marsanne and 22% Viognier. The aromas jump up, with notes of canned peach, flower and lees. Stone-fruit flavors extend on the sleekly styled palate, with peach notes lingering on the finish. It provides a lot of intrigue.
Wine: Result of a Crush 2016 White (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Loads of pear and a lean hint of guava show on the nose of this bottling. Fleshy aromas of ripe pears and apples meet with a touch of tropicality on the clean palate.
Wine: Roblar 2017 Gold Collection Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: SeaGlass
Review: This Trinchero-made bottling shows lemon sorbet and Pink Lady apple on the clean and easy nose. It's easy and likable on the palate, offering lime sorbet with tangy lemon-rind flavors.
Wine: SeaGlass 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Sonoma-Loeb
Review: Oaky, big and bold in flavor, this appellation wine is textured with highlights of lemon peel, pineapple and stone fruit.
Wine: Sonoma-Loeb 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

Appellation: New Jersey, US
Review: Charming aromas of white peach nectar and Mandarin orange mingle with honeysuckle and honeydew. The slick palate feels fresh in zippy flavors of pink grapefruit and lime.
Wine: Turdo 2017 Turis Sauvignon Blanc

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Wet cement and cut grass make for a very fresh nose on this bottling. The palate is quite grippy in texture, offering lime pith, red pear and more damp sidewalk flavors.
Wine: Velvet Bee 2016 McGinley Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Vanilla, cherry, spice and herb aromas are followed by plump black-fruit flavors, with the tannins bringing a bit of grit and dryness on the back end. Tasted twice with consistent notes.
Wine: Amavi 2015 Estate Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This bottling, which includes 7% Grenache, shows rich aromas of black currant and boysenberry with touches of charred wood and thyme. The palate is tart with black-plum-skin flavors and shows a good amount of energy, though the finish is a tad tarry and woody.
Wine: Asuncion Ridge 2015 Nefarious Syrah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Roasted blackberries, black-plum skins and woody smoke make for a fruitful yet savory entry to the nose of this wine. Hearty smoke flavors show prominently on the palate, where tangy plum flavors otherwise reign.
Wine: Bellante 2016 Watch Hill Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Though this red bubbly wine may explode all over the kitchen, the hassle is worth the effort. Aromas of black cherry, tart boysenberry and clove lead into full-flavored palate of blackberry and baking spice. The mouthfeel is quite lavish and there's the slightest sense of sweetness.
Wine: Broken Earth 2015 Sotto Voce Merlot (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Aged in 100% stainless steel, this will appeal to fans of the style—a sleek, straightforward expression of tropical fruit and floral aromas. It has a smooth rounded palate of easygoing texture and light-bodied ripeness.
Wine: Bucher 2017 Bucher Vineyard Unoaked Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: A light-salmon color and rather generous peach and cherry flavors give this medium-bodied wine made from Rhône grape varieties more substance than many rosés. A generous mouthfeel adds to its appeal.
Wine: Cochon 2017 Old Vine Rosé (California)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: From a site on Woolsey Road in the appellation, this is a sulfurous, lemony white, aged in both neutral French oak and stainless drums. Textured, it offers powerful concentration, rich tropical flavors and body weight.
Wine: Davis Bynum 2017 Jane's Vineyard Virginia's Block Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Della
Review: Grainy and dense in caramelized oak, this robust wine shows ample ripeness and body on the palate, with a lasting taste of vanilla.
Wine: Della 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Black currant, blackberry, damp wood and dried purple flowers show on the nose of this bottling from the region between Gilroy and Morgan Hill south of San Jose. It's a down-the-middle Syrah on the palate, showing familiar hints of pepper and black fruit with proper tannins and acid.
Wine: Aver Family Vineyards 2014 Homage Syrah (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Rounded blackberry and plum meet with hickory smoke and flint on the nose of this blend of 53% Petite Sirah, 22% Syrah, 16% Grenache and 9% Viognier. It's full of flavor on the palate, combining tangy berries, charred wood, a hint of tar and herbal oils.
Wine: Broken Earth 2013 CdR Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Made from several blocks and clones within the sustainably farmed site, this is an earthy, stemmy wine that is exotic in lightly spiced cola and pomegranate. A robust texture and body provides nuanced richness and ample concentration.
Wine: Bucher 2015 Bucher Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Sour lemon aromas meet with strong sandalwood and charred oak on the very woody nose of this bottling. Tangy lemon skin, lighter lemon blossom and viscous, nearly sweet oak flavors show on the palate, which is dominated by wood.
Wine: Byron 2015 Nielson Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Light lime aromas meet with nectarine on the plush nose of this appellation blend by this Alsatian variety-focused winery. It's quite dry on the palate, offering subtle flavors of apple rind and wrapped up in a fairly tight texture. It's an easy-drinking introductory Riesling.
Wine: Claiborne & Churchill 2017 Dry Riesling (Central Coast)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: Supple, concentrated and generous, this wine has lightly oaky aromas like vanilla and coconut, an abundance of ripe plummy milk-chocolaty flavors and a soft texture that feels gentle on the palate.
Wine: Cochon 2015 Whole Hog Red (California)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Fleshy and full-bodied with moderate acidity, this is a barrel-fermented wine, made from Pinot Noir grapes grown by the Sangiacomo family. Strawberry, melon and cherry flavors leap from the glass.
Wine: Cosa Obra 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Slightly cloudy in the glass, this bottling, featuring a great label by artist Ethan Stuart, starts with aromas of mashed-up lemons, crushed nuts, and oak. That smoky lemon tang shows strongly on the palate too, which verges on savory, with hints of roast chicken, sea salt and herbs.
Wine: Dusty Nabor 2017 The Florist Viognier (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Falkner
Review: Loads of white flowers meet with an orange-banana smoothie and sandalwood aromas on the nose of this bottling. The palate shows the sweetness of apple flesh with a rounded woody character, making for solid flavors even if the acid is a tad weak.
Wine: Falkner 2017 Viognier (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Fess Parker
Review: Oregano meets with dark pomegranate and a touch of smoke on the nose of this appellation blend. More smoke shows on the palate alongside tangy red fruit and dried herbs. It's a decent midweek option.
Wine: Fess Parker 2016 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: Flavors like blackberry jam and black pepper make a nice match in this full-bodied broad-textured wine made mostly from Bordeaux varietals with 22% Petite Sirah added. It tastes rich and smooth, and is concentrated enough for a lingering finish. The ornate label features a surprising yet alarming portrait of George Washington with the face of a French bulldog that belongs to winery owner Jean-Charles Boisset.
Wine: Frenchie Winery 2014 Frenchington Red (California)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Ripe red-fruit aromas meet with sweet wood shavings on the nose of this blend of 66% Cabernet Sauvignon and 34% Syrah. Blackberry flavors show up alongside pepper and thyme on the pleasant, but somewhat simple, palate.
Wine: Jamie Slone Wines 2014 P1 Red (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This is the first wine to be released off this recently planted vineyard. Fermented and aged in stainless steel, aromas of red and yellow apple, kiwi and pineapple are followed by fresh tangy stone and tropical-fruit flavors. It shows promise.
Wine: Lagana 2017 Eritage Vineyard Chardonnay (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Review: This Super Tuscan blend of Sangiovese, Syrah and Merlot plays to the less-ripe side of the equation, offering aromas of tomato, bell pepper and green peppercorns. There is juicy red fruit on the palate and lots of peppery spice, but that bell-pepper undercurrent persists, which is interesting for this often very ripe region.
Wine: Lorenzi Estate 2016 Rick's Red (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Very crisp, lean and herbaceous, this light-bodied wine has aromas of celery and white pepper and vivid flavors of cucumber and fresh herbs. It's very thirst quenching and vibrant in texture.
Wine: Meeker 2017 Evina Vineyard Verdelho (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Green Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Minty, this wine is full bodied and powerfully built, with smooth lush layers of spicy cardamom and forest pine. The fruit is elusive, a blend of brambly berry and cherry that is wrapped within dense oak.
Wine: Saintsbury 2016 Sundawg Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Light, fresh and with a bite of citrus at its core, this blends 85% Pinot Noir with 15% Vermentino, the two fermented and aged in French oak, just 10% of it new. The high-toned acidity is nicely integrated around strawberry highlights and a lasting tease of ginger.
Wine: Satyre Wines 2016 Amalthea Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Stags' Leap Winery
Review: Burly soft tannins are both chalky and robust in this well-made full-bodied wine, which is blended with small amounts of Syrah, Grenache and mixed Rhônes. Soy, blackberry, blueberry and chocolate flavors mix well before a softness comes into play on the finish.
Wine: Stags' Leap Winery 2015 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: This big but gentle wine has a mouth-filling texture and lavish fruit and spice flavors that are hard to resist. Lots of berries and cherries flood the taste buds, while soft tannins and relatively low acidity give it a nicely viscous feel.
Wine: Terre Rouge 2015 Tête-à-tête Red (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This Super Tuscan blend of Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Freisa and Petit Verdot shows hickory, red-cherry and pepper-crusted steak aromas on the nose. The palate offers tangy cranberry fruit and a slightly reductive touch of tar.
Wine: Toccata 2015 Classico Red (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: V. Sattui
Review: Fruity and fresh-tasting peach and pine aromas waft up from the glass before crisp apple and white-peach flavors hit the tongue, tempered by a light touch of sweetness. The wine is light to medium bodied, very tasty and charming.
Wine: V. Sattui 2017 Riesling (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino Ridge, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: A bright gold color and assertive oak aromas and flavors make this an unusual example of the variety, but it is appealing nonetheless. The aroma is quite buttery and the flavors resemble toasted almonds and grilled pears while the body is full and viscous.
Wine: Waits-Mast 2017 Mariah Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino Ridge)

Appellation: Madera County, Central Valley, California, US
Review: This full-bodied and densely packed wine has aged well. It shows aromas like coffee and cedar, and flavors like late-harvested plums and chocolate. It feels smooth and velvety but has substantial tannins suspended in the rich fruit and spice elements.
Wine: Westbrook Wine Farm 2011 Museum Red (Madera County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Quite gamy on the nose, this bottling shows lamb meat, crushed asphalt and black pepper on the nose. The palate is very woody with cedar shavings but also plenty of juicy dark fruit and a touch of game.
Wine: Bellante 2015 Watch Hill Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Cassis and lilac aromas show prominently on the nose of this very extracted wine. The palate is juicy and tangy with balsamic-laced strawberry fruit, lifted by a touch of savory pepper on the finish.
Wine: Bellante 2016 Shokrian Vineyard Reserve Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine is half Malbec and half Cabernet Sauvignon. The aromas of plum, herb and tar provide appeal, expressing these two varieties well. The palate is medium bodied with abundant blue-fruit flavors on the finish.
Wine: Callan 2016 MC2 Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Rusty aromas of earth, pomegranate and raspberry meet with a dusty minerality on the nose of this bottling from actor Challen Cates. It's fairly light on the palate, offering tangy cranberry, thyme and dried sage flavors.
Wine: Challen 2014 Jasper Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This is a delicately textured fruit-forward wine lush in candied strawberry and grainy oak. Relatively light bodied, it retains acidity well, adding a flourish of lavender on the finish.
Wine: De Loach 2015 Maboroshi Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Aromas of vanilla extract, wood spice, plum and cherry are followed by restrained fruit and barrel flavors. The oak seems a bit intense for the fruit that is in the glass.
Wine: Dunham 2015 XXI Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Hestan
Review: This wine is sticky and grippy in tannin, with a reductive quality to its huge burly structure. Dusty elements of crushed rock ride alongside sizable oak and a girth of baked cherry.
Wine: Hestan 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: J Vineyards & Winery
Review: Hints of spearmint and minerals on the nose and ample ripe-apple and honeydew flavors on the palate add up to a substantial and well-balanced wine. Bright acidity lends a tangy undertone.
Wine: J Vineyards & Winery 2017 Pinot Gris (California)

Appellation: Los Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Review: Blending 51% Chardonnay with 49% Pinot Noir, this is a creamy rounded sparkling wine of moderate structure, opting for fleshy opulence in abundance. It tastes of green apple, melon and peach.
Wine: JCB 2014 No. 9 Brut Sparkling (Los Carneros)

Appellation: Koehler
Review: There is an abundance of tropical fruit, sweet pear and orange Popsicle aromas on the nose of this bottling. It dries up considerably on the sip, where bright and tight flavors of apple flesh are framed by fairly ripping acidity.
Wine: Koehler 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: Bold in fruit flavor and very dry, this medium-bodied Pinot Gris smells tangy and fresh, tastes crisp and lively like tart cherries and lemons, and seems to have very low residual sugar.
Wine: Lichen Estate 2014 Blanc de Gris Sparkling (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Examples of this variety are rare in this state, with this one coming from a hot site and vintage. Blackberry seed, anise, herb stem and dark-plum aromas are followed by rich ripe cherry flavors that persist on the finish. It's equal parts intrigue and delivery.
Wine: Lobo Hills 2014 StoneTree Vineyard Barbera (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: The aromas are redolent with notes of honeysuckle, ripe peach and floral soap. Rare for the state, it drinks bone dry, with a light sleek feel. Pair it with food to see it shine.
Wine: Lobo Hills 2017 Dry Riesling (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Matthews
Review: Blended with 13% Sémillon, the aromas are quite light, with notes of herb and citrus. The palate is medium bodied with a lingering finish. It's pleasant but comes off as quite lightly flavored.
Wine: Matthews 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Prima Materia
Review: Very smooth, ripe and grapey, this is an exuberant wine packed with plum, strawberry and cinnamon flavors. It is full bodied but very low in tannins, so the palate impression is soothing and soft. The winemaker blended in 12% Syrah and 8% Petite Sirah, and a portion of the grapes was air dried on racks before fermentation.
Wine: Prima Materia 2014 Grenache (Lake County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Smoke, leather and dark-berry aromas make for a savory and fruity entry on the nose of this bottling. Gritty tannins frame the rugged palate, offering plummy flavors of rhubarb and hickory smoke.
Wine: Rabble 2016 Mossfire Ranch Tempranillo (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Plum, wax crayon and sizable tannins pique the palate of this robust full-bodied wine, made in a 100% varietal manner. The midpalate is soft in fruity berry and oak flavors, finishing in a quiet dusting of white pepper.
Wine: Spicy Vines 2015 Morning Song Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: The Orcas Project
Review: This wine is a blend of fruit from Art den Hoed and Upland vineyards. Light in color, the aromas suggest notes of raspberry candy along with herb accents. There's a pretty sense of purity to the raspberry-jam flavors that persist on the warm finish.
Wine: The Orcas Project 2016 Garnacha (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
