Review: This wine is 100% Merlot. High-toned aromas of coffee, graphite, licorice, black raspberry and spice lead to medium-bodied fruit flavors that paint around the edges, missing in the middle. There are good things going on if the midpalate fleshes out.
Wine: The Orcas Project 2016 Red Willow Vineyard Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Review: This proprietary red blend, always a favorite of this winery's following, shows rounded and ripe aromas of cherries and red currants, with a hint of roast beef and grainy oak. The palate is boisterous and driven by decent acid, with ripe red fruit and more oaky flavors.
Wine: Wilson Creek 2014 Double Dog Red Five Paws Vineyard Red (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: This rarely seen grape seems to do well in the warmer environs of Temecula, starting with aromas of snappy black raspberry and dark chocolate on the nose. The palate offers muddled black plum and elderberry flavors with just enough acid to carry through to the finish.
Wine: Wilson Creek 2016 Cellar Select Teroldego (California)

Appellation: Carson Scott
Review: This is a very good, straightforward wine with plenty of fruit flavor to fill out the medium body and balance out the rather firm tannins and acidity. It's one of several current good-value Pinots from the 2016 and 2017 vintages in California.
Wine: Carson Scott 2017 Pinot Noir (California)

Appellation: Los Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Review: Crisp in orange and lemon, the acidity fresh and persistent, this is an unfussy quaffer with moderate structure and body. It impresses in its fruity exuberance.
Wine: Cuvaison 2017 Estate Grown Rosé of Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: There's a slightly nutty kick to the nose of this bottling, with almond aromas playing alongside the lemon rinds. Those blanched almond flavors show on the sip as do tangy yellow-apple skins and lemon oil.
Wine: Epiphany 2016 Inspiration White (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This is a refreshing white blend, tightly wound although quite subtle. Light in the glass, it shows aromas of lime skin, peach, dried honeysuckle and white lily. The palate is tightly wound and bright with delicate pome-fruit flesh flavors.
Wine: Folded Hills 2016 August White (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: G & C Lurton
Review: Tart, thick and woody, this white presents as full bodied and richly thick on the palate, before slowly unfurling brighter, crisper notes of lemon verbena.
Wine: G & C Lurton 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Highway 12
Review: This wine blends in 15% Petite Sirah, adding to its dense, rich and rounded character. Aromatic in clove and black pepper, it tastes of blackberry cobbler and vanilla oak.
Wine: Highway 12 2015 Merlot (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Lobo Hills
Review: The aromas are locked up initially, with notes of cedar, herb, cherry and anise. The palate is similarly wound up, with a tight core of tannins that still need some time to settle in.
Wine: Lobo Hills 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Review: Subtle dark fruit aromas meet with licorice, wood spice and toffee on the nose of this bottling. It's rather thick on the palate with extracted fruit flavors as well as licorice, charred berries and burned caramel, ending on the slightest kick of menthol.
Wine: Lorenzi Estate 2015 Single Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine is a bit green out of the gate, with notes of garden herb and green pepper in front of dark fruit. The fruit flavors are full bore, with a tight core of slightly dry tannins wrapped around them.
Wine: Maloney 2015 Single Vineyard Phinny Hill Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Maryhill
Review: Vibrant aromas of raspberry jam, fruit leather and spice are followed by plush fruit flavors. It's a very enjoyable, spot-on example of the variety.
Wine: Maryhill 2015 Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Temecula, South Coast, California, US
Review: Pepper and pencil shavings give depth to the ripe black-currant and caramel aromas on the nose of this blend of 40% Cabernet Sauvignon, 40% Merlot and 20% Cabernet Franc. Strong licorice and juniper flavors show on the palate alongside ripe elderberries and black currant.
Wine: Palumbo Family Vineyards 2014 Tre Fratalli Meritage (Temecula)

Appellation: Rancho Sisquoc
Review: Subtle aromas of lemon bar, white peach, passion fruit soda and chalk show on the nose of this bottling, which comes from one of the region's older properties. It's very zippy and fresh on the palate, and that racy character fades into Pink Lady apple and mandarin orange flavors.
Wine: Rancho Sisquoc 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Mostly Syrah (73%) along with Cabernet Sauvignon (23%) and a pinch of Merlot, the aromas show notes of vanilla and dill in front of blueberry and dark cherry. The palate is full bodied and comes off as high octane, with a background of firm slightly gritty tannins. Though listed as only 20% new American oak, it shows a bit prominently at times.
Wine: Ryan Patrick 2015 Rock Island Red (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Stags' Leap Winery
Review: This blends in handfuls of Petite Sirah, Malbec and Petit Verdot, adding to the wine's thick concentration and full-bodied density. Reduced on the nose, it unfurls layers of leather, tobacco and plum within a larger context of chocolate and tobacco.
Wine: Stags' Leap Winery 2015 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Sutcliffe
Review: This Chardonnay opens with pleasant aromas of lemon curd, filo dough, fennel and rye. The palate has some heft, but is lifted by tangy acidity and radiates lemon juice and orange zest flavors anchored by oaky nuances of pie crust and browned butter. The lingering lemony finish offers undertones of Marcona almond.
Wine: Sutcliffe 2015 Chardonnay (Colorado)

Appellation: VGS
Review: Robust in pineapple and guava, with a generosity of oak, this is a concentrated, ripe and full-bodied white, that is fleshy and voluptuous in style. It offers a sweetness of tannin that emphasizes the ripe nature of the fruit.
Wine: VGS 2016 Chardonnay (Mount Veeder)

Appellation: Zotovich
Review: Peach and ripe apples meet with a strong kick of honeysuckle on the nose of this bottling, one of the few Viogniers from the appellation. There is decent tension to the palate, where more white flowers and pome-fruit flavors approach tropicality but are wrapped in a compelling texture.
Wine: Zotovich 2017 Viognier (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Alara
Review: Very light in the glass with the slightest hint of pink, this wine's aromas are very shy, with just a hint of apple flesh. It's quite zippy and refreshing on the palate, but the flavors are also light, with hints of apple and lemon skin.
Wine: Alara 2017 Pinot Grigio (San Benito County)

Appellation: San Benito County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Light red-fruit and damp wood aromas show on the nose of this rosé treatment of Barbera, not the most common of varieties for a pink wine. There is a strong lime-skin tang to the palate with deeper cranberry flavors, making for a very full-flavored rosé.
Wine: Alara 2017 Rosé of Barbera (San Benito County)

Appellation: Crossbarn by Paul Hobbs
Review: Dense, earthy and forested, this red offers compressed condensed flavors of dark cherry cola and blood orange. Intensely rich, ripe and fruity, it's well integrated in oak and tannin.
Wine: Crossbarn by Paul Hobbs 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: A mere one barrel was produced of this wine. Dried herb aromas and flavors are at the fore, followed by green pepper, baking spice, dill and cherry. Lighter styled, it shows a pretty sense of nuance, with fruit and barrel playing off each other. Coffee and vanilla notes linger on the finish.
Wine: Eternal 2015 Privelege Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Monterey, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Rounded Pink Lady apple aromas meet with pear blossom and chalk on the nose of this stainless steel wine brand by Wrath and winemaker Sabrine Rodems. Ripe apple and pear flavors show on the chalky sip, which is a solid option for lovers of the style.
Wine: Ex 2017 Unoaked Chardonnay (Monterey)

Appellation: Husch
Review: Apple skin and pine-needle aromas waft up from this light-bodied wine, while crisp apple and mild floral accents dominate the fresh and quite fruity flavors. It's helpful that the label reveals a 11 g/L residual sugar, which means it is a touch sweet.
Wine: Husch 2017 Chenin Blanc (Mendocino)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: This is an especially aromatic wine in a particularly aromatic varietal category. Aromas like cut grass, grapefruit and snap peas rush out of the glass, leading to equally vivid veggie flavors and a nice, crisp texture.
Wine: Husch 2017 La Ribera Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino)

Appellation: Los Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Review: Made from 51% Chardonnay and 49% Pinot Noir, this is a broad and rich sparkling wine with ample mousse and body weight. Peach, apple and almond paste mingle on the midpalate with ease.
Wine: JCB 2014 No. 24 Brut Sparkling (Los Carneros)

Appellation: Les Trouvés
Review: A blend of 44% Viognier, 37% Marsanne and 19% Roussanne, aromas of wet stone, apple and peach are followed by lighter-styled stone fruit-flavors that finish warm.
Wine: Les Trouvés 2016 White (Washington)

Appellation: Bennett Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This wine is earthen in ash, stems and a thickness of up-front tannin. Black cherry and berry dominate on the balanced midpalate before giving way to bubbling acidity on the finish.
Wine: MacLaren 2015 Heather Pinot Noir (Bennett Valley)

Appellation: Suisun Valley, North Coast, California, US
Review: This fruity wine made from 100% Pinot Noir has a light-peach color, powerful effervescence and frank flavors like red cherries that make it refreshing and tasty. It comes from an under-the-radar appellation just east of Napa County.
Wine: Rock Wall 2017 Blanc de Noir Loney Ranch Sparkling (Suisun Valley)

Appellation: Rotation Vineyards
Review: This full-flavored and full-bodied wine leads with smoky peppery oak notes in the aroma and ladles more oak on the palate but also backs it up with generous fruit flavors and a smooth texture due to fine-grained tannins. This will be excellent with a wide range of proteins.
Wine: Rotation Vineyards 2016 Red (California)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Review: Upfront oak is tight-grained on the palate, before allowing layers of fennel and pear to come into focus. Medium bodied, the vineyard site shows both the character of a warm, even vintage and the excellence of the site.
Wine: Saintsbury 2016 Sangiacomo Green Acres Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Monterey, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Standard aromas of Pink Lady and Gala apples meet with seared pear on the nose of this bottling. There's a hint of sweetness to the palate, where pan-seared apples, butter, sea salt and warm peach tones make for a fairly rich experience.
Wine: San Simeon 2016 Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Monterey)

Appellation: Sawtooth
Review: Aromas of pear, grass, green apple and lemon zest, lead to a flavorful palate full of pineapple flavors, backed by a zip of lemony acidity. It delivers a lot of quality and value.
Wine: Sawtooth 2017 Pinot Gris (America)

Appellation: Tenor
Review: Vibrant aromas of vanilla, cream, clarified butter and peach are followed by full-bodied textured fruit flavors with plentiful toasty notes on the warm finish. The concentration dips at times and the style seems oak heavy but there is still much to enjoy.
Wine: Tenor 2016 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: The Archivist
Review: Slightly simple but pleasurable aromas of pomegranate, black raspberry, light cocoa and caramel candy show on the nose of this bottling. The structure is also airy, but it's easy to enjoy with ripe strawberry and boysenberry flavors.
Wine: The Archivist 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: The Archivist
Review: Clean and familiar aromas of butter and lemon preserves make for a somewhat simple but very straightforward and crowd-pleasing take on Chardonnay. The same goes for the palate, where the buttery middle is cut by lemon rind on the edges, making for a mellow but tasty experience.
Wine: The Archivist 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

Appellation: The Vice
Review: Rich and creamy in texture, this wine offers lasting freshness from start to finish. The palate is dotted in bold flavors of fig and green apple.
Wine: The Vice 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Van Ruiten
Review: A light spearmint aroma and lively, subtle spiced-apple flavors make this medium-bodied wine very engaging. It has good lively acidity, a sense of freshness and a clean tangy finish.
Wine: Van Ruiten 2017 Pinot Grigio (Lodi)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Aromas of dark roasted coffee beans, herb and spice are followed by somewhat lighter-styled cherry flavors with a slightly tacky feel. Cherry notes persist on the finish. The variety seems hard to find.
Wine: Ambassador Vineyard 2015 Estate Grown Malbec (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: The aromas offer notes of anise, cassis, baking spice and cherry, with the wood out front. The fruit flavors are ripe, with a slightly gritty feel to the tannins, which also bring some bitterness. Coffee notes linger on the finish.
Wine: Ambassador Vineyard 2015 Estate Grown Plenipotentiary Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Double Black
Review: Woody spices rule on the nose of this bottling, but there are also elements of blackberry jam, thyme and anise. The palate is quite smoky with oak, which frames the dark fruit and baking-spice flavors.
Wine: Double Black 2015 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Estancia
Review: Shy aromas of red cherry and wet slate show on the nose of this widely available bottling. Its palate is down the middle for an affordable Pinot Noir, with cooked cranberry, a hint of pepper and the slightest touch of star anise.
Wine: Estancia 2017 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)

Appellation: Hightower
Review: The aromas are brooding, opening with notes of barrel spice, green tea, green pepper, graphite and herb. There's a pretty sense of elegance to the light fruit flavors that taper toward the herb-filled finish.
Wine: Hightower 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Half Cabernet Sauvignon with the balance Merlot (33%) and Syrah (17%), toast, raspberry, coffee and herb aromas are followed by lightly styled fruit flavors that seem to paint around the edges, missing in the middle. Coffee notes linger on the finish. The concentration seems light, especially for the vintage and appellation, but what's there is interesting.
Wine: JM Cellars 2015 Tre Faniciulli Red (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Kontos
Review: Anise, cherry candy, vanilla and spice aromas are followed by straightforward fruit flavors backed by soft tannins. It's an easy-drinking offering of the variety, wanting a bit more structure to pull it all together.
Wine: Kontos 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Cabernet Sauvignon makes up half of this wine, with the rest 25% Merlot, 17% Malbec and 8% Syrah. Barrel aromas are at the fore, with notes of coconut shavings and freshly hew wood. Dark-fruit flavors fill the palate with the tannins giving a slight squeeze. Coconut flavors persist on the finish. The oak seems dominant.
Wine: Kontos 2014 Progeny Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Line 39
Review: This wine is smooth and supple, attractively fruity and well-balanced, making it easy to sip and savor. It shows black-cherry and red-cherry aromas followed by tasty cherry and berry flavors that are lightly accented by baking spices.
Wine: Line 39 2016 Pinot Noir (California)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: Toasted-bread aromas and a tight tannic texture give a definitely oaky profile to this full-bodied wine. Its cherry and raspberry flavors are surrounded by a gripping mouthfeel and spicy oak notes that keep emerging on the palate and finish.
Wine: Lula 2016 Costa Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Matthews
Review: Toast, coffee, berry and herb aromas are followed by lighter-styled fruit flavors. It all seems a bit dialed back.
Wine: Matthews 2015 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Ancient Lakes, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Green-apple, lime and lime-leaf aromas are followed by lightly spritzy feeling, lighter-styled white-peach flavors that drink off dry but with enough acidity to off-set it. It delivers a lot of appeal.
Wine: Milbrandt 2016 Evergreen Vineyard Riesling (Ancient Lakes)

Appellation: Skinner
Review: Very light cherry and berry aromas are followed by mild fruit flavors and a slightly gripping texture in this medium-boded wine. It is delicate and restrained, with very good acidity and more taut balance than most examples.
Wine: Skinner 2016 Grenache (El Dorado)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Fruit for this wine comes from Dutchman Vineyard. The aromas pop, with notes of lemon rind and melon leading to lightly spritzy ale, pineapple-rind and melon flavors. It appears to need some additional time in bottle to settle in.
Wine: The Orcas Project 2017 Dutchman Vineyard Albariño (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: This Super Tuscan blend of Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot shows cherry, wood-oil and balsamic-vinegar notes on the nose. The flavors are quite woody, with juicy red-fruit, anise, roasted fig and juniper flavors.
Wine: Wilson Creek 2016 Legacio Red (California)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Deep and dark aromas of blackberry, elderberry, black plum and clove show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is rather thick and somewhat sweet with blackberry jelly, roasted meat and brown-sugar flavors.
Wine: Bellante 2016 The Dark Side Cuvee Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Merlot makes up over half of this wine, with the balance Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot and other varieties. The aromas are brooding, with high-toned notes of herb, cherry, vanilla, chocolate and spice. The flavors show a mix of fruit and barrel, with the tannins seeming a bit dry. Coffee and vanilla notes persist on the finish.
Wine: Columbia Crest 2015 Grand Estates Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Painted Hills Vineyard provides the fruit for this wine. The aromas are light, with notes of candle wax, lemon balm, peach and flower. The palate is sleek in style, with the flavors trailing on the back half.
Wine: Eternal 2017 Perspective Grenache Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Falkner
Review: Shy aromas of cut grass and yellow-apple rinds show on the nose of this bottling. There is a sweet flash of ripe apple on the palate, but it's cut with a fresh lime juice kick.
Wine: Falkner 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine is almost all Cabernet Sauvignon, topped off with Malbec (14%). The aromas bring notes of fresh and dried herb, wet stick, dried cherry and a medicinal note. The palate is light, pretty and reserved in style. There's interest to be had but it seems a bit dried out. Tasted twice with consistent notes.
Wine: Hightower 2015 Reserve Red (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Lighter in color, pleasing aromas of garden herbs, fresh tobacco and tire rubber are followed by plump fruit flavors that dip in the middle. It wants a bit more structure to pull it all together but intrigues all the same.
Wine: Lagana 2015 Nox Perpetua Seven Hills Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Metzker Family Estates
Review: Thick in tightly woven tannin, this is an earthy, minty wine, rich in baked flavors of cherry and strawberry with a grip of toasted oak.
Wine: Metzker Family Estates 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Milbrandt
Review: Dark roasted coffee, mortared herb and cassis aromas are followed by lightly sweet, ripe black-currant flavors. It provides easy-drinking appeal.
Wine: Milbrandt 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: A solid sense of concentration and fresh floral and citrus flavors make this wine attractive. It has a lively but smooth texture, with good acidity backed by a soft, ripe and fruity core.
Wine: Oak Grove 2017 Family Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: North Carolina, North Carolina, US
Review: This orange Viognier, fermented on the skins, is cloudy in appearance, offering aromas of Mandarins, lychees, yellow peaches and fresh lillies. Drying tannins and a dandelion note distract from candied orange peel, dried flower and dried apicot flavors on the palate. A good effort, there is plenty of acidity for balance but the moderate finish of tea tannins and persimmons is lacking in concentration.
Wine: Sanctuary Vineyards 2016 Handcrafted Vin Orange Viognier (North Carolina)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Review: A blend of 68% Cabernet Sauvignon, 23% Merlot and 9% Malbec, this wine is soft and structured, with dusty tannin and components of sage and cedar. The midpalate is intensely ripe without overt definition—a mix of blackberry and blueberry jam.
Wine: St. Francis 2015 Anthem Meritage (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: The aromas intrigue, with notes of exotic spice, black tea, cherry, cedar and fresh herb. The flavors are sweet and palate coating, with dry, astringent, slightly bitter tannins. Perhaps some time will even them out?
Wine: Tendril 2015 Octave Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Cabernet Sauvignon makes up the majority (53%) of this wine, with the rest 27% Malbec, 16% Merlot and 4% Petit Verdot. Cherry, raspberry and wet penny aromas are followed by pleasing, elegantly styled fruit flavors that bring a sense of structure. It seems to finish a bit warm.
Wine: TruthTeller 2015 Pun Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Cabernet Sauvignon makes up just under two-thirds of this wine, with the balance Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Coffee, cherry, anise and herb aromas are followed by juicy, somewhat lighter-styled fruit flavors. Firm, slightly gritty-seeming tannins back it all up.
Wine: TruthTeller 2015 Wisdom Red (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: All varietal, barrel aromas are out front, with notes of vanilla and exotic spice. The red-fruit flavors are lighter styled and seem ever so slightly dried out. The variety is a bit hard to find.
Wine: Ambassador Vineyard 2015 Estate Grown Merlot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Coming from a blazing hot vineyard and vintage, raspberry, cranberry and barrel-spice aromas are followed by a cranberry-filled palate. The variety seems hard to place and the oak prominent.
Wine: Brian Carter 2014 One Stone Tree Vineyard Syrah (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Sangiovese (68%) makes up the majority of this wine, with the balance Cabernet Sauvignon (18%) and Syrah. Light in color, the aromas are elusive, with notes of tree bark, anise, Red Vines and cherry. The flavors are elegant and pretty, with raspberry flavors on the finish. It doesn't stand up on its own but should fit in nicely at the dinner table.
Wine: Brian Carter 2014 Tuttorosso Red (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: A thick, reduced entry of leathery meat and blackberry bramble mark this wine, which is densely rich in additional baked-cherry flavors. The finish is smoky in oak.
Wine: Buena Vista 2015 Ida's Selection Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Fruit for this wine comes from Boushey Vineyard. Aromas of dried apple and spice are followed by creamy-feeling fruit flavors. It's equal parts intrigue and delivery.
Wine: Eternal 2017 Insight Marsanne (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Black-currant jam, crushed slate and black plum show on the nose of this bottling, which features a rendition of the famed Edvard Munch painting on the label. Candied cherry and blackberry meet with a roasted wood flavor on the palate.
Wine: Graveyard 2015 Scream Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This blend of Bordeaux and Rhône varieties brings blueberry-pie and huckleberry aromas. The somewhat lighter-styled blue-fruit flavors provide plenty of easy-drinking appeal, with the oak seeming pleasantly dialed back.
Wine: Milbrandt 2016 Brother's Blend Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Ancient Lakes, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: A pale-golden color, the aromas suggest notes of cream and spice. The flavors are full bodied, showing a sense of nuance, followed by a warm, slightly bitter finish.
Wine: Milbrandt 2016 The Estate Evergreen Vineyard Chardonnay (Ancient Lakes)

Appellation: Napa Cellars
Review: Herbal in dried herb and sage, this is a rich and softly pleasing wine, with moderate structure and a chalky aspect tot he texture. The core flavors dip into chocolate mocha and baked cherry.
Wine: Napa Cellars 2015 Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Spring Mountain District, Napa, California, US
Review: Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot make up the majority of this blend, with smaller amounts of Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc and Malbec. Turned earth and dried herb provide a classic entry of savory imprint against dry tannin and savory oak.
Wine: Newton 2015 Puzzle Red (Spring Mountain District)

Appellation: North by Northwest
Review: Dark coffee, mocha, vanilla, cherry and herb aromas are followed by plump-feeling fruit flavors. One wants a bit more structure to hang all that fruit on but what's there is pleasant.
Wine: North by Northwest 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: This is a light-bodied, low-alcohol wine that tastes delicate and fresh, showing faint cherry aromas and flavors and brisk acidity for balance. It's dry and refreshing, so it fills its role well.
Wine: Oak Grove 2017 Family Reserve Winemaker's Rosé (California)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Classic Riesling aromas of petrol and grapefruit pith combine with wet clay on the nose of this bottling. It's very tight on the palate, clinging to a lime-pith core and loaded with tons of acid and more petrol flavors.
Wine: Oso Libre 2015 Alsacia Riesling (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Sevtap
Review: Crushed red flowers, thyme, wet rocks and rusty earth make for a compelling nose on this bottling. The palate proves extremely tangy, with strawberry balsamic sauce flavors and white pepper on the finish.
Wine: Sevtap 2015 Merlot (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Snowy Peaks
Review: This wine aims to please, offering aromas of licorice, blackberry, vanilla and cherry wood. Full of black cherry flavors alongside oak and vanilla, softer-bodied tannins quickly get to work drying out the palate. The acidity expertly wipes clean the palate, alleviating all drying from the tannins on the finish.
Wine: Snowy Peaks 2016 Syrah (Grand Valley)

Appellation: Colorado, Colorado, US
Review: The aromas are deceptively rich in this wine, leading with butterscotch followed by overripe mango, ripe yellow peach and orange blossom honey. The palate is electric with bright pineapple acidity, tart green apple and more ripe peach. The acidity builds towards searing on the finish, bordering on punishing, with fresh lime juice trailing on and on.
Wine: Sutcliffe 2015 Signature Castillo Vineyard Chardonnay (Colorado)

Appellation: Clarksburg, Central Valley, California, US
Review: Well done in a light, refreshing style, this medium-bodied wine offers tangy green-apple aromas, fresh citrus and herb flavors and good nervy acidity.
Wine: Terra d'Oro 2017 Exploration Series Pinot Grigio (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Aromas of vanilla, baking spice, anise, cherry and whiffs of game are followed by ripe, slightly dried-out-seeming fruit flavors. There's a light grip of tannins on the finish.
Wine: Ambassador Vineyard 2015 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This is an interesting blend of 27% Merlot, 21% Petit Verdot, 17% Cabernet Sauvignon, 17% Malbec, 16% Cabernet Franc and 2% Syrah. Baking spice, vanilla, cherry, herb, anise and black-fruit aromas lead to slight tacky feeling dark-fruit flavors, with the tannins bringing a light squeeze. A bitter note lingers on the finish.
Wine: Ambassador Vineyard 2015 Estate Grown Envoy Red (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This is a unique blend of 56% Petit Verdot, 24% Merlot, 8% Cabernet Franc, 8% Cabernet Sauvignon and 4% Malbec. The aromas are lighter styled, with notes of char, cherry and flower. The flavors are light and elegant, showing a pretty sense of styling, with bright acidity providing the frame. It doesn't stand up on its own but has a place at the dinner table.
Wine: Brian Carter 2014 Trentenaire Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine dedicated to long-time assistant winemaker Robert Takahashi. A blend of 58% Malbec, 34% Merlot and 8% Cabernet Franc, char, baking-spice, black-tea, balsamic and blue-fruit aromas lead to elegant fruit flavors that dip in the middle.
Wine: Brian Carter 2015 Takahashi Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Coming from an up-and-coming area of the valley, aromas of peeled orange, wild flower, fresh herb, barrel spice and mountain blueberry are followed by somewhat lighter-styled fruit flavors, with a firm squeeze of slightly bitter tannins. Tasted twice with consistent notes.
Wine: Cadaretta 2015 Southwind Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Sangiovese makes up half of this wine, with the balance Malbec, Barbera, Syrah and Primitivo. Aromas of dried cherry, licorice and dried currant lead to tart cherry flavors with a zing of acidity. The fruit seems a bit dried out but it's an otherwise interesting wine that should fit in well at the dinner table.
Wine: Cana's Feast 2015 Bricco Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Light in color, aromas of graphite, herb, cherry and raspberry are followed by light fruit flavors. It's a pleasant example of the variety, coming from a somewhat difficult vintage for Merlot, particularly from this appellation.
Wine: Dillon Cellars 2014 Erratic Klipsun Vineyard Merlot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This twist-top bottling is very pear-driven and tropical leaning on the nose, with edgier touches of citrus. It grabs hold of the palate with ripe apple and more pear flavors, but a lime peel element keeps it zesty.
Wine: Donati Family Vineyard 2017 Sisters Forever Un-Oaked Chardonnay (Central Coast)

Appellation: Falkner
Review: Lime skins, guava and a hint of sourdough show on the nose of this bottling. Light honeydew and guava flavors show on the easy and clean sip, which doesn't offer too much texture or acid, but remains very pleasant.
Wine: Falkner 2017 Chardonnay (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Fleshy and robust in oak, this wine offers a rounded ripeness of tropical fruit and butterscotch, flavors that work well with each other and take on added richness in the glass.
Wine: Geyser Peak 2016 Water Bend Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Bruised apple and poached pear aromas show on the nose of this bottling from the Hearst family. It seems a bit sweet on the palate, with ripe apples and pears as well as a touch of roasted nuts.
Wine: Hearst Ranch 2017 Glacier Ridge Chardonnay (Monterey County)

Appellation: Joseph Cellars
Review: This wine has a sweetness of brown sugar underlying jammy black cherry, soft tannin and robust oak. Richly round and approachable, it's a crowd pleaser for fans of a big jammy style.
Wine: Joseph Cellars 2015 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: A blend of 58% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Merlot and 17% Malbec, high-toned aromas of maraschino cherry, vanilla, baking spice, medicine and black cherry lead to rich, extracted dark-fruit and vanilla flavors. The tannins show a bit of grittiness. A warm finish follows.
Wine: Kontos 2014 Alatus Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Merlot makes up 64% of this wine, with the balance Cabernet Franc. Lightly colored with a slight orange tinge, the aromas pop, with notes of raspberry jam, herb and spice. The flavors are quite elegantly styled, not able to deliver on the aromas' promise.
Wine: Lobo Hills 2013 Right Bank Blend Lonesome Springs Ranch Red (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Milbrandt
Review: Barrel aromas are out front, with notes of toast in front of butter and corn-on-the-cob. The palate is full bodied with a lightly creamy feel to the stone-fruit flavors.
Wine: Milbrandt 2016 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Roblar
Review: Soft aromas of nectarine and lemon zest show on the nose of this appellation blend. There is decent grip to the sip, which is rather light in flavors, offering apple blossom and fresh pear flavors alongside a touch of tannic tension.
Wine: Roblar 2017 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Sand Point
Review: Rich fruit and peppery spices combine in this full-bodied smooth-textured wine, giving it a rather bold earthy effect. The aroma shows black pepper and ripe plum while the flavors give black-cherry notes.
Wine: Sand Point 2016 Pinot Noir (California)

Appellation: Tenor
Review: Green pepper, clove, herb, graphite and spice aromas are followed by dry, somewhat lighter-styled flavors. The tannins don't seem fully resolved.
Wine: Tenor 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: The Archivist
Review: Tangy pear, lime skins and lemongrass aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is a decent tension to the palate, where Bartlett pear and soda-like flavors of 7-Up arise.
Wine: The Archivist 2016 Pinot Grigio (Central Coast)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Blackberry, asphalt, anise and spice lead to quite dry fruit and lighter-styled flavors, with the tannins giving a light squeeze.
Wine: Spoken Barrel 2015 Rich and Complex #42 Meritage (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Eagle Foothills, Idaho, US
Review: The aromas seem a bit unsettled, with notes of vanilla, green herb, graphite, cocoa powder and cherry that don't entirely mesh. The fruit flavors are sweet and focused, but the wood seems to get a bit in the way, particularly on the finish.
Wine: 3 Horse Ranch Vineyards 2014 Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Eagle Foothills)

Appellation: Eagle Foothills, Idaho, US
Review: High toned, unsettled aromas of dried Rainier cherry, spice and a medicinal note are followed by tightly wound fruit flavors that taper toward the finish.
Wine: 3 Horse Ranch Vineyards 2014 Single Vineyard Merlot (Eagle Foothills)

Appellation: Alara
Review: Light nectarine and vanilla cookies aromas are coated in a damp oak aroma on the nose of this appellation blend. There is a bright lemony edge to the palate, where the core is mostly dried apple and sandalwood flavors.
Wine: Alara 2015 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

Appellation: Callan
Review: Aromas of garden herb, orange peel and cherry give way to ripe, slightly sweet-seeming orange-peel and cherry flavors. There's no question of the variety or appellation.
Wine: Callan 2016 Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: Thick, rich and moderate in acidity, this full-bodied white is fleshy and robust in lemon, lime and grapefruit flavors.
Wine: Clark-Claudon 2017 Wild Iris Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine comes from a vineyard best known for its Cabernet Sauvignon. The aromas are all high toned, with notes of black and red cherry along with leather accents. The flavors are lighter styled, with the tannins bringing a bit of grit.
Wine: Dillon Cellars 2014 Wrought Klipsun Vineyard Syrah (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Review: Strong notes of vanilla extract, coconut, cherry and berry are followed by ripe, plump but still lighter-styled cherry and raspberry flavors. The oak plays a prominent part in the show but there's still enjoyment to be had.
Wine: Dunham 2016 Three Legged Red (Washington)

Appellation: EOS
Review: Pungent aromas of candied raspberry meet with rose petal and cinnamon on the fresh, vibrant and somewhat sweet nose of this bottling. There's a sweetness to the palate as well, where candied cherries and red currants make for an easily enjoyable fruit-punch profile.
Wine: EOS 2016 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Grande River
Review: The nose on this Meritage offers fresh hay, yellow plums, sawdust and cherry. Well placed acidity highlights a red plum flavor on the palate alongside notes of vanilla, oak and walnuts. Dry, green tannins are firm and lend structure, but are ultimately distracting, leading into a stemmy finish.
Wine: Grande River 2015 Meritage (Grand Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Green herb, cherry, soil, coffee, cedar and flower aromas lead to sweet, somewhat lighter-styled green-tea and cherry flavors that paint around the edges. There are good things going on, but it comes off as quite green for the variety.
Wine: JM Cellars 2016 Champoux Vineyard Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Joseph Cellars
Review: Fermented in stainless steel, this wine opens in lime salt and stone, with a light texture and minimal structure. The oak takes on flavors of butterscotch and crème brûlée.
Wine: Joseph Cellars 2015 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: Concentrated dark-fruit flavors are slightly over-matched by a prominent oak character in this full-bodied spicy wine. The aroma shows plenty of baking spices and charred wood, while the flavors have black cherry and black pepper with nutmeg. It's a big tempting wine but unusual for the varietal.
Wine: Lula 2016 Peterson Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Cabernet Sauvignon (68%) takes the lead, followed by 18% Merlot, 9% Cabernet Franc and 5% Petit Verdot. Aromas of blueberry, graphite, herb, miso paste and spice are followed by plentiful coffee flavors that linger on the finish. Lightly grainy tannins back it all up.
Wine: Matthews 2015 Reserve Claret Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Proximity Twenty Six
Review: Deeply colored in the glass, this wine shows blackberry, elderberry and light smoke on the nose. The sip starts with fresh black-raspberry and plum-juice flavors, and the tannic tension is strong and sticky, though the mouthfeel is somewhat thin.
Wine: Proximity Twenty Six 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Reynoso
Review: Lighthearted and moderate in ripeness and oak, this wine is plummy and round in dark chocolate and a lasting note of tobacco.
Wine: Reynoso 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Lighter-styled aromas of cherry, vanilla, plum and herb lead to ripe raspberry flavors and cherry flavors. It's straightforward but comes off as a bit light for the variety.
Wine: The Fam Vin 2015 The Gr8 Cab Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey
Review: This is a ripe wine, offering aromas of blossoms, gooseberries and pears. The exuberant palate doles out juicy lemons, apricots and apples, with touches of blossoms, white pepper and grass. Delicately balanced, this is light footed but carries some weight from the alcohol. It stays ripe through the finish, with a final wave of white peaches and white pepper pleasantly lingering.
Wine: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey 2017 Viognier (Colorado)
Winery: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey

Appellation: Waterbrook
Review: The aromas leap up, with notes of pink grapefruit, herb and kiwi. The flavors are full in feel, providing enjoyment.
Wine: Waterbrook 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This moderately ripe, affordable wine is fruity in cherry and berry flavors and has a soft rounded structure of unfussy richness.
Wine: Balletto 2015 Estate Grown Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Char and toast aromas are at the fore, followed by berry and spice. The fruit flavors are light and elegant. There are good things going on but the aromas and palate don't seem to line up and the barrel influence is a bit intense.
Wine: Brian Carter 2014 ONE Dineen Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: La Crema
Review: Hibiscus, sumac, pepper and vanilla aromas show on the nose of this widely available bottling, which works as a midweek sipper. The fruit is fairly ripe and extracted, showing flavors of orange-cranberry juice, although the mouthfeel remains a bit thin.
Wine: La Crema 2016 Pinot Noir (Monterey)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Reduced and tightly wound, this wine features generous helpings of tannin and oak around juicy brambly blackberry and a component of dried spicy fruit and nut.
Wine: Ledson 2015 Estate Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: A very pale color and equally subtle flavors come with a tart mouthfeel and very crisp balance in this light-bodied and refreshing wine.
Wine: Lula 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Lyeth
Review: Spicy smoky pruney aromas lead to chocolate, raisin and baking-spice flavors in this full-bodied rich-textured wine. It's quite dark in color, very spicy and flavorful, but relatively soft and easy in texture.
Wine: Lyeth 2015 Red (California)

Appellation: SeaGlass
Review: Very light on the nose, this bottling offers aromas of wet cement, apple, lime skin and a hint of flint. There is decent acid and texture to the sip, where light flavors of pome fruit and tangy lemon show.
Wine: SeaGlass 2017 Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: This is a fruity and fresh-tasting wine that's light to medium in body, very aromatic and has flavors like a fruit salad of apples, melons and peaches with a dash of lemon juice. All that fruitiness verges on sweetness, so dry-wine stalwarts beware.
Wine: Sean Minor 2017 4B Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This moderately ripe, affordable wine is fruity in cherry and berry flavors and has a soft rounded structure of unfussy richness.
Wine: Balletto 2015 Estate Grown Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Char and toast aromas are at the fore, followed by berry and spice. The fruit flavors are light and elegant. There are good things going on but the aromas and palate don't seem to line up and the barrel influence is a bit intense.
Wine: Brian Carter 2014 ONE Dineen Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: Carson Ridge
Review: Smoked meat, black raspberries and gamy aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is somewhat tight and sticky, with underripe blackberry flavors as well as dried herbs and roasted meat.
Wine: Carson Ridge 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Cherry and spice aromas lead to graceful fruit flavors, with plentiful vanilla accents. Herb notes linger on the finish. The concentration seems light and the vanilla notes a bit heavy.
Wine: Desert Wind 2016 Estate Grown Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Flower Child
Review: Fruity and full bodied, this white is densely concentrated in pear, nutmeg and a confectionery core of vanilla crème brûlée.
Wine: Flower Child 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Grande River
Review: The nose displays a some what odd combination of candied orange, pineapple, asparagus and white flower. The palate is on the softer side, showing mildly concentrated flavors of peach, grapefruit, sweet grass and juicy lemon-lime acidity. The finish is astringent and lemony, leaving a fairly dull impression.
Wine: Grande River 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Grand Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Cabernet Sauvignon (43%) and Cabernet Franc make up equal percentages of this wine, with the balance Petit Verdot. The aromas provide notes of vanilla, baking spice, fresh herb, cherry, pencil lead, dill and anise, with the oak far out front. The fruit flavors are lighter styled, not seeming fully able to stand up to the oak. Coffee notes linger on the finish.
Wine: Armstrong Family 2014 David's Folly Red (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Buena Vista
Review: This wine is intensely earthy and big boned, with a shock of tart acidity. It flourishes in the appellation's herbal mint and pomegranate.
Wine: Buena Vista 2015 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Appellation: Castle Rock
Review: This wine presents vibrant citrus-zest aromas and clean, fruity, almost-sweet flavors on a rich texture. It has more thickness and mouthfeel than many renditions of the grape, and feels low in acidity.
Wine: Castle Rock 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Lake Chelan, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Extremely pale in color with an orange rim, the aromas are presently hard to get at, with light notes of strawberryies, cherries and twigs emerging over time. The cherry flavors are light but juicy with raspberry notes on the finish. There are some good things happening, but it all seems a bit faint.
Wine: Drink Washington State 2016 Dip Into Lake Chelan Pinot Noir (Lake Chelan)

Appellation: Grande River
Review: This herbaceous Viognier dispalys aromas of tangerine, dandelion, pear and kale. The weightier palate shows ripe tangerine and nectarine balanced by fresh greens and a good kick of acidity flowing into a white peach and white pepper finish.
Wine: Grande River 2015 Viognier (Grand Valley)

Appellation: Heavyweight
Review: Ripe fruit flavors dominate this full-bodied but soft-textured wine as it goes from mulled cherry aromas to baked blueberry flavors wrapped in mild tannins and barely a trace of acidity. While not sugar-sweet it has a dessert-like quality.
Wine: Heavyweight 2016 Pinot Noir (California)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Lightly volatile seeming aromas of raspberry cobbler, barrel spice, vanilla and cherry lead to sweet full-bodied raspberry and cherry flavors. It doesn't all work.
Wine: Kontos 2015 Les Collines Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Cherry candy, raspberry and herb aromas are followed by plump ripe sweet flavors with a warm tangy finish. It comes off as quite ripe.
Wine: Maryhill 2015 Proprietor's Reserve Barbera (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Aromas of vanilla, char, coffee and dried herb are followed by soft red-fruit flavors, with plentiful barrel accents. The variety seems a bit hard to find, especially compared to their entry-level offering from the same vintage.
Wine: Maryhill 2015 Proprietor's Reserve Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Milbrandt
Review: The aromas of apple and pear seem difficult to access at present. Dry medium-bodied flavors follow. It's a pleasant if somewhat innocuous offering of the variety, with the concentration at times seeming a bit light.
Wine: Milbrandt 2016 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Very ripe and overextracted aromas of berry and grape meet with a touch of vanilla bean on this rustic bottling, which includes 12% Viognier. The palate explodes with extreme amounts of acid, which carry candied boysenberry and lavender flavors.
Wine: Millésimé 2013 Le Reflexion Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: America, US
Review: Fruit forward black currant, plum and green pepper aromas are followed by plump, pleasant, lightly sweet fruit flavors. There's not much complexity, but if you want to know what Cabernet looks like unadulterated by oak, this wine is it.
Wine: Original House Wine 2016 Dark Cabernet Sauvignon (America)

Appellation: Cochise County, Arizona, US
Review: Shy notes of lemon peel, white flower, peach fuzz and clementine zest are slowly revealed on the nose. This has a round mouthfeel with gently tingling acidity. Flavors of nectarine and grapefruit are tinged with endives and are neutral in character, leading to a ripe lemon finish dusted with white pepper.
Wine: Page Springs 2014 Pillsbury Vineyard Viognier (Cochise County)

Appellation: Two Angels
Review: This wine is light bodied, very fresh in aroma and reasonably crisp in texture, showing green-apple flavors and subtle herb and citrus notes. It is very clean, well balanced and should be perfect for a crowd.
Wine: Two Angels 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (High Valley)

Appellation: Williamson Vineyard
Review: Baking spice, fresh herb, blackberry, orange peel and cranberry aromas are followed by flavors that mix equal parts fruit and barrel, with orange peel notes on the finish. Grainy tannins provide support.
Wine: Williamson Vineyard 2013 Petite Sirah

Appellation: Wind Rose
Review: This wine is a blend of half Dolcetto and half Sangiovese. Salmon colored, the aromas suggest notes of apple, sour cherry and pear. The palate brings tart dried apple and cherry flavors that finish short.
Wine: Wind Rose 2017 Rosato (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Eagle Foothills, Idaho, US
Review: Aromas of baking spice, vanilla, green herb and dried cherry are followed by ripe, quite sweet seeming fruit and barrel flavors. The tannins bring a fair amount of grit and dryness. It doesn't all come together.
Wine: 3 Horse Ranch Vineyards 2014 Single Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Eagle Foothills)

Appellation: Briceland
Review: Light and dry, this straightforward wine has a pale-garnet color, mild aromas of cherries and baking spices and restrained fruit flavors. The texture is rather lean and slightly tannic.
Wine: Briceland 2015 Pinot Noir (Humboldt County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Coffee, herb and cherry aromas are at the fore, with an ever so slightly burnt note in the background. The palate is light but flavorful, showing a sense of elegance. The concentration seems to be missing in the middle.
Wine: Columbia Crest 2016 Grand Estates Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Dunham
Review: Aromas of char, coffee bean, vanilla and berry are followed by light but creamy feeling flavors that dip in the middle, showing a mixture of fruit and barrel. It doesn't all come off.
Wine: Dunham 2015 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Grande River
Review: The fresh nose offers fruity aromas of pineapple, mango and melon, alongside somewhat soapy notes of honeysuckle. This is firmly medium bodied but feels bright and zippy on the palate, with ripe flavors of oranges and mangoes joined by honey and white pepper. A touch of vanilla and a squeeze of lemon introduce the finish, which lingers on a bitter peanut shell note.
Wine: Grande River 2016 Chardonnay (Grand Valley)

Appellation: Milbrandt
Review: Aromas of braised green pepper, blueberry, coffee and herb are followed by lightly sweet, medium-bodied fruit flavors. It provides a lot of easy-drinking appeal, though the variety seems a bit hard to find.
Wine: Milbrandt 2016 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: America, US
Review: The aromas are downright fruity, with notes of black plum and black currant along with herb and green pepper. The palate brings sweet, simple fruit flavors, with the oak influence not apparent. It's a straightforward quaffer.
Wine: Original House Wine 2016 Steak House Cabernet Sauvignon (America)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Very extracted aromas of blackberry and raspberry meet with cola on the nose of this bottling. The palate is extremely tangy and primary: like drinking straight blackberry juice with the slightest hint of tannic structure.
Wine: Rockin' R Winery 2012 King Crimson Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Rutherford, Napa, California, US
Review: Thick, concentrated and rich, this is a 100% stainless-steel fermented white that tangles in tart flavors of lemon and grapefruit.
Wine: Round Pond 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

Appellation: SeaGlass
Review: Extremely light in the glass, this wine's aromas are almost so subtle that they don't exist. The palate is more interesting, starting a tad sweet then tightening around chalk and nectarine.
Wine: SeaGlass 2017 Riesling (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Williamson Vineyard
Review: Aromas of medicine cabinet, brambly berry, tire rubber, and woodspice lead to sweet seeming fruit flavors. It doesn't all come together.
Wine: Williamson Vineyard 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon

Appellation: Ramona Valley, South Coast, California, US
Review: Plump black-currant, wood oil and licorice aromas show on the fairly ripe and deep nose of this bottling from northern San Diego County. Tannins rise quickly as does prominent acid on the palate, where black-fruit and darker-spice flavors reign.
Wine: Castelli Family Vineyards 2014 Estate Sangiovese (Ramona Valley)

Appellation: Cadaretta
Review: Light aromas of cherry, blueberry and wood spice are followed by lighter-styled fruit flavors. It falls a bit flat on the finish, not coming together. Tasted twice with consistent notes.
Wine: Cadaretta 2015 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Creekside Cellars
Review: Lemon in color, the mild nose displays white peach, lemon zest, cashew and white toast. White peach, joined by lychee, carries to the very palate before the 50% new French oak flexes and brings almond and vanilla. The finish turns bitter, settling into a lemon pith tone.
Wine: Creekside Cellars 2015 Chardonnay (Colorado)

Appellation: Hawk Haven
Review: The nose seems a bit disconnected from the palate, showing aromas of overripe lemons and stinky steamed vegetables. While the palate shocks with searing acidity, fresh squeezed lemon and lime and a pervasive grassy note, ending on a tangy lemon note.
Wine: Hawk Haven 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Outer Coastal Plain)

Appellation: Carmel Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Rather tropical on the nose, this bottling shows pear, plumeria and ripe apple aromas on the nose. It's a bit viscous on the palate but with some energy, carrying flavors of apple soda, honeydew and candied pears.
Wine: Joullian 2017 Family Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Carmel Valley)

Appellation: Kontos
Review: Herb, coffee, green tea and wood spice aromas lead to light coffee and chocolate flavors. The wood seems to get in the way of the plum flavors.
Wine: Kontos 2015 Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Clarksburg, Central Valley, California, US
Review: This light and very lean wine smells like fresh thyme and pine needles, tastes very crisp and delicate, has low alcohol and good refreshment qualities.
Wine: LangeTwins 2017 Merrill-Johnson Vineyard Pinot Grigio (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Maryhill
Review: Raspberry jam and dried cranberry aromas are at the fore, with peppery accents in the background. The flavors are plump and ripe, but don't have the structure to hold them together.
Wine: Maryhill 2015 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Maryhill
Review: The aromas pop, with notes of raspberry jam, cherry and spice. The cocoa and jammy red-fruit flavors are light and appealing, tapering toward the finish. It's a straight down the fairway offering of the variety.
Wine: Maryhill 2015 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Mt. Konocti Winery
Review: Dried herb aromas and lemon-lime flavors highlight this medium-bodied and smooth-textured wine. It has considerable richness in the mouthfeel and tastes soft in terms of acidity.
Wine: Mt. Konocti Winery 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Black currant, blueberry and tar aromas lead to lightly sweet blackberry flavors. It shows a fair amount of sugar but largely pulls it off.
Wine: Ryan Patrick 2016 Redhead Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Sobon Estate
Review: An assertive oaky streak covers ripe apple and caramel flavors in this full-bodied wine. It shows pronounced aromas of charred wood and smoke in the aroma that continue on the palate.
Wine: Sobon Estate 2017 Viognier (Amador County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: This is a soft-textured, medium-bodied wine with floral, earthy aromas and butterscotch flavors that come off as candied and a touch sweet. It's well made and should appeal to people who don't like their wines bone dry.
Wine: Terra d'Oro 2017 Exploration Series Viognier (California)

Appellation: Dunnigan Hills, Central Valley, California, US
Review: This is a fairly rich and moderately fruity wine that has peachy aromas and flavors and light to medium body.
Wine: Tinto Rey 2017 Estate Bottled Verdejo (Dunnigan Hills)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Barrel aromas are at the fore, with notes of vanilla, green wood, dill, menthol and char, making it a challenge to get at the fruit. The fruit flavors are lighter styled, not bringing the heft to stand up to the oak.
Wine: Armstrong Family 2014 Portteus Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Chime
Review: This wine has a strong new-oak signature easy to detect in the vanilla and cinnamon aromas and the ginger-spice flavors that layer over good red-cherry notes underneath. It is medium to full bodied and highly stylized.
Wine: Chime 2016 Pinot Noir (California)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This is all Grenache coming from French Creek Vineyard. Extremely pale in color, looking almost more like a white wine than a rosé, the aromas suggest notes of lees, raspberry and spice, with palate bringing more of the same. It doesn't all seem to come together.
Wine: Eternal 2017 Beauty Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Rutherford, Napa, California, US
Review: Floral and characterized by bold stone-fruit flavors, this wine is spritzy in acidity, with a nutty herbal imprint of anise.
Wine: Foley Johnson 2016 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

Appellation: Kontos
Review: Light aromas of soil, dried herb, dried cranberry, licorice, barrel and cherry are followed by anise and cranberry-filled flavors that trail on the finish. It doesn't all seem to come together, with the structure seeming lacking.
Wine: Kontos 2014 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Maryhill
Review: Raspberry jam, rose hip and spice aromas are followed by light juicy fruit flavors that finish warm. It doesn't all come together but it still provides enjoyment.
Wine: Maryhill 2015 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine is about two-thirds Cabernet Sauvignon, with the rest Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Syrah and Malbec. Aromas of blueberry, herb, plum, green pepper and spice lead to soft lighter-styled fruit flavors with slightly grainy tannins. The concentration seems quite light.
Wine: Matthews 2016 Cuvée Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Ancient Lakes, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Lighter styled aromas of peach, apricot and whiffs of lime are followed by sweet, rich stone-fruit flavors. It leans a bit too much on the sugar for its appeal but it still delivers plenty of it.
Wine: Milbrandt 2017 Sweet Katherine Evergreen Vineyard Riesling (Ancient Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: The aromas offer notes of fresh flower and canned peach, with lightly styled flavors that follow. The concentration at times seems a bit light. Still, it delivers plenty of easy-drinking appeal.
Wine: The Fam Vin 2016 The Gr8 White Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Perfumed aromas of flower, nectarine, lime and herb lead to lightly sweet-seeming fruit flavors. It's a well made example of the variety.
Wine: TruthTeller 2017 Frolic Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Viaggio
Review: A good weekday choice, this full-bodied wine smells of plums and prunes, has an iron-like tang in the flavors and a pleasant mouth-filling texture.
Wine: Viaggio 2014 Pinot Noir (Lodi)

Appellation: Vinum Cellars
Review: Dry and medium bodied, this wine has appley aromas, apple-skin flavors and a tangy, edgy texture. It tastes rather low on the ripeness scale but has refreshing qualities.
Wine: Vinum Cellars 2016 Chenin Blanc (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Review: Really light in the glass for a Cab, this bottling shows hints of green herbs and exotic red plum on the nose. The palate is a bit thin and minty, surrounding a light cranberry core.
Wine: Wilson Creek 2015 Gerry's Vineyard Family Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Andis
Review: This full-bodied wine has assertive smoky oaky aromas and flavors that nearly overwhelm the jammy fruit flavors underneath. The roasted toasted character gives a little spine to the otherwise soft impression on the palate.
Wine: Andis 2015 Grenache (Amador County)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Maraschino cherry, anise and vanilla aromas lead to lightly sweet-seeming fruit flavors. It doesn't all work.
Wine: Kontos 2015 Seven Hills Vineyard Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Quite light in color, aromas of caramel and red fruit are followed by light fruit flavors. The concentration doesn't seem all there, with the variety hard to find.
Wine: Maryhill 2015 Proprietor's Reserve Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Pull
Review: Rather light in the glass, this bottling shows cherry juice, smoke, caramel and mint on the nose. The palate delivers acid, but in a slightly weird way, carrying flavors of extracted cherry and berry along with dark spice.
Wine: Pull 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: A tad cloudy in the glass, this proprietary blend shows smashed blackberry, crushed thyme and grape-seed aromas on the nose. It's quite tangy and chalky on the palate, with strong black-plum-skin flavors.
Wine: Rockin' R Winery 2012 Back in Black Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Grand Valley, Colorado, US
Review: This ruby colored blend opens with aromas of poblano pepper, followed by black raspberry, red currant and old, dusty wood. The tannins are present and astringent on the palate, just barely balanced by lazy acidity. Ripe cherry, vanilla and nutmeg flavors turns tart on the cranberry finish.
Wine: Talon 2016 Wingspan Red (Grand Valley)

Appellation: Andis
Review: This full-bodied wine has assertive smoky oaky aromas and flavors that nearly overwhelm the jammy fruit flavors underneath. The roasted toasted character gives a little spine to the otherwise soft impression on the palate.
Wine: Andis 2015 Grenache (Amador County)

Appellation: CK Mondavi
Review: A flinty aroma and smoky, white-peppery flavors give this medium-bodied wine a savory rather than fruity profile. Hints of earthiness join subtle lemon flavors on the palate.
Wine: CK Mondavi 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Coming from the exceptionally cool 2011 vintage, this wine is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah, Malbec and Merlot. The aromas are high toned, with notes of cherry and licorice. The palate is lighter in style, with the concentration not seeming all there. Drink now.
Wine: Elsom 2011 Isabella Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Kirkland Signature
Review: Fresh in feel and a touch sweet, this fruity wine is light bodied and shows flavors of flowers and apples, supported by a soft texture.
Wine: Kirkland Signature 2017 Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This atypical blend of 70% Syrah, 22% Sangiovese, 8% Cabernet Franc shows tangy aromas of blackberry balsamic sauce, turned loam, smoke and grape seed on the nose. The palate is very primary with Concord grape and oak flavors.
Wine: Millésimé 2013 Scoprire Red (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Murray
Review: The aromas pop, with notes of blueberry, orange peel, flower, smoked meat and Dimetapp cough syrup. The palate is light but chock-full of mesquite flavors. Blueberry-pie notes linger on the finish. It doesn't all work.
Wine: Murray 2015 Syrah (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Provenance Vineyards
Review: This wine is flabby and full-bodied, with ripe flavors of green olive and apple. There's a lingering sweetness to the finish.
Wine: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Caramel candies, black cherries and oak dust aromas show on the nose of this blend of 50% Grenache and 50% Syrah. A coffee-candy flavor meets with black-cherry and cola flavors on the palate, which finishes with oddly chalky tannins.
Wine: Rockin' R Winery 2013 Hellagood Grenache-Syrah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Aromas of black currant, cassis and herb lead to off-dry dark-fruit flavors. It's a straightforward quaffer. Drink now.
Wine: Sagelands 2016 Dark Shadow Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Grand Valley, Colorado, US
Review: This Syrah-dominate blend smells rooty and medicinal, like licorice and black cherry syrup, sprinkled with white pepper. The palate starts off with a bright berry flavor but quickly softens into baked raspberry, vanilla, licorice and woody tannins. Oak kicks off the finish, while the tannins lend a crushed velvet texture, ending on a dry, muddled black plum note.
Wine: Snowy Peaks 2016 Élevé Red (Grand Valley)

Appellation: Sutcliffe
Review: A rather round nose offers heady aromas of honey, dried apricot and hazelnut. The palate has some weight, but is well balanced by acidity and shows notes of apple juice, baking spice and more hazelnuts.
Wine: Sutcliffe 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Colorado)

Appellation: B. Lovely
Review: The aromas are quite subdued for the variety, with notes of jasmine and peach struggling to get to the surface. It drinks medium sweet with a slight bitter note on the finish.
Wine: B. Lovely 2017 Riesling (Washington)

Appellation: Pennsylvania, Pennsylvania, US
Review: The nose on this Sauvignon Blanc is very green, offering up eucalyptus, fresh garden herbs and lemon peel. The palate is astringent in feel, leaning on lemon and lime pith with lots of grassiness straight through the finish.
Wine: Chaddsford 2016 CFW Sauvignon Blanc (Pennsylvania)

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Review: Starting out a bit reduced, the aromas open to reveal notes of berry, herb and orange peel. The fruit flavors are straight down the fairway, if seeming a bit innocuous, with the concentration light with a candied finish.
Wine: Charles Smith 2016 Boom Boom! Syrah (Washington)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: The aromas come out of the gate seeming a bit reduced, opening to reveal notes of berry and tar. The coffee and berry flavors seem extremely light, trailing on the finish.
Wine: Columbia Crest 2016 Grand Estates Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Plum, vanilla bean and spice aromas lead to lighter-styled fruit and vanilla flavors. There's enjoyment to be had, but the concentration seems quite light.
Wine: Desert Wind 2016 Estate Grown Ruah Proprietary Red (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine is a blend of 54% Cabernet Sauvignon, 34% Merlot, 10% Malbec and 2% Cabernet Franc. Aromas of blueberry, herb, vanilla and toasty spices lead to very lightly styled cherry and vanilla flavors. The flavors seem a bit washed out, with the oak way out front.
Wine: Dunham 2015 Trutina Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: The aromas provide notes of wet penny, black pepper, damp sagebrush, anise and cherry. The sweet cherry and raspberry flavors seem to have a slight metallic tinge. Tasted twice with consistent notes.
Wine: Lagana 2015 Nox Perpetua Patina Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Subdued, slightly reduced aromas of lime leaf and white peach lead to just off-dry drinking, lighter-styled fruit flavors, with ale notes on the tart finish. There are good things going on, but it seems a bit pulled back for the variety. Perhaps it just needs some additional time in bottle?
Wine: Ryan Patrick 2017 Olsen Brothers Vineyard Riesling (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Shamwari
Review: This wine has a strong note of juniper amidst dried herb, earth, leather and tobacco, the tannins persistently chewy and somewhat astringent.
Wine: Shamwari 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Cedar, wood spice, herb, coffee and licorice aromas are followed by coiled-up, slightly bitter-seeming tannins. It doesn't all work.
Wine: Ambassador Vineyard 2015 Estate Grown Limited Varietal Selection Petit Verdot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Willcox, Arizona, US
Review: Aromas of gooseberry and white peach tinged with vanilla are joined by a whiff of spoiled tangerine. The palate is certainly round, with a pudding like weight highlighting the vanilla and creamy lemon cookie flavors, though there is enough acidity for balance.
Wine: Aridus 2015 Limited Production Viognier (Willcox)

Appellation: Carneros Ranch
Review: This wine is quietly floral with a thick entry of simple, lemon-lime flavors and a rounded structure.
Wine: Carneros Ranch 2016 Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Vanilla bean, pencil eraser and licorice aromas lead to light but creamy-feeling vanilla-extract flavors. The oak influence seems primary, without the fruit to stand up to it.
Wine: Desert Wind 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Aromas of custard, funk and corn-on-the-cob lead to lightly creamy-feeling fruit flavors. The concentration waxes and wanes throughout, at times coming off as quite light.
Wine: Dunham 2016 Shirley Mays Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: There's a strong metallic and new tire rubber tinge to the aromas, along with whiffs of diesel. The palate falls flat, with abundant canned peach and Nestea Iced Tea flavors. It seems past peak.
Wine: Lagana 2014 Sagemoor Vineyards Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: A pale-salmon color with an orange tinge, aromas of strawberry, herb and flower lead to a broad palate with plentiful apple flavors. It doesn't all work.
Wine: Lagana 2017 Breezy Slope Vineyard Pinot Noir Rosé (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: The aromas are quite reticent and hard to get at. The palate brings plentiful red-fruit flavors and grippy tannins, with a tire rubber note that distracts.
Wine: Maryhill 2015 Proprietor's Reserve Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine is a blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Cabernet Franc, 7% Syrah, 6% Merlot and 2% Malbec. Blue-fruit aromas are at the fore along with notes of green pepper and green herb. The concentration is quite light, not able to deliver.
Wine: Matthews 2016 Blackboard Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: The Huntsman
Review: Light in color, the aromas provide notes of black currant and herb, with the oak dialed way back. The palate is elegantly styled, with the concentration seeming a bit lacking.
Wine: The Huntsman 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: The apple, spice and custard aromas take some time to tease out. The palate is medium bodied, shortening up on the finish.
Wine: TruthTeller 2016 The Stand Up Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Review: This very fruity and slightly sweet wine has a hot-pink color, bold aromas of cherries and strawberries and a simply fruity flavor.
Wine: Van Ruiten 2017 Sparkling Rosé (Lodi)

Appellation: Carson Ridge
Review: Aromas of orange blossom and mandarin pith show on the somewhat flat nose of this bottling. There's a burst of acid on the tip of the sip, but it quickly fades into dried apple and orange-rind flavors.
Wine: Carson Ridge 2016 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

Appellation: Estancia
Review: Dark blackberry fruit meets with raw game on the nose of this bottling. Tangy black-plum flavors meet with a funky kick on the palate.
Wine: Estancia 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This is a dull tannic red, earthy in dried herb, sage and a lasting note of clove. It is full bodied and presents as duly ripe.
Wine: Kunde 2014 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Maryhill
Review: Aromas of green coffee bean, garden herb and flower are followed by elegantly styled fruit flavors. Coffee notes linger on the finish. The concentration seems quite light.
Wine: Maryhill 2015 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Aromas of Jolly Rancher and licorice are followed by lighter-styled flavors that show a lot of wood influence. Green notes linger on the finish.
Wine: Maryhill 2015 Proprietor's Reserve Tudor Hills Vineyard Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Black currant and elderberry aromas show on the overly ripe nose of this blend of 34% Merlot, 34% Cabernet Franc and 32% Sangiovese. Deep-black-fruit flavors meet with caramel, vanilla and balsamic vinegar on the palate.
Wine: Millésimé 2013 Stone Rouge Red (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: This is a thickly constructed white that tastes sweet in vanilla and mango, a big expression of the variety that opts for richness over freshness.
Wine: Rutherford Ranch 2017 Proprietor's Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Review: An earthy barnyardy aroma gives way to flavors like tamarind and dried cherries in this funky but interesting wine. Medium body and moderate tannins give it some weight on the palate.
Wine: Viaggio 2015 River Red (Lodi)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: The aromas of dried orange peel and lime provide interest but seem a bit evolved. The concentration of the dry Nestea Iced Tea and lemon flavors seems extremely light.
Wine: Maryhill 2016 Winemaker's White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Millésimé
Review: Overextracted aromas of reduced kirsch and cassis make for a very ripe nose. The palate is almost sweet but also very tangy with ripe extracted fruit.
Wine: Millésimé 2014 Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Review: Sweet fig, olive and sugar apple are the flavors that first come to the fore of this full-bodied, ripe and robust wine, which is flat in structure with little acidity.
Wine: Replica 2016 Retrofit Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Extremely overextracted on the nose, this shows aromas of cassis, dried berries and grape seed. It's tangy and ripe on the palate, with more grape-seed flavors.
Wine: Rockin' R Winery 2013 Bohemian Rhapsody Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Roth
Review: This wine struggles for definition, showing a dryness of tannin around harsh, astringent green notes and overwhelming ripeness.
Wine: Roth 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Aromas of canned corn are followed by quite light and linear-seeming fruit flavors. It comes off as very light.
Wine: Ryan Patrick 2016 Naked Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Elsom
Review: This wine is near equal parts Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec, finished off with a dash of Syrah. The aromas show some volatility, along with notes of vanilla and dried cherry. The cherry and green-pepper flavors are lighter styled, with tart cranberry-like acidity. Green-pepper notes linger on the finish.
Wine: Elsom 2011 Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This is tannic and heavy, made in a big full-bodied style that overwhelms at times. Soy, leather and earth feature prominently.
Wine: Kunde 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Leese-Fitch
