Review: Aromas of fresh lemon balm, cut grass and limestone translate to the palate. These flavors are met with tones of salt and creamy lees. Bright acidity leads the way to a long and savory finish.
Wine: Barboursville Vineyards 2016 Reserve Vermentino (Virginia)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Review: Strawberry and raspberry aromas meld with rosewater on the nose of this rosé made from Nebbiolo and Petite Sirah. Flavors of red berries and lavender meld with chalk and grapefruit pith on the palate, with racy acidity leading to a lingering finish.
Wine: Barboursville Vineyards 2017 Allegrante Rosé (Virginia)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: The aromas bring notes of cherry, sarsaparilla, nutmeg, wood spice, cranberry and orange peel. The flavors are full and rich, with a spice-filled finish. The oak influence seems a bit overt.
Wine: Battle Creek 2015 Roe Vineyard Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

Appellation: San Benito County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Really taut and tangy on the nose, this blend of 50% Tocai Friulano and 50% Arneis shows lime peels, sweetgrass, green apple and brine on the nose. The palate is zippy, showing more tangy citrus rinds and underripe orange flavors—altogether a unique flavor profile.
Wine: Bella Luna 2017 Bella Bianca White (San Benito County)

Appellation: Blair Estate
Review: Lemon cream, honeydew, honeysuckle and toast aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is a citrusy boost to the palate, where orange-sorbet and lemon-spritz flavors arise.
Wine: Blair Estate 2015 Pinot Gris (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine is a blend of 48% Syrah, 30% Counoise, 17% Mourvèdre and 5% Grenache. Cranberry, herb, black-raspberry, blackberry and barrel-spice aromas lead to well-balanced fruit flavors. There's a lot to like.
Wine: Lady Hill 2014 Ad Lucem Elaina Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yamhill-Carlton, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: This is elegant but constrained, with light berry fruit that simply stops short. The tannins taste of tea and lemon rind, with the drying astringency that marks all the other 2015 Pinots from Lenné.
Wine: Lenné Estate 2015 Eleanor's 114 Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Lenné Estate
Review: There's a pleasing mix of chewy strawberry and blackberry fruit. The drying tannins are a bit chalky, but somewhat offset with juicy acids. The barrel regimen was unspecified but there doesn't seem to be much new oak evident.
Wine: Lenné Estate 2015 Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Roasted red-cherry aromas meet with dried herbs and a cedar kick on the nose of this bottling. The palate shows punchy flavors of red currant and red cherry, lifted by touches of tarragon and light pepper spice.
Wine: Chiron Wines 2016 Los Hermanitos Fiddlestix Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Chris James
Review: A fine value, this three-vineyard blend spent 16 months in 20% new French oak. Ripe cranberry and raspberry fruit finishes up hitting a burst of cherry. Still young and slightly yeasty, it's nonetheless a delicious bottle with lovely fruit, perfect for that holiday turkey.
Wine: Chris James 2016 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: Whole cluster pressed and fermented and aged in half new oak, this is a thick oaky wine, with plenty of toast and butter. The fruit is green apple, simple yet with adequate acidity to cut through all the barrel spice. Drink now through 2020.
Wine: Coelho 2016 Coelho Vineyard Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Deer Creek
Review: Round and fruity, this pushes plump apple and pear fruit out front in abundance. It's sappy and buoyed with lively acidity, finishing with a splash of tangerine.
Wine: Deer Creek 2017 Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Dense aromas of black currant, packed purple flowers and tarry asphalt show on the nose of this blend of 46% Syrah, 38% Grenache, 8% Mourvèdre and 8% Petite Sirah. It's rather thick on the palate, where tangy black-plum skins meet with baking spice flavors.
Wine: Écluse 2015 Rendition Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Review: Elegant aromas of black plum, elderberry, dried flowers and pepper show on the nose of this bottling of a relatively uncommon Rhône Valley grape. Dried anise, pepper and roasted plum show on the rustic palate.
Wine: Europa Village 2015 C'est La Vie Counoise (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Plump and bursting aromas of boysenberry and black currant make for a very fresh if rather fruity entry to the nose of this bottling. It's relatively lightweight on the palate, with fresh strawberries, lilac and violets flavors, framed by delicate tannins and decent acid.
Wine: Grey Wolf Cellars 2016 Jackal Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: This blends in small amounts of Syrah, Merlot and Cabernet Franc from several appellations within the valley, aging the whole in French oak for 22 months. Tasting of blackberry and blueberry pie, it's juicy and grippy with a smooth mocha-dusted finish.
Wine: Hailstone Vineyards 2013 Impact Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: King Estate
Review: Fresh and textured, this lightly-ripened style offers jicama, daikon radish and white-melon fruit, with a peppery note. The wet stone minerality contributes to a clean finish.
Wine: King Estate 2016 Pinot Blanc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Review: This expressive wine displays a nose of prune, sultana and pencil shavings, with hints of lavender, violet and earth. The light-bodied palate is carried by fine tannins that underscore a savory mix of gunpowder and cured meat. It finishes long, with juicy acidity.
Wine: King Family 2016 Small Batch Series Cabernet Franc (Monticello)

Appellation: Kirkland Signature
Review: This offers a mix of delicately wrapped red cherry, pomegranate and currant that meet an herbal spray of mint and laurel. The lightness of the tannins covers a full-bodied richness beneath.
Wine: Kirkland Signature 2016 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: A darker shade of pretty pink, this bottling offers aromas of roasted plum, wet cement and lemon balm. It's fairly juicy on the sip, where berry and cherry flavors are clean and set against a chalky texture.
Wine: Koehler 2017 Rosé of Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Morell-Peña
Review: This wine saw only larger format new oak as well as aged barrels. Pretty aromas of flower, pear and spice are followed by lively fruit and spice flavors. A lemony finish caps it off. It shows a fresh vibrant side of the variety.
Wine: Morell-Peña 2017 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Examples of this variety are uncommon in the state. The aromas are light, with notes of toasted Grape-Nuts, pear and spice. The palate is elegant but flavorful, with a lightly creamy feel.
Wine: Novelty Hill 2017 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Roussanne (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Rutherford, Napa, California, US
Review: Bright and focused, this wine is full of gravelly minerality and wet stone grit, with vibrant shakes of lemon peel and grapefruit. The freshness hides a robust weight and full-figured ripeness.
Wine: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: Oddly enough for a wine sourced from this top vineyard, the flavors are subdued, almost veiled. Scents of crushed roses and sandalwood converge over flavors of cherry pie. It's all good, just muted, even after a full day of breathing.
Wine: Raptor Ridge 2015 Temperance Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Dark red fruit, red flowers and baking spice show on the rather subtle nose of this bottling. It's medium bodied on the palate, where smashed berry and cherry flavors are lifted by anise and finish on a vanilla note.
Wine: Rideau 2015 Thompson Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: This is a very drinkable, easygoing wine, offering aromas of plummy red fruit, hibiscus and pomegranate. The palate tastes very much like the Mexican hibiscus-based drink Agua de Jamaica, proving fruity and simple but rather delicious and refreshing.
Wine: Roblar 2016 Stone Oven Red (California)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: This tastes of graham cracker crust and blackberry jam— a rich expression of the variety that offers a juicy and soft midpalate of rounded richness. The finish is slightly spicy in black pepper and clove, with a lasting note of smoke.
Wine: Rutherford Ranch 2014 Estate Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Review: Syrah is a rarity in this cooler-climate appellation, with this particular offering dry farmed. Starting out quite reduced, the aromas open to reveal heaping amounts of freshly ground black pepper along with sea salt and nori. There's a pleasing sense of lightness and purity to the tart fruit and savory flavors. It's a unique offering of the variety in the state. If the reduction blows off it could move up a notch or two.
Wine: Savage Grace 2016 Underwood Mountain Vineyard Syrah (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Appellation: Seven Falls
Review: Aromas of cocoa, baking spice, vanilla and cherry lead to full-feeling blackberry and black-cherry flavors. The tannins bring a lightly grainy feel.
Wine: Seven Falls 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot from one of the state's top vineyard sites. Aromas of dried cherry, anise and blackberry Fruit Roll-Ups are followed by medium-bodied fruit flavors. The tannins give a firm, slightly dry grip. It seems dried out for its age.
Wine: Seven Hills 2015 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Red (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Seven Hills
Review: This wine is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Malbec and Petit Verdot. A bit lighter in color, the aromas are high toned, with notes of dried currant, dried herb and barrel spice. It's lighter in style with the tannins seeming a bit gritty and bunched up at present.
Wine: Seven Hills 2015 Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Sevtap
Review: Light aromas of orange and apple show on the easy-to-like nose of this crisp bottling. There is a nice tightness to the sip, where lemon pith and tangy apple-skin flavors arise.
Wine: Sevtap 2016 Grenache Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Silver Ghost
Review: A wine made in tribute to the 1909 Rolls Royce, this offers hearty elements of smoke and oak alongside soft, muddled layers of blackberry and cured meat. It's powerfully ripe and concentrated.
Wine: Silver Ghost 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Stinson
Review: This wine offers heady aromas of ripe cantaloupe, white peach, honeysuckle, button mushroom, brioche and a hint of flint. On the palate, flavors of peach and orange peel give way to stone and salt tones. This is creamy and ripe in feel, with a tension of acidity offering balance.
Wine: Stinson 2015 Chardonnay (Monticello)

Appellation: Sweet Cheeks
Review: Bright and tight, this has dense and concentrated fruit flavors of orange and lime. The orange tilts toward baby aspirin, a bit grainy, and quite tart, with a lip-puckering finish. Though 22% new oak was indicated, this most closely resembles an all-stainless style.
Wine: Sweet Cheeks 2016 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: The Great Oregon Wine Company
Review: This mixes light flavors of black cherry, cola and a touch of tanned leather. The tannins are soft and supple, and the mouthfeel has been rounded off for immediate drinkability.
Wine: The Great Oregon Wine Company 2016 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Three Rivers
Review: Aromas of red plum, clove, barrel spice and dried herb lead to soft lighter-styled fruit flavors, with the tannins bringing a lightly chalky feel. There's a pleasing snap on the finish.
Wine: Three Rivers 2015 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Willamette Valley Vineyards
Review: Medium sweet and fruit forward, this is a juicy fruity wine with flavors of sweet lemon tea. It's full, round and ripe, with enough acidity to cut through the sugar. Drink now through 2020.
Wine: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2017 Riesling (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Wine by Joe
Review: Joe Dobbes' even-handed winemaking consistently delivers reliably tasty and affordable Wine by Joe white wines. There's plenty of crisp clean fruit, with apple, pear and melon in the mix. A peppery hint of daikon radish adds extra pizzazz.
Wine: Wine by Joe 2017 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: High-toned aromas of cherry and spice are followed by surprisingly elegant fruit flavors given the listed alcohol level. It trails off on the finish.
Wine: Alleromb 2015 Scarline Vineyard Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Ballard Lane
Review: A broad pear aroma meets with lemon blossom, chalk and a steely minerality on the nose of this fairly priced bottling. There's a flash of ripe apple on the tip of the palate, then it fades into zesty melon rind. The acid is also strong in front, but flatter by the end.
Wine: Ballard Lane 2016 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Rusty aromas of wet dirt, cherry syrup and pomegranate reduction sauce show on the nose of this bottling. The red-cherry flavors of the palate enjoy an herbal enhancement of oregano and pepper, but there's also orange rind and smoke to complete the experience.
Wine: Blair Estate 2014 Delfina's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Lighter in color, the aromas bring notes of baking spice, raspberry, red cherry, smoke and herb. The oak seems primary, but there's a lovely sense of texture to the palate that increases the appeal.
Wine: Lady Hill 2014 Ad Lucem Daystar Slide Mountain Vineyard Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: Sourced from the David Hill vineyard, this was whole-cluster pressed and vinified in both stainless steel and concrete egg. Floral aromas lead into a light graceful mix of apple, pear and peach. There's a suggestion of residual sugar in the overall fruity sweetness, along with a hint of honey. That helps to round off the peppery phenolics.
Wine: Cochon 2017 Cuvèe (sic) Sophie Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: Bright strawberry fruit anchors this forward and tasty pink wine. It opens with a big burst of flavor, then gently fades. What it lacks in texture and detail is compensated by the excellent fruit.
Wine: Coleman 2017 Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: The aromas bring notes of black raspberry, blueberry, scorched earth, apple and brooding barrel spice. The palate brings a sense of richness yet elegance. It seems to be in an unusual spot at present.
Wine: Columbia Crest 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Aromas of gummy bear, herb, pink-peppercorn, dark coffee and spice are followed by elegantly styled fruit and green-pepper flavors. It's a very pretty wine, though it comes off as a bit light.
Wine: Côte Bonneville 2012 Carriage House DuBrul Vineyard Red (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Generous aromas of fresh black currant, blackberry, herb and anise are followed by fruit-forward flavors. The tannins give a gentle squeeze. Coffee notes linger on the finish. It's straight down the fairway for this variety.
Wine: Côte Bonneville 2015 Train Station Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: DaMa
Review: Aromas of green herb, green pepper, tar, orange twist and blackberry are followed by medium-bodied cherry and green-pepper flavors. Orange-rind notes linger on the finish.
Wine: DaMa 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Devona
Review: Fruit for this wine comes from esteemed Celilo Vineyard in the Columbia Gorge. Aromas of lemon custard, lees and corn silk are followed by elegantly styled lemony flavors. The lees influence seems a bit intense.
Wine: Devona 2016 Chardonnay (Washington)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine comes from a vineyard best known for its Syrah. The aromas draw you into the glass, with notes of flower, fresh pear, ripe banana, mineral, guava and citrus. The palate shows lightly spritzy muscat gummy and lemon flavors, giving a pleasing sense of purity.
Wine: Eight Bells 2017 Boushey Vineyard Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Lake Chelan, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This is the winery's first release from the estate vineyard adjacent to the recently built facility. Initially subdued aromas of raspberry, blueberry and barrel spice lead to ripe rich sweet smoky fruit flavors. Mesquite notes linger on the finish.
Wine: Fielding Hills 2015 Estate Defiance Vineyard Syrah (Lake Chelan)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: The aromas fascinate with notes of dried yellow apple, pear and apple peel. The palate is bone dry, made in a sleek, elegant style, with a bright sense of acidity.
Wine: Fielding Hills 2017 Rothrock Vineyard Old Vine Chenin Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: This is a tasty fruit bowl of a wine, with a mix of pineapple, peach and cherry, all jumbled together as you might find in a fruit salad. Done entirely in stainless steel, it's a fine quaffable every day wine.
Wine: Fullerton 2017 Three Otters Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Clarified butter, white peach, crayon and spice aromas are followed by creamy-feeling fruit flavors. The oak and malolactic influence seems heavy but there's still much to enjoy.
Wine: Gård 2016 Lawrence Estate Wines Lawrence Vineyards Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: The aromas are generous, with notes of char, tangerine peel, café au lait, spice and blue and black fruit. The palate is medium bodied, dipping in the middle, with a lightly creamy feel. Smoked-meat flavors persist on the finish.
Wine: Gorman 2015 The Pixie Syrah (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Guzzo
Review: Built upon earthy tannins, this wine has offsetting black-cherry fruit, hints of cola and some brown spices. It was aged for half a year in American oak barrels, half new and half once used.
Wine: Guzzo 2016 Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Walla Walla Valley white wines remain rare, with this vineyard on the cutting edge planting a number of them. Aromas of slate, citrus peel and apple are followed by sleek lively fruit flavors.
Wine: Kerloo 2017 Blue Mountain Vineyard Grenache Blanc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Pale-copper colored, the aromas are light, with lees notes taking center stage. There's a pleasing sense of elegance to the palate, which has a creamy feel. The lees influence is quite prominent.
Wine: Kerloo 2017 Painted Hills Vineyard Grenache Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Slightly reductive on the nose, this blend of 58% Merlot, 28% Cabernet Franc and 14% Cabernet Sauvignon offers aromas of roasted coffee and beef, tar and charred wood. That woody character extends deep into the palate, which also shows roasted berries and espresso bean.
Wine: Millésimé 2013 Lumiere Du Fleur Red (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Aromas of cranberry, raspberry, vanilla and baking spice lead to concentrated flavors that show a mixture of fruit and barrel. There are good things going on but the oak seems quite heavy handed, overrunning the variety.
Wine: Novelty Hill 2015 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Barrel aromas are at the fore, with notes of char, coffee and wood spice in front of dark plum. The palate shows a pleasing sense of weight, texture and length. There are good things going on but the oak seems primary.
Wine: Novelty Hill 2015 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Light aromas of dried flower, cherry and baking spice are followed by medium-bodied fruit flavors. It brings a sense of sophistication.
Wine: Novelty Hill 2015 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: The aromas are quite light, with notes of melon, lees, lemon, vanilla, herb and pear, with the palate bringing more of the same. There are good things going on but the concentration seems a bit light.
Wine: Novelty Hill 2017 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: The aromas of this wine are quite light initially, seeming hard to tease out before opening to reveal notes of green apple, citrus zest, toasted Grape-Nuts and minerals. It drinks bone dry, while bringing a sense of richness.
Wine: Orr 2017 Old Vine Chenin Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Palencia
Review: Intense aromas of freshly scooped honeydew melon, flowers and herbs. The rounded palate brings plenty of appeal with its tropical fruit flavor. Enjoy now for its straightforward nature.
Wine: Palencia 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Review: Tight blackberry, dried purple flowers and baked earth aromas show on the nose of this Sangiovese that includes 25% Merlot. Somewhat tangy black-plum and violet flavors show on the palate.
Wine: Palumbo Family Vineyards 2014 Due Rossi Sangiovese (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: Light in color and delicate in fruit flavors, this pushes pretty cranberry and raspberry notes against a stiffly tannic finish. The wine is young and well made, so more time in bottle should help to adjust and balance the entry and the finish.
Wine: Project M 2016 Bednarik Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Candied-red-currant and strawberry aromas meet with rose, carnation and lavender on the nose of this blend of 51% Grenache, 28% Syrah and 21% Mourvèdre from Pipestone Vineyard. Balsamic-laced berries meet with savory touches of pepper and herbs on the palate, finishing with crème brûlée.
Wine: Pulchella 2016 The Fallen G-S-M (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: A blend of Rhône varieties with Mourvèdre making up over half, this wine is pale-copper colored. The aromas are light, with notes of raw salad, strawberry, spice, grapefruit and cherry. The flavors are light but sleek, delivering appeal.
Wine: Pursued by Bear 2017 Blushing Bear Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: Supple with scents of violets and sweet spices, this features fruit flavors of black cherries, laced with hints of brown sugar. It's made for near-term drinking, and backed with balanced acids and tannins.
Wine: R. Stuart & Co. 2015 Love, Oregon Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Riley's Rows
Review: This wine has juicy apple, lemon and lime flavors with a touch of tangerine-laden acidity that helps keep the balance in check. Moderately structured, it's an enjoyable wine with texture and length.
Wine: Riley's Rows 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

Appellation: Rodney Strong
Review: Smoky oak and chewy tannin provide a stiff backbone to this rich dark-fruited wine, made to be enjoyed in its youth. Tobacco, black pepper and turned earth add complexity to a rounded midpalate of lush black cherry and plum.
Wine: Rodney Strong 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Saggi
Review: This wine starts out a bit reduced, with aromas of tire rubber, char and pencil eraser in front of cherry, flower, raspberry and herb. The flavors are sleek in style, with firm, not fully resolved tannins backing it all up.
Wine: Saggi 2015 Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Monterey, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Hibiscus, carnations and a hint of vanilla show on the nose of this bottling. The palate shows a strong fruit-punch character, with layers of fennel pollen adding complexity.
Wine: San Simeon 2017 Estate Reserve Pinot Noir (Monterey)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon (65%), Merlot (24%) and Cabernet Franc. There's some reduction out of the gate. Smoke, tar, blackberry, blueberry and earth aromas and flavors follow, with a warm finish. There's an appealing sense of texture and a length finish, but it seems a bit unsettled now.
Wine: Saviah 2015 Une Vallee Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Review: This is a strong heavy wine, with dense blueberry fruit bordering on jam. Tannins are smooth and the finish seems drenched in chocolate syrup. There's nothing shy here, but the potent flavors and overall drinkability show the potential for Dolcetto in southern Oregon.
Wine: Spangler 2015 Khayam's Block Dolcetto (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Sweet Cheeks
Review: Soft and supple, this blends light berry fruit with butterscotch and chocolate highlights. It's forward, easy-drinking and fairly light, though quite delicious. Drink now–2020.
Wine: Sweet Cheeks 2016 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: A blend of Portuguese varieties, the aromas explode, with notes of mountain blueberry, huckleberry, orange peel, fresh tobacco, herb and spice. The palate shows an elegant styling, with orange-peel notes lingering on the finish. One wants more concentration but what's there is riveting.
Wine: The Walls 2015 Stanley Groovy Red (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Review: Bright notes of red cherry, lavender, fig and cedar are fierce on the nose, leading to a palate that adds in smoked meat and charred wood flavors. The oak spice and firm tannins are well integrated, with zippy acidity carrying to a smoky finish.
Wine: The Williamsburg Winery 2015 XV Limited Release Red (Virginia)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Review: Deep and unctuous, this Bordeaux-style red blend is dark garnet in color, with brooding aromas of cacao nibs, tar, plum and cooked blueberry. Beyond the heavy tannic expression, flavors of black plum, violets and more cacao come through. The acidity is bright enough to match the tannins and weight. The finish is long with bitter dark chocolate at the end.
Wine: Veritas 2015 Vintner's Reserve Red (Monticello)

Appellation: Watermill
Review: This young wine is an unusual offering of the variety, with aromas of cranberry, black raspberry, herb and fruit leather. The cranberry and cherry flavors are tart, with a grip of tannin, coffee and barrel spice on the finish.
Wine: Watermill 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Cola, black raspberries, lilacs and a hint of tar show on the nose of this blend of 45% Grenache, 44% Mourvèdre, 9% Cinsaut and 2% Syrah. Dense flavors of red and purple fruit lead into chipped asphalt and gravel on the palate.
Wine: Zaca Mesa 2014 Z Cuvée Red (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Ancient Peaks
Review: Quite light in the glass, this bottling shows strong amounts of guava and tuberose on the nose, but also touches of chalk and citrus pith. There is racy acidity on the palate, where loads of bubblegum and lily flavors are quite powerful.
Wine: Ancient Peaks 2017 Chardonnay (Santa Margarita Ranch)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Aromas of pear, Grape-Nuts and toast lead to a palate that is broad down the middle, and lighter along the edges. It finishes a touch warm.
Wine: Ashan 2017 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Lady Hill
Review: This is a tight lightly peppery wine, with green-fruit flavors of melon, apple and a touch of cucumber. Two-thirds was fermented in stainless tanks; the rest in neutral oak. Drink now through 2020.
Wine: Lady Hill 2017 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Knights Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Rich, round and slightly candied, this is a crowd-pleasing wine that shows layered flavors of apple and cherry. The acidity is measured and supportive.
Wine: Lawer 2017 Betsy's Vineyard Rosé of Syrah (Knights Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: In a state seemingly overrun with rosé, this is cheaper and sweeter than most of its peers. Pretty cranberry and black-cherry fruit is front and center, and the natural acids just about balance out sugar listed at 13 g/L. It's best drunk chilled, as an aperitif or with mild cheeses.
Wine: Chris James 2017 Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Donati Family Vineyard
Review: Honey, apple flesh, wet stone and lime show on the layered nose of this bottling from an appellation in San Benito County. The honey-brushed palate shows orange cream and a hint of almond.
Wine: Donati Family Vineyard 2017 Pinot Blanc (Paicines)

Appellation: Yamhill-Carlton, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: All stainless fermented, this thin, green effort shows little fruit flavor apart from tart citrus. There's a bit of lemon rind along with the juice, and despite going through 100% malolactic it's still a tart acid-driven wine.
Wine: Et Fille 2016 Deux Vert Vineyard Viognier (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Review: Aromas of black olive, clove, coffee, licorice and leather are powerful on the nose. The palate is equally robust, with dense flavors of bitter chocolate and charred wood that mask the faint blackberry fruit. This wine has ample tannins, bright acidity and a full body.
Wine: Flying Fox 2015 Trio Red (Monticello)

Appellation: Flying Fox
Review: Cantaloupe and hazelnuts are abundant on the nose and carry to the palate. While round in feel, ample acidity offers proper dimension. The finish is long and nutty.
Wine: Flying Fox 2017 Pinot Gris (Shenandoah Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: Five clones are blended in this barrel-fermented wine. It's young, sharp and toasty (from just 10% new oak). Fruits are light and recall yellow apples and a touch of citrus.
Wine: Fullerton 2016 Five Faces Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Hailing from Stonetree Vineyard, the aromas show notes of raspberry, blueberry, spice and a light medicinal note. The palate mixes rich dark-fruit and medicine-cabinet flavors.
Wine: Guardian 2015 The Informant Syrah (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Guzzo
Review: This winery ferments in small American oak barrels. Here, the flavors are earthy and tannic, with touches of leather, licorice and mushroom. Tannins have a bitter character, and there's not much fruit flavor, but in the style of a simple rustic European red wine, it's perfectly acceptable.
Wine: Guzzo 2016 Syrah (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: J Wilkes
Review: Clean strawberry-juice aromas meet with light mint cream on the nose of this bottling. The flavors are a bit primary still, with fresh and juicy red-fruit touches with just a touch of tannic framing on a somewhat thin body.
Wine: J Wilkes 2016 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Juicy and broad-shouldered in a ripeness of brawny blackberry and cherry fruit, this wine is marked by a preponderance of oak and tannin.
Wine: JCB 2016 No. 12 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Jefferson Vineyards
Review: Floral and tropical in aroma and flavor, this wine displays tones of elderflower, papaya and grass. It is round and mouthcoating, with a long, fruity finish.
Wine: Jefferson Vineyards 2015 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine starts out quite reduced. Behind that are aromas of peach, apricot, Creamsicle and flower. There's a pleasing sense of weight and viscosity to the palate, without ever getting bogged down.
Wine: K Vintners 2016 Art Den Hoed Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Newsprint
Review: The variety is unmistakable, with notes of garden herb in front of dark fruit along with a medley of barrel spice. The fruit flavors are light but well proportioned.
Wine: Newsprint 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Grenache (60%) takes the lead on this wine, followed by Syrah (30%) and Mourvèdre. Lighter in color with an orange tinge at the rim, the aromas suggest notes of raspberry, cranberry, rose hips and vanilla bean. There's a lovely sense of feel but the oak seems a bit intense.
Wine: Palencia 2015 Casa Amarilla Red (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: This is made from 72% Merlot with 20% Cabernet Sauvignon and 8% Cabernet Franc. Roundly structured, it has classic herbal undertones that accent black cherry and clove, with a lasting taste of toasted oak.
Wine: Picayune 2015 Padlock Red (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Sean Minor
Review: Zesty lime and citrus blossom aromas make for a very fresh take on the grape. There is a hint of sweetness at the tip of the sip, then come bright flavors of orange rind and squeezed citrus.
Wine: Sean Minor 2017 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

Appellation: Starside
Review: Bittersweet chocolate, dried herb, tar and cherry aromas are at the fore. The palate brings leafy herb flavors, with plenty of fresh cherries alongside them.
Wine: Starside 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Cabernet Sauvignon (44%) is the highest percentage in this blend, followed by Cabernet Franc (28%), Merlot (22%) and Malbec. Aromas of green herb, dried red and black fruit, ash, dried orange peel and herb are followed by tangy medicine-cabinet flavors backed by dry tannins with a pleasant lick of acidity. It seems a bit dried out.
Wine: Stevens 2015 Stevens424 Red (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: The Williamsburg Winery
Review: This wine starts off with exotic aromas of white flowers, lemongrass and quince. The palate is rich and creamy in feel, with an herbaceous character and a lingering finish.
Wine: The Williamsburg Winery 2017 Petit Manseng (Virginia)

Appellation: Three Rivers
Review: Lighter-styled aromas of herb, lemon zest and fig are followed by medium-bodied fruit flavors. A melon note lingers on the finish.
Wine: Three Rivers 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: Though riper than the last vintage tasted (2013), this wine is affected from the sameness that runs through virtually all of the winery's many vineyard selections. Clearly a stylistic choice, it's acidic, bone dry, earthy and stocked with green, leafy flavors over and above the light hints of berry.
Wine: Torii Mor 2015 Nysa Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: There are lightly floral aromas, along with suggestions of barely ripe strawberries. On the palate the flavors run to tomato leaf and strawberry leaf more than ripe fruit.
Wine: Torii Mor 2017 Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Suisun Valley, North Coast, California, US
Review: Sunbaked fruit aromas and very ripe flavors saturate this full-bodied wine. Intense dried plum and raisin notes shade black cherry and chocolate while mild tannins firm up the palate.
Wine: GrapeHeart Vineyards 2013 The Thrill Cabernet Sauvignon (Suisun Valley)

Appellation: Austerity
Review: Tangy red fruits meet with roasted game, damp campfire and juniper on the nose of this bottling. There is a strong eucalyptus and pine needle kick to the sip, alongside tobacco leaf and dark fruits.
Wine: Austerity 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Ballard Lane
Review: Slightly sour cherry aromas meet with juniper and wet earth on the nose of this bottling. Similar elements carry over to the palate, where tangy orange-rind flavors meet with pomegranate and earthy herbs.
Wine: Ballard Lane 2016 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

Appellation: Big Fire
Review: A return to form in 2015, this value-priced Pinot delivers enjoyable flavors of citrus and berry, front-loaded and easily accessible. There are light hints of herb, and for your flavor dollar, this is a winner.
Wine: Big Fire 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Review: A fairly dark shade of yellow in the glass, this bottling starts with aromas of toasted nuts, lemon sorbet and clotted cream. The palate comes across as cleaner and crisper, tangy with orange rind but broad with toasted bread and more nutty qualities. It shows a touch of early oxidation.
Wine: Blair Estate 2015 The Matriarch Delfina's Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Aromas of dill, pickling spice, vanilla, herb and dark fruit lead to straight down the fairway, with light but plump-feeling fruit flavors. The aromas and flavors don't sync up.
Wine: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2015 Canoe Ridge Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: Among the winery's trio of Pinot Gris offerings, this occupies the middle rung. It's a steely herbal style, quite different from the fruit-laden vineyard designate. Here the flavors focus on citrus rind and a touch of bitter seed rather than ripe fleshy fruit. It's a different style, which would accompany simple grilled chicken with rosemary.
Wine: Coelho 2017 Renovação Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: McMinnville, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: This is a blended rosé, 45% Syrah and 55% Pinot Noir. The light strawberry fruit may be attributed to the latter; the peppery punch-up to the former. It's finished dry, with a full-bodied fruity mouthfeel.
Wine: Coeur de Terre 2017 Rustique Rosé (McMinnville)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Tar and dried berries show on the somewhat weak but pleasant nose of this bottling. Tannins frame the palate rather rigidly, hiding the dark-fruit flavors.
Wine: Cooper-Garrod 2014 Finley Vineyard Syrah (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine is principally Merlot (69%), with the rest Cabernet Sauvignon (26%) and Cabernet Franc. Aromas of baking spice, fresh herb, blackberry, tar and spice lead to lighter-styled fruit flavors. The concentration seems light, but what's there is nice, bringing a sense of elegance.
Wine: DaMa 2014 Collage Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine is mostly Merlot (58%) and Cabernet Sauvignon (35%) along with pinches of Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Aromas of dried raspberry, mint, herb and spice lead to rich but dried-out-seeming fruit flavors that finish short.
Wine: DeLille 2015 D2 Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Kudos
Review: This is a light wine, with tangy cranberry-raspberry flavors and a hint of toasted coconut. The flavors are forward and quite pleasant; they hit the palate and hold steady, but there's no further development and they quickly fade.
Wine: Kudos 2016 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Matthews
Review: This is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon (45%), Merlot (26%), Cabernet Franc (21%), Malbec (4%) and Petit Verdot. The aromas offer high-toned notes of green herb, cherry, anise and char. The palate shows a light linear styling, not seeming to have the fruit or structure to entirely hold it all together.
Wine: Matthews 2015 Claret (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: Though the majority of Oregon rosés are light versions of Pinot Noir that's been picked early and quickly pressed off the skins, this is simply a blend of regular Pinot and unspecified white wine grapes. It's fruity and dry, with a blocky mouthfeel and flavors of grapefruit and tart raspberry.
Wine: Project M 2017 Acclara Rosé (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Provenance Vineyards
Review: With 5% Sémillon and 1% Muscat, this is no shy white, offering instead full-bodied, lush and fleshy flavors of peach, mango and vanilla. It lingers in a finish of freshly cut grass.
Wine: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Review: Sourced from the Folin vineyard, this is quite light and herbal. The flavors move into a tannic midpalate, with tobacco and tea rather than ripe fruit. It spent almost two years in 100% new French oak, which seems to have sent the fruit packing, at least for the time being.
Wine: Raptor Ridge 2015 Reserva Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Both the candied-red-cherry and warm baking-spice notes make for a very welcoming nose on this bottling. The palate is a bit light and framed by rough tannins, showing flavors of smoke, cinnamon and red fruit.
Wine: Rockin' R Winery 2013 Purple Rain Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Review: Red plum, kirsch and cola are met a savory tone on the nose. The palate brings tones of game, licorice and red plum. Ample acidity, well-integrated tannins and a full body lead to a long, meaty finish.
Wine: Slater Run 2015 First Bridge Red (Virginia)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: High-toned aromas of green herb, fresh flower, green pepper and cherry are followed by a mixture of lightly styled fruit and herb flavors that bring a lightly tacky feel. Floral notes persist on the finish.
Wine: Stevens 2015 StevensFranc Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Review: On the nose, aromas of black cherry and blood-orange bitters seem medicinal. The palate echoes the nose and is supported by a rustic tannic structure.
Wine: Stinson 2017 Rosé of Mourvèdre (Virginia)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Review: This unoaked Chardonnay offers soft notes of marzipan, white peach, ripe yellow apples and ginger powder on the nose. It is round and mouthcoating on the palate, with flavors that echo the nose.
Wine: The Williamsburg Winery 2017 Stainless Steel Fermented Chardonnay (Virginia)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine is 60% Roussanne and 40% Viognier. After starting out quite reduced, it opens to reveal notes of melon, pencil eraser and citrus. The lemony flavors are sleek and acid driven.
Wine: Time & Direction 2017 Fretboard White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Review: Watermelon, watermelon-rind and herb aromas are followed by dry, broad but still lighter-styled fruit flavors. It's straight down the fairway.
Wine: Vino 2017 Sangiovese Rosé (Washington)

Appellation: Vino La Monarcha
Review: Bright aromas of honeydew melon, Asian pear and herb lead to tart, spritzy, lighter-styled fruit flavors. The concentration seems light, but what's there is good.
Wine: Vino La Monarcha 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Ancient Lakes)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: Made from fruit sourced from the Elton and Tualatin vineyards, this is tart and racy, with flavors of light strawberry and citrus rind. It thins out and leaves an impression of grippy tannins.
Wine: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2017 Estate Rosé (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Review: The aromas pop, with notes of tropical fruit, peach and flower. The palate brings just-off-dry peach and grapefruit flavors. There's value to be had.
Wine: 14 Hands 2016 Hot to Trot White (Washington)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Lighter in color, aromas of vanilla extract, green wood, baking spice, herb and raspberry are followed by light-bodied fruit flavors. The concentration doesn't all seem there, and the wood is quite intense.
Wine: Ambassador Vineyard 2015 Estate Grown Grenache (Red Mountain)

Appellation: St. Helena, Napa, California, US
Review: Tart, dry acidity accentuates a sharpness of lemon and grapefruit in this thickly textured wine. A gamy note of charcuterie contrasts well against the fruit.
Wine: Benessere 2017 Estate St. Helena Vineyard Rosato di Sangiovese (St. Helena)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine comes from a new, yet-to-be approved growing region called The Burn. Plum, herb, green-pepper and baking-spice aromas are followed by lightly sweet black-currant flavors. The concentration seems a bit light.
Wine: Borne of Fire 2016 The Burn Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: L'Ecole No. 41
Review: Though labeled as Syrah, this wine contains a healthy dollop of Grenache (20%) and a dash of Mourvèdre. Raspberry, toasty oak, plum, coffee and spice aromas are followed by lighter-styled fruit flavors that trail on the finish. The concentration doesn't seem all there.
Wine: L'Ecole No. 41 2016 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Newsprint
Review: The aromas are fruit forward, with notes of plum and spice, along with what appears to be a light oxidative note. The palate is lush and fruit-filled finishing warm.
Wine: Newsprint 2016 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Palencia
Review: Fruit for this wine hails from Canyon Vineyard Ranch. Aromas of baking spice, vanilla extract and raspberry are followed by lighter-styled elegant fruit flavors, with abundant vanilla accents. There are good things going on, but the wood gets in the way, taking over on the palate.
Wine: Palencia 2015 Grenache (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Potomac Point
Review: This Cabernet Franc bursts with notes of grilled peppers and jammy blackberries. It boasts zippy acidity, with herbaceous flavors and underpinnings of earth and toasty oak. The finish is fresh with ample acidity.
Wine: Potomac Point 2016 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Smoked black-raspberry aromas meet with sagebrush and a pinch of pepper on the fresh nose of this bottling. The palate shows slightly sour plum, smoke, wild mint and woody earth flavors.
Wine: Pulchella 2015 Mercenary Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Fleshy and gravelly, this white is blended with 14% Sémillon. It leans into a sweetness of stone fruit and vanilla, with a lasting lushness on the finish.
Wine: Roth 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Coming from one of the state's premier vineyards, this wine is 100% varietal and saw just a kiss (10%) of new oak. Aromas of green herb, tobacco, anise, flower and blackberry lead to pure supple sweet fruit flavors. It's an intriguing offering of the variety, almost completely unadulterated by new oak.
Wine: Savage Grace 2015 Red Willow Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Aromas of blueberry, herb and spice are followed by lighter-styled fruit flavors. It's enjoyable but the concentration is quite light.
Wine: Saviah 2016 The Jack Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: This has kind of a crunchy mouthfeel, meaning the strawberry and peach flavors come with a hard edge. The wine is peppered with herbs and finishes with a taste of grapefruit.
Wine: The Four Graces 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: There's a definitely grassy note in both scent and flavor, very Sauvignon Blanc-like. Fruit flavors hint at sweet fresh pear, with notes of lemongrass. Though a little off-center for the variety, it's balanced and refreshing.
Wine: The Great Oregon Wine Company 2017 Rose City Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Bacchus Vineyard is home to some of the state's oldest Cabernet vines. There's no mistaking the variety, with its aromas of fresh herb, black currant, blackberry and barrel spice. The palate is lighter on fruit yet heavy in structure, with the tannins giving a firm grip.
Wine: Three Rivers 2014 Bacchus Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: It gets off to a good start with solid black-cherry fruit. Some lighter cola and coffee flavors streak through, then the wine quickly turns a bit green and stemmy as the finish tails off.
Wine: Torii Mor 2015 La Colina Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: The aromas are bright, with notes of cherry, plum, vanilla and baking spice. The fruit flavors are plump, with plenty of barrel accents. The tannins come off as quite dry, leading to a sweet vanilla-filled finish. The oak is at the fore.
Wine: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2015 Cold Creek Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Chime
Review: A little restraint adds interest to this value-priced wine. Subdued in flavor but with good balance and a refreshing mouthfeel, this dry wine gets the job done without overt oak or a cloying texture.
Wine: Chime 2016 Chardonnay (California)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: A unique blend of Cabernet Sauvignon (63%) and the seldom seen in the state Carmenère, the aromas are downright fruity, with notes of black currant, berry, red apple and herb. The flavors are sweet and ripe but maintain a sense of balance, though they seem a bit bunched up.
Wine: Col Solare 2015 Collector's Society Red (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Herb, flower, char, blue-fruit, tar and cedar aromas are followed by full-bodied fruit flavors. It trails on the blue-fruit-filled finish. It seems quite light and linear right now.
Wine: Col Solare 2015 Component Collection Estate Vineyard Syrah (Red Mountain)

Appellation: CrossKeys
Review: Aromas of roses and cooked black plum are enticing on the nose. The palate is concentrated in feel, with deep flavors of prune and tar. Smooth, prominent tannins are met with lively acidity and give this wine a silky finish.
Wine: CrossKeys 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Virginia)

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Review: Light in color and body, this rosé is produced in larger quantities than most in the state. It offers tart juicy flavors that hint at peach and nectarine more than any red fruits. It is fine for chilling and chugging in hot weather.
Wine: Erath 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Oregon)

Appellation: Flying Fox
Review: Aromas of pear drop, limestone and ginger spice are medium in intensity. The palate follows suit, with a bit of grassiness coming through. It's fresh and vibrant in feel, with a creamy touch.
Wine: Flying Fox 2017 Viognier (Shenandoah Valley)

Appellation: Guzzo
Review: Quite light fruit flavors suggest that these grapes were from young vines. That said, there are pretty strawberry flavors up front, though the wine quickly tails off and disappears. It doesn't have the muscle of most Cabs, but it's fine for a light sipping red.
Wine: Guzzo 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: J Wilkes
Review: Dried lemon peels, key lime, white peach and strong wood aromas show on the nose of this bottling. It's tangy and very flavorful on the palate with sharp lemon and grapefruit elements.
Wine: J Wilkes 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: J Wilkes
Review: Wet slate, earth, smoke, dark red fruit and a hint of roasted pork show on the nose of this bottling. Tangy red-currant flavors meet with thyme and more savory meat qualities on the palate.
Wine: J Wilkes 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Yamhill-Carlton, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: This pretty wine is a bright sunset-rose shade, with pleasing flavors of watermelon, strawberry and nectarine. It's fresh and forward, though the finish turns astringent, wrapped in flavors of dry tea leaves.
Wine: Kramer 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Kudos
Review: This is smooth and open, affordable and quickly accessible. The loose-knit fruit flavors bring apple and pear, along with a light dusting of cocoa. Drink now through 2020.
Wine: Kudos 2016 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: McMinnville, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: Sourced from a much-admired vineyard, this rather hot wine offers steely black fruits wrapped in flavors of roasted earth and coffee. The intent may have been to offer more ripeness and more barrel toast, but overall the wine loses focus and feels off balance.
Wine: Kudos 2016 Single Vineyard Series Hyland Vineyard Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine is all Grenache from Lawrence Estate Vineyards. Aromas of rubber band, herb and cherry are followed by dry lighter-styled fruit flavors.
Wine: Gård 2017 Grand Klasse Reserve Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horton
Review: While pale in color—it's almost clear—the aromas are unexpectedly concentrated. Charred grapefruit, linalool and gunpowder aromas carry to the palate and meld with additional tones of fresh green pepper and flint. Ample acidity leads to a long finish.
Wine: Horton 2017 Rkatsiteli (Virginia)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Pale pink-orange, the aromas jump up, with notes of watermelon Jolly Rancher and cherry. The palate is light on its feet, with a spritzy feel. It still needs some time still to settle into the bottle.
Wine: Julia's Dazzle 2017 Pinot Gris Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Review: This carries aromas of lemon-lime, ripe yellow apple, apricot and lees. The flavors echo the nose, with a hint of button mushroom. Warm in feel with ample body, the finish is long and full.
Wine: Barboursville Vineyards 2016 Reserve Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Blueberry, blackberry, herb and tar aromas lead to lighter-styled fruit flavors. There's a sizable dip in the middle but what's there is pleasant.
Wine: Beast 2015 Wildebeest Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Dried strawberry, roasted meat and leather aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers tangy plum-skin flavors with a touch of dried earth.
Wine: Bellante 2016 Camp 4 Vineyard Mourvèdre (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Review: A rather dark shade of mauve-pink in the glass, this rosé is quite ripe with aromas of dark plum, rose petal and crushed slate. The palate is quite grippy with somewhat clunky tannins and is full bodied in style, showing strong flavors of dark red fruit, vanilla and baking spice.
Wine: Blair 2016 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: CrossKeys
Review: This wines offers tones of blueberry pie, black currant leaf and plum on the nose and palate, with a hint of oak spice coming through. The finish is long and jammy.
Wine: CrossKeys 2015 Petit Verdot (Virginia)

Appellation: Duckhorn
Review: Blended with 18% Sémillon, this is a lush wine richly discreet in guava, melon and fig, with moderate acidity holding it together with grace and concentration. A note of oak boosts the tropical profile.
Wine: Duckhorn 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paris Valley Road
Review: Butter, butterscotch and baking spice aromas explode from the glass and lead to extremely rich, butter and caramel flavors in this unapologetic full-bodied wine. It has a soft creamy texture that coats the palate and little acidity to counter it.
Wine: Paris Valley Road 2017 Chardonnay (California)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Thyme, pepper, asphalt and sweet cherry-liqueur aromas show on the nose of this blend of 37% Petite Sirah, 34% Grenache, 20% Syrah and 9% Viognier. Ripe mulberry and dark plummy flavors meet with purple flowers on the candied palate.
Wine: Pull 2013 CdR Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Review: This offers tart black cherry, with a streak of cola and a strong impression of brown sugar. The earthy, chewy tannins kick in on the palate and take over the finish. It's big enough for barbecue, though not particularly subtle.
Wine: Reustle 2015 Pishon Bloc Pinot Noir (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: This full-bodied wine matches fruitiness with oakiness in equal measure, wrapping luscious pear-syrup flavors in a blanket of butter and vanilla.
Wine: River Road 2016 Double Oaked Chardonnay (California)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Extremely rich aromas of prune and spice cake show on the very extracted nose of this bottling. Thick and gooey flavors of black-currant and blueberry syrup arise on the sip, but there is decent acidity to cut through the ripeness. The finish is laced with vanilla and caramel.
Wine: Rockin' R Winery 2012 Jammin Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: There's much to enjoy here—a mix of watermelon, tart berry and highlights of white pepper. The wine turns just slightly sour through the finish, but should be delightful when chilled down for a hot weather picnic.
Wine: The Great Oregon Wine Company 2017 Rose City Rosé (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley, Virginia, US
Review: Gamy tones ride over a wealth of blackberry, black currant, fig and lavender on the nose of this wine. The fruit is hard to find on the palate, obscured by charred oak. Well-balanced acidity and a firm tannic structure last through the finish.
Wine: The Williamsburg Winery 2016 Limited Release Petit Verdot (Shenandoah Valley)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Review: White tea, wintergreen, white peach and grass are pronounced on the nose and find themselves on the palate. This offers bright acidity but lacks concentration, with a short finish.
Wine: The Williamsburg Winery 2017 Petite Fleur White (Virginia)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Review: Soft aromas of grilled peach, marzipan, ginger and acacia are pleasant on the nose and come through on the palate. Ginger and oak spice are major players for the flavors, carried by a creamy, plush feel.
Wine: The Williamsburg Winery 2017 Wessex Hundred Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Watermill
Review: The aromas bring appeal, with notes of flower, green herb, fresh tobacco, green herb, vanilla and cherry. The palate mixes fruit and barrel, with cherry flavors intermingled with sweet barrel and baking-spice accents. The concentration seems a bit light.
Wine: Watermill 2016 Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: A new offering from the winery, this is a blend of 75% Grenache, 16% Mourvèdre and 9% Syrah. The aromas bring notes of orange peel, black pepper and cherry. The dark-fruit flavors are full bodied. The blend seems a bit hard to find.
Wine: Andrew Januik 2015 Los Molinos Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: The aromas aren't quite ready to reveal their charms. The plum flavors are more giving but can't make up the difference. It seems to be in a strange spot.
Wine: Baer 2015 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Barrister
Review: This wine is a blend of fruit from Pepper Bridge and Seven Hills vineyards. Vanilla, butterscotch, char, herb and cherry are followed by lightly smoky fruit and barrel flavors. The barrel influence rules the day.
Wine: Barrister 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Aromas of baking spice, coconut, dried cherry and herb lead to a palate that mixes fruit and barrel. It runs a bit hot and the fruit seems dried out.
Wine: Barrister 2015 Kiona Estate Sangiovese (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Pale in color, the aromas offer high-toned notes of raspberry hard candy, cranberry and flower. The palate shows a sense of elegance, with a supple feel to the pure red-fruit flavors.
Wine: Lady Hill 2014 Procedo Red Willow Vineyard Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: Though the wild cherry fruit has some substance to it, the main flavors are a jumble of earth, herb and green tea. The wine spent 18 months in 40% new French oak puncheons.
Wine: Lady Hill 2015 Thistle Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: L'Ecole No. 41
Review: This 100% varietal wine is a blend of fruit from Ferguson, Pepper Bridge and Seven Hills vineyards. The aromas are hard to tease out initially, with notes of blackberry, mineral and spice emerging over time. The palate brings abundant dry tannins that give a strong squeeze. Lively acidity backs it all up. There are good things going on if the tannins integrate.
Wine: L'Ecole No. 41 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: From the estate vineyard, this young wine seems to be flattening out a bit, with just a hint of oxidation showing. Lemon oil, grapefruit and cilantro flavors suggest less than optimally ripe grapes. Given all that, it would be best consumed by 2020, and give it a bit of a chill.
Wine: Coelho 2016 Apreciação Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: This rosé is made via saignée and aged for four months in a mix of stainless steel and neutral wood. It's fruity and fresh, with tart citrus and a hint of berry.
Wine: Coelho 2017 Bunny Cuvée Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Criss Cross
Review: This wine slathers butter and vanilla aromas together with overripe pear and pineapple flavors for an assertive profile. It feels full bodied, tastes slightly sweet and has a cushy soft texture.
Wine: Criss Cross 2016 Chardonnay (Lodi)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: This is a blended rosé: 60% Pinot Noir and 40% Pinot Gris. It's fruity and forward, with an unusual mix of flavors, including pineapple and cherry fruit. Simple and fresh, it's good to go now through the summer of 2019.
Wine: Fullerton 2017 Three Otters Rosé (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Geyser Peak
Review: Redolent of Anjou pear and vanilla in the aroma, this full-bodied wine floods the palate with ripe and creamy flavors and a lush texture that's soft on acidity. On the midpalate and finish a tinge of sweetness rounds it out, possibly from the 10% of Viognier that was blended in.
Wine: Geyser Peak 2015 Chardonnay (California)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This bottling, which includes 23% Petite Sirah, offers very ripe aromas of tangy black plum, black pepper, wild mint and chocolate on the nose. The palate is a bit overextracted and thick with flavors of dried black currant, raisin and a touch of prune, with savory smoked meat flavors as well.
Wine: Grey Wolf Cellars 2016 Territory Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: Though pungent with crisp varietal grassy notes, this does not push that herbaceous character too far over the edge, as one-quarter was fermented and left on the lees in French oak barrels. The fruit flavors run to bruised apple and melon, which contrast with the herbal side.
Wine: King Estate 2016 Croft Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Kudos
Review: This inexpensive wine is clean and fresh, with a precisely-balanced mix of fruit and acid. Nothing stands out, and as is often the case with value Chardonnays, it's basically generic white wine with a touch of barrel toast.
Wine: Kudos 2017 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Mason Cellars
Review: Grassy in pea shoots, this is an easygoing, quaffable white with buzzy acidity and a lasting taste of fig and melon.
Wine: Mason Cellars 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Earthy on the nose, this bottling shows exotic red-plum aromas as well as hints of sagebrush. Turned earth, plum skins, pepper and savory roasted-meat flavors arise on the palate.
Wine: Midnight 2015 Moonbeam Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Light in both color and aroma, this bottling offers faint scents of framboise, plum and licorice. The palate is full of tart red-plum-skin flavors, and would make a nice table wine for midweek dining.
Wine: Proulx 2016 Willow Creek Farm Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Review: This is a heavy tannic wine, seemingly pushing the reserve into thickly extracted, heavily oaked territory. As a result the berry fruit is buried fruit, with flavors of earth, herb, coffee, cola and pepper dominating.
Wine: Reustle 2015 Winemaker's Reserve Pinot Noir (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Pretty in pink and orange colors, this is a thick, rich and rounded wine, generously fruity in dark cherry and strawberry preserves. The acidity is measured and happy to play a background role.
Wine: Take Me With You 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: The Williamsburg Winery
Review: This offers faint honeydew, chamomile and elderflower tones on the nose. The palate is similar, boasting more floral and melon flavors.
Wine: The Williamsburg Winery 2017 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: The aromas command attention, with notes of corn silk, clarified butter, lees and white peach. The palate is medium bodied, with a lightly creamy feel. There are good things going on but the concentration seems a bit light.
Wine: Three Rivers 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Trinity Vineyards
Review: Light cherry-candy flavors carry a hint of menthol. It's a forward, fruity wine, with pleasant flavors that lack depth. It spent 15 months in 20% new French oak.
Wine: Trinity Vineyards 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Lighter in color, the aromas offer notes of toasty spice, berry, green pepper and tire rubber. The red and blue-fruit flavors are sweet with a tangy finish.
Wine: 14 Hands 2015 Limited Release Kentucky Derby Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Lees aromas are at the fore, with notes of brioche and baked bread. The fruit flavors seem quite light and thin. It doesn't all work.
Wine: Buty 2016 Conner Lee Vineyard Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Lady Hill
Review: This is young and fruity, with flavors suggesting strawberry lollipops. Short and fruit forward, it's best served chilled and should be opened in the next year or two. The wine spent 12 months in 25% new French oak puncheons.
Wine: Lady Hill 2016 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: This Chardonnay was originally intended for a sparkling wine program, and has flat, generic flavors. There are suggestions of toast and buttered popcorn, along with light apple fruit.
Wine: Coelho 2016 Bunny Cuvée Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: This is all but indistinguishable from the previous vintage's white Pinot Noir. Both are a tawny gold, with light generic fruit. This is a bit fresher than the other wine, which has had an extra year in the bottle. Drink up.
Wine: Coelho 2017 Coelho Estates Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Aromas of sugared plum, green pepper and herb lead to lightly sweet-seeming easy-drinking fruit flavors. The concentration seems very light.
Wine: Columbia Crest 2016 H3 Cabernet Sauvignon (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Aromas of toast, peach, corn on the cob and herb are followed by light, spritzy, full-feeling flavors. It doesn't all work.
Wine: Gorman 2017 Old Scratch Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Cabernet Franc (43%) takes the lead, followed by Cabernet Sauvignon (43%) and Petit Verdot with the fruit sourced from the Klipsun and Stonetree Vineyards. Aromas of red and black cherry, dried herb, game, leather and medicine cabinet are followed by a palate full of gamy flavors, supported by grainy-feeling tannins.
Wine: Guardian 2015 The Wanted Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Aromas of fig, toasted Grape-Nuts and fresh lemon are followed by lighter-styled fruit flavors. The concentration seems quite light.
Wine: Gunpowder Creek 2016 Caleb's Harvest The Greatest Hits Les Collines Vineyard Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Review: This fortified Seyval Blanc has pronounced aromas of caramel and butterscotch. On the palate it tastes like tonic water, dried yellow apple and marzipan. While full in body, it lacks acidity and concentration.
Wine: James Charles 2017 Cincinnatus Seyval Blanc (Virginia)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Cedar and smoke aromas decorate the tangy black-plum aromas on the nose of this bottling. Tons of wood spice also shows on the palate, including cedar, redwood and pine, set against the dark-red-fruit backdrop.
Wine: Martin Ranch 2016 J.D. Hurley Zinfandel (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Graphite, high-toned cherry, vanilla and herb aromas lead to somewhat elegantly styled fruit flavors. The tannins bring a bit of grip.
Wine: Seven Hills 2015 Seven Hills Vineyard Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Sevtap
Review: Interesting aromas of dried pear, mango, honeydew rind and cherimoya show on the nose of this bottling. There is tightness and freshness to the sip, but the acidity fades quickly as flavors of lemon peel and dried apple arise.
Wine: Sevtap 2016 Chenin Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: Smoky oaky aromas and flavors blanket the cherry and plum notes in this medium-bodied bold-tasting wine. The strong charred-barrel character is obvious but this wine will be enjoyable for most people.
Wine: Sobon Estate 2015 Home Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Amador County)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: The first release of this wine is forward and fruity, with front-loaded berry flavors. Tangy berry and plum fruit starts out well but quickly thins through a short finish, with hints of herb and citrus.
Wine: Tendril 2015 Child's Play Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: Light and earthy, the aromatics suggest air-popped popcorn, and the flavors are earthy and herbal. There's little in the way of ripe fruit evident.
Wine: Torii Mor 2016 Dundee Hills Select Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Malbec, Cabernet Sauvignon, Sangiovese, Merlot and Syrah make up this wine. Lighter in color, the aromas suggest fresh raspberry, berry and currant. The palate shows an elegant styling, with citrus notes on the finish. There are good things going on but the concentration seems light.
Wine: Waterbrook 2016 Mélange Founders Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Aromas of cigar box, roasted coffee bean, vanilla and spice are followed by lighter-styled fruit and barrel flavors, with the latter winning out on the finish. The barrel influence is very intense.
Wine: Ambassador Vineyard 2015 Estate Grown Syrah (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: A tawny gold and a mouthfeel that is flattening out may be early indications of oxidation. The impression is of sharp acidity and light generic fruit. Drink up.
Wine: Coelho 2016 Coelho Estates White Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: Clean and crisp, this all-stainless style offers light flavors of apple and jicama. Nothing fancy, but it's a serviceable bottle with a hint of bell pepper.
Wine: Fullerton 2016 Three Otters Unoaked Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Heavyweight
Review: Very concentrated and fruity, this medium-bodied wine practically explodes with black-cherry aromas and bright berry flavors. It has very little tannin, which is unusual for the varietal.
Wine: Heavyweight 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Starting out reduced, light aromas of herb, citrus zest, kiwi and other tropical fruits lead to lighter-styled fruit flavors. There are good things going on but the concentration seems light.
Wine: Hedges 2017 CMS Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Henry Estate
Review: Vanilla scents and flavors dominate the palate, with a big lick of butterscotch following. There's a touch of cut tobacco, but all of the above flavors, though undeniably potent, almost completely obscure the fruit.
Wine: Henry Estate 2016 Pinot Noir (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Madrigal
Review: Smooth, unfussy and moderate in structure, this is a ripe fruit-forward wine is robust in black-cherry and mocha flavors.
Wine: Madrigal 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Sand Point
Review: This full-bodied wine amps up the butter and vanilla notes on a rich soft texture. It is mouth-filling, verging on sweet, and feels low in acidity.
Wine: Sand Point 2016 Chardonnay (Lodi)

Appellation: Slater Run
Review: This wine is ruby in color, with notes of red currant, plum and cherry on the nose and palate. A bit of earth also carries the flavors, with bright acidity that cuts the finish short.
Wine: Slater Run 2016 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)

Appellation: Veritas
Review: This starts off with an interesting blend of hazelnuts, faint lemon preserves and whiff of artichoke on the nose. The palate brings a fresher pineapple tone, but devolves into an aftertaste of more artichoke. This wine is dry as a bone and bright in acidity.
Wine: Veritas 2014 Petit Manseng (Monticello)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Aromas of barrel spice, red apple and cherry are followed by nicely textured fruit flavors. The tannins bring a lot of grit and grip.
Wine: Waterbrook 2015 Reserve Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wine Spots
Review: Sweet tannins emphasize a rich rounded midpalate of jammy dark cherry and a smooth texture, making for a fruit-forward approachability that will please an array of palates at a fair price point.
Wine: Wine Spots 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Liparita
Review: Rounded in nondescript aspects of apple and crushed stone, this lightly ripe white is floral in jasmine and honeysuckle and is easily quaffable.
Wine: Liparita 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (St. Helena)

Appellation: Sostener
Review: Very ripe aromas of black plum, tangy earth and baked fruitcake show on the nose of this bottling, which is aimed at raising the sustainability message. Dried berries and leather reveal themselves on the palate, which is a touch overcooked but lifted by decent acid.
Wine: Sostener 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Soft and moderately structured, this is a 100% varietal wine that's jammy in black cherry and berry with a strong presence of tannin.
Wine: St. Anne's Crossing 2014 Slattery Road Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Stevens
Review: Aromas of Band-Aid, dried cherry and dried orange peel are followed by Fruit Roll-Ups flavors. It all seems dried out.
Wine: Stevens 2015 Merlot (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: The aromas bring notes of vanilla, herb, tire rubber and dark fruit. The cherry flavors are sweet and plump, backed by soft tannins. The oak plays a prominent part in the show.
Wine: 14 Hands 2015 The Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Templeton Gap District, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Black currant, balsamic blackberry, roasted meat and purple flowers show on the nose of this blend of 60% Sangiovese and 40% Cabernet Sauvignon. There is chalky grip on the sip, which grows quite strong by the finished, and tangy flavors of balsamic fig sauce.
Wine: Bella Luna 2014 Estate Riserva Sangiovese-Cabernet Sauvignon (Templeton Gap District)

Appellation: Broken Earth
Review: Hickory smoke wafts across the nose of this bottling against a red berry backdrop. That smoky character extends to the palate, which also shows blackberry jam and tangy plum-skin flavors.
Wine: Broken Earth 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: The aromas show notes of bruised apple and pear. Lighter-styled plum flavors follow. It doesn't all work.
Wine: Columbia Crest 2015 Reserve Andrews & Rowell Vineyard Malbec (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
