Review: This is Pinot Gris at its youthful best: fresh, creamy, leesy and bursting with zippy grapefruit, orange, apple and melon flavors. Made entirely in stainless steel, it is sufficiently rich and ripe despite the relatively low alcohol.
Wine: Walnut City WineWorks 2017 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Writer's Block
Review: This is a sturdy, well-balanced and firmly structured wine that will pair nicely with birds and beef. It has enticing, light, toasted oak aromas, tasty black-cherry and blackberry flavors and an appetizing, moderately tannic texture.
Wine: Writer's Block 2015 Malbec (Lake County)

Appellation: Writer's Block
Review: A biscuit and almond aroma gives way to tangy but ripe lemon and apricot flavors that are subtle and satisfying. This medium-bodied oak-aged wine is on the austere side, but in a good way, as it compels continued sipping to get to the bottom of its complexity.
Wine: Writer's Block 2016 Roussanne (Lake County)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: The reserve-worthy wine is made from vineyards across the valley, with the majority coming from Howell Mountain and St. Helena. It reflects the power of mountain fruit with dense sweet tannins, black-inky color and swathes of toasted oak, the big body accented in sanguine currant and cassis.
Wine: Beringer 2014 Private Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: This is the first vintage of this reserve—a blend of Dijon clones fermented and aged in French oak. The extended (22 months) time in barrel has infused it with loads of nutty, toasty, buttery flavors, yet it has just enough acidity to keep it afloat. This is a style made for lovers of heavily oaked Chardonnay.
Wine: Left Coast Cellars 2015 Suzanne's Reserve Estate Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: This popular cuvée is a startling shade of almost impenetrable black. Yet despite the intense color, it's an accessible, fruity wine with broad, open blackberry and black cherry flavors. Silky smooth, it finishes with a streak of mocha.
Wine: Left Coast Cellars 2016 Cali's Cuvée Estate Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: This is a concentrated and truly dry Bordeaux-style blend that has a blackberry aroma and flavors of black cherry and dark chocolate. Firm tannins and good acidity give it plenty of structure, so it will easily stand up to steaks, chops and ribs. Made from Petit Verdot, Malbec and Cabernet Sauvignon.
Wine: Matchbook 2015 The Arsonist Red (California)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: The grapes for this wine are all from the cooler Green Valley area, grown in Goldridge soils. It's exotically earthy and robust in red berry, citrus and rose, with a density to the body ripeness and elongated tannin.
Wine: Migration 2015 Dutton Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This full-bodied wine is deep in color, bursting with black-fruit aromas and juicy, almost chewy blueberry and blackberry flavors that it wraps in a firm layer of tannins. Made with 50% Merlot plus Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc, it tastes dry in a good way and grips the palate nicely.
Wine: Nottingham Cellars 2015 Wolfe of Livermore Red (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: Grown, picked and vinified deliberately for rosé, this low alcohol, pale copper wine rewards your attention. Though neither forward nor fruity, it's loaded with lovely details. It starts with aromatic notes of rose petals, lemon zest and white pepper. Then, it fills in the palate with juicy light berry flavors. The length and detail are impressive.
Wine: Patton Valley 2017 Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Review: New oak shapes the texture and heavily dominates the flavors of this firm and spicy wine. It shows vanilla and nutmeg in the aroma, and crisp apple flavors seasoned with ginger and cinnamon. Good acidity and a touch of tannin make it snappy on the palate. Aged in new Hungarian barrels, it needs some time to mellow. Best after 2020.
Wine: Poseidon 2015 Boon Fly's Hill Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: This hearty 100% varietal wine combines clove, cinnamon and blackberry pie within a highly aromatic introduction teased in violet. Intensely spicy and baked in flavor, it finishes in black pepper and pipe tobacco.
Wine: Pride Mountain 2014 Vintner Select Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: After parting with the winery that bears his name, Samuel Coelho has ramped up production of his Samuel Robert wines, offering some of Oregon's finest values. This lip-smacking rosé is irresistible—bright, lemony and loaded with fresh strawberry flavors. It finishes dry and shows impressive length and concentration.
Wine: Samuel Robert 2017 Vintner's Reserve Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Three Sticks
Review: From the vineyard made famous by Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, here is an aromatic white, steely on the nose in lemon oil and white flowers. On the palate it is lushly layered and velvety, bright with heft.
Wine: Three Sticks 2016 Pinot Blanc (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This full-bodied wine pleases the palate with great balance and a nice combination of fresh fruit and light spice flavors. Hints of new leather and sunbaked earth temper strawberry and cherry notes, and mild tannins add some good grip to the texture.
Wine: Vasco Urbano 2015 Norm Marina Ranch Grenache (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Review: Softly appealing at first taste, this shows some bite on the back half, like apple pie with a dash of pepper. Its mix of baking spice and cooked apple flavors and its buttery aftertaste are unusual but intriguing.
Wine: Viento 2015 Annala Vineyard Pinot Noir (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Appellation: Vigilance
Review: Lots of butter and baking spices waft from the glass before lush pear, apple and butterscotch flavors coat the palate. This full-bodied wine is very nicely crafted in a big smooth style that emphasizes viscosity and ripeness.
Wine: Vigilance 2016 Chardonnay (Red Hills)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Stemmy herb and earth meet a fleshy midpalate of tight-grained tannin and oak in this moderately structured wine, made from estate-grown grapes.
Wine: Clouds Rest 2014 Femme Fatale Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Cuttings
Review: Full bodied and nicely complex, this ripe and concentrated wine exudes ripe fruit, light smoke and black pepper aromas and flavors while offering a satisfying sense of heft and structure. The black-cherry and black-plum flavors are rich and concentrated, verging on sweet and softening the effect of moderate tannins.
Wine: Cuttings 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Appellation: Drouhin Oregon Roserock
Review: This new Domaine Drouhin Oregon label has increased drastically in production—a real boon for consumers, given its modest pricepoint. Still quite young, it shows tightly wound, compact cranberry, raspberry and red plum flavors, with plenty of supporting acidity. Give it ample aeration if you plan to drink it before 2020.
Wine: Drouhin Oregon Roserock 2015 Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Rutherford, Napa, California, US
Review: Structured and undeniably concentrated, this is a burly brawny red, showing the exuberance of a warm, steady vintage and a well-known site. Mountain sage, cedar and graphite give it a savory complexity complemented by dense dark cherry.
Wine: Elyse 2014 Morisoli Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This blend of 39% Roussanne, 34% Viognier and 27% Grenache Blanc offers nuanced apricot, peach, flower and spice aromas. It's full bodied and juicy on the palate, with textured stone fruit-like flavors. Peach notes linger on the warm finish.
Wine: Forgeron 2015 Façon Blanc White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Gainey
Review: Light in the glass, this wine starts with a touch of sandalwood on the nose alongside preserved lemon, toast and oak. The palate offers a firm textural grip, then leads into tangy lemon rind, sour apple and a bit more toasted oak flavors.
Wine: Gainey 2016 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Review: This wine has a pretty nose of apple blossom and jasmine. Present, persistent oak gives it a roundness and richness that complements mango, wet stone and lemon-drop flavors and tight focused acidity.
Wine: Hartford Court 2015 Sevens Bench Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Jason-Stephens
Review: Blackberry, roasted coffee and spicy white-pepper aromas play on the nose of this Malbec, a strong performer in this region. There is strong tannic tension to the sip and loads of acidity, which carry flavors of boysenberry juice, spice cake, herbs and espresso.
Wine: Jason-Stephens 2014 Malbec (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: Consumers have an impressive number of excellent Willamette Valley Pinot Noirs from which to choose at this price point. This one offers deep and potent black fruit and even darker notes of black coffee and chocolate. There's nothing cheap or cheerful about it. It's a serious bottle of wine, right down to the finishing suggestions of toast from new oak aging.
Wine: Joleté 2016 Le Verre Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This is an earthy, nutty and dry sparkling wine, made from Chardonnay, that tastes of apple skin and lemon zest. Textured tight acidity buoys the flavors and provides lasting freshness in the glass.
Wine: Kokomo 2014 Peters Vineyard Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Kokomo
Review: Brawny in leather, baked strawberry and blackberry, this is a robust version of the variety, ripe, softly layered and undeniably fruity. Cinnamon and brown sugar add richness and a touch of spice.
Wine: Kokomo 2016 Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Gooseneck
Review: Gooseneck is based in Rhode Island but sources wines from around the world. This Pinot Noir was produced at River's Edge in the Elkton Oregon AVA. Like the previous vintage, it offers excellent quality at a budget price. Dense black fruit layered with American and French barrel flavors, like coffee, mocha, smoke and chocolate, complement the black cherry-like appeal of its Pommard clone fruit.
Wine: Gooseneck 2016 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

Appellation: Holloran
Review: Though the vineyard source is not indicated, the texture and flavors of this wine speak to biodynamic farming. It's loaded with dark, bloody flavors and accents, along with a whiff of wet moss. On the palate, it recalls cool climate Syrah with its mix of umami, herb and cured meat flavors. Play close attention, and it will slowly reveal hidden pleasures.
Wine: Holloran 2015 Tempranillo (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Joullian
Review: Aromas of ripe boysenberry and black cherry meet with sweet herbs and cocoa on the nose of this bottling. Berry flavors show on the palate alongside dried herbs, slightly sour plum skins and a touch of tobacco, all framed by tense tannins.
Wine: Joullian 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Carmel Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: This is one of a series of single clone offerings from Kason—and tends to be the most forward and fruity of the bunch. It shows robust black cherry fruit, with streaks of smoke and coffee. It was aged 16 months in French oak.
Wine: Kason 2015 Pommard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Earthy forest and pine meet a thistle of rose petal in this somewhat exotic full-bodied red made from multiple sites. Orange peel and strawberry define its fruitier components, alongside cola and a handful of toasted oak.
Wine: Kenwood 2015 Six Ridges Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Larner
Review: Opulent fruit tones of blackberry and black currant are sprinkled with toasty vanilla aromas on this Syrah, which is very approachable and user-friendly. Thyme and cracked pepper lift the dark berry flavors of the palate.
Wine: Larner 2014 Syrah (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: Vibrant black raspberry, kirsch, sweet herb, red currant and cranberry aromas are followed by restrained, detailed and elegant fruit flavors in this wine. A cranberry-inflected finish caps it off.
Wine: Battle Creek 2015 Battle Creek Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Yamhill-Carlton, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: This light colored wine brings appealing cranberry, raspberry, cinnamon and forest floor aromas. The flavors are equally light and delicate, with a snap of fresh, cranberry-like acidity and a spice- and fruit-filled finish.
Wine: Battle Creek 2015 Yamhela Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Broadley
Review: Broadley follows up its outstanding 2015 with another exceptional value. Supple and true to variety, this was fermented with wild yeasts and aged in neutral oak. The result is an aromatic, well-balanced and affordable wine showing true craftsmanship. Its cherry, Dr. Pepper and sandalwood components meld together gracefully.
Wine: Broadley 2016 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: An attractive, spicy oak aroma leads to butter and vanilla flavors and a broad creamy texture. The wine feels full bodied, tastes toasty and rich without overdoing it, and has a lingering finish.
Wine: Brutocao 2016 Bliss Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This blend of all five key red Bordeaux varieties, the majority Cabernet Sauvignon, has a soft entry of red currant and cherry that leads into savory elements of pencil shavings and tobacco. Full bodied, the oak and tannin are well integrated. The brand is devoted to supporting LGBT equality.
Wine: Christopher Street 2014 Winemaker's Pride Red (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: This medium-bodied wine has a very pale-pink color, vivid strawberry and grapefruit flavors and a good crisp texture. It will provide great refreshment as well as concentrated fruit flavors that last through the tangy finish. The Clif Family made it with Grenache grapes and no oak aging.
Wine: Clif Family 2017 Rosé of Grenache (Mendocino)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Blended with 20% Petite Sirah and 1% Primitivo, this is a thick, dense wine that offers smoky char beneath rich, full-bodied red berries and softly integrated oak. The finish has touches of mocha and sweet tobacco.
Wine: Dry Creek Vineyard 2016 Heritage Vines Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Duckhorn
Review: Blended with 10% Merlot and 2% Petit Verdot, this wine is from two estate vineyards, one of which contains some of the producer's oldest vines. It offers a hearty helping of thick, dense black fruit, spicy clove, bay leaf and leather, structured by powerful tannins.
Wine: Duckhorn 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: The La Casita site was planted to clone 114 in 2000. In some vintages, the wine is quite ripe and sweet; this year, it's lighter, with pretty flavors that suggest just-picked strawberries and raspberries. A gentle wash of cocoa seems to coat the fruit through its light but lingering finish.
Wine: Durant 2015 La Casita Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Review: One of a pair of reserves from Joe Wagner's new Oregon project, this full-bodied wine carries a liquorous, bourbon-like scent. Its rich and soft berry and cherry flavors show a streak of licorice and a light touch of toast. Big, round and almost voluptuous, it's ready to drink now and into the early 2020s.
Wine: Elouan 2016 Klamath's Kettle Reserve Pinot Noir (Oregon)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: This is a friendly, rich and lightly oaked wine that coats the tongue with ripe pears, apples and vanilla. While the texture is smooth and lush, the wine has enough good acidity from its 58% Marsanne grapes to provide balance and freshness.
Wine: Le Casque 2017 Calotte White (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Michael Pozzan
Review: This lean and refreshing wine smells minerally and tastes bright and citrusy, backed by crisp acidity and a light body. Lemon and lime merge with light herb and mineral flavors that stay lively with each sip.
Wine: Michael Pozzan 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Blackberry syrup, coffee extract and a touch of raisin show on the intense nose of this bottling from the Tierra Alta and Morehouse vineyards by bartender-vintner Chris Wright. There is great verve to the sip, with dark berry flavors and a strong tannic structure.
Wine: Órale 2014 Mas Que Alta Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: This brand brags on the label that they replicate your favorite wines, and with this one they really did it. Ripe fruit aromas of pear and peach lead to rich fruit flavors and a lively spicy component of nutmeg and ginger in this full-bodied and creamy-textured wine. It combines richness with oaky complexity in an alluring way.
Wine: Replica 2016 Knockoff Chardonnay (California)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Named for winemaker Matt Smith's ancestral village in Italy, this is a blend of 80% Cabernet Sauvignon, 11% Cabernet Franc and 9% Sangiovese. Sanguine, it features strong flavors of currant, wood and graphite, with secondary notions of dust and cedar, the tannins sizable but polished and lengthy.
Wine: Sassoferrato 2015 Monte de Ferro Red (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Scott Paul
Review: This totally delicious young wine is fresh and lively, with nose-tickling crushed berry and citrus aromas and tart acidity. In the mouth, it's like an explosion of strawberries. Drink now and over the next three to four years.
Wine: Scott Paul 2016 Gamay Noir (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Terra d'Oro
Review: This is an exuberant but well-balanced medium-bodied wine, with fresh apple and lime aromas and a tangy yet layered texture. The two varieties weave together nicely, presenting the rich aspect of Viognier and the crisp, lively aspect of Chenin Blanc.
Wine: Terra d'Oro 2017 Chenin Blanc-Viognier (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This vineyard is set amongst redwood trees outside the coastal town of Occidental. The resulting wine is juicy in orange and rhubarb flavors, with a robust fleshiness and lushness on the palate. It has an enticing smoked and candied element in the background, dotted in lasting cardamom and clove.
Wine: Tiny House Vineyard 2016 W.E. Bottoms Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This small-production wine is earthy, with a distinctly herbal nose, yet shows a hearty robustness and meaty character on the palate. Lightly ripe, it offers underlying hints of cherry and Tahitian vanilla, with sparks of vibrant acidity.
Wine: Tiny House Vineyard 2017 Rosé of Pinotage (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: Winemaker Kirk Venge combines 70% Zinfandel with 14% Charbono, 9% Petite Sirah and 7% Syrah to great effect, offering a jammy expression of blackberry, brown sugar and vanilla. Soft integrated oak supports the rounded rich fruit and gives it an impressive framework of structure and likability.
Wine: Venge 2016 Scout's Honor Red (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: This late release from the acclaimed 2014 vintage comes from a high-altitude site. It offers ripe, forward pomegranate and raspberry flavors. There's ample acidity, but the density of past vintages is not evident.
Wine: Adelsheim 2014 Bryan Creek Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Review: Fleshy, this wine offers a roundness of oak and lushness on the midpalate, presenting as brioche and peach Melba. Structured with plenty of acidity as its backbone, it finishes in a concentrated swirl of crème brûlée.
Wine: Anaba 2015 J McK Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Bryn Mawr Vineyards
Review: This delightful wine was barrel fermented and brings a bright and tasty mix of Meyer lemon and melon flavors. It's tangy, with a lightly minty note, and retains its lively and accessible balance through the elegant finish.
Wine: Bryn Mawr Vineyards 2017 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Capo Creek
Review: This wine is rewarding in tones of earth and blueberry that are balanced by bright, juicy acidity. Easygoing on the palate, with soft, integrated tannins, it finishes in a dusting of cocoa powder.
Wine: Capo Creek 2015 Grenache (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: Quite distinct from the winery's similarly priced RoseRock Chardonnay, this is more precise and firm, with crisp apple and spice flavors. Oak aging has lent a rather dominant bourbon barrel scent, which comes across on the palate as liquorous. It finishes on a gentle, buttery note.
Wine: Domaine Drouhin Oregon 2016 Arthur Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This bottling from a newer property at the entrance to Carmel Valley is very fresh on the nose with aromas of sweet honeysuckle, candied banana and a very prominent pineapple note. That pineapple persists powerfully on the palate, where it meets with citrusy acidity and a toasty oak touch.
Wine: Folktale 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Bennett Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This is a blend of the best barrel lots and is not made every year. For this vintage, it opens in floral gardenia and green olive, imparting spicy acidity and tart tastes of green apple, pear and peach. Bright on entry, it has an underling richness and depth of concentration that's fleshy and lush.
Wine: Frostwatch 2015 Ophira Reserve Chardonnay (Bennett Valley)

Appellation: Moon Mountain District Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Thick, oaky and dense in tannin, this is a highly ripe wine that finds its groove amidst a curtain of baked bread, compost and blackberry bramble. The richness is underlined in mocha chocolate and sweet tobacco.
Wine: Hanna 2015 Bismark Mountain Vineyard Zinfandel (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)

Appellation: Howell Mountain Vineyards
Review: Earthy in compost and truffle, this is a concentrated exploration of a grape more often used for blending. A bright thread of acidity courses through its veins, helping to balance the bold ripeness and grippy tannic structure at its core.
Wine: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2014 Petit Verdot (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: This delightful, full-flavored rosé is packed with generous watermelon, strawberry and candied cherry flavors. The supporting acidity brings a lemon drop note, and the palate has far more weight and power than the low alcohol might suggest.
Wine: Kason 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: From the estate's Don Miguel Vineyard in cool-climate Green Valley, this wine is floral on the nose, with a pronounced jasmine note. The palate is weighty in oak and tropical fruit tones, with fleshy richness of baked peach and apple pie.
Wine: Marimar Estate 2016 La Masía Don Miguel Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This is from the producer's 70-acre estate vineyard and is the second vintage from it. It shows the appellation's classic mix of warm baking spice and velvety, smooth texture, with a robustness of red cherry. The finish is lush and rich in vanilla.
Wine: Migration 2015 Running Creek Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This wine is bold, full-bodied and balanced, combining the richness of 65% Sémillon with the citrus tang of 35% Sauvignon Blanc. Aromas of honey, vanilla and toast lead to ripe grapefruit and melon flavors and a texture that's creamy and mouth coating.
Wine: Nottingham Cellars 2017 Micro-Lot Reserve Ghielmetti Vineyard BDX Blanc White (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Omen
Review: This is a full bodied and rather complex wine that is nicely dry and moderately tannic. It has a medium to full body, generous black-plum aromas, touches of earth and oak, and well-concentrated blackberry flavors that linger on the finish.
Wine: Omen 2016 Red (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Pride Mountain
Review: Blended with 8% Merlot and 4% Petit Verdot, this is a full-bodied wine, no doubt, with inviting waves of dark cherry, cassis and milk chocolate. Well structured, it retains underlying acidity that helps balance out the ripeness and power of the fruit.
Wine: Pride Mountain 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa County-Sonoma County)

Appellation: Sonoma County-Napa County, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Review: This combines 56% Merlot with 44% Cabernet Sauvignon, the fruit from both counties. Aged entirely in French oak, it holds the oak well, offering lengthy tannins and powerfully concentrated black fruit, with accents of sage, dried herb and vanilla.
Wine: Pride Mountain 2014 Reserve Claret (Sonoma County-Napa County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Pungent in grassy, herbal tones, this is lemony tart in key lime and stone fruit, with a sublime texture and straightforward freshly layered finish.
Wine: Quivira 2016 Fig Tree Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This wine is densely packed in soft tannin, its thickness characterized by earthy leather, black pepper and clove. Soy and black licorice follow along for the ride, as the full-bodied richness takes hold on the palate.
Wine: Ravenswood 2015 Big River Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: Though 2011 was initially considered an inferior vintage due to cool, wet weather, a handful of wineries turned out great, ageworthy bottles. This late release spent 32 months in 20% new French oak. It has the muted shades of a mature wine, with light bricking at the rim, delicate red berry flavors and well-integrated barrel toast.
Wine: Sass 2011 Vieux Amis Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Coombsville, Napa, California, US
Review: This is a Cabernet Franc-dominant blend at 36%, with 30% Cabernet Sauvignon and 24% Merlot (as well as tiny additions of Malbec and Petit Verdot). Sanguine, it's dusty and powerful in tannin and oak, with strong flavors of currant, cassis and mocha powder.
Wine: Shadybrook 2014 Estate V Red (Coombsville)

Appellation: Siduri
Review: This is a nice expression of the appellation, spicy in big cherry fruit and a dense succulence that's hard to resist. Full bodied and integrated, it offers heft within a varietally characteristic earthiness and pretty aromatics.
Wine: Siduri 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Silvan Ridge
Review: This wine's impressive nose suggests mixed berries and plums, with minty chocolate highlights. It's smooth and supple, with satiny raspberry, blueberry and black cherry fruit. Lovely and seamless, it finishes with just a hint of toast.
Wine: Silvan Ridge 2016 Malbec (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: This wine's full-bodied blackberry and black cherry flavors come with barrel toast and chicory highlights. A whiff of leather lingers in the background, but ripe fruit is what shines.
Wine: Sokol Blosser 2015 Watershed Block Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: Here's a well-made Willamette Valley Pinot Noir at a value price. The use of oak staves has contributed a hint of toast without overdoing it. Hints of black olive add complexity to its tart raspberry and black cherry fruit, elevating it above many of its peers.
Wine: Sokol Blosser 2016 Evolution Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Review: Full bodied and firmly structured, this wine is concentrated and ripe in flavor, coating the palate in richness. It has deep, ripe black-cherry aromas, cherry and milk chocolate flavors, firm tannins and a lingering finish.
Wine: Steele 2014 Stymie Founder's Reserve Limited Production Merlot (Lake County)

Appellation: The Winery SF
Review: This wine offers gorgeous fruit flavors, subdued spices and great balance. It feels poised on the palate, lifted by good acidity, braced by moderate tannins and well filled out by plum, prune and cherry flavors shaded by hints of nutmeg and vanilla.
Wine: The Winery SF 2014 Tempranillo (North Coast)

Appellation: V. Sattui
Review: Vivid oak spices dress up the aromas and flavors of this full-bodied, ripe and concentrated wine. Toasted baguette and baking-spice nuances complement good, ripe berry and black-plum flavors while a firm moderately tannic texture adds good grip.
Wine: V. Sattui 2016 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Focused aromas of dark berry, charred beef, concentrated purple flowers and smoke combine for an intense attention-grabbing nose on this bottling. Smooth and well-integrated flavors of dark berry and baking spice make for a compelling palate where no single element stands out.
Wine: Waxwing 2016 Lester Family Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This full-bodied wine is unusually dark in color for the varietal, and generously spiced with oak in both the aromas and the flavors. Very ripe blackberry and black-cherry flavors meet light wood smoke and baking spices throughout.
Wine: Vasco Urbano 2015 Raboli Vineyard H P Mourvèdre (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: This wine is dark and brooding, showing ultraripe flavors, a full body and a thick layer of velvety tannins. It has well-concentrated blackberry and roasted plum aromas and focused fruit flavors that show just a touch of oak spice.
Wine: Amador Cellars 2014 Estate Tempranillo (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Sumptuous elements of baked plum, clove and cinnamon mark this big full-bodied wine, a 100% varietal from the estate. With an herbal underbelly, it imparts red currant and woody oak, with a grippy hold of tannin.
Wine: B.R. Cohn 2014 Olive Hill Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Big Table Farm
Review: There's a slight flatness to the mouthfeel of this wine that is atypical for Big Table Farm. That aside, you'll find black fruit in abundance here, with cured meat and coffee suggestions. The finishing tannins are drying and slightly chalky. Retasted on the second and third day after opening, it not only held up but improved considerably.
Wine: Big Table Farm 2014 Syrah (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: This block selection comes off the vineyard's highest elevation parcel. Young and punchy, it has toasty barrel flavors from aging in one quarter new French oak. Its core of black cherry fruit promises good things to come. Drink after 2020.
Wine: Bryn Mawr Vineyards 2015 Krista's Block Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This new offering from Cloudlift Cellars was made predominantly from old vines at Bacchus Vineyard. The aroma shows notes of herb, cedar, plum and blueberry. It's full of elegant blue fruit flavors that coat the palate, backed by tart acidity and a lick of tannin.
Wine: Cloudlift Cellars 2015 Cloud 2 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Lovely balsam and cedar aromas meet ripe plum and cherry flavors in this medium- to full-bodied wine. It pairs fairly concentrated flavors with a moderately tannic texture and achieves good balance.
Wine: Fenestra 2013 Infrared Red (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This pink blend of half Grenache and half Gamay Noir starts with a slightly sour nose of raspberry and lemon rind. There is great grip to the palate, which is shy in flavors but allows wet stone, nectarine flesh and citrus pith to cut through the acid and texture.
Wine: Joyce 2017 Turbidity Current Rosé (Monterey County)

Appellation: Landmark
Review: This is an oak-powered bottling, showing lots of smoky wood and campfire aromas on the nose along with black raspberry. That smoke carries to the sip as well, wrapping up flavors of black cherry and star anise.
Wine: Landmark 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine's aromas are high toned, suggesting baking spice, dried herb, cherry liqueur and anise. The palate shows sophistication, especially considering the warm vintage and region. Cranberry notes linger on the warm finish.
Wine: Obelisco Estate 2014 Electrum Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Ruby Cellars
Review: Black cherry meets with pencil shavings, game and wet schist on the complex nose of this bottling from a newer project in Atascadero. Rounded flavors of cherry and oregano show on the sip, along with dust and earthy forest-floor tones.
Wine: Ruby Cellars 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: This young, brightly fruity wine overdelivers for its price, with blueberry, blackberry and ripe plum flavors, dappled with rosemary and thyme notes. Native yeasts were used, and just 10% of the barrels were new, lending a light note of chocolate to its rather stiff tannins.
Wine: Sass 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: There's a strong herbaceous character to this bottling, with intriguing and exotic spice aromas decorating charred cherry-tomato and black-raspberry fruit. The palate is quite gamy, with tart cranberry flavors.
Wine: Steele 2014 Goodchild Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Stolo
Review: Fresh and floral aromas of lime blossom, white peach flesh and a hint of chalk are reminiscent of lemon-lime soda pop on the nose of this bottling. The sip is energetic, with acid and a tension that extends into the finish, showing lime, honeydew and white-flower flavors.
Wine: Stolo 2017 Gewurztraminer (San Luis Obispo County)

Appellation: Storypoint
Review: A very deep color and concentrated blackberry flavors give this full-bodied wine a big impact. Berry compote and light touches of maple and wood smoke waft from the glass, then deep dark fruit flavors coat the palate while a moderately tannic texture helps balance the profusion of almost-sweet fruit.
Wine: Storypoint 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Review: The name “Iso” is Finnish for big, and this blend of 90% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Syrah fits that bill, showing pure and clean aromas of blackberry jelly, caramelized black currants, dried herbs and vanilla spice. The red and purple-fruit flavors are very candied and sweet-seeming, but there are dashes of herbs and acidity to add complexity.
Wine: Kukkula 2014 Iso Red (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Bella Grace
Review: This rather hefty and powerful white wine has plenty to explore. It offers aromas of smoke, roses and flint, flavors that are ripe like pears with a savory aspect like sliced fennel bulb and a big rounded texture.
Wine: Bella Grace 2017 Viognier (Amador County)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This reserve rosé, which is a blend of 50% Grenache, 15% Grenache Blanc, 12% Cinsaut, 12% Mourvèdre, 8% Carignane and 3% Roussanne, does indeed show a bit of age and elegance. The nose starts with light strawberry and preserved lemons before turning a bit nutty with browned-butter touches. The palate offers a blend of walnuts, nectarine and orange rind, with a hint of pine.
Wine: Bonny Doon 2016 Vin Gris de Cigare Reserve Rosé (Central Coast)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: This tasty wine is a goblet full of chocolate-covered cherries. Gripping acidity underlies the fruit and sets up a medium length finish. It was fermented with native yeast, and aged in one quarter new French oak.
Wine: Bryn Mawr Vineyards 2015 Jeffrey's Block Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Effort
Review: Meyer lemon rind, wet gravel, lime blossom and a touch of toast show on the nose of this bottling, which is quite restrained. It's tightly wound and quite grippy on the palate, where clean and crisp flavors of river stone and citrus shine through.
Wine: Effort 2016 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: This is a big wine that shows concentrated berry and black-pepper flavors, with accents of rosemary and wood smoke. Firm tannins and good acidity give plenty of grip.
Wine: Feist 2016 Reserve Cooper Vineyard Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: The winery's least expensive Pinot Noir, this is also its best value, offering cherry tobacco, brown spice and tanned leather highlights. It was aged 16 months in French oak and has supple tannins, making it ready for immediate enjoyment.
Wine: Kason 2015 Black Label Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Lorimar
Review: This dry Bordeaux-style blend is rich and satisfying, showing generous berry and plum aromas, a mouthfilling texture and nuances of earth and leather that complement the fruit flavors. It is full bodied but not too tannic.
Wine: Lorimar 2015 Meritage (California)

Appellation: Niner
Review: Stewed red currants and a hint of licorice make for a familiar nose on this twist-top blend of Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon, Grenache, Malbec, Petit Verdot and Barbera. Those bits combine for a tannic sip that's full of acid, with bright and juicy red fruit flavors and sarsaparilla spice.
Wine: Niner 2015 Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lake County, California, US
Review: Aromas like wet stones and smoked ham meet flavors that are also slightly earthy, along with good lemon and crisp apple notes. The wine is medium bodied, nicely tart and not at all bland.
Wine: Pech Merle 2017 Loasa Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc

Appellation: Roblar
Review: Concentrated aromas of cranberry and pomegranate meet with tangy orange peels and juniper spice on the nose of this bottling. The palate is loaded with rich, thick and dense dark red-fruit flavors, which are leveled by herbal touches of forest moss and a shiitake-like umami kick.
Wine: Roblar 2015 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: This is a serious wine, with a core of black cherry cola, a hint of molasses and plenty of juicy acidity. The flavors are straightforward, honest and substantial.
Wine: Samuel Robert 2016 Vintner's Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: V. Sattui
Review: Herbal in cedar, wood and a thick concentration of blueberry and dark cherry, this is a fruity and likable wine that finishes in a dollop of milk chocolate.
Wine: V. Sattui 2015 Malbec (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Black plum, cocoa, coffee spice and raisin syrup show on the fairly ripe yet not overdone nose of this bottling. The palate is well integrated with flavors of red cherry, baking spice and a vanilla finish, all presented with fresh acidity.
Wine: Verde 2015 Estate Merlot (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Placer County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: Mild aromas of wood smoke and charred oak lead to rich and layered blackberry flavors that are so ripe they're almost sweet. A firm but smooth texture completes this medium- to full-bodied wine.
Wine: Wise Villa 2015 Estate Syrah (Placer County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: Ripe black-fruit aromas and flavors and moderate spicy oak accents give this full-bodied wine an easy appeal. Made from Mourvèdre and Syrah, it has a smooth, lightly tannic texture and hints of black pepper and smoke that develop in the glass.
Wine: Le Casque 2015 Adrian Red (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine recalls incense, sweet spice, graphite and black cherry on the nose. The palate brings abundant fruit and game flavors, with a meaty finish.
Wine: Obelisco Estate 2014 Nefer III Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Ponzi
Review: This is the second varietal offering in Ponzi's Italian series, a sibling to their Arneis. It's high toned and astringent, and sensitive noses may detect the scent of nail polish. Despite that volatility, it offers lifted raspberry and cherry fruit.
Wine: Ponzi 2015 Dolcetto (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Review: High-toned floral aromas of jasmine open this wine, in a Sauvignon Blanc-reminiscent way, bright and steely on the nose with a touch of reduction and oak following. Dense rich layers of apple, pear and mango define the midpalate.
Wine: RouteStock 2016 Route 121 Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Marin County, North Coast, California, US
Review: This wine smells earthy at first, tastes quite dry and minerally and has a savory edge on the finish. It is nicely austere, very tight in texture and seems to hold its fruit flavors tightly too. With time in the glass the bold character of the Pinot Noir base wine takes over.
Wine: Schramsberg 2012 Redding Ranch Brut Sparkling (Marin County)

Appellation: Septentrio
Review: This full-bodied wine exudes aromas of new leather, sandalwood and black cherries, while the flavors are ripe and mouthfilling. Plenty of tannin coats the palate before the wine slowly releases dark-chocolate and cherry-candy notes on the finish.
Wine: Septentrio 2014 Tempranillo (Lake County)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This is certain to please large crowds, starting with its brilliant pink color and clean aromas of bubblegum, raspberry and chalk. It's taut and tight in texture, with pink-lemonade and fresh framboise flavors that will appease both experts and neophytes.
Wine: Sofia 2017 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Monterey County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Vanilla, caramel and roasted cherry aromas make for a lavish yet not overly rich nose on this bottling from the historic vineyard. The palate offers a similar trio of flavors, proving very familiar if not particularly complex.
Wine: Steele 2014 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Stolo
Review: Showing slightly sour touches on the nose, this estate bottling offers aromas of lemon peels, limeade honeysuckle and apple flesh. It's also very tangy on the palate with lime peels and lemon juice, but delivers a touch of hazelnut warmth and even a flash of marshmallow on the finish.
Wine: Stolo 2016 Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)

Appellation: White Hart Wine
Review: It may be impossible to find a carefully made old-vine Pinot Noir from a single vineyard (McIntyre) for just $25 other than this bottling. Earthy tones of dried red fruit meet with pepper and smoked pork on the nose, while the palate offers dark pomegranate, star anise and a touch of smoke.
Wine: White Hart Wine 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Bogle
Review: Full body, firm structure and well-concentrated fruit flavors make a great combination in this robust wine. It makes the mouth water for a meaty dish to enjoy it with, and it has a good palate-coating sense of richness.
Wine: Bogle 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: This wine has great structure and very focused fruit flavors. Attractive floral and strawberry aromas lead to nicely concentrated fruit and mineral notes that are firmly supported by moderate tannins and a medium to full body.
Wine: Charles B. Mitchell 2013 Reserve Estate Cabernet Franc (Fair Play)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: Despite the low alcohol, this wine does not lack for richness. Its waxy bee pollen scents lead to grapefruit, apple and lemon peel flavors. Stylish acids keep the finish clean and crisp. Drink now and over the next couple of vintages.
Wine: David Hill 2017 Estate Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Highland Valley
Review: Light anise, dark red currant and plump cranberry show on the nose of this Barbera bottling, which exhibits potential as a reliable grape for this warm region. Ample marjoram and star anise reside on the buoyant palate, alongside fresh boysenberry and vanilla flavors.
Wine: Highland Valley 2015 Barbera (San Diego County)

Appellation: Holloran
Review: Currently in a fine drinking window, this dry wine shows exceptional minerality and tart, apple-like fruit. There's a touch of spice as well, and some lightly bitter phenolic notes as it finishes.
Wine: Holloran 2013 Riesling (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Tart red fruit, a pinch of herbs and mushroomy qualities show on the nose of this bottling alongside an intriguing gamy note. There is pomegranate fruit driving the complex palate, which also shows dried shiitakes, more herbs and a bit of barnyard funk.
Wine: Folktale 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: San Diego County, South Coast, California, US
Review: The blend of 32% Cabernet Sauvignon, 32% Merlot, 28% Malbec and 8% Cabernet Franc shows promise for this region, starting with aromas of pressed red cherry and cedar. The sip is quite tangy with red plum, and is made complex by tobacco leaf and Mexican mole spices of cocoa and dried chile.
Wine: Highland Valley 2014 Craftsman Cuvée II Red (San Diego County)

Appellation: Klinker Brick
Review: This wine has an appetizing apple-skin tanginess and slight tannins underneath crisp, vibrant almond and white peach flavors. It's absolutely dry, lean and dramatic.
Wine: Klinker Brick 2017 Grenache Blanc (Lodi)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Review: Named for the soil type in which the vines grow, this sends up a bouquet of rose and sandalwood aromas. The flavors continue with blackbery and orange peel notes, with a dash of cola. At this young age, the tannins are still stiff. An extra year in the bottle should help.
Wine: 2Hawk 2016 Darow Series Pinot Noir (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: A veritable blender's choice, this incorporates grapes from 10 different vineyards. It was fermented using native yeasts and aged 10 months in barrel. It overachieves for the price, with plum, cherry and dried Provençal herb flavors. The tannins are supple and proportionate.
Wine: Brooks 2016 Runaway Red Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Review: This wine's bright plum, vanilla and barrel spice aromas lead to persistent, palate-coating fruit flavors. It's a full-bore, enjoyable interpretation of this variety that shows some warmth on the finish.
Wine: Castillo de Feliciana 2015 Estate Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Concentrated aromas of tobacco, tar, black cherry and charred beef show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. It's fairly tight on the palate, with judicious and not overjoyous black currant as well as tar and hints of dried herb flavors.
Wine: Castoro Cellars 2015 Whale Rock Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine's aromas pop, with blueberry, cherry and woodspice notes and a kiss of dried herb. The flavors are ripe and juicy, with a soft texture.
Wine: Cloudlift Cellars 2015 Panorama Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: Pure concentrated black-cherry flavors light up this wonderfully focused, vibrant and full-bodied wine. It is firm in texture due to moderate tannins and fresh acidity that give a little bite to the mouthfeel.
Wine: Easton 2015 Monarch Mine Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: McKahn
Review: This wine is full-bodied and quite concentrated, starting with oaky cedary aromas that lead to ripe rich blackberry flavors and a broad mouthfilling texture bolstered by moderate tannins.
Wine: McKahn 2016 Grenache (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Review: This wine is highly floral in gardenia and honeysuckle, with a light touch to the oak. Its muscular entry has a slow build up of concentrated apple and pear flavors supported by moderate structure.
Wine: Neyers 2016 El Novillero Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: Dark, concentrated and well-seasoned by oaky smoky spiciness, this full-bodied dry wine has rich blackberry flavors and a velvety texture. It's made from almost equal parts of the Bordeaux grape varieties Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot.
Wine: Oakstone 2015 Estate Vineyard Meritage (Fair Play)

Appellation: Proulx
Review: This is a very berrylicious play on Zinfandel, with strong yet elegant berry and currant aromas as well as touches of violet and lavender. Boysenberry syrup powers the palate and is leveled by white-pepper, dried marjoram and mint flavors, set against loamy earth tones that come through strong on the finish.
Wine: Proulx 2016 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: This wine's unusually bright purple hue is striking, as are the potent, earthy tannins. It was fermented with one third whole clusters, and leaf and stem flavors abound. Its blackberry fruit is ripe enough but hits a wall, shortening the finish. More bottle age is recommended.
Wine: Rex Hill 2015 La Colina Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Candied limes and tangerines meet with slightly reductive notes of grass, lemongrass and kaffir lime on the nose of this beautifully labeled bottling. The palate is extremely tangy and acid-washed, and settles into a pleasant vibe of lime, grapefruit and underripe orange flavors.
Wine: Saint K 2017 Flower Bomb French Camp Vineyard Malvasia Bianca (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: This block selection spent 10 months in 50% new French oak. Its shows lean red berry and brambly fruit, and stem flavors abound. A hint of bacon fat from barrel aging suggests it will be best tucked away for another couple years. Drink 2020–2025.
Wine: Sokol Blosser 2015 Peach Tree Block Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: This cuvée saw a touch more new wood than the regular Willamette Valley bottling, which didn't lack for dark, oaky highlights. There's more of the same here, with espresso, chocolate and charred toast layers. Its black fruit stands firm but just barely above the barrel flavors.
Wine: Territorial 2015 Stone's Throw Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Upper Five
Review: Made from organically grown grapes, this supple, well-ripened wine shows the grape's typical spicy plum and black cherry flavors. The fading color and short finish suggest drinking it sooner than later. Enjoy now–2020.
Wine: Upper Five 2015 Grenache (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: This blend is made from 73% Cabernet Sauvignon, 21% Merlot, 3% Malbec and 3% Petit Verdot. Possessed of a muted earthiness and spicy oak, this wine offers a depth of baked plum and baking spice within full-bodied ripeness and dense power.
Wine: V. Sattui 2013 Paradiso Red (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This full-bodied wine is seriously oaky and tannic, filling the aroma with smoke, cedar and pepper and the flavor with roasted, meaty and darkly fruity flavors like macerated blackberries. The texture is heavily tannic and somewhat drying but the rich fruit notes come back on the finish for relief.
Wine: Vasco Urbano 2015 The Sheriff G-S-M (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: White wines are a rarity in Walla Walla Valley. This blend of 65% Sauvignon Blanc and 35% Semillion has fascinating sweet herb, lemon zest, wildflower and stone fruit aromas. It's full bodied, with dry fruit flavors.
Wine: Adamant Cellars 2016 Bijoux White (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: This is just the second release of this cuvée, which is intended as a sort of benchmark for the AVA's Pinot Noirs. At first taste, it feels just a bit thin, with pomegranate and strawberry fruit and white pepper-like spice. A hint of licorice threads through the finish, and the wine will benefit from aggressive aeration.
Wine: Adelsheim 2015 Breaking Ground Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Pale pink in the glass, this blend of 57% Grenache, 18% Grenache Blanc, 9% Mourvèdre, 6% Roussanne, 5% Carignane and 5% Cinsaut shows light strawberry, melon, lime pith and wet sidewalk aromas on the nose. The palate is reminiscent of a gin and tonic, with strong lime character that cuts into the strawberry flavors.
Wine: Bonny Doon 2017 Vin Gris de Cigare Rosé (Central Coast)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Waxy apple skin, flint and a subdued palate of jasmine and white flowers mark the soul of this light, steely wine, which is reserved in fruit, revealing mostly lemon peel.
Wine: C R Graybehl 2016 Mounts Family Vineyard Grenache Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: This big but non-oaky wine starts with a rich figgy aroma that's slightly funky but engaging. It coats the palate with ripe blackberry, black-cherry and savory notes backed by firm tannins.
Wine: Cavaletti 2016 The 109 Mile Syrah (California)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: The spirit of experimentation is strong in this bottling, which is a pink wine made from a white grape thanks to a dry ice soak with red Grenache for 16 hours, delivering color without red juice. The result is a beautiful light-pink color, aromas of rose petal, strawberry and nectarine and a zippy palate with tightly wound flavors of lemon and tart raspberry.
Wine: Le Mistral 2017 Single Vineyard Rosé of Grenache Blanc (Monterey County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine offers pleasing café au lait, black raspberry, cherry, graphite and spice aromas. It has lovely polished and balanced blackberry and raspberry flavors that dip slightly in the middle before coming back together on the finish.
Wine: Cloudlift Cellars 2015 Halcyon Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Review: Light bodied and fresh tasting, this wine has a pale-pink color, delicate watermelon and raspberry flavors and a lively crisp mouthfeel. Its appetizing palate-cleansing aspect will pair well with a wide variety of foods.
Wine: Fleur 2017 Pinot Noir Rosé (North Coast)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: This is a tight, lean and refreshing wine with minimal ripeness but great acidity and a very clean palate-cleansing texture. It's just the thing for acid freaks and will light up pairings like goat cheese and seafood.
Wine: Graziano 2016 Dry Chenin Blanc (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: The single clone offerings from Kason are all quite similar. Like the Dijon 777 bottling, this delivers blackberry and black cherry fruit, with interesting sandalwood and toasted coconut highlights. There's a whiff of leather too, but it's light enough to be a feature rather than a flaw.
Wine: Kason 2015 Dijon 115 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: The majority of this wine is made from Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec, with smaller amounts of Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc, Tempranillo, Syrah and Merlot. Burly, expansive and rich, the tannins are billowy and supportive, underlining the strong flavors of mocha, tobacco and sage.
Wine: Krupp Brothers 2015 Water Witch Stagecoach Vineyard Red (Napa Valley)

Appellation: RoxyAnn
Review: There's lovely fruit here, reminiscent of blackberries, loganberries, cherries and raspberries, along with some scents of overripe fruit. Drinking more mature than other recent vintages, it's light at first, opening into citrus highlights. It includes 12% Cabernet Sauvignon and 4% Merlot and was aged in 40% new oak.
Wine: RoxyAnn 2013 Malbec (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: This slightly rustic wine brings brambly fruit and underbrush notes front and center. It was fermented using wild yeasts and aged in 15% new Oregon oak. It's a fairly lightweight, approachable style that subtly suggests soda pop. Drink over the next two or three years.
Wine: Scenic Valley Farms 2016 Hare Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: This lively wine shows pretty red berry and cherry fruit, with tart acidity. A small portion was fermented using native yeasts and underwent extended maceration; 44% spent 17 months in new French oak. The tannins are chewy and finish with strong herbal flavors.
Wine: Sokol Blosser 2015 Old Vineyard Block Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Yountville, Napa, California, US
Review: Generously oaky and exuberant in golden raisin, this has nutmeg and vanilla highlights on the nose, followed by an intensely rich round palate that veers into tropical territory. Underlying acidity helps to brighten the finish.
Wine: V. Sattui 2016 Carsi Vineyard Chardonnay (Yountville)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: This wine emphasizes stem and leaf flavors, led by green tea and bitter herb notes. And yet, it's a complex, interesting wine, showing light wild berry an earthy highlights. The tannins are granular and carry the herbal character through the finish.
Wine: Van Duzer 2015 Norris McKinley Vineyard Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Review: While most Oregon rosés are made from Pinot Noir, this Grenache-based wine delivers more robust fruit—a tangy mix of grapefruit, strawberry and peach pit flavors. Good concentration and weight and plenty of supportive acidity make this one of the sturdier rosés of the season.
Wine: 2Hawk 2017 Grenache Rosé (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This Albariño, the vines for which were planted specifically for the winery, has high-toned orange oil, melon rind and tangerine aromas. It's richly flavorful, with abundant tangerine flavors and ale notes on the finish that might integrate with time. It intrigues.
Wine: Adamant Cellars 2017 Gateshead Vineyard Albariño (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: There are very ripe aromas of apple, pear and guava on the nose of this blend of 55% Roussanne and 45% Grenache Blanc. There's a strong pithy character to the palate, which offers ripe flavors of honeysuckle, jasmine, guava and pineapple.
Wine: Andrew Murray 2016 Enchanté Curtis Vineyard White (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Ripe aromas of pear flesh and yellow-apple slices meet with a hint of butter and lots of chalk on the nose of this blend of 67% Grenache Blanc and 33% Roussanne. The palate offers grapefruit-skin, nectarine and pear flesh flavors, proving very easy to quaff if not overly complex.
Wine: Bonny Doon 2016 Le Cigare Blanc Reserve White (Central Coast)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Examples of this variety are rare in the state. Pale in color, this one offers anise, cherry, rose hip, tar, pencil eraser and spice aromas. The palate is highly structured, with tart acidity and firm tannins.
Wine: Cana's Feast 2013 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Nebbiolo (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: This cuvée opens with a floral bouquet and a hint of powdered sugar. On the palate, you'll find raspberry hard candy flavors, buoyed by citrus accents. Drink slightly chilled while it's young and fresh.
Wine: Carlton Cellars 2016 Seven Devils Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Charles & Charles
Review: Blended with 14% Cabernet Sauvignon, this enjoyable wine brings raspberry and red currant aromas that feel pure, with no obvious new oak influence. The flavors are sleek and juicy.
Wine: Charles & Charles 2016 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Clos La Chance
Review: Concentrated aromas of black plum, licorice, sage and bay leaf show on the fragrant nose of this bottling. The palate offers rounded flavors of cherry and plum set against tobacco and cedar shavings.
Wine: Clos La Chance 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Review: Waxy apple and melon dominate on the nose of this dry, moderately structured wine. It is a pretty and floral expression of the grape and does it justice within a light-bodied focus of ripeness.
Wine: Fleur 2016 Estate Vineyards Vermentino (Carneros)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Review: The airplane shown landing on a freeway on this wine's front label commemorates an incident involving winemaker Marc Girardet. Though the name is not a football reference, this would be a fine tailgate party wine. It's dark, firm, plummy and a bit tannic, made from 50% Cabernet Sauvignon and 50% Syrah.
Wine: Girardet 2015 Touchdown Red (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Made in a Brut style from 70% Pinot Noir and 30% Chardonnay, this sparkling wine is high in acidity with a metallic edge to the palate, simple and dry in execution with highlights of tart applesauce and lemon zest.
Wine: Korbel 2014 Natural Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Always an easy-to-find rosé offering, this bottling shows raspberry, rose petals and a hint of flint on the nose. The texture is chalky, carrying riper strawberry tones and more crushed rock flavors.
Wine: Noble Vines 2017 515 Vine Select Rosé (Central Coast)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This has a pretty nose and a meaty quality to the body and texture, and a medium-bodied core highlighted in melon, peach and apricot flavors. The finish revisits the floral.
Wine: Quivira 2016 Wine Creek Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sass
Review: Though made entirely in stainless steel, this wine exhibits a lightly toasty character in both the aroma and flavor. Its racy fruit flavors recall cucumber, apple and white melon. It drinks lighter than the alcohol suggests but would be delightful with white fish or poultry.
Wine: Sass 2016 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: This big fruit bowl of a white wine is loaded with off-dry lemon, apple and peach flavors. There is no oak influence, and the sweetness is complemented with natural acidity.
Wine: Sokol Blosser 2017 Estate Cuvée Müller-Thurgau (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Sokol Blosser
Review: This wine's appealing freshness and minerality overrides all else—in a good way. It's clean and bracing, with citrus rind and grapefruit flavors.
Wine: Sokol Blosser 2017 Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: The Lost Chapters
Review: Perfumed in leather, violet and cedar, this wine is ripe and intensely dense in blackberry and blueberry cobbler, with a soft underlying structure.
Wine: The Lost Chapters 2014 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Waterbrook
Review: This wine's black currant, incense, dark plum and spice aromas lead to soft, ripe blue and black fruit flavors. Lightly grainy tannins provide support.
Wine: Waterbrook 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This blend of 40% Malbec, 30% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Petit Verdot and 10% Merlot brings dill, leafy herb, cherry and spice aromas. The flavors are tart, with pleasingly bright acidity. Cherry and orange zest notes linger on the finish. It's intriguing and very well made but comes off as quite green.
Wine: Adamant Cellars 2014 Nalin Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: Quite lively in flavor, this medium-bodied wine exudes bright raspberry and red-cherry aromas, and has good acidity and vivid fruit flavors. It should be a versatile food wine due to the pinpoint balance.
Wine: Amador Cellars 2015 Fields Family Vineyards Barbera (Amador County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: In this blend of 70% Cabernet Sauvignon, 15% Merlot, 10% Cabernet Franc, 4% Malbec and 1% Petit Verdot, well-defined plum, baking spice, cedar, raspberry and anise aromas lead to somewhat light, tart, cranberry flavors. It has fine acidity.
Wine: Arbor Crest 2015 Dionysus Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: Bright, rose-tinged copper in color, this fresh young wine brings lemon and strawberry flavors, with a tart, juicy attack. It's the sort of rosé that's perfect for a summer picnic, with enough heft to stand up to all that fried chicken.
Wine: Brooks 2017 Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Clos LaChance
Review: Broad aromas of yellow pear and nectarine meld with hints of butter and gunmetal on the nose. There is decent tension to the palate, where Bosc pear and Gravenstein apple flavors arise.
Wine: Clos LaChance 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

Appellation: Dancing Crow
Review: Good varietal character comes through as this full-bodied wine moves from black-olive and light herb aromas through ripe black-cherry flavors and a rich velvety moderately tannic texture.
Wine: Dancing Crow 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lake County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Floral rose petal and black tea open the nose to this wine, which is simple in its approach, tangy in acidity and fruity in cherry and strawberry. There's an air of baking spice that dots the finish.
Wine: Davis Bynum 2015 Jane's Vineyard Clone 667 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Elouan
Review: Those who enjoy Joe Wagner's California-style Pinot Noirs will find this quite comfortable. Its tart wild berry fruit comes with a plush streak of vanilla. Some coffee and tobacco highlights follow. There's plenty of power and flavor, but don't look for varietal specificity.
Wine: Elouan 2016 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

Appellation: Fossil Point
Review: Delicate aromas of key lime, squeezed lemon and wet cement show on the nose of this widely available, affordably priced wine from the Center of Effort team. It's a lighter take on the palate as well, where fresh citrus spray, grapefruit and wet cement show.
Wine: Fossil Point 2016 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Review: Girardet's Bush Vine series explores the winery's recent plantings of Spanish and Italian varieties. From a dry-farmed, high-elevation (800 feet) site, this offers delicate tobacco leaf, plum tomato and strawberry jam flavors. Like many Girardet reds, it has a subtle streak of leather and shows no signs of new oak.
Wine: Girardet 2015 Bush Vine Sangiovese (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: This is a well-mannered wine with complementary characteristics of fruit and spice in the aroma, blackberry and leather in the flavor, and richness matched with light tannins in the texture. It's full bodied and well balanced.
Wine: Holly's Hill 2016 Petit Patriarche Red (El Dorado)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: This looks and drinks older than its vintage and may already be at its peak. Its pretty raspberry fruit has a baked pastry character, and the mouthfeel is soft and rounded. The tannins are unintrusive and the finish just slightly chalky. Drink up.
Wine: Kason 2015 Reserva Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: Fermented and aged in stainless steel, this crisp white wine tastes of fresh apples, with light veins of vanilla and almond. It's pleasant, quaffable and perfect for sipping on a mild day when you're torn between opening a white or a light red.
Wine: Left Coast Cellars 2017 White Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Liberty Lake
Review: This wine's baking spice, cherry, vanilla, coconut and anise aromas are followed by soft, saturated red and black fruit flavors. It shows polish, but the oak juts out.
Wine: Liberty Lake 2013 Merlot (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Mabera
Review: Herb and spice aromas compete for attention in this dual-personality medium-bodied wine. At first sniff it has a vanilla character that stands apart from the strong grassy flavors but with time in the glass they merge nicely.
Wine: Mabera 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This bottling is very tightly wound and light on the nose, showing only hints of white peach, lemon rind and crushed gravel. It's clean and easy on the palate, with crisp flavors of lemon juice, rose petal and Meyer lemon rind that broaden a bit on the finish.
Wine: Morgan 2017 Rosé of Grenache (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Murphy-Goode
Review: This medium-bodied wine has a light floral aroma, lots of fresh apple and peach flavors and accents of vanilla and butter. A dose of good, fresh fruit acidity livens up the mouthfeel and seems to brighten the flavors.
Wine: Murphy-Goode 2016 Chardonnay (California)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This blends 57% Sauvignon Blanc and 43% Gewürztraminer with no barrel aging, is ready to go with its exuberantly floral nose and sparkling acidity. Steely on the palate, it's easy to enjoy and light on its feet, with a fleeting intensity on the finish.
Wine: Pedroncelli 2017 Friends White (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Roth
Review: Baking spices and brioche give this wine a warmth on the nose and palate—aspects that complement the baked cherry and berry richness at its core. Hearty and smoky, it's fruit forward and full bodied, easily approachable and enjoyable now.
Wine: Roth 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This take on skin-contact Viognier works, but won't be for everyone. Murky in the glass, it shows aromas of smashed honeydew, melon rind and Meyer lemon on the edges. The palate is where things get interesting, with a creamy mouthfeel delivering flavors of orange bitters, lemon rind and honeydew candies. It's a great conversation starter.
Wine: Ruby Cellars 2016 Orange Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: San Simeon
Review: Flinty aromas meet with apple peels, lime rinds and pear flesh on the nose of this bottling. That flinty character just shows briefly on the palate, which warms up toward dried limes, yellow apples and a touch of grass.
Wine: San Simeon 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Monterey, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Light and almost effervescent in the glass, this bottling shows honeydew, kaffir lime, lemongrass and a hint of wet cement on the nose. The palate is lively with racy acidity and a stony minerality, offering melon and pink lemonade flavors, though it is ever-so-slightly lacking in the midpalate.
Wine: Scheid 2016 San Lucas Vineyard Grenache Blanc (Monterey)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Review: This wine is a potpourri of floral aromas and earthy mint. It is a tight-grained high-toned varietal wine that's edgy in tannins and strawberry-rhubarb tartness.
Wine: Senders 2014 Mahoney Ranch Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Review: The nose on this bottling starts with alkaline and quinine touches before evolving into fresh lemon blossoms, almonds and toast. The palate is toasty and nutty as well, set against a fresh citrus backdrop.
Wine: Talbott 2016 Logan Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This wine is likably soft and approachable, its tannins mellowed and playing a supporting role. Huckleberry richness meets brown sugar on the palate, with a slightly smoky undertone for contrast.
Wine: Tamber Bey 2016 Walala Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Territorial
Review: This wine's black fruit penetrates the palate, cloaked in smoke, espresso and dark chocolate accents. It spent 18 months in one quarter new French oak, and the barrel notes dominate, leading to expectations of length and power. But the wine tapers quickly, leaving wheat straw and cracker impressions.
Wine: Territorial 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Torial
Review: Dark in raspberry-cordial flavors and richness, this concentrated wine has underlying flashes of high-toned acidity that keep it refreshing, with lasting highlights of cedar and currant.
Wine: Torial 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Review: This offers jammy cranberry and raspberry aromas, with lemon peel notes and kisses of barrel spice. The palate brings a pleasing texture and sweet fruit flavors, finishing with fruit leather notes. A unique interpretation of a variety rarely seen in Walla Walla Valley.
Wine: Viola 2015 Dugger Creek Vineyard Barbera (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Darker in color than recent vintages, this wine brings very pretty aromas of cherry, herb and watermelon that lead to bone-dry fruit flavors with sharp-edged acidity. It needs some food alongside it to tame that tartness.
Wine: Waters 2017 Patina Vineyard Rosé (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Review: Subtle and pleasant aromas of lemon rind, nectarine, key lime and the hint of toast show on the nose of this well restrained Viognier. There are tropical touches of guava on the sip, but the lime flavors, strong acidity and grippy texture keep it in line.
Wine: Wilson Creek 2016 Chloe Vineyard Viognier (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Clarksburg, Central Valley, California, US
Review: This dramatic wine is no wallflower. It has a bright light-yellow color, striking aromas of chicken stock and wet earth that contrast with the tangy white-peach and grapefruit flavors that follow. It's very light in alcohol but feels medium bodied.
Wine: Wise Villa 2016 Estate Albariño (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: Cedary, floral aromas and powerful fruit and oak-spice flavors make this very full-bodied wine really fun to taste. It's unusual in the level of interesting complexity it offers.
Wine: Amador Cellars 2014 Farmhouse Red (Amador County)

Appellation: Bella Grace
Review: Herbal, grassy, peppery aromas and flavors give a big personality to this tangy, assertive but light-bodied wine. It has crisp acidity and taut balance.
Wine: Bella Grace 2017 Vermentino (Amador County)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: This is an attractive well-made dry wine that smells fruity and spicy, tastes moderately ripe and has a firm texture that will help it pair well with rich food. It's well balanced and medium bodied.
Wine: Bliss 2015 Blissful Red (Mendocino)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: A light herbal aroma leads to fresh and tangy but subdued citrus flavors in this light-bodied wine. It was made without oak aging, so the lean lemon and crisp apple notes and light but firm texture define it.
Wine: Nottingham Cellars 2017 Unoaked Ernest Wente Vineyard Micro-Lot Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Pendulum
Review: This wine's fresh black currant, plum and herb aromas are followed by lightly green fruit flavors. There's no mistaking the variety, but it seems a bit hollow in the middle.
Wine: Pendulum 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Thick and dense with a strong grapey character, this wine is raisiny in baked plum as well as richly layered with a taste of cherry pie and vanilla.
Wine: Puccioni 2015 Puccioni Ranch Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: Berry patch and brown sugar combine for a forceful, sumptuous and richly concentrated expression of the variety, which represents 100% here. Mint and leather abound along a simple structure and texture that's soft and layered.
Wine: Ravenswood 2015 Dickerson Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Redhawk
Review: This young Pinot Gris saw enough skin contact to color it a pale copper. Made from estate-grown fruit, it has fresh and pretty cut pear flavors, buoyed with lemony acids. As a testament to its youth, a hint of yeasty bread comes through, also.
Wine: Redhawk 2017 Pinot Gris (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Saintsbury
Review: Grainy, this wine is youthfully grippy and textured, with moderate acidity and layers of green apple, stone fruit and melon. Light on its feet, it's fresh and fleshy.
Wine: Saintsbury 2016 Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Review: Sourced from the estate vineyard, this well-balanced wine matches its slightly sweet golden apple flavors with a brisk hint of white radish. Ample acidity supports the fruit, which was cold-fermented in neutral French oak barrels.
Wine: Sass 2016 Walnut Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
