Review: This wine is mostly Merlot (84%), with the balance smidgens of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. With fruit coming from Quintessence, Red Willow, Ciel du Cheval, Klipsun and Olsen vineyards, the aromas leap up, with notes of toast, raspberry, earth, coffee bean, bittersweet chocolate and spice that show a lot of detail. The cherry and coffee flavors are polished and seamless in feel, lingering on the finish.
Wine: Mark Ryan 2015 Long Haul Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Review: Jasmine and orange blossom aromas start off this wine. The palate brings spicy oak and melon flavors cut through by steely, bright acidity. Creaminess ultimately wins out on the finish.
Wine: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2016 Southworth Estate Grown Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: Elegant and well balanced, this medium-bodied wine smells like roses and black cherries, has concentrated and focused fruit flavors, and a light grip in the texture due to moderate lip-smacking tannins and fresh acidity. It's very attractive in a somewhat lean style.
Wine: Meyer Family Cellars 2016 Peterson Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Baked black plums, toffee, cappuccino and loam aromas show on this dessert blend of 60% Touriga, 21% Tinta Cao and 19% Souzao. The palate shows heft wrapped in sweetness, with flavors of raisin, tobacco, quince paste and dark chocolate enveloped in a refreshing acidity.
Wine: PasoPort 2009 Violeta Portray Port (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Oregano, thyme and pepper give spice to the plum-jam and raspberry-sorbet aromas on the nose of this bottling. The palate is quite rich with ripe fruit at first but then picks up a savory side, showing roast pork in plum sauce flavors along with lavender and rosemary.
Wine: Peachy Canyon 2015 Mustang Springs Zinfandel (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Thacher
Review: Very floral and pungent aromas of melon, poached apple and canned pear make for an intriguing entry into this bottling. There is tremendous zest to the sip, with high-toned citrus flavors lifting the apple flavors. It's very tasty and zippy.
Wine: Thacher 2017 Chenin Blanc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Trujillo
Review: This lengthy, robust and well-integrated wine is smoothly layered in mocha, toasted oak and coconut flavors. It is soft on the palate, with ripe blackberry and currant tones. Small amounts of Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Petit Verdot are blended in.
Wine: Trujillo 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine is near equal parts Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, with the balance Cabernet Franc. Coming from a who's who of vineyards, the aromas are expressive, with notes of leafy dried herb, graphite, raspberry, cherry, toast, scorched earth, dark coffee and mineral. The palate shows an assortment of sweet red- and black-fruit flavors that display an exquisite sense of balance and polish. It's a superb value with a long life ahead of it.
Wine: Avennia 2015 Gravura Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine is a blend of 75% Merlot, 15% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Petit Verdot. Somewhat lighter in color, the aromas bring notes of cedar, raspberry, cherry, thyme, pencil eraser, flower and exotic spice. The palate shows restraint and finesse, especially considering the warmth of the vintage. It's a pretty, understated wine that should cellar well.
Wine: Betz Family 2015 Clos de Betz Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Roasted red berries, uncracked peppercorns, smoked beef and wood spice show on the nose of this blend of 63% Syrah, 19% Petite Sirah, 9% Mourvèdre and 9% Primitivo. The palate starts with ripe black plum and smoked pork in berry sauce flavors, then is dusted with white pepper. It is still a young wine at five-years-old.
Wine: Caliza 2013 Cohort Red (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Goldeneye
Review: This is a full-bodied, ripe and mouthfilling wine that offers generous black-plum and black-cherry flavors, a smooth texture and a lingering finish. The aroma is nicely spiced in new oak accents that meld well with the black fruits on the palate.
Wine: Goldeneye 2015 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Gramercy
Review: Aromas of dried herb, raspberry, moist earth and pencil lead are followed by soft elegant red- and black-fruit flavors. It shows a very pretty, understated styling, with a fine sense of acidity backing it up. Raspberry flavors linger on the finish. There's a wonderful sense of freshness to it, and it has a very long life in front of it.
Wine: Gramercy 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This wine is bursting in lavish aromas of blueberry, black currant and fudge that lead into a palate full of mouthcoating tannins and solid acidity. Blackberry, black plum and dried herb flavors complete the picture.
Wine: J. Lohr 2015 Hilltop Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This variety is rarely found in California. Strong aromas of tobacco, river rocks, black peppercorns, dried herbs and rustic elderberry dominate the nose. The palate is full of herbs, spice and crushed rocks, yet rounded by dark berries, oak, coffee and crème brûlée to make a complete experience.
Wine: Jason-Stephens 2013 Swing Carmenère (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This is a lovely colored and refreshing wine, well made and satisfyingly thirst-quenching and fresh. Light bodied, it shares a wealth of high-toned orange, grapefruit and Meyer lemon, the flavors commingling with balance and grace.
Wine: Kokomo 2017 Pauline's Vineyard Grenache Rosé (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Clarksburg, Central Valley, California, US
Review: This dry refreshing wine seems alive with tangy acidity and delicate citrus and floral flavors. It feels light bodied, crisp and appealing—just the thing for a summertime lunch and with simply prepared seafood.
Wine: Markus Wine Co 2017 Nuvola Grand Island Vineyards Gewürztraminer (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Blended with 16% Sémillon, pleasing aromas of kiwi, lemongrass, candle wax, citrus, lees and poached pear lead to the full-bodied, textured palate. It shows an exquisite sense of balance along with a fig-filled finish.
Wine: Novelty Hill 2016 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Rococo
Review: Tight aromas of guava, nectarine and bubblegum show on the nose of this bottling by young winemaker Natalie Darr. The supple yet racy palate is framed by intensely bright acidity and a solid grip, delivering flavors of white cherry, fresh Pink Lady apple and rounded melon.
Wine: Rococo 2017 Chenin Blanc (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Sculpterra
Review: Lighter in body and color, yet full of exotic plum, mulberry, sumac and cinnamon aromas, this is a very fresh and taut Pinot Noir from Paso Robles. It's full in body despite its light color, with brilliant acidity and snappy mouthfilling flavors of raspberry, cranberry, fennel pollen and soy.
Wine: Sculpterra 2015 Pinot Noir (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: Nice touches of cedar and earth in the aromas and flavors add complexity to this big but well-balanced wine. It is full bodied, moderately tannic and has a hint of good acidity to keep it fresh and appetizing on the palate.
Wine: V. Sattui 2014 Amador Ridge Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Cabernet Sauvignon makes up 56% of this blend, with the balance Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Malbec and Petit Verdot. It's locked up on first pour, with notes of barrel spice, dark chocolate, graphite, cassis, green herb and purple flower. The palate brings abundant cherry flavors backed by brawny, slightly astringent tannins. It shows a lot more tannic heft than this vineyard is often known for, needing significant time to settle in. Best after 2024.
Wine: L'Ecole No. 41 2015 Perigee Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: MacRostie
Review: Beautiful aromas of crisp cherry, raspberry and blueberry accentuate a this lean, light expression. The medium-bodied palate is undeniable earthy, with a well-measured balance of fruit.
Wine: MacRostie 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Exotic in wild mushroom and forest floor, this wine is tannic with plenty of body and power, seasoned in savory Asian spice and a lasting lushness of dark cherry.
Wine: MacRostie 2015 Wildcat Mountain Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Mostly coming from Angela's and Ciel du Cheval Vineyard along with a dash of Olsen, the aromas exude notes of spice, orange peel, flower, olive, iron and huckleberry. The palate is chock-full of raspberry and blue-fruit flavors that persist on the finish. It's a delicious ripe interpretation of this variety.
Wine: Mark Ryan 2015 Wild Eyed Syrah (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This is stainless steel-fermented and aged wine, whole-cluster pressed, that's juicy and broadly expansive in cherry, citrus and peach. Lovely, it is memorably fresh with an underlying meatiness that presents like charcuterie, with which it would successfully pair.
Wine: Metzker Family Estates 2017 Rosé of Syrah (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Review: An enticing mix of fresh berries, orange rind and herbs carries the nose of this reserve bottling. A plush, soft palate of red-fruit flavors is bolstered by a grip of tannins and a bed of acidity. This is a well-structured Pinot Noir that offers nice length and persistence.
Wine: Millbrook 2015 Proprietor's Special Reserve Pinot Noir (New York)

Appellation: Oakville, Napa, California, US
Review: This is a high-toned wine from a site in the heart of the appellation. Dried herb and tobacco show up on the nose, with a hint of black olive. The densely packed flavors of dark cherry and black licorice lean into rich, supportive tannins and a lush finish.
Wine: Nickel & Nickel 2015 John C. Sullenger Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: A blend of fruit from the esteemed Boushey and Olsen vineyards, initially reserved aromas of blackberry, blue fruit, barrel spice, herb and whiffs of olive lead to full-bodied fruit flavors that coat the palate. It doesn't hold back, showing the ripeness of the vintage.
Wine: Sparkman 2014 Darkness Syrah (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Monterey County-Sonoma County-Santa Barbara County, California Other, California, US
Review: This is a snappy yet flavorful wine with an expressive aroma of toasted oak, cranberry, cherry and black tea, and flavors that are just-ripe and centered around tasty black cherry. It is medium- to full-bodied, has moderate tannins, good acidity and a lingering finish.
Wine: Verada 2016 Tri-County Pinot Noir (Monterey County-Sonoma County-Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: The counterpart to the producer's Vin Clair (the white version), this blends 58% Pinot Noir and 48% Chardonnay from the same sites into a Beaujolais-like bright, light red that will do well serve slightly chilled. Pungent in earth, it offers dusty flavors of cherry and pomegranate, with a buzzy energy from the high-toned acidity.
Wine: Brick & Mortar 2017 Vin Rubis Red (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Divum
Review: There's a great animalistic streak on this bottling by fourth-generation farmers Tom and Rob Franscioni, with aromas of game hide as well as bursting cranberries and wet slate on the nose. The animal flavors meet with campfire smoke on the palate, with supportive red fruit, acidity and tannins to hold it all together.
Wine: Divum 2015 Pinot Noir (Monterey)

Appellation: Falcone
Review: The Falcones can't keep this bottling in stock, which is why the 2016 is already released. It's young, but already aromas of concentrated black plum, thyme, herbs and purple flowers are showing on the nose. There's an elegance to the energetic palate with flavors of Chinese five-spice, soy, black pepper and baked boysenberry, finishing with gingersnaps.
Wine: Falcone 2016 Syrah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Bennett Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This wine opens, interestingly, with aspects of charcuterie, nuts and oak. Robust on the palate in body and texture, it offers a wealth of supportive acidity and a brightness of grapefruit peel.
Wine: Frostwatch 2016 Kismet Sauvignon Blanc (Bennett Valley)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Dark red cherries, marinated olives and a slowly rising sense of dried herbs show on the nose of this fairly mellow bottling. The herbs and cracked peppercorn take center stage on the palate, with hints of cocoa and darker cherry fruit.
Wine: I. Brand & Family 2015 Bates Ranch Cabernet Franc (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This is a fascinating cool-climate Syrah that's very affordable. Pure aromas of black currant, smoke, pepper and roasted lamb lead into a savory palate loaded with roasted pork and white pepper. The bright acidity drives deep into the finish.
Wine: Joyce 2016 Tondre Grapefield Syrah (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: A blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, this successful sparkler is rich and expansive in dark cherry and strawberry, with bold layers of flavor and texture. It offers plenty of acidity to balance the lasting lushness on the palate.
Wine: Keller 2015 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Review: From an estate-farmed property, this tiny production is robust in thick, dense black cherry, black licorice and leather. The core of the wine's full-bodied profile is juicy, rich and concentrated.
Wine: Blue Farm 2015 Anne Katherina Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: This off-dry wine offers intense aromas of crushed stone, honeycomb and apple skins. The palate is textured and round in juicy peach and melon flavors yet balanced by a lively vein of lemon-lime acidity. Lemon honey lingers on the finish.
Wine: Fox Run 2014 Lot 11 Lake Dana Vineyard Riesling (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Gramercy
Review: This wine is a blend of Oldfield and Minnick vineyards in the Yakima Valley and Forgotten Hills and Old Stones in Walla Walla Valley. Aromas of red and black raspberries, anise, olives, smoked meat, high-toned herb and flower are followed by pure, textured red-fruit flavors that dance across the palate. It's a pretty expression of the variety.
Wine: Gramercy 2014 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Greystone
Review: Nicely balanced and full flavored, this medium-bodied wine deftly blends buttery, spicy notes with fresh, lemony ones for a good, mouth-coating yet lively sensation on the palate. Made for the Culinary Institute in Napa Valley, this is one of their best efforts yet.
Wine: Greystone 2015 Chardonnay (California)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Dried strawberries, Bing cherries and plum skins meet with savory elements of soy, sesame and nori wrap on the nose of this affordably priced bottling. There's an iodine touch to the palate, where intriguing flavors of black cherry, sumac and violets arise.
Wine: Hitching Post 2015 Cork Dancer Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This is a side project from Mark Ryan winemaker Mike Macmorran, focusing on fruit from one of the state's top vineyards. Blended with 8% Merlot and 4% Cabernet Franc, the aromas bring notes of sweet dried herb, dried leaf, pink peppercorn and black cherry, not fully ready to reveal their charms. The flavors are quite restrained, mixing fruit and savory notes with sneaky structure. It's a very pretty expression of this variety that calls out to the Old World and should have a long life ahead of it.
Wine: Manu Propria 2014 Ex Animo Red Willow Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: A blend of fruit from Quintessence, Ciel du Cheval, Klipsun and Obelisco vineyards, the aromas draw you into the glass, with notes of luxurious barrel spice, black-cherry meats, high-cacao chocolate, blackberry, high-toned herb, crème de cassis, dried earth, coffee and graphite. The palate is loaded with sweet cherry flavors that display a slightly linear styling at first, fleshing out a bit over time.
Wine: Mark Ryan 2015 Dead Horse Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: This is a structured and robustly built wine from a great site on the southern end of the appellation. Blueberry, red cherry and cedar all stand out, along with a spicy twist of nutmeg that persists on the lengthy finish.
Wine: Rock Wall 2016 Hendry Vineyard Block 29 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Made from Syrah, Grenache and a trio of Rhône whites (Viognier, Grenache Blanc and Marsanne), this is a delightfully playful wine, pungently floral in wild strawberry, orange and peach. Fully explosive in velvety texture, it finishes crisp and fresh in acidity.
Wine: Three Sticks 2017 Casteñada Rosé (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Trinitas
Review: This is a big wine, full of smoky dark-fruit flavors and supported by firm tannins and a framework of spicy oak. It's nicely dry, has a gripping texture, very full body and complex flavor elements like black pepper, blackberries, beef jus and molasses. Best after 2021.
Wine: Trinitas 2015 Zinfandel (El Dorado)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Review: Fresh, vivid and well-structured, this intensely fruity wine has great acidity and firm tannins to balance it beautifully. It tastes very focused on raspberry and black cherry, fills the mouth with layers of fruit and has an appetizing bite on the finish.
Wine: Black Saint Peter 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Dried rose petals, thyme and blueberries show on the nose of this bottling from the winery's small production estate varietal series. It's smooth on the palate, with caramelized blueberry, vanilla and cappuccino flavors framed by relatively high acid for such a dark wine.
Wine: Derby 2014 Derby Vineyard Petit Verdot (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Doubleback
Review: This wine is a blend of fruit from estate sites McQueen, Bob Healey and Lefore along with Pepper Bridge. The aromas draw you into the glass, with notes of high cacao chocolate, spice, bay leaf, dried flower, cassis, raspberry, herb and cherry, showing pleasing complexities. The black-currant, cherry and spice flavors coat the palate, bringing a sense of richness but still restraint and vibrancy.
Wine: Doubleback 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Review: Smooth rounded edges of white peach, strawberry and yeasty brioche combine effortlessly in this medium-bodied bubbly blend of mostly Pinot Noir with 10% Chardonnay. Light and dry, it offers just enough richness to match up to seafood and appetizers.
Wine: Gloria Ferrer 2014 Late Disgorged Brut Rosé Sparkling (Carneros)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: A blend of fruit from Gramercy Estate, Les Collines and Olsen vineyards, this wine was aged in a mixture of new and neutral American and French oak. The aromas are reserved, with notes of spice, raspberry, graphite and red cherry along with pleasing herb accents. The flavors show a lot of nuance and sophistication along with a tart finish laced with orange peel notes. Soft tannins provide support. It's a winner.
Wine: Gramercy 2014 Inigo Montoya Tempranillo (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: With all of the fruit coming from Quintessence Vineyard from vines planted in 2012 for the winery, this blend is 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 30% Merlot, 8% Cabernet Franc and 2% Petit Verdot. The aromas start out high toned, with notes of generous barrel spice, assorted herb, black currant, graphite, scorched earth, cocoa and dark plum. The flavors are reserved in style, broadening over time, showing a lot of sophistication.
Wine: Mark Ryan 2015 Water Witch Red (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This bold and firmly structured wine has effusive fruit aromas and flavors, full body and plenty of fine-grained tannins for a gripping mouthfeel. It smells intensely like cranberries and black cherries and tastes vivid, tart and fruit-focused. It is well-built for aging and should improve through at least 2023.
Wine: Nottingham Cellars 2014 Casa De Vinas Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Uvaggio
Review: This bold and very enjoyable wine goes big on the fresh fruity components while seasoning them with accents of wood smoke and black pepper. It's full bodied, not very tannic and seems to overflow with blackberry and blueberry flavors.
Wine: Uvaggio 2016 Primitivo (Lodi)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: Thick and broad-shouldered in ripeness, this hearty blend of 69% Cabernet Sauvignon and 31% Cabernet Franc is accented by blackberry, tar, leather and coffee. The tannins are robust and youthful.
Wine: Viader 2015 Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Vineyard 511
Review: This wine offers tones of anise, black currant and sage that play along a thread of forceful tannin and French oak. The palate offers a density of jammy cherry and dark chocolate that persists through a spicy finish.
Wine: Vineyard 511 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: This is a hugely ripe, robust wine that imparts smoky char, black pepper, clove and cinnamon. Smoothly textured, it is well integrated in terms of oak and power, with plenty of old-vine red-cherry and blackberry character.
Wine: Ballentine 2015 Reserve Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon (41%), Syrah (39%), Petit Verdot (15%) and Merlot, the aromas are fruit forward, with notes of raspberry compote and plum along with thyme and other herbs. The palate is chock-full of plump fruit flavors backed by soft tannins.
Wine: Betz Family 2015 Possibility Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon (41%), Syrah (39%), Petit Verdot (15%) and Merlot, the aromas are fruit forward, with notes of raspberry compote and plum along with thyme and other herbs. The palate is chock-full of plump fruit flavors backed by soft tannins.
Wine: Betz Family 2015 Possibility Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Made in tiny amounts, this wine is all about earthy compost and rose garden, thick in tannins and a weighty density that shows a committed concentration of tangy fruit.
Wine: Blue Farm 2015 1861 Vineyard Estate Farmed Pinot Noir (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Camlow
Review: Subdued in forest floor and earthy compost, this wine is fresh and spicy in equal measure, with a medium-bodied ripeness and embrace of black cherry and cola.
Wine: Camlow 2014 Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: Aromas like green apple slices precede flavors like Anjou pears, butter and almonds in this medium- to full-bodied wine that blends the unorthodox Verdelho grape variety with Chardonnay, Riesling and Sémillon. Crisp acidity matches a certain richness for good balance, and helps create a lingering attractive finish.
Wine: Fenestra 2016 True White (California)

Appellation: Frostwatch
Review: Heady in voluptuous up-front oak, this wine's rich full-bodied character continues with a taste of brioche and caramel apple. The creaminess on the palate is met by buoyant underlying acidity.
Wine: Frostwatch 2015 Chardonnay (Bennett Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This winery's restaurant background helps deliver wines like this that are perfect for the table but won't break the bank. Aromas of decomposing roses, cranberry-orange-pomegranate compote and turned earth lead into a rustic palate of muddled red currants and baked soils. The acid and grip are just fine.
Wine: Hitching Post 2015 Hometown Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Review: Peppery, smoky aromas lead to ample ripe fruit flavors in this full-bodied and rather complex wine. It shows the influence of new oak in the lightly charred aroma and spicy meat accents on the palate.
Wine: Klinker Brick 2015 Marisa Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: Sourced from a five-acre plot on the east side of Seneca Lake, this Riesling is bright and focused on the nose in tones of limestone, white blossom, underripe peach and green apple. There's a zesty feel to the light-bodied palate, offering a well balanced mix of stone fruit and racy lime flavors.
Wine: Lamoreaux Landing 2016 Round Rock Vineyard Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Aromas of raspberry jam, huckleberry and generous spice accents lead to full-bodied fruit flavors backed by soft tannins. It's a rich, ripe charmer.
Wine: L'Ecole No. 41 2015 Estate Grown Seven Hills Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Tannic up front, with a full-bodied density and layered concentration, this big bold wine shines in floral rose and lavender, with powerful flavors of strawberry, brioche and Asian spice.
Wine: MacRostie 2015 Klopp Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This estate-grown wine is tannic and tightly wound, savory in nature with a moderate build and structure. Forest floor is prominent and persistent, with streaks of raspberry that brighten.
Wine: Marimar Estate 2014 Mas Cavalls Doña Margarita Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This is an elegant, deceptively delicate wine that builds body and texture in the glass. Tangy orange and cranberry elements emphasize naturally high acidity and a mineral component of rose petal and dried herb.
Wine: Ram's Gate 2015 Roberts Road Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: Slate and stone provide a mineral character to this white wine, fermented in both concrete egg and oak. Mouthfilling and youthful, it offers strong flavors of green apple amidst a steely, complex body of light-bodied weight.
Wine: RouteStock 2016 Route 29 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Review: This is such an exuberantly fresh, focused and delicious wine. Floral as a strawberry patch in summer, it shows bright spicy flavors that lean into dried herb and blood orange with length and grace.
Wine: Starmont 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Carneros)

Appellation: Arroyo Grande Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This bottling is about as delicate as it gets for Pinot Noir in California, with light aromas of raspberry sorbet and licorice candy on the nose. There is compelling tension to the palate, where shy flavors of cranberry and hibiscus arise.
Wine: Talley 2015 Rincon Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Grande Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: This is a gutsy, spicy dry wine with intriguing black-pepper aromas, and beefy, lightly smoky flavors backed by plenty of blackberries. It has a firm texture suitable for the biggest proteins.
Wine: Alexander Valley Vineyards 2014 Temptation Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: Fresh, green notes of dill and tomato leaf ride over a concentrated core of dense bramble berry and cherry in this single-vineyard wine. The palate is soft and approachable, with a mild grip of tannins to offer support.
Wine: Billsboro 2016 Sawmill Creek Vineyards Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Nicely structured and with a solid focus on black-fruit character, this is a full-bodied wine that includes grapes from football great John Madden's vineyard. It feels firm and well balanced, with everything in place. A lightly smoky, toasty aroma leads to a palate of rich cherry and blackberry flavors supported by firm tannins.
Wine: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2014 Madden Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Smashed lemon rinds, sandalwood oil, split pine logs and a touch of toast show on the nose of this bottling from the historic vineyard. It's fresh on the palate with a sharp citrusy edge, which cuts through the fuller bodied midpalate flavors of pineapple and melon.
Wine: Fess Parker 2016 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Frostwatch
Review: This is a 100% varietal expression of the rare variety, grown in a relatively cool appellation. Grainy and thick on the palate, it nonetheless offers brightness around a gravelly viscous mineral character that is highlighted in apple, fig and melon. The body is robust and lush.
Wine: Frostwatch 2016 Semillon (Bennett Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Cinsault (44%) makes up the largest percentage of this wine, followed by Grenache (31%) and Syrah. A pretty pale-salmon color, the aromas are light, with notes of herb and strawberry that are followed by tart, nuanced fruit and herb flavors that possess a lovely feel.
Wine: Gramercy 2017 Olsen Vineyard Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: J Vineyards & Winery
Review: This is a richly layered, tropical white wine that offers flavors of sweet oak, mango and pineapple. These fruit flavors are concentrated on the palate, balanced by well-honed acidity and underlying freshness.
Wine: J Vineyards & Winery 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Light in color this wine is earthy in forest pine and Asian spice, the texture quiet in subdued fruit flavors of cranberry and wild strawberry. The structured, medium-bodied, vineyard designate is exotic in additional contours of citrus.
Wine: Keller 2015 La Cruz Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Kevin White
Review: A blend of 45% Syrah, 32% Grenache and 23% Mourvèdre, it brings notes of brambly berry, smoked meat, flower, strawberry, cherry, pomegranate and a whiff of black pepper. The flavors are full and juicy, generous and pure. Orange-peel notes linger on the finish. Best by 2021.
Wine: Kevin White 2016 Red (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Kitson
Review: Tightly wound, this medium-bodied wine has straightforward light-red-cherry and raspberry flavors and a rather lean mouthfeel that comes with good acidity and light tannnins. With time in the glass it also develops tea leaf and tobacco nuances that add good complexity. Best after 2020.
Wine: Kitson 2016 Pinot Noir (North Coast)

Appellation: Lorimar
Review: Rustic but beautiful aromas of red cherry, chaparral, thyme and campfire show on the nose of this bottling, which includes 10% Malbec, 8% Zinfandel and 7% Petite Sirah. Roasted red-currant flavors meet with grilled meat, pepper dust and roasting herbs, finishing on vanilla.
Wine: Lorimar 2015 Cabernet Franc (California)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This wine shows exuberant aromas of baked cherry, gingerbread, clove, cardamom and vanilla on the rich, heady nose. It tightens up on the sip to focus on thyme, oregano, rose petals and potpourri flavors, though the vanilla and cherry do flash on the finish.
Wine: Lucas & Lewellen 2015 Estate Vineyards Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Aromas of plum, black cherry, spice cake and turned earth show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard that's just east of Solvang and overlooks the Santa Ynez River. Boysenberry and plum flavors meet with oregano, lilac, tobacco and leather touches on the sip, which is upheld by sticky tannins yet remains lighter bodied. It is a versatile Cab for food.
Wine: Lucas & Lewellen 2015 Estate Vineyards Valley View Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Green Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Moderately structured and ripe, this velvety wine is smoothly textured and highlighted in fresh flavors of raspberry and strawberry. The secondary characteristics are spicy and full of forest floor and cardamom intrigue.
Wine: Magna Porcum 2014 Estate Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Review: Superrich aromas and deep saturated fruit and oak flavors make this extremely-full-bodied wine hard to resist. It has spicy smoky beefy aromas, nearly sweet flavors of dried plums, dates and blackberry jam and a mouth-coating texture that leads to a lingering finish.
Wine: Michael David 2015 Earthquake Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Mikami Vineyards
Review: Richness and ripeness define this extremely flavorful, full-bodied and smooth-textured wine. It overflows with blackberry jam, milk chocolate and maple syrup flavors while an almost thick texture coats the sides of the mouth.
Wine: Mikami Vineyards 2015 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Very clean and inviting lines of melon, pear, wet stone and chalk kick off the nose for this bottling from a vineyard adjacent to the winery near a heart-shaped oak grove popular for wedding proposals. Flavors of toast, Gravenstein apple and cherimoya show on the tightly woven sip, leading into a graham cracker finish.
Wine: Niner 2016 Reserve HH Estate Grown Grenache Blanc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Saldo
Review: Gorgeous ripe, jammy, berry flavors dominate this full-bodied, smooth-textured wine. It smells like blackberries and black cherries, tastes so rich it's almost sweet, and fills the mouth from cheek to cheek with a chocolate-cherry flavor that lingers on the finish.
Wine: Saldo 2016 Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: This ebullient wine has an aroma like smoked ham and roses, then sweet-seeming generous fruit and flower flavors. It is full bodied, fairly rich in texture and leaves a lingering floral finish.
Wine: V. Sattui 2016 Dry Gewurztraminer (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This is 100% Cabernet Sauvignon from Klipsun, Ciel du Cheval, Red Willow and Phinney Hill vineyards, The aromas are high toned on first pour, with the notes of cherry, spice, pencil lead and bay leaf not quite ready to reveal their charms but showing nuance over time. The flavors are tart and dry, showing a classic styling along with fine-grained tannins. It needs a few years in the cellar to settle in and stretch out.
Wine: Mark Ryan 2015 Old Vines Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine is a blend of 55% Cabernet Sauvignon, 28% Merlot, 16% Cabernet Franc and 1% Petit Verdot. Coming from top quality vineyards, the aromas are exuberant, with notes of blackberry, bittersweet chocolate and toast along with dried herb and luxurious barrel accents. The black-fruit flavors coat the palate, showing depth and intensity along with a firm tannic spine.
Wine: Mark Ryan 2015 The Dissident Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Review: This wine is big, broad and deep. There are wood-smoke and tobacco aromas along with blackberry and black-cherry flavors. The body is full and thick but there are soft tannins in the texture.
Wine: Michael David 2015 Earthquake Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)

Appellation: Millbrook
Review: This earthy Pinot Noir brings loads of forest floor, bramble berry and pepper spice to the fore. There's power and depth to the palate, with ripe berry fruit flavors that transition to a peppery, dry finish. A grip of tannins offers plenty of support. Drink from 2020 as this softens with age.
Wine: Millbrook 2016 Pinot Noir (New York)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: A 50-50 blend of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine is robust in cedar, dried herb and peppercorn aromas and hints of flavor. Thick extracted layers of grippy texture are highlighted in blueberry and dark chocolate.
Wine: Neyers 2016 Left Bank Red (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Very focused, concentrated and sleek, this wine is full bodied but well-polished and has a vivid core of black-cherry flavor that is impressive. The oak influence is moderate, the acidity is fresh and emphasizes the fruitiness while the tannins are not too thick, so it's easy to sip.
Wine: Occasio 2014 Heritage Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: Meaty spicy aromas backed by concentrated fruit and dark chocolate flavors give extra appeal to this rich full-bodied wine. The blackberry and raspberry flavors verge on sweet, while a good touch of tannin in the texture provides an appetizing balance.
Wine: Sentivo 2013 Mistra Reserve Red (El Dorado)

Appellation: Seven Peaks
Review: This is a bright well-balanced and medium-bodied wine with plenty of fruit flavor and just-right accents of baking spices and butter. It's very fresh and appley in aroma, hinting at vanilla and toasted baguette, then vibrant and fruity on the palate, too, thanks to good acidity.
Wine: Seven Peaks 2014 Chardonnay (California)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Pale peach in color, this wine brings vibrant aromas of spice, herb, sour cherry, bubblegum and strawberry. The flavors are sleekly styled with mouthwatering acidity. It impresses.
Wine: Sleight of Hand 2017 Magician's Assistant Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This is a full-bodied, structured and youthful wine, varietal in its softness and approachability. Cassis and cherry exude forcefully around a core of thick tannin and oak, with an undertone of dried herb.
Wine: St. Francis 2015 Reserve Merlot (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Strange Family Vineyards
Review: There are wild aromas of kelp, iodine and leather on the nose of this bottling, as well as more typical touches of sagebrush, mulberry and cherry juice. The palate shows earthy forest-floor flavors, alongside orange rind and very tangy plum skins.
Wine: Strange Family Vineyards 2014 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This is from the producer's One Sky Vineyard, a site that sits at 1,400 feet, influenced by coastal fog. Densely concentrated, it offers layers of rhubarb, cranberry and wild strawberry, a tartness that teases in between layers of texture and grainy oak.
Wine: Three Sticks 2015 Cuvée Eva Marie Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: The Pinot Noir producer offers a beautiful expression of rose petal, cherry and strawberry in this light, textured wine, which is bright yet still has body amidst orange-crisp acidity.
Wine: Three Sticks 2016 Casteñada Rosé (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: This reserve-tier wine was given three years of oak aging and it offers soft supple tannin and moderate structure as the reward. Bright cassis flavor takes on a confectionery richness alongside the toasted-vanilla notes from the wood.
Wine: ZD 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Chateau St. Jean
Review: Spicy and oaky in a delicious measured way, this full-bodied and nicely balanced wine backs up the toast, butter and bread dough aromas with generous ripe apple, pear and toasted-almond flavors for a complex and complete picture.
Wine: Chateau St. Jean 2016 Chardonnay (California)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This is made from grapes grown within the Petaluma Gap, now an appellation of its own. Heady notions of apple and pear rise on the nose, with seasonings of nutmeg and butterscotch emanating from the toasted oak. The lemon-curd-like richness is well-contained.
Wine: Clouds Rest 2014 Allure Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: Sourced from a single vineyard on the western side of Cayuga Lake, this Lemberger displays the ripeness and structure that is possible in warm, dry vintages like 2016. In its youth, this is wearing its nine month Hungarian oak aging on its sleeve, however at its core is a dense concentration of blackberry, dark cherry and warm spice. The medium-bodied palate is bolstered by a fine grip of tannins and juicy acidity, with loads of crunchy berry flavors broadening the feel. Drink from 2020.
Wine: Damiani 2016 Sunrise Hill Vineyards Lemberger (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Folie à Deux
Review: This is an expansively rich and layered wine, full bodied and bright in black cherry and blackberry, and with an underlying goodness of graham cracker crumble.
Wine: Folie à Deux 2014 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Gainey
Review: Green apples, freshly cut grass and slightly sweet white flowers invite the nose into this bottling, one of the best white wines for the money in the state. A strong grip grabs hold of the palate immediately, demanding attention for the ripe green-pear and tangy citrus flavors, all framed by powerful acidity.
Wine: Gainey 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This is a lovely aromatic explosion of baked strawberry and peach that satisfies in its plucky fleshiness on the palate. Juicy and fresh, it's remarkably elegant and crowd-pleasing.
Wine: Keller 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Kirkland Signature
Review: This is a crazy deal for the quality, a blend of 47% Merlot, 32% Cabernet Sauvignon, 13% Cabernet Franc, 4% Petit Verdot and 4% Malbec. Sanguine, it offers a broad, expansive palate of polished tannin, cedar and crisp red fruit that's dusted in spicy clove and tobacco.
Wine: Kirkland Signature 2014 Meritage (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: From dry-farmed old vines, this wine is juicy and expansive in richly concentrated fists of dusty blackberry and toffee. There's a welcome lift of freshness on the back palate that lingers on the finish in tones of clove and dark chocolate.
Wine: Armida 2015 Maple Vineyards Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: A blend of Italian grape varieties, this wine has deep, delicious berry aromas that lead to mouthcoating blackberry flavors and a moderately tannic texture that supports the ripe fruitiness very well.
Wine: Boeger 2015 Miglioré Red (El Dorado)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Review: This is an absolutely clean, fresh and grapey wine that's easy to sip and appreciate. It tastes dry and inviting and has beautifully concentrated aromas and flavors of blackberry jam, framed by a full but not tannic mouthfeel. Zinfandel, Syrah and Petite Sirah comprise the blend.
Wine: Vie Winery 2013 L'Etranger The Stranger Red (North Coast)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This is a tart briny wine from the newly minted Petaluma Gap that hints at green olive (the kind found in a Martini glass). Subdued, it offers floral honeysuckle and apple-blossom aromas that pair well with notions of green apple.
Wine: Keller 2015 Oro De Plata Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: A blend of Italian grape varieties, this wine has deep, delicious berry aromas that lead to mouthcoating blackberry flavors and a moderately tannic texture that supports the ripe fruitiness very well.
Wine: Boeger 2015 Miglioré Red (El Dorado)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Review: This is an absolutely clean, fresh and grapey wine that's easy to sip and appreciate. It tastes dry and inviting and has beautifully concentrated aromas and flavors of blackberry jam, framed by a full but not tannic mouthfeel. Zinfandel, Syrah and Petite Sirah comprise the blend.
Wine: Vie Winery 2013 L'Etranger The Stranger Red (North Coast)

Appellation: La Honda Winery
Review: Tangy lime, lemongrass and green grass met with chalky minerality on the nose of this bottling. It's crisp and taut on the palate, but allows slightly riper Gravenstein apple flavors and approachable grassy tones to round out the midpalate.
Wine: La Honda Winery 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: From dry-farmed old vines, this wine is juicy and expansive in richly concentrated fists of dusty blackberry and toffee. There's a welcome lift of freshness on the back palate that lingers on the finish in tones of clove and dark chocolate.
Wine: Armida 2015 Maple Vineyards Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley, Virginia, US
Review: A blend of Riesling and Petit Manseng, this wine is anything but ordinary. A gorgeous bouquet of orange peel, geranium, white peach and petrol lead the way to flavors that echo the aromas, as well as additional notes of apple peel, button mushroom and oyster. The umami element is really engaging to the senses and adds a creamy dimension the the mouthfeel. Despite the lovely acidity, the finish is won over by a creaminess.
Wine: Lightwell Survey 2015 Hintermen White (Shenandoah Valley)

Appellation: Cucamonga Valley, South Coast, California, US
Review: The nose of this bottling from an old vineyard in Rancho Cucamonga carries aromas of blackberry jelly on wet slate, with a touch of violets. The palate is rich and flavorful, with more blackberry paste, a dusting of cracked pepper and a warm toast tone, framed by decent acidity.
Wine: Lorenzi Estate 2014 Lopez Ranch Old Vine De Ambrogio Block Private Reserve Zinfandel (Cucamonga Valley)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Review: Lush aromas of smoke, black cherry, clove, cinnamon and game lead the way to the palate. Full in body, with silky tannins and vibrant acidity, this wine offers a lingering smoky finish.
Wine: Lovingston 2016 Gilbert's Vineyard Pinotage (Monticello)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This is Mark Ryan's first offering of this wine, coming from vines planted for the winery in 2013. A blend of three different clones, aromas of lees, peach, lemon curd and spice lead to creamy well-balanced flavors that lead to an impressively long finish. It's equal parts promise and delivery.
Wine: Mark Ryan 2016 Olsen Vineyard Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: A swirl of smoke, blackberry paste, lavender, rosemary and sagebrush kick off the nose to this reserve bottling. Dried earth, wild red berries and red flowers show on the palate, which is reminiscent of the wines of old California.
Wine: Martin Ranch 2015 Therese Vineyards Reserve Zinfandel (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Oakville, Napa, California, US
Review: Soft integrated tannins support an expansive, succulent midpalate of cassis, currant and cherry in this full-bodied, well-made wine. The oak is moderate and adds texture and spice.
Wine: Melmar Wines 2014 Signature Edition Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Review: Brawny and meaty, this full-bodied wine has spicy, oaky, sun-baked-earth aromas followed by a broad mouthfeel and beefy, raspberry, coffee and cranberry flavors. It has plenty of fine-grained tannins for a supportive structure.
Wine: Mt. Konocti Winery 2014 Lower Lake Cabernet Sauvignon (Lake County)

Appellation: Borden Ranch, Central Valley, California, US
Review: This is a well-made, full-flavored and firm-textured wine that offers fresh raspberry and cherry aromas, generous flavors and moderate tannins that give a little grip to the mouthfeel. Good balance and a little restraint in ripeness make it especially appealing.
Wine: Neyers 2016 Vista Luna Zinfandel (Borden Ranch)

Appellation: Paumanok
Review: Brisk notes of lemon, pineapple rind and peach kick off this zesty, refreshing Sauvignon Blanc. Round in feel, the palate is plump in tropical fruit and melon tones, with a persistent line of grapefruit acidity maintaining focus. The finish lingers on a light, chalky note.
Wine: Paumanok 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Medium bodied, soft and supple, this is an easy-drinking and approachable wine, lengthy in chocolate, raspberry and red currant, that's ready to enjoy and is priced unbearably fair.
Wine: Rolling Plains 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: This 100% Cabernet Franc rosé offers an exuberance of watermelon, tart cherry and spicy raspberry on the nose. There's a rounded feel to the palate, with flavors of juicy red fruit, peach and tart pomegranate. A lingering note of watermelon is heightened by a dusting of minerals.
Wine: Sheldrake Point 2017 Dry Estate Bottled Rosé (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Smith & Hook
Review: Always one of the more compelling bottlings for the price each year, this vintage shows deep plum, black cherry and vanilla on the welcoming nose. The mouthfeel is impressively thick and the firm texture quite gravelly, carrying flavors of black fruit, roast beef and black pepper.
Wine: Smith & Hook 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This bold blend of 50% Zinfandel and 50% Petite Sirah starts with ripe aromas of black currant that are scaled back by the minerality of crushed lava rocks. The palate is considerably more dry and elegant, with black-plum, elderberry and purple-flower flavors.
Wine: The Blending Lab 2015 wZPS Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: A joint project between winemakers Trey Busch and Mark McNeilly, this wine is almost all Syrah. The aromas are exuberant, with note of huckleberry, plum, smoked meat, baking spice, orange peel, cinnamon and raspberry. Bountiful fruit flavors coat the palate, bringing a pleasing sense of purity and more restraint than this warm appellation and vintage might suggest. Best by 2021.
Wine: Underground Wine Project 2015 Idle Hands Red (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine, which is 100% varietal, saw no new oak, and was aged for 21 months in 500 liter, once-used puncheons. The aromas are bright, with notes of black-cherry meats, fresh and dried herb, scorched earth, whole green pepper and anise. The palate is lighter styled, wound up initially, with the fruit surrounded by tightly wrapped tannins, framed by bright acidity. It needs a bit of time to settle in but it has all of the stuffing.
Wine: Block Wines 2015 Block 1 Discovery Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Old-vine Chenin Blanc is rapidly slipping away in Washington as growers rip out vines for more profitable varieties. It's a shame as it can excel here, as this wine shows. Coming in at an almost unheard of alcohol level for the state, aromas of poached pear, apple, lees, citrus and spice are followed by bone-dry, sleek, tart flavors with a lemony finish. The acids are downright racy. It needs some food alongside it to be properly appreciated but it delivers.
Wine: Block Wines 2016 Old Vine Gnarl Block Rothrock Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Bogle
Review: This is a dramatic full-bodied wine that is very concentrated in flavor, very tannic in texture, but nevertheless finds good balance. It has meaty beefy smoky aromas, rich blackberry and black-pepper flavors and a lingering finish. It's one more pearl on a long string of great values by Bogle, and should age well through at least 2023.
Wine: Bogle 2015 Petite Sirah (California)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Dark gold in color and marked by a sweetness of oak, this wine is intensely layered and full bodied, an explosively powerful combination of pineapple, baked apple and lemon custard.
Wine: Chateau St. Jean 2015 Robert Young Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: From a selection of fine vineyards from throughout the appellation, this wine impresses in its stemmy earthy character of forest pine and fresh light-bodied juicy layers of strawberry, rhubarb and tangerine. This is a widely appealing wine that's balanced and bright.
Wine: Dutton-Goldfield 2016 Dutton Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: This vintage of the well-known blend combines 82% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Malbec and 8% Petit Verdot. Rich, smooth and concentrated, it offers a wealth of cherry, vanilla, plum and mocha flavors, the finish dotted in black pepper and cedar.
Wine: Flora Springs 2015 Trilogy Red (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Freakshow
Review: Big and spicy, this full-bodied wine is plump, mouthfilling and packed with ripe fruit flavors. It has a rounded, soothing feel on the palate despite firm tannins, no doubt due to the extra-ripe plum, cherry and milk chocolate flavors that follow aromas of maple syrup, vanilla and cedar.
Wine: Freakshow 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)

Appellation: Hoyt Family Vineyards
Review: Concentrated black-currant aromas meet with dark spices on the unctuous nose of this bottling from a winery based in Malibu. The palate impresses much more, with polished tannins and a soft mouthfeel carrying flavors of blackberry paste, licorice and vanilla. Though six-years-old, it's barely starting to show its age.
Wine: Hoyt Family Vineyards 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Review: Pretty aromatics open into a medium-bodied expression of cherry vanilla and grapefruit. With enough body to make for a good pairing with food, this wine remains light-bodied and freshly tart in acidity, a delicious quaff for an array of settings.
Wine: Kokomo 2017 Grenache Rosé (North Coast)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: From a site in the Sebastopol Hills, this wine offers up-front acidity and freshness, with a floral flourish of rose garden and lavender. On the palate it becomes velvety and exotic in nutmeg and cardamom, the fruit, oak and acidity integrated well.
Wine: Ladera 2015 Pillow Road Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Not showy or oaky, this wine is very dense, concentrated and dry, and needs more time to develop in the bottle. Blend from Tempranillo, Syrah, Petite Sirah and Malbec, it has an inky color, aromas of blackberry and cloves, and mouthfilling flavors backed by firm tannins and good acidity. Best after 2023.
Wine: Las Positas 2014 Coccineous Estate Red (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Las Positas
Review: Full body and a firm texture give this wine plenty of structure, which it fills with black cherry, wood smoke and black-pepper flavors that are concentrated and persistent. Good gripping tannins help balance out the richness of fruit, and should help it age well. Best after 2020.
Wine: Las Positas 2014 Meritage (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: L'Ecole No. 41
Review: This wine is a blend of fruit from Seven Hills, Candy Mountain, Summit View, Bacchus and Stone Tree vineyards. Aromas of raspberry and blackberry jam are followed by ripe rich fruit flavors and a warm finish. There's no mistaking the warm vintage that it comes from.
Wine: L'Ecole No. 41 2015 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Longboard
Review: Dark fruit and subtle cinnamon combine with grace and effortless simplicity in this wine, which is tart in acidity and notions of citrus and toasted oak.
Wine: Longboard 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Mi Sueño
Review: Sugary vanilla seasons baked pineapple flavors in this full-bodied concentrated white that's fleshy and plush in richness. The layers are robustly structured to hold up to the fruit, with a supportive backbone of toasted oak.
Wine: Mi Sueño 2015 Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: Leading with 86% Cabernet Sauvignon grown in St. Helena, this wine also includes 14% Merlot. Together, they offer smooth rounded layers of cherry, blackberry and a dusting of cinnamon, the acidity focused and spicy.
Wine: Pellet Estate 2015 Henry's Reserve Red (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Kevin Riley continues to make strides in showcasing the historic Mission grape. This bottling, which includes 11% Zinfandel, 9% Syrah and 5% Mourvèdre, shows pink grapefruit, cotton candy, lemon spray and crushed chalk on the nose. There is sizzling acidity on the sip, with stony flavors of wet cement that add depth to the yellow-peach and lemon-juice elements.
Wine: Proulx 2017 Willow Creek Farm Rosé of Mission (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Siduri
Review: Deep aromas of black-plum sauce, dark rose petals, sugar plums and roasted pork show on the nose of this appellation blend by Adam Lee. Freshly cut plums, cherry pits, squeezed cranberries and cocoa show on the vivacious sip.
Wine: Siduri 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine is a blend of fruit from Klipsun, Kiona and Obelisco vineyards, along with a touch from Olsen in the Yakima Valley. The aromas are high toned, with notes of baking spice, assorted dried herb and cherry. The pit-fruit flavors are ripe and polished, with a warm finish.
Wine: Sparkman 2014 Kingpin Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Starmont
Review: This offers tremendous value. It is oaky on the nose and voluptuously balanced in green apple, citrus and fresh uplifting acidity. The freshness and lightness win the day and make this a food-friendly deliciously balanced wine.
Wine: Starmont 2015 Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: This substantive medium-bodied wine smells fruity, tastes refreshing and feels gutsy on the palate as good acidity and even a touch of tannin contribute to the texture. Grown on the winery property, it tastes bone dry and has a lingering finish like a good red Pinot.
Wine: Toulouse 2017 Estate Rosé of Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Upshot
Review: Sourced from throughout the county, this approachable wine is a blend of 44% Zinfandel, 29% Merlot, 15% Malbec, 7% Petit Verdot and 5% Riesling—not something one sees every day. Leather and tobacco lean forward aromatically, as red and black fruit mingle along a smoothly integrated well-made frame of lushness.
Wine: Upshot 2015 Red (Sonoma County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: This assertive medium-bodied wine has a bright-pink color, vivid raspberry aromas and crisp lively berry flavors supported by great acidity. The fruit notes deepen on the palate and turn riper and more substantial on the finish.
Wine: Vigilance 2017 Pinot Noir Rosé (California)

Appellation: Cambiata
Review: This bottling of a rarely found grape by Eric Laumann from Rocosa Loma Vineyard shows Concord grape, cassis and cola-spice aromas. The palate offers candied black fruit, a pinch of pepper and wood smoke, along with elegant touches of lavender, framed by firm tannins.
Wine: Cambiata 2014 Tannat (Monterey)

Appellation: Green Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: From a tremendous site planted with older vines, this white is delicious in green apple, melon and rocky stone, its texture creamy and somewhat lush. The acidity is high pitched and intense yet supportive.
Wine: Clouds Rest 2014 Dutton Shop Block Forbidden Sauvignon Blanc (Green Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine comes from 35-year-old vines. Aged on lees for 17 months with 100% malolactic fermentation, aromas of clarified butter, lees, peach, cream, corn silk and spice are followed by medium-bodied fruit flavors that show a pleasing sense of elegance, despite the warmth of the vintage. The lees influence seems a bit intense.
Wine: Co Dinn 2015 French Creek Vineyard Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: Clean aromas of quince and limestone ride over a riper stone fruit core. Light bodied in feel, the dry palate is taut and focused, with tart apricot, lime and a chalky, mineral tone.
Wine: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2016 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Blackberry sorbet, charred wood and fresh violets show on the nose of this wine, which is already six-years-old but not showing much age at all. Fruity blackberry flavors are cut by a chalky tension on the palate, and that structure carries deep into the finish.
Wine: Grosso Kresser 2012 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Merry Cellars
Review: Most of the fruit for this wine comes from Stillwater Creek Vineyard and saw no new oak. Aromas of black cherry, blackberry, dried herb and barrel spice lead to a full-bodied palate with a big blast of acidity and firm, slightly dry tannins. It needs some food alongside it to help tame it but brings appeal.
Wine: Merry Cellars 2015 Petit Verdot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Clarksburg, Central Valley, California, US
Review: This is a well-balanced and well-rounded wine made from almost equal parts Malbec, Mourvèdre and Petit Verdot that tastes nicely dry, lightly tannic and full bodied. It has cranberry and black-cherry aromas, vivid fruit flavors and firm structure.
Wine: Rock Wall 2016 Heringer Vineyard Red (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Black cherry and blackberry start the somewhat lithe nose on this bottling from 28-year-old vines, topped by dried herbs and black pepper. More cherry and darker elderberry tones arise on the palate, lifted by cola and black-pepper spice. Those flavors are more compelling than the texture, which is smooth but simple.
Wine: Sculpterra 2014 Bentley Ironworks Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: The Grenache (60%) comes from Upland Vineyard with the Syrah from Les Collines. The aromas are unusual, with notes of peanut shell, dried and fresh tobacco, flower, green olive, cherry and herb. The palate brings more of the same, delivering a sense of heft along with sweet fruit flavors on the finish. It's an unusual wine. Not for all tastes.
Wine: Sleight of Hand 2015 Sorceress Grenache-Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: The Crusher
Review: This blockbuster wine is packed with smoky, oaky aromas, extremely ripe and spicy flavors of dark chocolate, coffee bean and blackberry, and has a full body backed by firm tannins. It's almost larger than life and fun to taste. Its secret ingredient is 51% Tempranillo grapes.
Wine: The Crusher 2015 Red (California)

Appellation: Thirsty Owl Wine Company
Review: Cherry wood and soft vanilla tones carry the nose, while the palate brings a bit more freshness in sweet orange spice and crunchy raspberry flavors. A mild grip of tannins offers support from start to finish. The oak is currently a bit prevalent, but will mellow with time in the bottle. Drink from 2019.
Wine: Thirsty Owl Wine Company 2016 Pinot Noir (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: Dark berry tones mix with fresher aromas of strawberry and cranberry, with a bit of pepper in the background. This is round and juicy in feel, bolstered by plush red-berry flavors and a bit of black pepper adding astringency.
Wine: Atwater 2015 North Block Five Pinot Noir (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This is an early Cabernet release from the 2016 vintage. Aromas of vanilla, huckleberry, herb and spice are followed by juicy ripe blue-fruit flavors that lead to a silky finish that carries. It doesn't necessarily scream Cabernet but the appeal is hard to ignore.
Wine: Board Track Racer 2016 The Chief Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Reduced slightly with a huge heft of oak on the nose, this wine continues the robust oak theme, taking on toasted vanilla and tropical flavors around concentrated companions of baked apple and brioche.
Wine: Chateau St. Jean 2015 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: A beefy, salt-and-pepper flavor complements the fruit components in this full-bodied and firmly tannic wine made from Zinfandel and Petite Sirah. It carries blackberry notes on the palate and a good sense of richness.
Wine: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2014 Field Blend Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: From a new project of biodynamically grown Riesling on the Wiemer estate, this wine offers a wealth of peach, spring blossoms and citrus on the nose. The palate is soft in feel yet bolstered by a refreshing vein of acidity that carries ripe flavors of stone fruit and papaya. There's lots of balancing astringency in this wine, which lends to its textured, dry finish.
Wine: Hermann J. Wiemer 2015 HJW Bio Estate Bottled and Grown Riesling (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Jason-Stephens
Review: Rounded red-berry fruit meets with vanilla, caramel, smoke and wet soil on the nose of this bottling from a winery near Morgan Hill. Hickory smoke and rich red-fruit flavors start the palate, where grippy tannins lead into a cocoa-laced finish. It needs some time to smooth out.
Wine: Jason-Stephens 2014 Merlot (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This wine offers gamy aromas of grilled lamb, black pepper, dried fennel and dark blackberry. The palate shows roasted espresso bean, tart black plum and more cracked pepper, touching on all of the grape's hallmark characters.
Wine: Kendall-Jackson 2015 Vintner's Reserve Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Texas, Texas, US
Review: This rosé opens with charming aromas of strawberry, cherry, fresh cut grass and crushed minerals. The palate is fresh and savory echoing the nose and adding lime acidity. Grassy flavors build into the finish with plenty of citrus and a touch of bitter grapefruit right at the end.
Wine: Llano Estacado 2017 Monte Stella Rosé (Texas)

Appellation: Lone Birch
Review: Expressive aromas of freshly cut red apple, pear, white peach, star fruit, cantaloupe, white-grapefruit skin and flower lead to crisp spritely fruit flavors with a tart lemony finish. It brings a whole lot of enjoyment for the price.
Wine: Lone Birch 2016 Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Review: This Cabernet Franc is bursting at the seams with complexities. Flavors and aromas of blueberry, cinnamon, cedar, violet and lavender are contained on a medium-bodied palate, with very light tannic expression and graceful acidity.
Wine: Lovingston 2016 Shay's Cask Cabernet Franc (Monticello)

Appellation: Mt. Konocti Winery
Review: Herbal, piney aromas and vivid lively grapefruit and pineapple flavors give this medium-bodied wine lots to enjoy. It is smooth and rich in texture and has a lingering finish.
Wine: Mt. Konocti Winery 2016 Sauvignon Blanc

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Intensely herbal and earthy, this wine also shows a hint of reduction on the nose that integrates into the thick rich palate of strawberry and cherry. The fruit takes on concentrated jammy texture that speaks to its bigger style.
Wine: Sean Minor 2016 Sangiacomo Roberts Road Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: Dry and refreshing, this wine has light fruit flavors and good balance, a lively texture and tangy finish. Aromas like canteloupe and crisp apple lead to similar brisk flavors.
Wine: The Forager 2017 Vin Gris Red (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: Aromas of watermelon, cranberry, wild strawberry and a bit of pepper mingle on the nose of this rosé made from Cabernet Franc and Lemberger. The palate is light in feel, with driving acidity that is rounded out by ripe red fruit flavors. A lingering cherry skins note carries on the finish.
Wine: Bellangelo 2017 Dry Rosé (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley, Virginia, US
Review: Aromas of white peach, honeysuckle and geranium follow through to the palate and are met with flavors citrus pith and ginger powder. There is also fullness to the palate and the finish is long and lively with evolving flavors.
Wine: Lightwell Survey 2015 Goodbye Horses Riesling (Shenandoah Valley)

Appellation: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
Review: An engaging nose of spiced black berry, Thai basil and thyme make for an interesting and exotic start. A medium body of soft tannins and bright acidity houses loads of tart red berries that are broadened out by fleshier red plum. More herbal notes resound on the finish.
Wine: Millbrook 2014 Block Three East Cabernet Franc (Hudson River Region)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: This wine has a profusion of mature spicy jammy flavors fueled by lavish oak and very rich ripe fruit. It starts with cedar, vanilla, and maple aromas and continues on the palate with blackberry and milk chocolate flavors carried by a broad texture. It's quite full bodied and moderately tannic.
Wine: Renwood 2015 Sea of Grapes Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Renwood
Review: Sturdy and straightforward, this full-bodied dry wine combines the classic brambly, wild-berry aromas with good fruit flavors and moderate tannins. It's a no-nonsense wine that could be enjoyed often.
Wine: Renwood 2015 Zinfandel (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: Crisp and dry, this very pale-colored peachy tasting light-bodied wine has a lively character driven by good fruit acidity. It does a great job of cleansing the palate and will be extremely food friendly.
Wine: Renwood 2017 Zinfandel Rosé (Amador County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This early release from this vintage is a blend of 43% Cabernet Sauvignon, 32% Cabernet Franc, 22% Merlot and 3% Petit Verdot. The aromas lean into the green, with notes of savory fresh herb along with flower, plum, cherry, black currant and spice. Plush ripe blue- and black-fruit flavors provide appeal.
Wine: Sleight of Hand 2016 The Conjurer Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine is a blend of fruit from Oasis, Gamache and Olsen vineyards and was aged half in stainless steel with the rest in neutral barrels. It's a bit reduced out of the gate, opening up to reveal kiwi, citrus, pineapple and herb aromas. The bountiful tropical fruit flavors delight.
Wine: Sparkman 2017 Pearl Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: The Infinite Monkey Theorem
Review: Magenta in color, aromas of blueberry and pomegranate are muddled with strawberry, white pepper and vanilla on the nose of this delightful Cabernet Franc. The palate is juicy and bright in tones of pomegranate and red cherry, tempered by white pepper, vanilla and fine grained tannins. The juicy fruit flavors pleasantly linger, leading to a second wave of white pepper on the finish.
Wine: The Infinite Monkey Theorem 2016 Cabernet Franc (Grand Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Brawny and tannic, this dark-colore, full-bodied and firm-textured wine has tasty blackberry and black pepper flavors that are bound up tightly by a thick layer of tannin. It will take a lot of patience but the wine may be fantastic when well aged. Best after 2028.
Wine: Vasco Urbano 2015 Brunswick; Casa de Vinas Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Desiccated strawberries, dark plums, leather and char show on the nose of this bottling, which leans toward the dried-fruit side of the spectrum. It starts a tad sweet on the palate but opens up into a very floral expression with hints of blueberries and toast. Acid drives into the caramel-kissed finish.
Wine: Villa San Juliette 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Red plum, strawberry, tangerines and clay aromas show on the nose of this pink wine. There is decent grip to the sip, with plenty of mandarin orange juice and skin flavors, proving quite lively.
Wine: Waxwing 2017 Delfina's Vineyard Rosé of Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: Aromas of watermelon, cranberry, wild strawberry and a bit of pepper mingle on the nose of this rosé made from Cabernet Franc and Lemberger. The palate is light in feel, with driving acidity that is rounded out by ripe red fruit flavors. A lingering cherry skins note carries on the finish.
Wine: Bellangelo 2017 Dry Rosé (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: Earthy in character, this off-dry Riesling shows an exuberance of lemon, lime and sun-baked stone on the nose. The palate is succulent and round in juicy peach, blossoms and honey flavors.
Wine: Fox Run 2014 Lot 11 Hanging Delta Vineyard Riesling (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Review: There's a pleasant array of violets, lilacs, lamb roast, rosemary and dark fruit swirling on the nose of this bottling, with includes 11% Counoise. Ripe boysenberry, a hint of tar and a vanilla-laced syrup arise on the palate, which is dominated by a Concord grape-syrup element that's both thick and tangy.
Wine: Kukkula 2015 Noir Syrah (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Lighter in color, the aromas pop, with notes of green olive, potpourri, green herb and orange peel. The flavors bring a light, elegant styling, providing a lot of interest but not fully delivering on the aroma's promise. Citrus flavors linger on the finish. It's a pretty interpretation of this variety.
Wine: Full Pull & Friends 2012 Olsen Vineyard Grenache (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Dumas Station
Review: This blend of fruit from Minnick Hills and Birch Creek vineyard was aged in 40% new American and French oak. Aromas of green wood, spice, vanilla, black cherry, herb and plum lead to a sweet, fruitful palate. The concentration tapers a bit toward the finish, which is filled with vanilla notes. It seems a little green.
Wine: Dumas Station 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Dumas Station
Review: Aged in just 30% new oak, the aromas offer appealing notes of vanilla, red raspberry, cedar and cocoa. The flavors are plump, soft and pure, pulling up ever so slightly on the vanilla-filled finish.
Wine: Dumas Station 2014 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: Lip-smacking and well balanced, this concentrated but lively wine has everything in good proportions, including a bold rosemary and black-cherry aroma, rich cherry and dark chocolate flavors, and moderate tannins that merge with good acidity for an appetizing mouthfeel.
Wine: Fetzer 2016 50th Anniversary Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: A velvety texture supports brooding notions of baked strawberry and chocolate in this concentrated wine that's soft and supple in tannins and has a pronounced underlying note of oak.
Wine: Longboard 2016 Mystos Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: NoCurfew
Review: A tasty kiss of oak gives this full-bodied and smooth-textured wine a little extra lift. Vanilla, toast and a touch of caramel in the aroma meet a warm broad mouthfeel, ripe fruit flavors and hints of baking spices.
Wine: NoCurfew 2014 Red (California)

Appellation: NoCurfew
Review: Subtlety and minerality give this medium-bodied wine an appealing profile. It has intriguing low-key aromas, and then flavors that build on the palate with each sip. Savory, lightly earthy aromas set the tone, then somewhat richer fig and pear flavors and a nice sense of depth join in.
Wine: NoCurfew 2015 Chardonnay (California)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: Nicely focused cherry flavors and great balance make this medium-bodied wine both lively and satisfying to sip. Hints of mint and cinnamon add some complexity to the fresh fruit notes and there are light tannins to lend a welcome grip on the palate.
Wine: North Coast All Stars 2016 Lichen Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Candied cherries, rustic earth aromas and black pepper show on the nose of this bottling from the Zinfandel veterans. Big dark juicy fruits show on the sip alongside savory oregano and sage, but the overall impression is ripeness bordering on sweetness.
Wine: Peachy Canyon 2015 Mustard Creek Zinfandel (Adelaida District)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: This full-bodied wine is a terrific value. It blends smoky, spicy oak nuances with rich black-cherry and blackberry flavors so that the result is a tasty, savory richness. It starts with toasted bread and cedar in the aroma, then gains lots of concentrated fruit on the palate amid moderate tannins and finishes with lingering spices.
Wine: Pra Vinera 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Review: From a brand that's well known for it's Zinfandel, this is a well-structured, moderately tannic wine that's chock full of ripe berry and plum flavors. It's full-bodied, well concentrated and nicely dry, too, which not all Zins are.
