Wine: Ravenswood 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Cherry juice, grenadine, white pepper, turned earth and damp wood show on the somewhat subtle nose of this single-vineyard expression. Stewed raspberries make for a slightly cooked flavor, lifted by baking spice.
Wine: Samsara 2014 Rancho La Vina Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Lewis Vineyard makes up the majority of this wine (70%), with the rest coming from Les Collines. The aromas seem locked up on first pour, with notes of ripe raspberry, flower and dried herb. The palate is more generous, with soft lush fruit flavors and silky tannins. It finishes warm.
Wine: Sleight of Hand 2015 Levitation Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Alma de Cattleya
Review: This bottling is very pungent and sharp on the nose with fresh lime-skin aromas and hints of green papaya and wet cement. The bright tightly woven palate contains cut grass, lemongrass and more wet stone flavors.
Wine: Alma de Cattleya 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Blindfold
Review: This full-bodied, dry wine has vivid apple and butter aromas. The palate is ripe and mouthfilling, with a baked-apple flavor and a generous, broad texture. It offers the appeal of ripe fruit alongside a luscious mouthfeel.
Wine: Blindfold 2016 White (California)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This rosé is darker and richer than most, but proves quite quaffable. Red plum, sour cherry, wet stone and iron aromas lead into an acid-driven palate of candied cherry, cola and vanilla spice. Dynamic and compelling.
Wine: Derby 2016 Derby Vineyard Rosé (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Doubleback
Review: Chardonnay is an extreme rarity in the valley, with this example coming from Kenny Hill Vineyard in the Mill Creek area. Aged in 35% new French oak and 15% concrete tulips, aromas of freshly peeled tangerine, citrus, ripe peach and honeysuckle lead to medium-bodied fruit flavors, with vibrant tangerine and stone-fruit notes on the finish. Much more reminiscent in some respects to a Viognier, it's a unique example of this variety and region that shows promise.
Wine: Doubleback 2016 Chardonnay (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Dr. Konstantin Frank
Review: Punchy, vibrant aromas of grapefruit and pineapple juice meet a mild, floral hop note on the nose. There's a round feel to the palate which displays lots of tropical fruit rinds and floral, grapefruit flavors. Perfect for a hot summer's day.
Wine: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: Milky white flowers, limestone and citrus aromas are delicate on the nose. The palate shows an intricate balance of ripeness struck against a vein of lime juice. This is off-dry in style and lingers on a citrus blossom note.
Wine: Hosmer 2016 Single Wheel Patrician Verona Riesling (Cayuga Lake)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Blended with 7% Merlot and 3% Malbec, this hillside wine shows a sanguine, meaty character and complexity. Soft and lush on the palate, the velvety texture is accented in dark chocolate, tobacco and leather. It is hugely ripe and powerful.
Wine: Lancaster 2014 Sophia's Hillside Cuvée Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: Bursting with ripe fruit flavors and lightly accented by oak, this full-bodied and smooth-textured wine tastes very generous and has a broad, almost soft mouthfeel.
Wine: McManis 2016 North Forty Red (California)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: Smoky, spicy oak aromas are well integrated with generous ripe fruit and licorice flavors in this full-bodied lightly tannic Rhône-style blend.
Wine: Neyers 2016 Sage Canyon Red (California)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Review: This reserve bottling shows its concentration, with aromas of cherry syrup and baking spice on the nose. There's a dense quality to the palate, with rich black cherry, roasted meats and a vanilla brioche kick to the finish. It is a heavier take on the grape.
Wine: Robert Renzoni 2013 Vineyard Riserva Cabernet Franc (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Northern Sonoma, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Flinty with an aroma of matchstick, this wine is ultimately fresh and fruity in honeydew melon and peach, with an ebullience on the palate. Lightweight, it adds highlights of grapefruit and lemon on the finish.
Wine: Rodney Strong 2017 Charlotte's Home Sauvignon Blanc (Northern Sonoma)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: Bright aromas of bramble berry, warm spice and herbs carry to the taut, light-bodied palate. Cranberry and earth make for an enticing combo for the flavors, with sandy tannins offering support.
Wine: Rooster Hill 2016 Estate Grown and Produced Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Focused, somewhat shy aromas of fruit punch and thyme show on the delicate nose of this bottling. The palate offers tart red-fruit flavors and a pinch of herbs, proving fresh, easy and not particularly complex.
Wine: Samsara 2014 Melville Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Candied red cherry, crushed hibiscus and rose hips float atop a very intriguing mineral streak of flint and crushed granite on the nose of this bottling, which is dedicated to and features the winery's laborers. Bright berry and fruit-punch flavors lead into rocky earth tones on the palate. Great for summer with a chill.
Wine: Sculpterra 2016 Heroe Primitivo (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: It's a bit hard to get at this wine's aromas of cream, stone fruit, toast, char, fig and spice on first pour. The palate is considerably more expressive, with broad, nuanced peach and spice flavors that lead to a warm finish.
Wine: Sparkman 2016 Lumiere Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Blackberry, tobacco and dusty tannins define this blockbuster. It is a full-bodied red that is varietal in its underlying softness and approachability. There's an intensity and heat to the lingering finish.
Wine: St. Francis 2015 Behler Vineyard Merlot (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Review: A bright-pink color is followed by vivid citrus, cherry and berry flavors in this medium-bodied wine. It feels smooth and is on the soft side of balance, but retains enough pink-grapefruit flavor to stay fresh and inviting.
Wine: Steele 2017 Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Lake County)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Review: Cabernet Sauvignon dominant, this Bordeaux-style blend boasts bright, elegant aromas and flavors of cranberry, acacia, red plum, lavender and cinnamon. The tannins are prevelant but well integrated and sleek, while the acidity is vibrant and gives an impression of brightness. It's approachable now but can cellar through 2028.
Wine: Stone Tower 2015 Hogback Mountain Red (Virginia)

Appellation: Waxwing
Review: Rustic aromas of baked earth, red cherry sauce, dark plum and slightly burned gingerbread show on the nose of this appellation blend. It's quite dark on the palate, with deep plum and boysenberry flavors, framed by decent acidity and a firm structure. Nothing sticks out, for better and worse.
Wine: Waxwing 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: A very concentrated style of Syrah, this bottling begins with cooked black currants and caramelized blueberries, lifted by a bit of lilacs. It's rich and full on the sip as well, with decent weight and body, showing prune-like flavors and a tart plum-skin snap at the end.
Wine: Vie Winery 2013 White Hawk Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: San Benito County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Orange blossom oil, stargazer lily and grapefruit-granita aromas show on the nose of this dessert wine, which is transcendent in some years but merely delicious this time around. A soft viscosity frames the palate, where flavors of honey and orange-blossom syrup arise.
Wine: Williams Selyem 2016 Vista Verde Vineyard Late Harvest Gewürztraminer (San Benito County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This lovable hearty red includes 10% Petite Sirah, the grapes pulled from five vineyards across the appellation. Smooth, thick and concentrated, it offers graham cracker, blackberry jam and a presence of dark chocolate.
Wine: Armida 2016 PoiZin Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine is two-thirds Merlot, with the balance Cabernet Franc. The aromas bring notes of golden raisin box, cedar, anise, mineral and cherry, seeming a bit dried out. The palate offers a fine sense of structure.
Wine: Auclair 2015 Right Blend Artz Vineyard Red (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Beautiful pink and orange in color, the nose of this wine is akin to a Creamsicle, with fresh citrus. The acidity lingers on a tart bracing finish.
Wine: Baldassari Family Wines 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Bogle
Review: This full-bodied wine has spicy-sweet aromas, nicely ripe cherry and berry flavors and a fairly soft smooth texture. It's one of the best California Pinots for the money.
Wine: Bogle 2015 Pinot Noir (California)

Appellation: Chamisal Vineyards
Review: Warm aromas of white peach meet with blanched almonds and toast on the clean and inviting nose of this bottling. There's a strong and likable toasty quality to the palate, topped with butter and marmalade. It's rich, but not overly done, cut by a spray of lemon juice.
Wine: Chamisal Vineyards 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

Appellation: Chloe
Review: Baked cherry, boysenberry, violet and baking spice show on the nose of this widely available bottling. Clean crisp flavors of red currant are tart, tightly wound and zippy.
Wine: Chloe 2016 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)

Appellation: Dr. Konstantin Frank
Review: High-toned raspberry is mellowed by vanilla and anise on the nose of this wine. A brisk mouthfeel and a tart cherry flavor makes for a refreshing start, with sweet oak tones hiding in the background.
Wine: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2015 Lemberger (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Nicely balanced and full bodied, this Malbec blend is fruit-driven, tasting like blackberries and black cherries, with minimal spicy oak additions. It has a smooth sleek texture and very light tannins.
Wine: Fenestra 2013 Conjugation Red (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Girasole
Review: A dark color and lots of concentrated, focused, fruit aromas and flavors make this medium-bodied wine very appealing. Black-cherry, blueberry and chocolate flavors are supported by firm velvety tannins and carried to a lingering finish.
Wine: Girasole 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: Vivid fruit flavors and a lively texture make this medium-bodied wine very refreshing and mouth-cleansing to sip. It has bright raspberry and ripe blackberry flavors accented by light earthy spicy notes.
Wine: Iron Hub 2014 Esola Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: This wine offers a substantial nose of bay leaf and eucalyptus—pleasant and defiant. Huge sweet tannins wrap around sizable power and ripeness, a mix of black cherry and cinnamon-dusted plum.
Wine: John Anthony 2014 Crane Vineyard Merlot (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Keuka Spring
Review: Dense, dark fruit and spicy raspberry meld with hints of earth, white pepper and orange rind on the nose. The medium-bodied palate is fresher in profile in zesty notes of raspberry and bramble, supported by bright acidity and a medium grip of tannins.
Wine: Keuka Spring 2016 Lemberger (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Review: The red fruit and flower petals that show on the nose of this bottling are overwhelmed by a clay-like muddy aroma of turned earth. The palate offers cohesive flavors of boysenberry and black raspberry, and that earthy clay component does also arise toward the finish.
Wine: La Crema 2014 Panorama Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Candied blackberry and a pinch of black pepper make for a concentrated but not overly lush nose on this bottling. The palate is clean and straightforward with rich red fruit and dark spices, framed by even acidity and structure.
Wine: Le Vigne 2015 Di Ranchita Vista Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)

Appellation: L'Ecole No. 41
Review: This is a true pan-Washington Merlot, with fruit coming from nine vineyards across the state. Blended with a good whack of Cabernet Franc (13%) which reveals itself, baking-spice, plum, raspberry and herb aromas are followed by soft ripe fruit flavors, with the tannins pulled back. Herb and raspberry notes linger on the tart finish.
Wine: L'Ecole No. 41 2015 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Light pineapple, melon rind and a touch of toast show on the nose of this blend of 67% Grenache Blanc, 28% Roussanne and 5% Picpoul Blanc. The palate is clean and framed by a steely tightness and shows light zippy flavors of lemon peel and a clay-like minerality.
Wine: Lion Ranch 2016 Cuvée Blanc White (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Review: Subdued aromas of grapefruit, banana and papaya carry to the juicy, medium-bodied palate. This offers a round, textural mouthfeel, with a brisk, chalky finish.
Wine: Macari 2016 Lifeforce Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Mark Ryan
Review: A blend of fruit from Olsen and Red Willow vineyards, this offers aromas of orange blossom, ripe peach, toast and spice. The medium-bodied palate brings stone-fruit flavors that dip slightly in the middle, finishing bitter. This variety can be a difficult needle to thread, with this one not quite pulling it off.
Wine: Mark Ryan 2016 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Made from 71% Merlot and 29% Cabernet Sauvignon this traffics in reductive leathery aromas that lead to thickly layered, smoothly lush flavors highlighted in bitter dust, plum and clove.
Wine: Medlock Ames 2015 Snakepit Red (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Neyers
Review: This youthful wine comes out of the gate hugely concentrated and big in reduced aromas of oak. Voluptously lush in dense flavors of crème brûlée, it finds a balance midpalate, buoyed by juicy citrus-backed acidity.
Wine: Neyers 2016 Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Numbskull
Review: Though not labeled as such, this could be a varietal Merlot (78%), with the balance Cabernet Sauvignon (18%) and Petit Verdot. Exuberant aromas of raspberry compote, toast, green herb and flower lead to plentiful red- and black-fruit flavors, with a toasty finish. It runs a bit hot.
Wine: Numbskull 2016 Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Raeburn
Review: This wine is made in a big rich style, concentrated and extracted in robust flavors of vanilla cream soda and Bing cherry. It appeals in its approachability and soft smooth contours of mellow texture.
Wine: Raeburn 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Sarah's Vineyard
Review: Sandalwood, smoke, lemongrass and lime skins make for an intriguing entry to this appellation blend. There is good vibrancy to the sip although it is quite ripe, with flavors of baked apple and slightly sweet nectarine.
Wine: Sarah's Vineyard 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: Very fruity, buttery and nearly sweet, this wine has a rich soft mouthfeel, plenty of ripe pears and pineapples and low acidity. It's blended from grapes grown in Santa Barbara, Sonoma and Mendocino counties.
Wine: Steele 2016 Cuvée Chardonnay (California)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine comes from a newly explored area of this appellation near the North Fork of the Walla Walla River. Aged for 22 months in one-third new French oak, plum, jalapeño, cinnamon, cranberry, mineral and wood-spice aromas lead to soft, elegant, lightly styled cranberry flavors. It provides intrigue.
Wine: Tertulia 2015 Elevation Estate Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: The Crusher
Review: An oaky smoky character pervades this full-bodied wine from the aromas of charred wood to flavors like grilled beef, black cherry and dark chocolate. It's a well-made full-bore wine that's unapologetic.
Wine: The Crusher 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Review: A rounded mouthfilling texture and generous soft-fruit flavors make this full-bodied wine easy to enjoy. It has lightly spicy aromas, quite-concentrated grape-jam flavors and a soothing rich mouthfeel.
Wine: The Winery SF 2013 People's Red (North Coast)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: A condensed black berry aroma meets a mildly herbal rooibos tone on the nose. The soft, plush palate is well balanced, with persistent tones of juicy blackberry, cherry and white pepper. A woodsy, herbal note lingers on the finish.
Wine: Timothy Moore 2015 Siltstone Bed Reserve Blaufränkisch (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Ultraviolet
Review: This is a well-balanced, medium-bodied wine that has just enough smoke and spice in the aroma, just enough ripe blackberry in the flavors and just enough firm tannin to give the grip it will need to pair with your favorite hearty dish.
Wine: Ultraviolet 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Appellation: San Benito County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Orange blossom oil, stargazer lily and grapefruit-granita aromas show on the nose of this dessert wine, which is transcendent in some years but merely delicious this time around. A soft viscosity frames the palate, where flavors of honey and orange-blossom syrup arise.
Wine: Williams Selyem 2016 Vista Verde Vineyard Late Harvest Gewürztraminer (San Benito County)

Appellation: La Crema
Review: Rounded aromas of ripe pear, orange skins, poached apple and buttered toast with marmalade show on the nose of this bottling. Lemon rinds and dried apple slices arise on the sip.
Wine: La Crema 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Three-quarters Cabernet Sauvignon, with the balance Cabernet Franc (19%) and Merlot, aromas of plum, dried cherry, smoke, golden raisin and dried herb lead to slightly sweet-seeming fruit flavors backed by highly structured acid and tannins. There are lots of good things going on but the fruit seems ever so slightly desiccated.
Wine: Auclair 2015 Left Blend Artz Vineyard Red (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Middleburg, Virginia, US
Review: This wine offers lemon, grapefruit, chamomile and a soft, green mossiness on the nose. Pea shoots, citrus and crushed minerals dance on the tongue with vibrant acidity. It finishes zippy and crisp, and would be perfect with oysters.
Wine: Boxwood 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Middleburg)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: From a coastal site, this wine exudes notes of forest pine, rose petal and dried herbs. The thickly textured core of ripe fruit offers weight and youthful complexity.
Wine: Dutton-Goldfield 2015 Dutton Ranch Freestone Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: High Dive
Review: This is made from 64% Cabernet Sauvignon, 19% Merlot, 14% Cabernet Franc and 3% Petit Verdot. Woody, the full-bodied wine is integrated, with a mild structure that lends itself to soft savory flavors of clove and rich cassis.
Wine: High Dive 2014 Red (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Review: Vibrantly pink and lush in aromas of rooibos, melon, raspberry and peach, this rosé sets itself apart from the pack. Flavors burst with raspberry and orange peel on the palate, with a well-balanced, flavorful finish.
Wine: Horton 2016 Private Reserve Nebbiolo Rosé (Virginia)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Review: Aromas of chocolate and mint lead to very ripe, almost sweet fruit flavors and a soft, melting texture like that of a dessert wine. It has low acidity and very little tannin. Recommended for after a meal at fireside.
Wine: Jessie's Grove 2014 Westwind Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Review: The name Los Idiots references the potential blunder of the winemaker's decision to make a low-intervention, carbonic-maceration, Syrah-and-Riesling blend in Virginia. A complex nose of rose, black cherry, bubblegum and iron lead the way to the palate, which boasts a vein of cinnamon spice. Delicate in mouthfeel, this is well balanced and full of interest.
Wine: Lightwell Survey 2015 Los Idiots Red (Virginia)

Appellation: Lorimar
Review: This bottling, which includes 14% Merlot and 6% Petite Sirah, shows tightly wound blackberry and plum fruit with touches of pepper and balsamic on the nose. The palate offers reduced strawberry flavors with a pinch of white pepper.
Wine: Lorimar 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Review: A brilliant pink in color, this wine tastes crisp and light despite rather full body. It's well balanced and mouthwatering. Good acidity and light cherry and raspberry flavors give it a refreshing aspect.
Wine: Markus Wine Co 2017 Zeal Rosé (Lodi)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Review: Brambly, wild-berry aromas and generous plum, maple and milk chocolate flavors make a delicious combination in this full-bodied plush-textured wine. It's soothing on the palate and has an almost-sweet finish.
Wine: Mt. Konocti Winery 2015 Estate Zinfandel (Lake County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Fairly dark in the glass, this Grenache rosé, which includes 19% Cinsault, shows raspberry and orange oil on the nose. There is persistent acidity and a tactile grip to the sip, where orange skin and red pear flavors ride a chalky texture.
Wine: Proulx 2017 Willow Creek Farm Rosé of Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Spring Mountain District, Napa, California, US
Review: Juicy, this affordable red is high-pitched in acidity, with soft simple layers of red currant and strawberry buoyed by chocolatey oak.
Wine: Publix 2015 Limited Edition Cabernet Sauvignon (Spring Mountain District)

Appellation: Schug
Review: Made primarily from estate fruit, this is a full and fleshy wine, with robustly integrated offerings of rich apple, mango and pear. It has a fresh, layered finish that sparks the palate for more.
Wine: Schug 2016 Chardonnay (Carneros)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: Ripe strawberry, currant and underbrush carry this lithe, light-footed Pinot Noir. This is well balanced and straightforward in its appeal.
Wine: Silver Thread 2015 STV Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon (55%), Cabernet Franc (26%), Syrah (12%) and Merlot. Aromas of huckleberry, plum, fresh herb, green pepper and black currant are followed by lighter-styled, easy-drinking blue- and black-fruit flavors. Green-pepper notes linger on the finish.
Wine: Sleight of Hand 2016 The Spellbinder Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: A blend of fruit from Klipsun and Angela's vineyards aged in 17% new French oak, cherry, black raspberry, baking spice, anise and dark fruit aromas are followed by focused dark-fruit flavors with a citrusy finish. The tannins give a gentle squeeze.
Wine: Sparkman 2015 Preposterous Malbec (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Stone Tower
Review: Using slightly less new oak than the Reserve, this Sauvignon Blanc is bright and energetic. Aromas and flavors of passionfruit, grapefruit, honeysuckle and grass carry this wine. The acidity is racy and works well to combat the full, creamy weight. It finishes long and smooth. Pair with rich, creamy cheese.
Wine: Stone Tower 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Virginia)

Appellation: Stone Tower
Review: There is a lot going on in this wine, from the depth of flavors and aromas to the compelling mouthfeel. Aromas of honeydew, juniper, white peach meld with coconut, ground ginger and butter. Smooth and creamy in the mouth, this could stand up to a hearty meal. The finish is long and evolving.
Wine: Stone Tower 2016 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This is a fascinating wine—one of the few white Pinot Noirs from the region. It starts with beeswax, yeast and lemon rinds on the nose, and then hits the palate both broadly and energetically, offering smoked lemon peels, the slightest hint of vanilla and more wax.
Wine: Strange Family Vineyards 2015 Blanc Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Green Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Meaty on the nose, this wine is tart in citrus and tangerine, spritzy, fresh and light bodied. The label is stellar and what's inside will refresh and rejuvenate. This is a fun wine.
Wine: Sus Volans 2016 Estate Whole Cluster Rosé of Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Review: This is all Dineen Vineyard (Rattlesnake Hills) fruit, aged in a mixture of neutral and twice-filled French oak barrels—a rare look at this variety in the state without overt oak influence. Aromas of pencil eraser, gummy bear, tobacco and spice are followed by plentiful dried and fresh tobacco flavors that show a reserved styling.
Wine: Temporal 2015 Temp Tempranillo (Washington)

Appellation: Colorado, Colorado, US
Review: Intensely floral aromas of summer rose gardens and lavender fields leap from the glass, with hints of freshly peeled orange peeking through. The palate is equally playful in flavors of lemon juice and orange-blossom honey, kept light by tangy acidity and jubilant bubbles. White peach joins lemon juice on the finish, with just a touch of nuttiness bringing it to a close.
Wine: The Infinite Monkey Theorem 2014 Bubble Universe Sparkling (Colorado)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This blend of 75% Primitivo, 13% Syrah and 12% Cabernet Franc is starting to show its age, offering rustic dried red-cherry, dust and leather flavors. There are hints of clove and cinnamon decorating the candied red fruit of the palate, but it's time to drink up on this bottling.
Wine: Wild Hogge 2012 Moongate Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This vineyard-designated rosé brings aromas of strawberry, orange blossom and sweet herb. The palate is packed full of broad-feeling fruit flavors that deliver enjoyment.
Wine: L'Ecole No. 41 2017 Alder Ridge Vineyard Grenache Rosé (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Pacificana
Review: There's a focused-by-intense-smoke quality to the nose of this bottling, which wafts over the fresh Meyer lemon spray and inviting roasted Gravenstein apple aromas. It grips the palate right away, showing roasted apples, a bit of butter and prominent oak.
Wine: Pacificana 2016 Chardonnay (California)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Review: Earthy and floral, this is not your average Sauvignon Blanc. This displays lots of floral, lemon balm, melon and warm spice notes on the palate. A delicate line of tannins from 18 hours of whole-cluster skin contact offers balance to the weighty juicy fruit.
Wine: Paumanok 2015 Minimalist Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: Deep flavors of black cherry and cedar give this wine good focus, while moderate tannins and good acidity add welcome grip in the texture. The body is medium to full, and the palate sensation is dry and appetizing.
Wine: Projection 2016 Winemaker's Cut Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Appellation: Oakville, Napa, California, US
Review: This big wine is hugely fragrant in strawberry, cherry and a slightly reduced hint of oaky tar. Dense rich layers of flavor etch themselves against a backdrop of tobacco, cedar and ripe black cherry.
Wine: Risk 2014 Reserve Merlot (Oakville)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Concentrated aromas of grenadine and sumac are almost too intense on the nose of this bottling. The palate is also quite thick, with extracted cherry and raspberry flavors lifted by sage oil and wood spice.
Wine: Samsara 2014 Cargasacchi Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Cabernet Sauvignon (67%) makes up most of this wine, with the rest Malbec (22%) and Petit Verdot. The aromas bring notes of cherry, raspberry, cinnamon, vanilla, green wood and spice. The palate shows a sense of ripeness and appeal, still seeming bunched up.
Wine: Sparkman 2014 Stella Mae Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Rockpile, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Smooth, thick and meaty, this appellation wine is robustly built to coat the palate and stick to the ribs. Chocolate, blackberry jam and smoky char give it weight and richness.
Wine: St. Francis 2014 Rockpile Cabernet Sauvignon (Rockpile)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: The aromas are light and a bit difficult to tease out, with notes of red and blue fruit, tire rubber, herb and spice. The palate is lighter in style with a tart blue-fruit-filled finish.
Wine: Tertulia 2015 Whistling Hills Estate Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Colorado, Colorado, US
Review: Cedar, oak, leather and vanilla dominate the nose and carry over to the palate, where vibrant cranberry and pomegranate flavors pop with a wash of fresh acidity over attractive peppery notes and grippy tannins. Tangy fruit lingers on the finish with a pinch of pepper.
Wine: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey 2015 Reserve Merlot (Colorado)
Winery: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: This is a sturdy palate-gripping wine with a good lean texture and firm tannins. The aromas capture forest floor, black pepper and earthy nuances and the flavors are tart and tea-like.
Wine: Toulouse 2014 Estate Hungarian Oak Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: A solid concentration of black raspberry and red currant shows on the nose, with sweet baking spice backing it up. Medium in body and soft in feel, fresh acidity keeps the ripe dark fruit flavors in focus on the palate.
Wine: Wicked Water 2016 Sawmill Creek Vineyards Reserve Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Aromas of tire rubber, green pepper, blackberry and sweet barrel spice are followed by ripe fruit flavors that finish a bitter touch. The tannins dry out the finish.
Wine: Airfield Estates 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Colorado, Colorado, US
Review: Cedar, oak, leather and vanilla dominate the nose and carry over to the palate, where vibrant cranberry and pomegranate flavors pop with a wash of fresh acidity over attractive peppery notes and grippy tannins. Tangy fruit lingers on the finish with a pinch of pepper.
Wine: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey 2015 Reserve Merlot (Colorado)
Winery: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: This is a sturdy palate-gripping wine with a good lean texture and firm tannins. The aromas capture forest floor, black pepper and earthy nuances and the flavors are tart and tea-like.
Wine: Toulouse 2014 Estate Hungarian Oak Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: A solid concentration of black raspberry and red currant shows on the nose, with sweet baking spice backing it up. Medium in body and soft in feel, fresh acidity keeps the ripe dark fruit flavors in focus on the palate.
Wine: Wicked Water 2016 Sawmill Creek Vineyards Reserve Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This wine opens in a wave of bright fresh flavor that evolves to present more creamy and substantive body and richness. The highlights are dipped in peach, apricot and melon, with a pronounced finish of vanilla and cinnamon.
Wine: Dutton Estate 2016 Kylie's Cuvée Dutton Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Held back in bottle a bit, this reserve wine is juicy, herbal and possessed of sharp edges. Despite that, it is succulently soft, approachable and ripe in its jammy red-cherry fruit.
Wine: Ferrari-Carano 2013 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Gravel Bar
Review: Aromas of cream, mandarin orange, custard, clarified butter, toast and spice are followed by lightly creamy fruit flavors that dance across the palate. It shows a nuanced touch.
Wine: Gravel Bar 2014 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Harmony Cellars
Review: Crushed black cherry, cherry pits and snapped sage stems show on the woody nose of this bottling. There is an extreme chalky texture to the sip, where black-currant and licorice flavors lead into a minty finish.
Wine: Harmony Cellars 2015 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: Dark and brambly on the nose, this Pinot Noir is carried by crunchy dark berries, cocoa and cranberry skins on the palate. This is medium bodied, with a soft grip of tannins and a refreshing balance of acidity.
Wine: Heron Hill 2015 Ingle Vineyard Pinot Noir (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: Pale pink in color, this wine from the extremely consistent winemakers at K-J is delicate without being wimpy. It offers fresh cherry and raspberry aromas, crisp acidity and modest red-fruit flavors.
Wine: Kendall-Jackson 2017 Vintner's Reserve Rosé (California)

Appellation: Gray Ghost
Review: A demure nose of lemon, orange peel and green apple starts this off. The palate is more intense in its apple and lemon curd flavors, with racy acidity on the finish.
Wine: Gray Ghost 2017 Riesling (Virginia)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: Grassy herbs, gooseberry and slate make for an atypical aroma for a late harvest Riesling. The palate brings more familiar melon and chalky apple flavors, with a mild vein of acidity carrying to a peach-fuzz finish.
Wine: Hermann J. Wiemer 2015 Late Harvest Riesling (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: Boysenberry and chocolate flavors flood the taste buds as this full-bodied and broad-textured wine fills the mouth with richness. It tastes lush and ripe, feels smooth and almost soft.
Wine: Kendall-Jackson 2015 Vintner's Reserve Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: La Crema
Review: Toast, butter, lemon spray and a hint of smoke show on the nose of this widely available and reliable wine. It's fresh and zesty on the palate with lime peels and Meyer lemon juice, yet there are also creamy butter and blanched almond flavors to round out the palate.
Wine: La Crema 2015 Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: Lemongrass, grapefruit peel and tonic are refreshing and clean on the nose. The lithe palate shows a bit more ripeness, with juicy peach on the fore that turns more lean and tart on the finish. Overall, this is quite enjoyable for its short burst of power.
Wine: Lamoreaux Landing 2016 Dry Estate Bottled Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Cabernet Sauvignon makes up just about two-thirds of this wine, with the balance Merlot and Malbec. Blue fruit, anise, herb and spice aromas are at the fore. The palate boasts soft fruit flavors that linger on the finish.
Wine: Board Track Racer 2016 The Vincent Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: This wine is clean and focused on the nose in notes of citrus rind, crushed stone and grassy, blossomy floral tones. The light-bodied, dry palate offers pithy lemon-lime flavors, with a wealth of white flowers and minerals that linger on the finish.
Wine: Buttonwood Grove 2016 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: Ballet-slipper pink, this rosé boasts aromas of cherry blossom, watermelon and crushed stone on the nose. The palate shows good texture and grip, with flavors of cranberry skins and strawberry met with a citric backdrop and a delicate peach-fuzz finish.
Wine: Casa Larga 2017 Dry Rosé (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Virginia's Eastern Shore, Virginia, US
Review: This unoaked Chardonnay is fresh in with aromas of lemon, grapefruit, lees and wet stone. The palate mirrors the nose, with vibrant acidity that extends the long, cheeky finish.
Wine: Chatham 2016 Church Creek Steel Chardonnay (Virginia's Eastern Shore)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: Boysenberry and chocolate flavors flood the taste buds as this full-bodied and broad-textured wine fills the mouth with richness. It tastes lush and ripe, feels smooth and almost soft.
Wine: Kendall-Jackson 2015 Vintner's Reserve Zinfandel (California)

Appellation: La Crema
Review: Toast, butter, lemon spray and a hint of smoke show on the nose of this widely available and reliable wine. It's fresh and zesty on the palate with lime peels and Meyer lemon juice, yet there are also creamy butter and blanched almond flavors to round out the palate.
Wine: La Crema 2015 Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: Muted on the nose, this blend of 52% Petit Verdot, 44% Malbec, 2% Merlot and 2% Cabernet Sauvignon is hearty and thickly extracted, the fruit red and highly strung, with herbal components taking on prominence as the wine opens.
Wine: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2014 Midnight Red (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: Appley floral aromas meet rich ripe apple and pear flavors in this generous mouthfilling and smooth-textured wine. It is medium bodied, fragrant and easy to enjoy, especially with an appetizer like smoked trout.
Wine: Naggiar 2017 Mamma Mia Estate White (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Paradise Springs
Review: This Petit Verdot-heavy blend is deep in color and complexity. A heady bouquet of black plum, clove, cedar, black-currant leaf and licorice carries to the palate. Well balanced by ample acidity and plentiful, yet smooth tannins, this is silky in feel. The finish is long, with tones of oak spice and black tea.
Wine: Paradise Springs 2015 Meritage (Virginia)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: A light electric pink, the aromas bring notes of watermelon bubblegum, cherry and strawberry. It drinks dry with medium-bodied slightly fat-feeling fruit flavors, with grapefruit notes on the finish.
Wine: R.J. Wines 2017 Beyond the Pale Boushey Vineyard Syrah Rosé (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Rodney Strong
Review: Rounded and creamy with a touch of citrus, this floral aromatic wine is simple in its approachable layering of lemon zest and tropical pineapple. The oak is supportive and spicy in vanilla bean and nutmeg.
Wine: Rodney Strong 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This bottling, part of the winery's series dedicated to its labor crew, is a fresh herbally laced take on Cab, with peppercorns, asphalt, smoke and earth decorating the tangy black-plum aromas on the nose. Red cherry and plum start the sip, followed by crushed gravel, more smoke and dried herbs.
Wine: Sculpterra 2015 Heroe Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey
Review: The smoky nose shows aromas of black pepper, tobacco and leather. Ample acidity on the palate is highlighted by juicy blue fruit flavors, alongside green tobacco leaf, black pepper and wood smoke with spicy, gritty tannins. This finishes on strong notes of leather over cranberry and smoked pepper.
Wine: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey 2015 Merlot (Colorado)
Winery: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey

Appellation: Titus
Review: This wine is simple in structure and ample in density. It is full bodied and plush on the palate in black cherry, berry and a richness of vanilla wafer.
Wine: Titus 2015 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Very dark in the glass but not thick, this bottling shows roasted black plum, coffee and charred vanilla bean on the nose. The palate is layered with that vanilla flavor and cut by a slow-rising acidity, offering flavors of tangy blackberry and espresso on the finish.
Wine: Villa San Juliette 2013 Reserve Petit Verdot (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Airfield Estates
Review: The aromas pop, with notes of green flower, bountiful citrus peel, fresh herb, kiwi and scooped honeydew melon. The broad feeling but lighter styled kiwi flavors bring appeal, with a pink-grapefruit snap on the finish.
Wine: Airfield Estates 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Barrel Burner
Review: This is likely to become a very popular wine, thanks to an inviting nose of lemon candy, white peach, pineapple, plumeria and a hint of guava, all leveled by a chalky minerality. The palate is zippy and tense, yet also somewhat crowd-pleasingly sweet with ripe apple and pear flavors.
Wine: Barrel Burner 2016 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

Appellation: Boeger
Review: This wine is dark and rich but also very approachable for this notoriously tannic varietal. The tannins are moderate and the blackberry and blueberry flavors so concentrated that they balance out the tannins and make the mouth feel velvety.
Wine: Boeger 2015 Petite Sirah (El Dorado)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: Yellow apple, peach and banana make for a fruity entrance to this unoaked Chardonnay. There's nice weight and roundness to the palate, with ample acidity to back it up.
Wine: Buttonwood Grove 2016 Unoaked Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Cass
Review: Blackberry, cracked pepper, crushed herbs, licorice and coffee show on the nose of this bottling, which includes 10% Merlot, 8% Petit Verdot and 2% Cabernet Franc. There is decent heft to the sip, which offers flavors of blackberry, oregano, anise and a pinch of dill.
Wine: Cass 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Strawberry punch aromas meet with cotton candy on the light but very inviting and rounded nose of this Grenache-based pink wine. It's soft on the palate with just enough grip to make for a compelling sip.
Wine: Comartin 2017 Adelaide's Rosé of Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Concord grape, boysenberry and dried anise aromas show on the nose of this fresh bottling. The palate focuses first on dried herbs and then moves into elderberry as well as elderflower, beef jerky and soy.
Wine: Le Vigne 2015 Di Domenico Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Strawberry punch aromas meet with cotton candy on the light but very inviting and rounded nose of this Grenache-based pink wine. It's soft on the palate with just enough grip to make for a compelling sip.
Wine: Comartin 2017 Adelaide's Rosé of Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Vineyard
Review: Small amounts of Sauvignon Musque and Sauvignon Gris are blended within this substantive, lushly built wine, which is thick and rich in flavors of peach and vanilla. The finish brightens with aromas of jasmine.
Wine: Dry Creek Vineyard 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: A very rocky expression of the grape, this bottling shows mud, clay and just a hint of dark red fruit on the nose. Dark cherry starts the sip alongside cola spice, but it's the texture and structure that take center stage, with thick tannins and strong grip. A smoky meat character shows on the finish.
Wine: Opolo 2015 Summit Creek Merlot (Paso Robles)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Review: This wine has a delicious, appetizing, tart cherry character supported by firm tannins and good acidity, so it's lively on the palate. Touches of baking spices add to the vivid strawberry flavors.
Wine: Replica 2016 Label Envy Pinot Noir (North Coast)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: A soft pink color, this bottling from the Riboli family's new Stefano Vineyard shows watermelon, lime rinds and orange on the nose. It's clean and crisp on the palate with lime, strawberry and a fresh acidity.
Wine: San Simeon 2017 Stefano Vineyard Rosé of Grenache (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Rust and wet gravel aromas meet with rhubarb, macerated strawberry and carnations on the nose of this bottling, a rare Pinot Noir from Paso Robles. The rusty character extends to the palate, which it gains rose hip, dried mint, cranberry and vanilla flavors. The acid is bright throughout.
Wine: Sculpterra 2016 Heroe Pinot Noir (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: Tart red fruit tones are peppered with a leafy, green tobacco note on the nose. The medium-bodied palate is round and soft, with no hard edges, letting the fleshy red plum and cranberry-skin flavors do all the talking.
Wine: Sheldrake Point 2015 Estate Bottled Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: A blend of 70% Chardonnay and 30% Pinot Noir, this méthode Champenoise is dry and fruity, with a strong aroma of strawberry on the nose. Approachable and fresh, it adds a taste of tangerine to continuing flavors of strawberry and peach.
Wine: Strala 2015 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Napa Valley)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Review: Rich and buttery all the way through, this full-bodied wine smells like butterscotch and cream, tastes ripe, oaky and full of vanilla, and has butter and fig flavors. The texture is extremely soft and mouthfilling.
Wine: Truett Hurst 2015 California Square Chardonnay (North Coast)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Review: One of the meatier, spicier rosés from California, this wine smells like fresh berries and prosciutto, and tastes quite substantial. Made from Sangiovese grapes, it has more concentration than most and keeps improving in the glass.
Wine: Victor Vineyards 2017 Dry Rosé (Lodi)

Appellation: Wölffer
Review: Aromas of papaya, lemongrass and tart candies are brimming with vibrancy on the nose. There's a solid fruit presence on the rounded palate, with a line of crisp acidity providing adequate tension.
Wine: Wölffer 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Long Island)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Review: This light-colored and medium-bodied wine has fresh citrus aromas, lemon, apple and vanilla flavors and a rounded texture that give it a full mouthfeel. It's well made and well-balanced.
Wine: Z. Alexander Brown 2016 Uncaged Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine is a blend of Tempranillo (81%) and Syrah. Aromas of pencil eraser, cherry, sweet herb and spice are followed by a tight core of fruit flavors with a smoky finish. Firm, lightly grainy tannins provide support.
Wine: Airfield Estates 2015 Hellcat Red (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Airfield Estates
Review: The aromas jump up, with notes of lemon zest, cream and white peach that lead to rounded melon and stone fruit flavors. It brings appeal.
Wine: Airfield Estates 2016 Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Airfield Estates
Review: The aromas jump up, with notes of lemon zest, cream and white peach that lead to rounded melon and stone fruit flavors. It brings appeal.
Wine: Airfield Estates 2016 Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine is principally Merlot (62%) and Cabernet Sauvignon (20%), with the rest pinches of Malbec, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Expressive aromas of huckleberry, jalapeño pepper, cherry and wood spice lead to sweet plump fruit flavors, with lightly grainy tannins providing support. It's enjoyable but comes off as quite green.
Wine: Airfield Estates 2016 Dauntless Red (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Review: Notes of pollen, lemon and plastic carry the nose, with a bit of melon showing on the light-bodied palate. There's mild concentration to the flavors and a pleasing roundness to the feel, balanced by a gentle vein of acidity.
Wine: Anthony Nappa 2016 Shared Table Farm Long White Cloud Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: Vibrant pink in color, this offers bright tones of crushed strawberry and watermelon, with a bit of tart currant. Light in body but with a pleasing roundness, this is a well-balanced summer sipper.
Wine: Bellangelo 2017 Dry Merlot Rosé (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: Made as a white wine from dark Pinot Noir grapes, this medium-bodied wine has earthy aromas and savory herbal flavors that give it a rustic character. It has a tartness like grapefruit on the finish.
Wine: Boeger 2016 Pinot Grande White Pinot Noir (El Dorado)

Appellation: Columbia Winery
Review: High-toned smoke, char, baking spice, berry and herb aromas are followed by plentiful currant, plum and vanilla flavors, with a crème de cassis finish. The tannins are surprisingly soft for the variety.
Wine: Columbia Winery 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: Spicy bramble berry and cherry aromas are raspy on the nose. Light in body, with bright acidity and soft tannins, the palate is carried by a condensed cherry note.
Wine: Heron Hill 2015 Reserve Blaufränkisch (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Hosmer
Review: Red cherry and spicy raspberry meet with earthy stems on the nose, while the palate is more straightforward in its juicy red-fruit nature. It's light in feel, with driving acidity and a dusting of tannins. Best enjoyed with a meal, like smoked duck.
Wine: Hosmer 2016 Cabernet Franc (Cayuga Lake)

Appellation: Hosmer
Review: A mild concentration of cherry, raspberry and white pepper marks the nose. Light in weight and supported by soft tannins, the palate brings juicy cherry to the fore, with a pleasing grip of black pepper adding texture. Enjoy with a slight chill on a hot summer's day.
Wine: Hosmer 2016 Lemberger (Cayuga Lake)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: Full bodied and very ripe tasting, this bold wine is packed with plum and raisin flavors and supported by moderate tannins that add grip to the texture.
Wine: Iron Hub 2014 Clockspring Zinfandel (Amador County)

Appellation: Lakewood
Review: High-toned cherry and cranberry aromas carry the nose, with a slight menthol kick in the background. There's a pleasing roundness to the soft palate, bolstered by more red-berry flavors.
Wine: Lakewood 2016 Pinot Noir (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: Intense berry and black-cherry flavors give focus to this full-bodied, smooth and not-very-tannic wine. Touches of raspberry and leather in the aroma add complexity to the core of dark fruit.
Wine: Longevity 2013 Press-Ton Vintner Select Red (California)

Appellation: Nottingham Cellars
Review: This medium-bodied wine smells at first like toasted garlic and dried herbs, but it develops complexity and good fruit flavors after airing in the glass and then it deepens with each sip. It's supported by a very lively crisp texture.
Wine: Nottingham Cellars 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Review: A very rare rosé of Tannat, this botling from the Bella Collina Vineyard is rather dark in the glass and shows aromas of carnation, cherry and black-plum juice. The flavors are very plummy and show a bit of baking spice as well.
Wine: Pulchella 2017 Rogue Rosé (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Robert Mondavi
Review: Tight, integrated oak forms around a core of pineapple, sweet vanilla and pear in this robust, full-bodied white. Richly textured and layered, it satisfies in its boldness and lush, plush toastiness.
Wine: Robert Mondavi 2015 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Saint Gregory
Review: This assertive and earthy wine is crisp and nervy, showing lively herb, wet stone and citrus aromas, crisp apple and lemon flavors and a texture that's firmed up by good fruit acidity.
Wine: Saint Gregory 2016 Pinot Gris (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Tranzind
Review: Very ripe berry flavors and a broad smooth texture propel this full-bodied and mouth-coating wine to a lingering finish. Oaky accents of cinnamon, smoke and vanilla add complexity.
Wine: Tranzind 2015 Red (Lodi)

Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: Citrus, creamed corn and butterscotch aromas are enticing on the nose. The medium-bodied palate is bright in flavors of lemon and tart pineapple rind, with lively acidity keeping focus through the crème-brûlée finish.
Wine: Treleaven 2016 Tacie's Estate Bottled Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Cayuga Lake)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Oak aromas are at the fore, with notes of vanilla and baking spice taking over, along with a light meaty note. The palate shows more of the same, with lighter-styled cranberry flavors working to get to the surface. The fruit seems overmatched for the oak.
Wine: Aluvé 2015 Estate Menozzi Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Avant
Review: This is a good, reliable unoaked style of wine that will please a lot of different drinkers. It has mild pear and apple aromas, fresh-tasting fruit flavors and a good lively texture that refreshes the mouth.
Wine: Avant 2016 Chardonnay (California)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Aromas of green wood, green herb, tire rubber, baking spice, mint and cherry lead to medium-bodied fruit flavors that dip in the middle. Orange-peel notes linger on the finish. It wants a bit more acid and tannin structure to stand it up.
Wine: Cana's Feast 2013 Slide Mountain Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Dark-purple fruits meet with deep-violet aromas and loamy soil on the nose of this bottling. There's a powerful and earthy richness on the sip, showing flavors of boysenberry, cut by an acidity that's almost overpowering.
Wine: Davine Cellars 2014 Symphony Regan Vineyard Merlot (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Dr. Konstantin Frank
Review: This is a smooth and supple Merlot that offers a mix of red plum, blackberry and a mild leafy, herbal twang. Its mildly grippy tannins and soft acidity lend to its easy-drinking appeal.
Wine: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2015 Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: Aromas and flavors of watermelon and strawberry make for an easily enjoyable wine. While light in body, there's a nice presence of fruit on the palate, with a refreshing lemon backdrop.
Wine: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2017 Dry Pinot Noir Rosé (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Review: This bottling of a Zinfandel rosé is very darkly hued, showing aromas of dark berries, cola and plum. There is decent zip to the sip, with heavy flavors of berry, plum skins and darker spices.
Wine: HammerSky 2017 Rosé of Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Syrah (39%) and Cabernet Sauvignon (36%) take the lead on this wine, with the balance Merlot (18%) and Cabernet Franc. The aromas bring appeal, with notes of plum, wheat and assorted dried herb. The flavors are plump in feel but still elegant, wanting a bit more tannic structure to fully stand them up. Blue-fruit flavors linger on the finish.
Wine: Helix by Reininger 2014 Pomatia Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Highland Valley
Review: Juicy and fruity aromas of blackberry jam, black plum, purple flowers and a savory hint of soy show on the nose of this bottling from a San Diego winery that sourced fruit from Paso. It hits the palate with power, showing Concord grape and dark-berry flavors. But it's quite ripe despite judicious acidity and tannins.
Wine: Highland Valley 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: The aromas are fresh, with notes of whole green pepper, dark cherry, cocoa and wisps of vanilla and other oak spices. There's a lot of smoothness to the fruit flavors, which lean into the savory, with abundant green-pepper flavors that taper toward the cranberry and spice-filled finish.
Wine: Kestrel 2013 Winemaker's Select Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: Bright and vibrant on the nose in spiced cranberry and blackberry, there's a hint of green herb in the background of this wine. Having seen no time in oak, this light-bodied wine is all about fresh, racy currant and cranberry flavors, with a graphite edge to offer support.
Wine: Knapp 2016 Unoaked Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Lasorda Family WInes
Review: A strong rocky minerality drives the nose of this bottling by the family of former Dodgers manager Tommy Lasorda, but there are also hints of smoke and dried blueberry. The palate is fairly light in tannins and mouthfeel, showing boysenberry, crushed rock and marjoram flavors.
Wine: Lasorda Family WInes 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Texas, Texas, US
Review: Aromas of white grape juice, yellow peach and ruby grapefruit introduce this luscious rosé. Yellow cherry and white peach flavors are struck against white pepper and beachgrass on the palate. The polished finish introduces some stony flavors while bitter lime marks the close.
Wine: Llano Estacado 2016 Mont Sec Rosé (Texas)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Raw, sliced banana pepper, ground black-pepper, cinnamon and green-herb aromas lead to plump front-loaded cherry and pepper flavors that don't entirely stay together throughout. Cranberry notes linger on the finish.
Wine: Merry Cellars 2014 Seven Hills Vineyard Carmenère (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Review: Given 16 months in French oak, half of it new, this is an oaky, buttery and intensely full-bodied wine, thick and rich in baked apple and brioche flavors.
Wine: Merryvale 2015 Silhouette Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: This wine has a very deep color. Ample aromas of blackberry and boysenberry jam are followed by flavors that are rich and ripe. It's concentrated and fruity while staying rather low in acidity and soft in terms of tannin.
Wine: Naggiar 2015 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Prototype
Review: Accents of brown sugar and maple syrup make this full-bodied wine taste almost sweet. A sense of oaky richness is backed by tasty blackberry and boysenberry flavors and a smooth rich texture.
Wine: Prototype 2016 Zinfandel (Lodi)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: The nose on this bottling is extremely shy and reserved at this stage of its life, showing light aromas of damp oak and lanolin. There is decent tension to the sip, where flavors of nectarine, Gravenstein apple and a chalky minerality barely start to show.
Wine: Sarah's Vineyard 2016 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Review: This Bordeaux-style blend starts off with aromas of red plum, cranberry, rhubarb stalk and green pepper. These translate onto the palate, where the char of the oak becomes prominent. While the feel of the wine is well balanced from sprightly acidity and structured tannins, the finish has a bitterness that lingers.
Wine: Stone Tower 2015 Wind Swept Hill Red (Virginia)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Aromas of raspberry candy, fresh flower, dried orange peel, herb, smoked meat and tire rubber are followed by soft fruit flavors that coat the palate, then taper. Orange-peel notes linger on the finish.
Wine: Tertulia 2015 Riviere Galets Estate Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: The Infinite Monkey Theorem
Review: Cranberry, pomegranate and black pepper aromas introduce a lush wine. Gentle tannins and well-balanced acidity add to the easy flavors of juicy red berries and vanilla speckled with peppery spice. The finish is all red fruit, with a whisper of vanilla and white pepper.
Wine: The Infinite Monkey Theorem 2016 Malbec (Grand Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: This is enjoyable in its straightforward appeal, offering pineapple rind, crushed stone and Sweet Tart candy tones on the nose and palate. This has a round, ripe feel, with proper balance from citrusy acidity, making this a perfect aperitif.
Wine: Three Brothers 2016 Zero Degrees Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Tuli
Review: This straightforward approachable wine offers a friendly sense of richness, rounded in lush apple, mango and integrated oak. The finish is bright and fresh.
Wine: Tuli 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: Full bodied and nearly sweet, this very ripe and fruity wine smells like waffles and maple syrup and tastes like strawberries and blackberries. Should be good to pair with salty and spicy dishes.
Wine: Zinfandelic 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Lorimar
Review: The nose on this twist-top bottling is a bit reductive at first, with a touch of petrol, citrus pith and Anjou pear rinds. That petrol quality extends to the sip as well, where is fits in with more pear skins and some beeswax.
Wine: Lorimar 2016 Grenache Blanc (California)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Review: This blends in 7% Cabernet Sauvignon. The wine is pungent and earthy in forest and tobacco, with smooth thick full-bodied waves of green tannin and light accents of clove spice.
Wine: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2014 Right Bank Merlot (Oak Knoll District)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This is a concentrated wine rich in red fruit that remains light in the glass. Herbal, earthy undertones of oystershell and dill mix with cedar and currant.
Wine: Medlock Ames 2015 Estate Red Bell Mountain Red (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Merry Cellars
Review: Vanilla, baking spice, sliced green-pepper and dried cherry aromas are followed by ripe sweet cherry and herb flavors. It finishes with a tart plum and vanilla-filled finish. Bitter notes linger.
Wine: Merry Cellars 2014 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Qupé
Review: A lighter expression of Syrah on both the nose and palate, this bottling starts with aromas of coffee, black currant and a bit of vanilla dust. The palate is fresh and easy but also somewhat simple, without much mouthfeel, structure or bold flavors.
Wine: Qupé 2016 Syrah (Central Coast)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Dark and golden in color, this 100% stainless-steel fermented white is steely on the midpalate, with an integrated, rich thread of vanilla that gives it a tropical tease of sweetness, though the wine finishes dry and defiantly light.
Wine: River Road 2016 Un-oaked Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine is mostly Roussanne (70%), with the balance equal parts Marsanne and Grenache Blanc, with the fruit coming from Olsen and Boushey vineyards. Lemon verbena, grape-nut, peach and apple aromas lead to broad stone-fruit flavors.
Wine: Sparkman 2016 Apparition White (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Pungent in oak and strong, warm aromas of crème brûlée, this wine offers a lush profile of mango, papaya and baked peach, slightly tropical and rich while being moderately balanced and the right kind of rich.
Wine: Taken Wine Co. 2016 Complicated Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine is mostly Roussanne (70%), with the balance equal parts Marsanne and Grenache Blanc, with the fruit coming from Olsen and Boushey vineyards. Lemon verbena, grape-nut, peach and apple aromas lead to broad stone-fruit flavors.
Wine: Sparkman 2016 Apparition White (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Review: Pungent in oak and strong, warm aromas of crème brûlée, this wine offers a lush profile of mango, papaya and baked peach, slightly tropical and rich while being moderately balanced and the right kind of rich.
Wine: Taken Wine Co. 2016 Complicated Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Being 100% varietal, baking spice, dried savory herb, dried tobacco and cherry aromas are followed by plump lighter-styled fruit flavors, with red-fruit and black-tea notes on the finish. The tannic structure is surprisingly light for the variety.
Wine: Tertulia 2014 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey
Review: Aromas of licorice, brandied cherry, red currant and black pepper show on a nose. This is a solid Cabernet Franc, if slightly over oaked, with juicy flavors of cranberry and pomegranate upfront leading to nutmeg, toasted oak and more black pepper. Tangy, lifting acidity keeps it in balance, with dusty tannins lingering through the oaky finish of muddled cherries and more spice.
Wine: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey 2015 Cabernet Franc (Colorado)
Winery: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: A straightforward nose of lemon, grapefruit and a touch of plastic make for an easy, yet enjoyable wine. Light in body, with a mildly round texture, the palate brings a crisp vein of gooseberry and green apple flavor.
Wine: Billsboro 2016 Sawmill Creek Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This wine is mostly Syrah (88%) finished off with Mourvèdre. Unusual, not entirely appealing aromas of barbeque sauce, smoked ribs and medicine cabinet lead to flat-seeming fruit flavors.
Wine: Board Track Racer 2015 The Shift Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Burnt Bridge
Review: With fruit coming from Les Collines Vineyard, aromas of green pepper, tire rubber, baking spice and cherry are followed by slightly sweet-seeming fruit flavors. Soft tannins provide support. It doesn't all come together.
Wine: Burnt Bridge 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Cabernet Sauvignon (35%), Merlot (30%), Cabernet Franc (15%), Malbec and Petit Verdot make up this wine. Aromas of ripe black currant, cigar box, dried herb and black cherry are followed by lightly sweet, smoky fruit flavors. It brings a tacky feel.
Wine: Gravel Bar 2015 Alluvial Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Gravel Bar
Review: The aromas bring notes of mesquite and fruit leather, seeming a bit dried out, with the palate showing more of the same. It doesn't all work.
Wine: Gravel Bar 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Happy Camper
Review: Ripe and fairly concentrated fruit aromas and flavors fill out a soft texture with just a touch of tannin in it. The wine has a good dark color, light cedar and mint accents and a touch of sweetness to round the edges.
Wine: Happy Camper 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: This single-vineyard Chardonnay sees no time in oak, making it a straightforward sipper with aromas and flavors of red apple and tart pineapple rind. It's light in profile, with a spritely, easygoing feel.
Wine: Heron Hill 2016 Ingle Vineyard Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Cayuga Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: Vibrant notes of bubblegum, cinnamon and cherry candies carry the nose and palate of this watermelon-hued rosé. It's light in feel, but altogether an enjoyable fruit-driven sip.
Wine: Hosmer 2017 Dry Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Cayuga Lake)

Appellation: Atwater
Review: Leaning on the herbal side, this Merlot shows fresh fennel and tobacco on the nose, with a core of red plum. There's some green bitterness on the palate yet a darker plum note offers some counterbalance.
Wine: Atwater 2015 Merlot (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: This blend of Cabernet Franc, Malbec, Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot comes from various vineyards in the Horse Heaven Hills and Red Mountain. Aromas of raspberry jam, cranberry, tire rubber and cherry are followed by lighter-styled cranberry flavors that show a sense of restraint. Herb and raspberry flavors linger on the finish.
Wine: Cana's Feast 2013 Two Rivers Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Lakewood
Review: A nose of bergamont and spicy bramble berry initially feels a bit sharp. The palate is light in feel, with racing acidity that shoots through flavors of sour cherry, geranium and white pepper. More sour cherry lingers on the finish.
Wine: Lakewood 2016 Lemberger (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Review: A moderate intensity of peach, strawberry and banana carries the nose and palate of this rosé made from Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Malbec, Pinot Noir and Pinot Blanc. While this lacks in complexity, it makes up for it with its exuberance of fruit, balanced by a soft, round palate and crisp acidity.
Wine: Lieb 2017 Bridge Lane Rosé (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Hints of caramel complement very ripe fruit flavors in this full-bodied, smooth and mouth-coating wine. It tastes well aged and ready to drink.
Wine: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2013 Choreography Red (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Review: A moderate intensity of peach, strawberry and banana carries the nose and palate of this rosé made from Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Malbec, Pinot Noir and Pinot Blanc. While this lacks in complexity, it makes up for it with its exuberance of fruit, balanced by a soft, round palate and crisp acidity.
Wine: Lieb 2017 Bridge Lane Rosé (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Longevity
Review: More aging should help this tightly wound, firm and tannic wine open up. It has concentrated red and black-cherry flavors, good acidity and medium to full body, but feels astringent as many young Cabernets do. Best after 2021.
Wine: Longevity 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: Melon, citrus and a bit of tropical fruit show on the nose of this unoaked Chardonnay. It's light and sprightly in feel, with taut citrus and stone fruit flavors on the palate that carry to a creamy lemon and tonic finish.
Wine: McGregor 2016 Unoaked Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Review: Cabernet Sauvignon (39%) and Merlot (28%) make up the majority of this wine, with the rest equal parts Merlot, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc. With all of the fruit coming from Stillwater Creek, the aromas bring notes of cherry, plum, cedar, herb and spice. The flavors are ripe and full in feel, sweet with a slightly tart, bitter finish.
Wine: Merry Cellars 2015 Crimson Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Merry Cellars
Review: Aromas of currant, dark plum, herb and spice are followed by light elegant fruit flavors, with the extraction pulled back. It finishes with strangely tart cranberry flavors that distract.
Wine: Merry Cellars 2015 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: NoCurfew
Review: Robust fruit and herb flavors combine with a supple texture in this medium- to full-bodied wine. Notes of bay leaf and tobacco join black-plum flavors while the tannins are very light.
Wine: NoCurfew 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: This sweet-seeming wine smells like maple syrup and tastes like brown sugar, so it may be an apt match for slow-cooked barbecue. Milk chocolate, plum jam and other pastry-like accents join in.
Wine: The Dirty Pure Project 2015 The Bomb Red (California)

Appellation: Tom Gore
Review: Tangy and fresh, this light-bodied wine has a vague citrus aroma, crisp lemony flavors and a rather light brisk texture, all of which will be appealing on a warm evening.
Wine: Tom Gore 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Appellation: Placer County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: Smooth and mellow, this medium-bodied wine has mild spice and fruit aromas, a soft texture and good, subdued black-plum flavors. It's low in acidity and tannins.
Wine: Wise Villa 2013 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Placer County)

Appellation: American House Wine
Review: This extroverted wine has a meaty beefy aroma and abundant oaky spicy flavors. It is medium to full in body, has moderate tannins and a good gripping texture.
Wine: American House Wine 2016 Red (California)

Appellation: American House Wine
Review: Dry and attractively reserved, this light-bodied small-production wine smells like flint and white pepper, tastes clean and minerally and feels crisp on the palate.
Wine: American House Wine 2016 White (California)

Appellation: Bella Grace
Review: Very ripe fruit flavors give this wine a sense of depth to go with its almost viscous texture. It's full bodied and feels soft in terms of acidity.
Wine: Bella Grace 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Amador County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: About as pale in color as possible, this dry wine has lively aromas and flavors that resemble prosciutto wrapped around a slice of melon. A hint of earthy astringency kicks in on the finish.
Wine: Mabera 2016 Estate Collection Zinfandel Rosé (Amador County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Review: This wine has a deep golden color, effusive aromas of butter and caramel and other similarly rich flavors that seem to flood the palate. It is medium to full bodied, has a smooth, almost unctuous texture and lingering butterscotch finish.
Wine: Chateau St. Jean 2016 Creamy Chardonnay (California)

Appellation: Virginia's Eastern Shore, Virginia, US
Review: This Merlot has aromas of black cherry, juniper, and white pepper. The palate is spicy in tones of clove and cinnamon, with an undercurrent of black plum and cherry. Ample acidity, a full body and generous tannic structure lead to a long, spicy finish.
Wine: Chatham 2014 Church Creek Merlot (Virginia's Eastern Shore)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Review: Candied red fruit, turned earth, crushed rocks and purple flowers show on the nose of this bottling. There's a cherry-cough-syrup touch to the sip alongside brown spice, but it's fumbling a bit over flavor and texture.
Wine: Chloe 2015 San Lucas Estate Vineyard Merlot (Monterey County)

Appellation: Columbia Winery
Review: This is mostly varietal with a splash of Pinot Gris, Viognier and other varieties that occasionally show themselves. Aromas of lemon curd, cut apple, vanilla, flower and talc lead to soft pear and apple flavors with a lightly oily feel.
Wine: Columbia Winery 2016 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Review: This unoaked Cabernet Franc isn't shy about its raw, straightforward appeal. Ripe raspberry and jalapeño show on the nose, carrying to a smooth, soft palate of juicy red cherry, bolstered by some delicate herbs. A lingering cranberry skin note extends the finish.
Wine: Fox Run 2016 Ikehu Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Review: About as pale in color as possible, this dry wine has lively aromas and flavors that resemble prosciutto wrapped around a slice of melon. A hint of earthy astringency kicks in on the finish.
Wine: Mabera 2016 Estate Collection Zinfandel Rosé (Amador County)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Review: This rosé is quiet on the nose but brings flavors of strawberry and grapefruit on the palate, alongside an umami-rich saline tone. The acidity is lively, making this a good summer salad wine.
Wine: Paradise Springs 2017 Nana's Rosé (Virginia)

Appellation: Purple Heart Wines
Review: Led by 67% Merlot, this also includes 19% Zinfandel, 8% Petit Verdot and 6% Cabernet Franc. Approachable and thickly concentrated, it offers a generous helping of fruity blackberry and cherry with toasted oak,
Wine: Purple Heart Wines 2015 Red (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Rosemont
Review: Aromas of lemon and pear drop are of medium intensity on the nose. The palate has an appealing stoniness and a lasting flavor of lemon curd. Bright acidity offers a long, zippy finish.
Wine: Rosemont 2017 Pinot Grigio (Virginia)

Appellation: Thirsty Owl Wine Company
Review: Spiced red apple and stone fruit aromas carry to the ripe, juicy palate. There's an attractive roundness adding weight, with a bit of residual sugar to help prop up the fruit flavors, ultimately this is a simple, off-dry pour.
Wine: Thirsty Owl Wine Company 2016 Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Review: This extravagantly woody wine has spicy, almost sweet aromas of cedar and pine followed by flavors like strawberry and blackberry jam. The texture is very smooth.
Wine: Trinitas 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Mendocino)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Review: This wine is earthy and herbal with a persistently tart tannic personality that's hard to crack. Full bodied and ripe, it finishes short and quick.
Wine: Willowbrook 2015 Harris-Kratka Vineyard Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Apothic
Review: Light peach and apple aromas lead to ripe sweet melon and peach flavors and a soft smooth texture. It's an easygoing fruit-forward off-dry wine.
Wine: Apothic 2016 White (California)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
